Franko.x: member of a former German people.

Hori.x: (Gr. rel.) Horæ, the three goddesses of the seasons.

Martinsomero.x: St. Martin’s summer: warm, damp season in England and southern Europe from November to about Christmas.

Parco.x: (myth.) Parca, one of the three Fates.

Tartuf.x: (ul)o: Tartuffe, a hypocritcal priest in Moliere’s «Tartuffe»; a hypocrite

abandonar.x: (tr.) to abandon, (wholly) give up, (totally) relinquish, forego, forsake. Ex.: Abandonar navo, domo, projeto, infanto. Abandonar su a desespero, a joyo. Ant.: gardar, retenar. V. exp.: Livar urbo, portuo, domo, persono ... esas simple forirar de ol sen ula sentimental impliko. Abandonar persono, ofico, posteno, esas sive lasar li, nevolunte o kontrevole, sive violacante ula devo (abandonar infanti, parenti). Retretar esas retromarchar: la senco primitiva e propra esas militala; senci figurala e derivta: livar la mondo (religiala retreto), funciono od agado (retreto di oficisto, komercisto, e.c.); II

abasar.x: (tr.) to lower: let down to a lower level; (fig.) to abase (morally), debase

abatar.x: (tr., phys. sense) to knock, beat, strike down, fell

abatiso.x: (of fowl, game) refuse parts, as head, feet, wings, skin, etc.; small edible parts, as giblets. Def.: Mikra parti di pultro, anke di leporo; VII

abceseskar.x: to become or turn to an a. Def.: Pusoza kavajo en la korpo.

abdikar.x: (tr.) to abdicate. V. exp.: Abdikar dicesas precipue pri la reji o suvereni, qui cesas regnar por transmisar la povo a sucedanto, sive naturala, sive selektata

abdomino.x: abdomen. V. exp.: Abdomino esas ciencala vorto, plu preciza kam ventro: IV-512.

abduktar.x: (tr., physiol.) to abduct. Note: Not abduct: to kidnap; cf. raptar.

abjektajo.x: a. act. Def.: Qua esas di extrema grado di etikala abaseso. Ex.: Persono, sentimenti abjekta. Ant.: nobla.

abjurar.x: (tr.) to abjure. Def.: Renuncar publike e solene. Ex.: Abjurar religio, doktrino, opiniono.

ablacionar.x: to ablate: to remove by surgical operation. Ex.: Ablaciono di membro, di tumoro.

ablucionar.x: (tr., relig., med.) to purify by washing

abluciono.x: ablution. Def.: Lavar parto di la korpo segun medicinal (o religiala) preskripti; IV-515.

abominar.x: (tr.) to abominate, abhor, loathe, detest (cf. odieg-ar, horor-ar); -ajo: an abominable act or object

abonar.x: (tr.) to subscribe for or to (a periodical) igar-ar: to cause (ulu) to subscribe to (ulo)

abordar.x: (tr.) to land on a (shore, a wharf, etc.); to board (a ship, a vehicle); (fig.) to go alongside, come up close to. Def.: Irar sur ulo o, per extenso, venar flanke ad, bordo an bordo kun ulo (por irar sur ol). L’etimologiala senco esas: irar a (sur) la bordo di ulo. Ex.: La Portugalani esis le unesma qui abordis la literi di India. Abordar la navo dil enemiko. La navo abordas (ad, an) la warfo. La pasajanti abordas sur la warfo.

abortar.x: (intr.) to abort, miscarry; (fig.) to come to nothing, fail

aboyachar.x: to give tongue falsely, snarl, bawl.

abreviar.x: (tr.) to abbreviate (words), abridge (a book), curtail (a narrative); (cf. rezumar, kurt-igar)

abrogar.x: (tr.) to abrogate, repeal, annul. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.

abrupta.x: precipitous, cragged, abrupt; (fig.) rough, broken, unpolished. Ex.: L’abrupta flanko di monto. Stilo, karaktero abrupta. V. exp.: vid. eskarpa.

absenteskar.x: to absent oneself, keep out of the way

absolvo.x: (rel.) absolution, (jur.) acquittal; (cf. indulgar). Def.: Deklarar senkulpa (do nepunisebla) ula akuzato; III-699. Ant.: kondamnar.

abstenar.x: (tr.) to abstain (voluntarily) from, to refrain from (ulo)

abstenemeso.x: abstinence (habitual state); igar ar: to cause (ulu) to abstain from (ulo)

absteneskar.x: to begin to abstain; Ex.: Ne esas facila abstenar drinkar, kande on durstas. V. ex.: Abstenar, karear: Karear ne implikas «vole», ol prefere implikas «nevole» o mem «kontrevole». On abstenas kozo, quan on havas o povus havar; on kareas kozo, quan on ne havas o ne povas havar (nun). Ex.: En voyajo on mustas karear multa kozi (pro ke la kozi mankas); ma se on havus li, probable on ne abstenus li, IV-658.

abstinencar.x: (intr., relig.) to abstain (from meat), to practise abstinence (from pleasure), to fast (de).

abstraktar.x: (tr.) to abstract: separate in thought, -ala: abstract (science, question)

abstruza.x: abstruse, recondite. Del.: Desfacile komprenebla e tedanta; II-706.

absurda.x: absurd, preposterous. Del.: Kontre la komuna raciono. Ant.: saja, racion-oza.

abundeganta.x: superabundant; -o-korno: horn-of-plenty, cornucopia. Ant.: esar skarsa, mankar.

abutar.x: (intr.) to abut (ad), come out (into), end (in); (abscess) to come to a head. Def.: Tushar per un extremajo. Ex.: Omna radii di cirklo abutas al centro.

acelerar.x: (tr.) to accelerate, hasten, quicken. Ex.: Acelerar la pazi. Ant.: moderar, (plu)lent-igar.

acendar.x: (tr.) to light (a lamp), to kindle (a fire), to turn on (electric light); (fig.) to inflame (the passions)

acensar.x: (tr., intr) to go up, ascend, mount

acento.x: accent: stress of voice (not written accent, cf. super-signo); -izar; to accent, lay stress on

aceptar.x: (tr.) to accept (something willingly, as a proposal, condition apology, challenge), to receive (a guest)

acerba.x: (also fig.) acerb: sour, bitter and harsh in taste (as unripe fruit); -eso:: acerbity, harshness; severity. Ex.: Frukto acerba. Parolado acerba. V. exp.: vid. aspera.

acesar.x: : (tr.) to have access to (ulu, ulo); (med.) to have an access, an attack

acesebla.x: accessible, approachable. Ex.: Il acesas loko, persono (o havas aceso a loko, persono). Loko, persono acesebla. Aceso di febro, (fig.) aceso di iraco, furio, desespero.

acesito.x: accesit: honorable mention accorded to a student.

acidentanto.x: on who or that which causes an a. -ito: vicitim of an a.

acidente.x: accidentally, by chance. Def.: Efektigar acidento ad ulu (ulo); IV-105, VI-162. Ex.: Acidento bona o mala. La infirmaji e acidenti di la vivo homala. Kozo acidental. Deskovrar acidente ulo.

acidento.x: accident (generally in an ill sense), mishap; (philos.) accident

aciono.x: (fin.) share (of a bank, railway, joint-stock company, etc.)

acizo.x: town or city tax on commodities, excise, octroi.

adaptar.x: (tr.) to adapt ulo ad ulo; -ar su: a. oneself

adbase.x: (with movement) to the bottom, (cf. ad infre). (cf. II-163.)

aden.x: (with movement) into. Ex.: Irar aden la gardeno. La ucelo flugis aden la kajo.

adequata.x: adequate. Ex.: Havar ideo adquata pri kozo.

adherar.x: (intr.) to adhere (ad): stick close to, be attached; (fig.) to give adhesion (to a party, a principle)

adherigar.x: to cause to adhere, stick. Ex.: La epidermo adheras a la pelo. Donar sua adhero a projeto.

adiar.x: (tr.) to bid adieu to (ulu), say good-bye

adibe.x: (over) there, thither, (with movement). Ex. Omnube vu iros, adibe me iros kun vu.

adicionar.x: (tr., math.) to add: cast up (numbers, cf. ad-juntar) -o: addition. Ant.: sustracionar.

adinfre.x: (with motion) down(ward); (cf. ad-sube, ad-base). Ex.: Irar adinfre sur l'eskalero.

adjudikajo.x: what is awarded. Ex.: Adjudikar la domo a la plendanto. Adjudikar premio ad ulu.

adjudikar.x: (tr.) to adjudicate, adjudge: to award (ulo ad ulo) judicially in a controversy: (at auctions) to knock down to, declare to be the purchaser of

adjudiko.x: awarding (of prizes), granting (of contracts): -ario: person who receives the award; highest tenderer

adjurar.x: (tr.) to adjure: command in the name of God, to charge solemnly. Ex.: Me adjuras vu, dicar la verajo.

administrar.x: (tr.) to administer: to manage, conduct (a business, an estate, a department of government)

admirinda.x: worthy of admiration, admirable. Ant.: des-prizar, des-estimar.

admisar.x: (tr.) to admit, to receive (ulu, ulo; cf. agnoskar); -o, -eso: admission, admittance, affiliation

admonte.x: above (i.e. further up on the same general level; not overhead, cf. super), up stream (toward the mountain, the source of the stream). Aernavo flugas trans la rivero admonte de la urbo: the airship flies over (crosses) the river above (i.e. not over the city itself, but up-stream from the city). Ant.: ad-vale.

adoptar.x: (tr.) to adopt (an opinion, a system); (jur.) to adopt (a child); (in assemblies) to agree upon, carry (a motion, resolution), to pass (a bill)

adoptito.x: an adopted child or person. Ant.: repulsar.

adorar.x: (tr., rel.) to worship (Deo); (gen.) to adore, idolize (ulu, ulo); -inda: adorable.

adosar.x: (tr.) to set the back (di ulu, ulo) to (ulu, ulo), to put back to back

adraganto.x: (bot.) gum-tragacanth, gum-adraganth. Def.: Gumo extrakita de tragakanto. IV-644.

adresizar.x: to address: put an a. on (a letter). Ex.: Ca letro esas adresizita a vu.

adsorbar.x: (tr., tech.) to adsorb: to condense by adsorption.

adsub.x: (with motion) under. Ex.: La kato kuris adsub la tablo.

adsur.x: (with motion) on to. Ex.: Irar adsur agro.

adube.x: (with motion) (toward) where, whither. Ex.: Adube vu iras?

advale.x: below: further down on the same general level; (not below = under, cf. sub), down stream (toward the valley, the outlet); vid. ad-monte. Ant.: ad-monte.

aerizar.x: to air, renew the air, (chem.) aërate

aeroplano.x: aëroplane. Note Technical terms may be found in IV-330-333. DEFIRS

aerostatala.x: aërostatic. Def.; «Balonegi» qui flotacas passive en l'aero (ne la «direktebla baloni» a qui esas rezervita la nomo: aernavo). 11-706.

afableso.x: affability; -ajo: amenity, courteous act. Ant.: des-, ne-afabia, ruda, impertinenta.

afecionar.x: (tr.) to have an affection for, to delight in, to be fond of (ulu, ulo)

afecionata.x: beloved, devoted, Ex.: La Polonani afecionas sua patrio. Afecionoza fratino.El afecionas sua matro.Ant.: antipatiar, odiar, abominar.

afektacar.x: (tr., intr.) to pose, to make an artificial show, to pretend ostentatiously ; -(ad)o: affectedness, affectation, mannerism; -anta, -ema: affected, pretentious, finical. Ex.; Afectacar la vertuo.Afektacar kom richulo, kom eleganto.

afektar.x: (tr., psychol.) to touch (the feelings), to move (emotionally); (med.) to take effect on, to sicken

afero.x: (com..) business; (gen. sense) affair: matter, thing, concern, question, etc.; (leg.) cause, legal action

afina.x: (chem.) having affinity (ad); (fig.) akin, congenial; -eso: affinity; -esar (ad): to have a. (to). Def.: Qua havas tendenco a kombino, ad uniono. Ex.: Karbono afinesas ad oxo. Afineso spiritala, mentala. Ant.:repuls-anta, -iva.

afirmar.x: (tr.) to affirm, aver (the truth, or that something is true)

afishigar.x: to publish, gazette (ulo); -o-glutinar: to post bill, billstick

afisho.x: poster, bill: placard posted in a public place

afixo.x: (gram.) affix: a prefix or a suffix.

afliktar.x: (tr.) to afflict: to cause to suffer mentally, to distress, grieve

afrankar.x: (tr.) to frank: to prepay (postage on letters), carriage on parcels)

afrontar.x: (tr.) to affront: to meet front to front, to face; (fig.) to brave. Def.: Opozar (su) fronto a fronto: figurale on afrontas danjero, tempesto, e.c.; II-136.

afuzionar.x: (tr.) to affuse. -o: (med., rel.) affusion; pouring of water, etc., on the body.

agacar.x: (tr.) to set on edge (teeth); (fig.) to irritate, annoy, tantalize, -anta, -iva: irritating, provoking. Def.: Senco propa esas iritar la nervi (specale e prope di la denti, ex. per la froto di kultelo sur plado o vitro); II-136. Ex.: Limar segilo agacas mea denti. (fig.) Agacar hundo.

agendo.x: agenda: memorandum of things to be done.

ageskar.x: to begin to act, to come into play

agigar.x: to make, cause (ulu, olu) to do (ulo); -(ad)o: acting, deed, action

agitar.x: (tr.) to shake, agitate (ulo, ulu); to wave (a flag, the hand, a handkerchief); (cf. ond-ifar); (fig.) to excite (the feelings

agitilo.x: agitator (inst.) Ex.: Agitar liquido. Agitar pupulo. El agitis sau brakio vers me.

aglutinar.x: (tr.) to agglutinate: stick as with glue; (fig.) to join together.

agnoskar.x: (tr.) to acknowledge, admit, own (something as right, good, true, false)

agoniar.x: (intr.) to be in the death agony, in the last death struggle, in death pangs, in extremis. DeFIRS

agorafobio.x: (med.) agoraphobia; morbid dread of, or giddiness in crossing open spaces.

agrafo.x: hook, hook-and-eye (to fasten dresses, etc.); clasp (for book-lids, cloaks, etc.); snap (of a necklace, bracelet, etc.); (ancient) agraffe

agreableso.x: agreeableness, charm. Ex.: Agreabla muliero, loko, figuro, sento. Ant.: des-agre-abla, des-plez-anta; ofens-iva.

agregar.x: (tr.) to aggregate, incorporate; to admit (into a society, university)

agro.x: field: piece of ground; (cf. feldo); -ala: agrarian, rural

agulagar.x: to ply the needle; to switch, shunt

agulpinto.x: point of a n. trikot-agulo: knitting n.

ajile.x: quickly, on the jump! Ant.: lenta.

ajiotar.x: (intr.) to speculate (in public securities, stocks), to be a stock-jobber

ajornar.x: (tr.) to adjourn, put off, defer, (ulo til); -o: adjournment, postponement, reprieve

ajuro.x: ajour-work: open-work, fret-work, (of fabric) webbed: carving, metal work, embroidery, etc. where background is pierced or removed, or where it is translucent

ajustar.x: (tr. tech.) to adjust, regulate, set (cf. ad-just-igar); Ex.: Finita instrumenti esas ajustebla. On ajustas teleskopo por la disto (ne por la direciono: apuntar); III-219; cf. regular.

ajuto.x: ajutage: nozzle, spout. Def.: Specala tubulo o fino di tubo, destinita ne a juntar du tubi or recipienti (quale tubulo), ma a determinar la formo di la sprico ekiranta (ex. ya la fino di lanco por arozar); VII-197.

akademiano.x: academician. V. exp.: Akademio esas societo de ciencisti (generale elektita ed en fix nombro) qui ne docas. On devas do evidente rezervar akademiala a ta senco, e ne uzar ol parolante pri universitato (profesori, studenti, kursi, e.c.); III-496

akantonar.x: (tr., milit.) to canton: billet, allot quarters (to troops in a locality)

akaparar.x: (tr., finan.) to corner (goods, the market); (fig.) to monopolize. Def.: Amasigar komercaji en granda quanto por skarsigar li e cherigar lia preco.

aklamar.x: (tr.) to acclaim: to shout approval or applause. Ex.: La rejo esis kronizata inter la aklami di la turbo. Li aklamis il kom rejo. Li aklamis la propozajo.

aklimatar.x: (tr.) to acclimate, acclimatize: to season, to inure, accustom to a climate; (fig.) to habituate, make one feel at home.

akomodar.x: (tr., tech., opt., etc.) to accomodate: adapt, adjust

akordar.x: (intr., mus.) to be in tune; (cf. konkordar); (gram.) to agree

akra.x: acrid (taste, smell); (cf. acerba, acida); harsh (in voice); (fig.) acrimonious

akreditar.x: (tr.) to accredit: to give credit or sanction to (ulu, ulo); -ita: accredited

akrochar.x: (tr.) to hang (on a hook), to hook on (ulo ad ulo), to interlock, grapple (a ship): -o: hitch, hooking on

aktiva.x: active (opposed to passive; also used in com., fin., gram., mil. senses); (cf. agema, ajila); -eso: activity

aktulaigar.x: to actualize. Def.: Qua traktesas od interesas en la nuna instanto (proxime reala); fakte e komplete existanta, opozite a to quo povus esar, ma ne esas, ed a to quo naskas o divenas (ica od ita); IV-495. Ex.: Aktuala energio, opozata a potencial energio. La evento aktuala esas . . . . La jurnali povas vivar nur per aktualaji (E. journals can live on passing events).

akular.x: (tr.) to bring to bay (ulu a ulo): To drive into a place from which there is no escape. Ex.: On povas akular kombatanto a muro, armeo a rivero o monto, bestio chasata a klozilo; IV-135.

akurata.x: punctual. Def.: Qua venas (persono) od eventas precize ye la loko, ye la kloko fixigita, konvencionita, IV-102. V. exp.: Persono povas dicesar akurata, ma ne exakta o preciza. Akurateso indikas la ideo di sorgo; IV-102.

akushar.x: (tr., obstet.) to deliver (a woman); (cf. parturar): -o accouchment: delivery in child-bed

akuta.x: (also fig. of sound, pain, sickness, accent) acute, sharp, keep

akutigar.x: to sharpen, whet, put an edge on

akuzar.x: (tr.) to accuse, inculpate, charge with, indict

akuzmotivo.x: reason for accusation. Def.: Imputar kulpo, delikto, krimino ad ulu. Ant.: justifikar.

alarmar.x: (tr.) to alarm: sound the alarm, give signal of danger

alarmo.x: cry or signal of danger; (fig.) sense of danger, fright (cf. pavoro); -ema, -emo, -isto: alarmist

albo.x: alb. Def.: Longa, blanka robo portata da la sacerdoto dum la meso; III-42.

albumo.x: album: book for photographs, autographs, cards, etc.

alegajo.x: allegation: what is alleged. V. exp. vid. citar. DEFIS

alegar.x: (tr.) to allege, adduce, advance (arguments, facts, etc. in order to prove or justify something)

alejar.x: (tr., phys. sense) to lighten, relieve (of a load); (fig.) to alleviate, ease, relieve (the mind, etc.). Ex.: Alejar mulo di qua la portajo esas pezoza. Alejar navo. Alejar dento-doloro. Alejar la mento. (vid. lejer-igar.

aleo.x: lane, walk, path (in a garden, park, wood, etc., generally between rows of trees); (cf. strad-eto).

alerta.x: alert: wide-awake, smart, brisk, sprightly; (cf. ajila, ag-ema, aktiva). EF

alezar.x: (tr.) to ream, bevel out, bore smooth (inside of a cannon, steam cylinders, etc.); (cf. borar) -ilo: reamer

algo.x: alga(e): sea-weed, kelp, dulse, sea-lettuce, etc.; (cf. fuko).

aliancito.x: relation by marriage; (cf. mis-aliancar). V. exp.: Ta verbo ne esas sinonimo di mari-ajar, qua relatas nur la gespozi; aliancar relatas lia familii; II-706. DEFIS

alienacar.x: (intr.) to be in a state of alienation (mental derangement)

alienar.x: (tr.) to alienate: to sell, dispose of (estates, property, rights)

alimentar.x: (tr.) to supply with what is necessary (as water, fuel to a machine, provisions to a town, food to a family or person); (cf. nutrar)

alimento.x: alimentation: supply, maintenance, feeding; -ala, -anta; alimental: sustaining.

alineo.x: (print.) a line of which the first word is indented; a new paragraph.

aliteracar.x: (tr., intr.) to alliterate. Def: Komencar (finar) per la sama sono o soni; IV-649.

alizeo.x: trade-wind. Def.: Vento qua suflas konstante dum la tota yaro inter la tropiki; II-641.

alloyar.x: (tr.) to alloy; combine metals by fusion

almanako.x: almanac: yearly calendar with variety of information; (fig.) year-book

alo.x: (also fig. of army, aeroplane, building, windmill, etc.) wing

alodio.x: allodium, freehold estate, fee-simple estate; (opp. to feudo)

alongirar.x: (tr.) to go along, skirt, coast. Ex.; Ni iris alonge (od, alongiris) la bordo dil lago.

alonjo.x: lengthening piece; leaf (of telescope, table), (jur.) allonge (of bills of exchange); Def.: Tubo quan on adjuntas ad altra por longigar ol o por igar ol komunikar kun altra tubo o vazo (III-134), anke uzata por (la prolonguro di) la tabli e trati; VII-197.

alopecio.x: (med.) alopecia: loss of hair, baldness; (cf. kalva, sen-hara, senpila).

alta.x: high, tall, lofty (also used with pressure, sound)

alterar.x: (tr.) to alter; modify the nature or quality of anything (generally for the worse)

alternanta.x: alternating (movement, crop, etc.) -igar la kultivo: to vary, rotate the crops. Ex.: La sezoni alternas.

alternativo.x: alternative, choice, option. Def.: Posibleso di selekto inter plura kozi, hipotezi.

aludar.x: (tr.) to allude to, have reference to, refer to

aluro.x: gait, pace. Def.: Maniero mar-char; IV-234.

amansar.x: (tr.) to tame, make docile (animals), to make tractable, sociable (persons)

amansebla.x: tamable. Def.: Igar la animalo min sovaja; (fig.) igar persono plu sociema. Ex.: Amansar leono, urso. Il esas homulo di humoro sovaja; on ne povas amansar il. V. exp. vid. domtar.

amar.x: (tr.) to love: to like (very much), care for, have affection for, cherish; (cf. amorar, prizar, afecionar); -o: love

amaragar.x: (tr.) to moor (by cable), to belay, make fast

amaro.x: mooring-cable, hawser; lashing (as for a gun, etc.)

amasigar.x: to heap up, hoard up, amass

ambiciar.x: (tr.) to be ambitious of, to aspire to

ambulanco.x: ambulance: field hospital following an army

amilo.x: starch: (chem.) amylaceous substance in plants; (gen.) fecula used to stiffen linen; (cf. starch-ivo); -izar: to starch: put starch on (cf. starchar); -iferio: s. works

amorcar.x: (tr.) to start a thing off, set going (an instrument or a force); to prime (a gun); to fetch (a pump)

amordeo.x: (myth.) god of love, Cupid. Def.: Expresas specale l'amo di la sexui, ne kom relato sexuala e pure korpala, ma kom specala sentimento; VI-322.

amoro.x: love: expresses not merely the sexual relation but also the sentiment between sexes

amortisar.x: (tr.) to weaken, deaden, break, (the force of a stream, a blow, a fall or shock); to calm (passions); to abate (inflammation); to blunt the feelings; to tone down, soften (colors); (fin.) to pay, liquidate (a debt), to redeem (an annunity); (jur.) to amortize: to sell in mortmain; (cook.) to make (meat) tender by long-keeping

amortisilo.x: extinguisher (for charcoal, etc.). Def.: Igar ulo min violent-oza; febl-igar; extingar debajo per pagar la kapitalo; igar plu mola.

ampla.x: ample: (of space) spacious; (of garments) full, easy; (of supplies) abundant; (of reward) liberal, etc.

ampligo.x: amplification. V. exp.: Expresas relato inter du kozi de diversa speci, maxim ofte la relato di kontenanto e kontenajo. "Ampla" no-mizesas mantelo, qua fitas tre laxe la portanto, chambro od agro ube granda kunveno devas eventar; provizuro qua satisfacas la demandi esas "ampla", stato qua havas granda mar-komerco mustas havar "ampla" floto; IV-596. Ant.: streta.

ampulo.x: ampulla: a bellied phial, glass bulb; (med.) a blister (on feet as from walking, or on hands from rowing).

amputar.x: (tr., surg. and fig.) to amputate, cut off.

amuzar.x: (tr.) to amuse, entertain; (fig.) to distract, divert (cf. distraktar); -ar su; -esar: to a. oneself (per, pri), to be amused (da); -(ad)o: amusement (act): -ivo:, ilo: that which amuses: plaything, toy

anakronismo.x: anachronism: error in chronology; something incongruous in time.

analgeziar.x: (tr.) to lull the sensibilities, produce insensibility to pain

analogajo.x: something analogous. Es.: Rezonado analoga. La linguo Italiana havas multa analogeso a la linguo Latina. An.: ne-simila.

ancienajo.x: something old. V. exp.: anciena, nova; yuna, olda; antiqua: anciena, nova relatas prefere la kozi

anesteziar.x: (tr.) to anesthetize (as by ether or chloroform)

angelizar.x: to put a hook on. (cf. peskar).

angorigar.x: to cause a. to, to agonize

angoro.x: anguish: pang, agony, violent pain (of body or mind)

angoroza.x: full of a. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.

angulfaldar.x: (tr.) to fold the corners of (ulo); -moblo: corner-piece (furniture)

anheligar.x: to put out of breath, to wind

animar.x: (tr.) to animate: endow with life; (fig.) to enliven, give animation to

ankore.x: (adv., conj.) yet, still, until now, until then (refers to a fact or act already existing)

anmo.x: soul (cf. psiko); -izar: to put soul into, to hearten

anso.x: handle: the arc shaped handle of a cup, bucket, etc.

antecedento.x: (gram., log., math.) antecedent. Ex.: La antecedenti di individuo, t.e. lua antea historio e konduto.

anti.x: contra (use generally as a prefix with scientific words) (cf. kontre-) anti-bakteria: bactericide.

antidoto.x: (also fig.) antidote. Def.: Substanco qua neutrigas l'efekti di la veneni; IV-76.

antifrazo.x: antiphrasis. Def.: Figuro di retoriko, qua konsistas en uzar ula vorto o frazo en senco kontrea a lua vera signifiko.

antipatiar.x: (tr:) to have an antipathy, aversion to (or against)

antipatioza.x: (who feels         antipathetical, full of aversion. Ant: simpatiar.

antiqua.x: antique, ancient: of a former epoch

antonomazio.x: (rhet.} antonomasia. Def: Remplasigo di propra nomo per komuna nomo equivaianta, o reciproke; V-483. Ex.: L'anjelo     di la skolo (vice Santa Thomas).

apanajo.x: appanage: royal grant of domain or allowance

aparato.x: (tech., surg.) apparatus; machine, instrument or appliance used to perform a certain operation.

aparigar.x: to cause to a. to; apparition (thing visible); to put in an appearance, -anta: apparent, plain, obvious, ostensible, specious

apartenajo.x: appurtenance. Ex.: Algeria apartenas a Francia. Il apar tenas a bona familio. Domo e lua apartenaji.

apartenar.x: (intr.) to appertain, pertain; belong to by right, nature or custom

apatio.x: apathy: want of feeling, indifference: (cf. indiferent-eso); -oza: apathetic, impassive. Ant.: anim-oz-eso, viv-em-eso.

apelar.x: (intr.) to appeal (in law); (fig.) to call for aid or sympathy (ad ulu, pri ulo); facar apelo: to lodge an a.

apene.x: (adv.) hardly, scarcely, barely. Ex.: Il apene arivis. Il apene eskapis la morto.

apertar.x: (tr.) to open, unclose (also fig. with heart, soul, etc.)

aperte.x: openly, plainly, frankly; (cf. kandida); -iva, -ivo: aperient, laxative

apetitar.x: (tr., pr. and fig.) to have an appetite for; crave or desire (instinctively)

apetitigar.x: to give or cause an a. for

aplastar.x: (tr.) to crush, squeeze, squash (soft objects); (fig.) to overwhelm, overburnden, oppress

aplaudar.x: (tr.) to applaud, clap; (fig.) to express approbation, -(ad)o: applauding

aplikebla.x: applicable, apposite, suitable. Def.: Pozar ulo sur ulo.

aplombo.x: (fig.) assurance, self-confidence, self-possession (cf. audaco); (inst.) plummet, plumb-line

apogar.x: (tr.) to prop (up), stay, support; to lean, to rest; to base, found, ground (assertions, reasons, etc.) -o: propping, supporting: -ilo, -trabo: prop, stay, support, pillar, strut, stanchion, brace

apologiisto.x: apologist. Ant.: blamar, denigrar, difamar. Note: For the translation of apologize in the sense of «to beg pardon» cf. exkuzar.

apologio.x: apology: written or spoken discourse to justify a person, a thing

apostateskar.x: to become an a., to apostatize.

apostilo.x: apostil: marginal note, annotation; recommendatory note (to back a petition)

aprentisesar.x: to be an a., obligar ulu kom -o: to bind as an a.

apretar.x: (tr., tech.) to dress: put a finish on calicoes, leather, etc. by applying a glaze dressing or varnish. - DFIR

aprobar.x: (tr.) to approve, give approbation to. Ant.: des-, ne-aprobar.

apta.x: apt, fit, appropriate, good for, suitable (ad); -eso: aptitude, aptness, qualification

apud.x: (prep.) close by, next to, beside, -a: near, neighboring, adjacent

apuntar.x: (tr.) to point (a fire-arm); take aim at; level at

aquilono.x: (poet., lit.) Aquilon: the north wind personified.

aquirar.x: (tr.) to get (through one's own exertions), to become the possessor of (by purchase, by labor, etc.), to acquire, win; to contract (a habit, a sickness); to gain (affection favor), to incur (dislike, hatred)

arachar.x: (tr.) to pull or drag out (a nail, etc.); to tear out (the hair, the eyes); to grub up (roots); to tear away (a child from its mother); to snatch, wrest, extort, wring (ulo de ulu); Ex.: arachar afisho, konfeso, krii, lakrimi. Arachar ulu de la morta.

aranjar.x: (tr.) to arrange: make orderly disposition of, dispose of in a proper manner; (cf. ordinar) -o, -eso, -uro: (act, state, result) arranging, disposition; Ex.: Aranjar libri sur tablo. Aranjar afero, mariajo, kofro, lito Aranjar por facar ulo.

arbitrajar.x: (tr., com.) to carry on arbitrage: to buy and sell on the market.

arbitrar.x: (tr.) to arbitrate: award as an arbitrator, decide, judge, settle (ulo); -o: arbitration

arbitriajo.x: arbitrary act, caprice: -e: ad libitum, at will

arbusto.x: shrub, bush (not over three feet in height)

ardorar.x: (intr.) to be aglow, glowing, hot, fiery (cf. brular, kombustar); (fig.) (of passion, zeal) to be ardent, fervent; (of animals) to be in heat, rut

ardorigar.x: to make burn, set on fire, make ardent.

ardua.x: arduous: (of mountains, etc.) steep, rugged: hard to climb (cf. eskarpa); (of tasks, etc.} difficult to perform.

areno.x: arena, ring. V. Exp.: Areno esas spaco rondatra od elipsoiorma e klozita, por la ludi e kombati cirklala. Lico esas longa kureyo, generale duopia (por iro e riveno) por kuri o por turniri, II-646.

arestar.x: (tr., legal) to arrest: make a prisoner of, put under a.

argilo.x: argil; clay, potter's earth; -a, -oza, -atra: argillaceous, clayish; -izar: to marl (land).

argumentaar.x: (intr.) to argue: hold an argument. Def.: Rezonar por pruvar ulo.

arieto.x: (instr. of war and tech.) battering-ram; Aries, sign of the Zodiac; hidraulikala -o: hydraulic ram.

aristo.x: (geom.) edge, projecting angle; (arch. and carp.) arris; (bot.) awn, beard (of barley, wheat, etc.); ridge (of nose, of mountain, of a bayonet, etc.)

arivar.x: (intr.) to arrive (at destination, at a certain place). V. exp.; Se ulu venas de Berlin ad Paris, lu advenas dum la tota voyajo; nia lu arivas nur ye la tino (lasta momento) di la voyajo; e lu povas advenar sen anvar (se lu esus haltigata da acidento); VI-322- Ant.: departar.

arkano.x: arcanum: great secret of nature. V. exp.: Sekreta, arkana, okulta: Sekreta esas la maxim generala vorto. Arkano esas sekreto ciencala (o, pseudo-ciencala), quan on revelas o docas nur ad iniciati (ex.: l'arkani di l'alkemio). Ol esas analoga a misterio, ma misterio apartenas a religio, ed arkano a cienco o tekniko. Okulta dicesas omno quo koncernas la mondo di la spiriti e nia (asertita) relati kun li (ex. magio, astrologio, spiritismo, e.c.). La ‹‹okulta cienci›› ne esas simple sekreta cienci ma la cienci qui pretendas revelar a ni l'altra mondo o komunikigar ni kun olu; (kp. IV-237).

arkigar.x: to arch: bend, curve, in form of a.

arko.x: (geom., arch., elec.) arch (as of bridge), arc

armatoro.x: shipowner. Def.: Posedanto ed equipanto di navo; III-75.

armaturo.x: (elec.) armature; (tech.) iron braces, stays (to strengthen masonry, etc.)

armekorpo.x: a. corps; (fig.) cielal- - o: celestial a.

arogar.x: (tr.) to arrogate (ulo a su): to make undue claims

aroruto.x: arrowroot: starchy flour of Maranta arundinatea and other plants.

arozar.x: (tr.) to moisten, wet, water (with any liquid)

arozventuro.x: sprinkling cart; V. exp.: aquizar, aspersar, irgacar: On povas arozar materiale o figurale, per mult altra liquidi kam aquo. La biblo dicas, ke Noa ‹‹arozis›› la vito sucedante per sango di pavono, per sango di simio, per sango di leono e per sango di porko. Do on ne povas uzar ‹‹aquizar››. On aspersas planti ed arbori por preventar ula morbo. Asperso relatas saneso. Irigaco esas brancho di agrokultivado. Ol aquizas tota farmi, distrikti per fluigar aquo de riveri, lagi, e.c., en artificala kanali a la kultivo-loki; IV-353, 459.

arteriito.x: arteritis: inflammation of the arteries; (cf. flebito).

artificala.x: artificial; (cf. falsa): -acho: (in a bad sense) cunning, craft, wile, trick

artiklo.x: (newspaper, gram.) article; (cf. varo, komerc-ajo); -o redaktistal: editorial

artilrio.x: artillery: body of troops; (cf. kanon-aro); -ano: a. man, gunner

arto.x: art: practical skill guided by rules; occupation requiring such skill

artro.x: (anat.) part or segment of a limb or body; movable articulation. Ex.: La korpi di kelka insekti havas multa artri.

arufar.x: (tr.) to ruffle up, turn back (feathers, hair)

asafetido.x: asafetida: gum resin of Ferula Asafoetida.

asaltar.x: (tr.) to assault, storm (a fortified place); to assault, charge (the enemy)

asasinar.x: (tr.) to assassinate. Def.: Mortigar kun preintenco ed embuske o surprize; III-698.

asemblar.x: (tr., gen.) to assemble: collect, bring together (people, materials, etc.)

asentar.x: (tr.) to give assent to: agree to, aquiesce in. Ex.: Me asentas vua judiko (t.e. me opinionas same, me judikas to kom vera. V. exp.: Asento koncernas opinioni pure teoriala

asertar.x: (tr.) to assert, allege, set forth, protest (declare)

asfixiita.x: a.ed. V. exp.: Sufokar esas la vulgara, asfixiar la ciencala vorto. Asfixiar esas la halto dil arterio-pulsado. Ol esas stando sucedanta al neperfekta oxigenizo dil sango, finanta per la morto, kande lu tro duras. Sufoko esas speco de asfixio, per obstaklo al adveno dil areo til pulmoni, obstruktado di naztrui, di boko, kompreso di kolo, e.c.; II

asidua.x: assiduous: constant, regular (in attendance or work). V. exp.: Diligenta relatas la fervoro od agemeso, ed asidua la akurata e reguloza prezenteso, la kontinueso di laboro; II

asignar.x: (tr.) to assign, to appropriate, allot, set apart (a sum), to fix, appoint (a day, place, rank), (fig., legal) to summons, cite, subpoena; (cf.atribuar, cedar)

asimilar.x: (tr.) to assimilate (physiol. and fig.). Ex.: La animali povas asimilar nur animala o vejetala substanci. Usa asimilas multa populi.

askoltar.x: (tr.) to listen to, hearken to, give ear to

asociar.x: (tr.) to make (a person) one's associate, partner, colleague, companion, accomplice (in an ill sense); to make (ulu) participate or share in (ulo)

asomar.x: (tr.) to fell, to knock down: to knock on the head

asomilo.x: loaded bludgeon. V. exp.: On povas asomar per mazo o sen instrumento (ex. per pugnobato); II

asortar.x: (tr.) to assort, match, suit, sort out, classify things alike, or somewhat alike, or suited to each other

aspektar.x: (intr.) to look (like, as if: quale), to seem (to be), appear

aspera.x: (of touch) rough, uneven. V. exp.: Acerba koncernas la gusto, aspera la takto; II-707. Ant.: glata.

aspersar.x: (tr.) to sprinkle (to prevent disease); (rel.) to asperse

aspersilo.x: sprinkler; (rel.) aspergillum. V. exp.: vid. arozar.

aspirar.x: (tr.) to inhale, draw in (air, smoke, etc.); to suck in or up (liquids); (gram.) to aspirate (a sound); to aspire: desire eagerly, long for, aim at

asterismo.x: (astron., opt. of crystals) asterism. Def.: Optikal fenomeno; reflekto radianta di la lumo sur ula lapidi; III-135.

astonar.x: (tr.) to astonish, surprise, amaze: -egar: to astound, aghast; (fig.) to stupify; (cf. stupor-igar); -esar: to be a.ed (da).

astriktar.x: (tr.) to have an astringent effect on

astriktiva.x: astringent. Def.: Astrikto esas densigo di ula organika texuri: ex. ‹‹aluno esas astriktiva›› II-645.

asumar.x: (tr.) to assume, take on oneself, undertake; (cf. entraprezar)

atakar.x: (tr.) to attack; (milit.) to take the offensive; (cf. asaltar, asomar, atentar); -o: (alo med.) attack(ing)

atencar.x: (tr.) to pay attention to (ulu, ulo); to apply the mind to, heed

atencez.x: attention! mind! look out! ne- -oza, -ema: inattentive, heedless

atentar.x: (tr.) to make a criminal attempt on (ulu, ulo)

atento.x: attempt (to commit an offense or crime); attack, assault (on persons or property), outrage

atestar.x: (tr.) to attest: certify, bear witness, give proof of

atlanto.x: (arch.) atlas; (pl.) atlantes; (cf. kariatido). Def.: Virala figuro, qua servas kom suportilo.

atrapar.x: (tr.) to entrap: take in, trick, hoax, dupe

atribuar.x: to assign, give, bestow, vest, allocate, invest with (something as due and appropriate)

atrico.x: (theol.) attrition: grief for sin arising from fear of punishment.

aturdar.x: (tr.) to stun. V. exp.: Aturdar ne esas sempre vertijigar, nek ebriigar; en sua propra senco, ol indikas nekoncio o preska nekoncio produktita exemple da frapo, granda shoko, e.c. IV-1102.

aucionar.x: (tr.) to bid for, offer a higher price

audacar.x: (tr.) to dare, venture, be so bold as

audar.x: (tr.) to hear: receive sensations by the ear

audienco.x: audience, sitting, hearing (granted by person in authority)

augmentar.x: (tr., intr.) to augment: to increase, enlarge, to make larger or more numerous; to raise (rents, prices, wages, etc. (cf. plu-cher-igar)

augurar.x: (tr.) to augur (de ulo); -o: augury, omen, presage

augusta.x: august: imposing awe or veneration, majestic. Ex.: Il esas persono di august aspekto.

aula.x: aula: hall in universities, colleges, etc.

aureolizar.x: to put a halo around (as in painting); (fig.) to crown with glory.

austera.x: austere: (in a moral sense) strict, rigid. Def.: Tre severa por su pri la mori, kun nuanco di rigoro ed asketeso; II-707.

auto.x: (prefix for scientific and technical words) auto-, self-

autografa.x: autographic: written by one's own hand

autopsiar.x: (tr.) to hold an autopsy on (ulu); -o: autopsy, post-mortem.

avalo.x: aval: guaranty, surety: a signature at bottom of a bill to guarantee payment

avan.x: (prep.) in front of, ahead of; before (in space, cf. ante); -e: (adv.) in front

avanajo.x: thing, object in front, forepart; (fig.) forequarters (as of a horse)

avancar.x: (tr. intr.) to advance: to go forward, move, put forward, (in space and time)

avancez.x: forward! Ex.: Avancar la manuo, la pedo. La armeo avancas en la lando. Avancar sua departo. Avancigar la laboro. Ant.: retro -irar; regresar, tard-igar.

avantajizar.x: to advantage, bestow an a. on, to favor

avanviro.x: front man; (milit.) chief of file. Ant.: dop.

avario.x: damage, loss, (com.) average. Def.: Avario indikas omna domajo, ne nur di navo, ma di kozi transportita per navo, fervoyo, veturo; II-138.

aventurar.x: (intr.) to seek adventures, go on adventures, lead an adventurous (or roving) life

avenuo.x: avenue. Def.: Larja voyo arborizita, duktanta ad ula loko, kastelo, monumento (forsan placo), III-16.

averse.x: front side to; (cf. facio). Ant.: reverso.

averso.x: front-, right-side (of cloth, medals, etc.) first page (of a book)

avertar.x: (tr.) to give notice, apprise, caution, advertise, warn (N.B. not necessarily to warn of danger)

aviacilo.x: flying machine (heavier than air). Note: for technical terms see IV-330-333.

avizar.x: (tr.) to apprise, advise, give notice of (pri ulo); -o: notice, notification (generally an order or prohibition)

azilo.x: asylum: place of refuge for poor, sick, or helpless; (fig.) any place of retreat or security

babilar.x: (intr.) to babble, prattle (as infants); to chatter (as a magpie); to gossip, gabble, prate (of grown persons)

badijonivo.x: badigeon: a cement or distemper paste of powdered stone and plaster.

bakanalo.x: (lit. and fig.) bacchanalia: a drunken feast or revel.

balado.x: ballad, ballade: epic dance and song.

balanciero.x: (of machines) a balancing body; fly-wheel; gimbals (of a compass). Def.: Maso (generale roto-forma) qua ocilas cirkum sua baricentro per risorto; II-641.

balbutar.x: (tr., intr.) to stutter, stammer (from emotion); to lisp (as an infant); to boggle; hem and haw, to hesitate in reading and reciting; (cf. barbuliar). V. exp.: vid. stoterar.

baldakino.x: baldachin: tester (of a bed); canopy (of a throne, altar, etc.)

baliso.x: (nav.) sea-mark, buoy, beacon; (cf. boyo); (land) signal-pole (on R.R. or towpath)

balotar.x: (tr.) to elect (ulu) by second ballot, -o: second-ballot (in Europe; necessary when no candidate has obtained an absolute majority). -voto: vote by ballot.

balotear.x: (intr., med. and gen.) to wabble, shake, tremble, quiver (pro). Def.: La vulgara senco di ica vorto expresas la movo ocilanta o tremanta di maso solida, ma elastika o viskoza (quale gelatino). IV-516. Ex.: Lua karno baloteas pro la shoko.

balustrado.x: balustrade, railing, (cf. pasamano). Def.: Rango formacita ek balustri, generale horizontala.

balustro.x: baluster: upright support for railing. Def.: Mikra pilastro faasonita.

balzamo.x: balsam: fragrant resin used as medicine; (fig.) balm, consolation

bandajizar.x: to bandage; put a tire on

bandear.x: (intr. nav.) to have a list, be lopsided

banderolo.x: pennant, streamer, banderole. Def.: Bendo longa ek stofo, qua flotacas en l'aero; finas ofte per du pinti; en pikturi, portas surskriburi; II-708.

bandoliero.x: bandolier: cross-, shoulder-belt. Def.: Rimeno o sharpo pozita sur un shultro e suportanta ula kozo (ex. espado) sur l'altra latero, do pasanta oblique sur la korpo; II-708.

bankrotigar.x: to bankrupt: cause bankruptcy to: -o: bankruptcy

barako.x: shed, hut; temporary wooden building to shelter soldiers, fishermen, etc.; booth, covered stall (in a fair)

baraktar.x: (intr.) to struggle: strive to get away, writhe, strive (kontre); (cf. luktar). Ex.: La kaptata fisho baraktas en l'aquo. Baraktar per manui e pedi. (fig.) La sovaji ne forte baraktas kontre la morto.

barar.x: (tr.) to bar to stop up (a way, a door, etc.)

baratrio.x: (nav.) barratry. Def.: Fraudo da la kapitano o navestro kontre armatori od asekuristi; II-75.

barbakano.x: (arch.) barbican; loop-hole; escape-hole (in retaining wall for water).

barbo.x: beard: hair on the chin, lips and cheeks of men and animals

barbotar.x: (intr.) to dabble, paddle, splash, flounder about (in mud or water).

barbuliar.x: (tr.) to sputter, splutter, mumble;(cf. balbutar). Def.: Parolar iro rapide e konseque neklare e konfuze, nekompreneble; III-6.

barko.x: bark: small boat as wherry, punt, skiff. Def.: Mikra kanoto senmasta, movanta per remili, e ne generale uzata in maral aqui; (mitol.) la paromo di C(h)aron en la rivero Styx.

baroka.x: odd, queer-looking, uncouth, baroque, bizarre; ill-shped, distorted (of pearls)

barokajo.x: an oddity. Def.: Qua havas aspekto nereguloza o stranja (ex. perlo, stilo); IV-2.

basa.x: (of dimensions, also pressure, sound) low (cf. alta)

basaGermana.x: low German (dialect). V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: alta.

basaeskar.x: to decline, wane, begin to droop, drop

basaigar.x: to make low: shorten the height of (cf. abasar); to lower (in tone, in pressure)

basamento.x: (arch.) basement. V. exp.: Ne konfunenda kun fundamento: basamento esas l'infra parto (bazo) videbla di edifico, qua jacas sur la fundamento; III-670.

baseno.x: (dock, river, water-works) basin; (geog.) valley, hollow; (dish) deep, wide pan

baskular.x: (intr.) to see-saw: sway up and down

baskuligar.x: to make s.s., to rock back and forward

baskulilo.x: a see-saw; swing (for play); rocker (of a chiar); sweep (of a well); (tech.) rocking lever

basoto.x: dachshund, basset-hound. Def.: Hundo karakterizata da gambi tre kurta e tordita; VI-604.

batita.x: beaten; (dispute) inter-batar, batar reciproke: fight, quarrel, exchange of blows

bayonetagar.x: to b. (ulu), to use the b.

bazo.x: base: lowest part of anything, foundation, bottom, foot; (fig.) basis, foundation, grounds; (chem.) base

bear.x: (intr.) to open the mouth, to gape (fig.) to yawn

bedelo.x: beadle: apparitor; usher. Def.: La nomo di ta qua preiras o sequas la procesioni (generale religiala); VII-43.

begino.x: beguine: a kind of nun in the Netherlands

beko.x: beak: bill of a bird; (tech.) beak, spout (of a vessel)

bendizar.x: to bind up, place a band on

bendo.x: bank: long, narrow piece of cloth, paper, metal, etc., strip, stripe, streak; fillet (for head), (hat) band

benedikar.x: (tr.) to bless, pronounce a benediction on.

beneficiero.x: beneficiary: holder of a benfice; recipient of the profits from a benefit performance.

benigna.x: benign: kind, morally good; mild (of medicines, diseases).

benko.x: bench, long seat, settle, form; (in boats) thwart

benzoo.x: (bot.) benzoin; resin from the tree Styrax benzoin.

beredo.x: beret: round, flat cap such as worn by Basque peasants.

berloko.x: trinket, charm (such as attached to watch chains).

bermo.x: (fort. and gen.) berme: narrow shelf. Def.: Parto horizontal en taluso.

bestiario.x: (rom. antiq.) bestiarius: person doomed to fight with wild beasts.

bestio.x: beast, any animal except man, (cf. animalo, bruto) -ala, -atra: bestial

bezonar.x: (tr.) to need; be in want of something necessary

biciklego.x: a large b.; the old-fashioned, high b.

bideto.x: (furniture) bidet; a kind of Sitz bath.

bidono.x: can (for oil etc.) (milit.) canteen. Def.: Ladovazo klozita por oleo, petrolo, benzino, e.c. qua kontenas de un til 10 litri; gurdatra kontenilo ek lado, quan la soldato portas. (III

bielkapo.x: cross-head. Def.: Stango qua ligas un peco ad altra, generale, stango di pistono a manivelo, e transformas movo rektolinea a movo rotaca. II

bifurkar.x: (tr. intr.) to bifurcate, branch off (from), fork (ek, kun) -o, -eyo: bifurcation, crotch (of a tree)

bilgo.x: (nav.) bilge, lower part of a hold, well.

biliono.x: billion: a million millions: (1,000,000,000,000) N. B. not as in U.S.: a thousand millions.

bilkoketo.x: cup and ball (used in a game).

bireto.x: biretta: R. C. ecclesiastic square cap

bis.x: twice, (in theaters) encore! repeat! klamar bis: to encore; (repetition of numbers)

biskoto.x: rusk, zwieback. Def.: Loncho de pano rostita o grilita; III

bitra.x: (lit. and fig.) bitter: hot and acid; sharp, poignant; biting; acrimonious

bivakeyo.x: a b. (place). V. exp.: Bivakar esas kampar sen tendi, sub la cielo (generale cirkum fairi), nun por un nokto; II

bizancano.x: quibbler. Def.:Qua prizas perdar sua tempo en diskutar subtilaji neutila; IV

blamar.x: (tr.) to blame, find fault with, reprobate, disapprove the actions or conduct of (ulo, pri, pro). V. exp.: vid. reprochar Ant.: laudar.

blanka.x: white; (fig.) blank: not written or printed on (page, etc.), -o, -ulo, -ino: a white person

blankigar.x: to whiten, to bleach (clothes): -eskar: to become or turn white

blazar.x: (tr.) to blunt, pall, cloy, sicken (ulu, pri ulo); -esar: to be palled, surfeited

blazono.x: blazon: coat of arms, armorial bearing

blezar.x: (tr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronuncar s quale th angla o c hispana (t. e. kun la lango-pinto inter la denti); III

bloko.x: block, lump (of wood, stone, iron, etc.)

blokusar.x: (tr.) to blockade (a port), to invest (a town)

blotisar.x: (intr.) to lie close to the ground, crouch, cower; (cf. squatar). Ex.: Blotisar en angulo; blotisar dop hego o pordo.

bluzo.x: blouse (as worn by workers, painters); smock (peasant's).

bogio.x: bogie-frame, -truck. Def.: Ensemblo di quar (o du) roti qui formacas vagoneto e surportas l'extremajo di vagono o di lokomotivo; III

bokalo.x: glass-jar. Def.: Vazo cilindra o cilindratra, ek vitro, sen pedo, kun plato fundo el larja boko, uzata precipue en kemio, farmacio (e por konfituri); II

boko.x: (anat.) mouth; orifice, opening, entrance (of a utensil, implement, volcano, harbor, etc.)

boliar.x: (intr.) to boil: be in a state of ebullition (cf. ebuliar)

bombardilo.x: bombarding instrument, as a mortar (cf. obus-kanono)

boneskar.x: to become, grow g. or better

boneto.x: rimless cap; bonnet (for woman or child)

bonimentar.x: (intr.) to make a mountebank's speech, claptrap speech. Def.: Bonimento: diskurso fanfaronema, quan facas la sharlatani e feriala aktori por laudar sua vari od aktraktar la publiko. Bonimentar: facar bonimento; IV

borar.x: (tr.) to bore, pierce (with a turning instrument)

borborigmo.x: (med.) borborygm: rumbling of water or wind in the stomach.

bordear.x: (intr., nav.) to tack (ship), beat to windward. Def.: Avanirar (navo) zigzage kontre la vento; III

bordo.x: border, margin, brink, edge, brim, (ship's) side

boreala.x: boreal. Def.: Mitologiala nomo di la nordvento, de qua venas boreala; III

boselar.x: (tr., tech.) to emboss, chase (plate, leather). Def.: Formacar reliefi en metalo per martelago (de interne); VI-382.

botanizar.x: (intr.) to botanize, herborize. Def.: Kolektar por la botanikal studio (ne praktikar o studiar la botaniko); III-169.

bracagar.x: to brace (a rope of a yard).

brakio.x: arm (anat. and fig. as a. of sea)

brakiumo.x: brassard, armlet (to show function or office)

brako.x: brach-hound; Def.: Speco di chas-hundo, rezapila e oreli pendanta.

bramar.x: (intr.) to make the characteristic call of any animal, except that of the dog, fox, cat, cock, crow, frog, hen

branchizar.x: add a b. to (a gas or water-main)

brando.x: (fire-)brand; a piece of wood partly burnt

brasar.x: (tr.) to stir: mix up ingredients; (fig.) to concoct, contrive, polot, (schemes, plots, etc.)

brazar.x: to braze: join with spelter (hard solder). V. exp.: vid. weldar.

brechizar.x: to make a breach, gap in (ulo).

brecho.x: breach, break, gap, opening (in a wall, etc.) dento-brech-oza: gap-toothed

bretelo.x: strap (to carry a knapsack, pack, etc.) strap, sling (for a musket, rifle); brace, suspender (to hold up trousers)

brezbaseno.x: brazier, warming-pan. Def.: Ligno konvertita en karbono per komusto, sive ardoranta, sive extingita; II-708.

brilar.x: (intr.) to shine: emit or reflect light; be luminous, bright, brilliant, radiant; to glitter, glisten (cf. cin-til-ifar)

brino.x: short end or bit (of a cord, rope); Def.: Parto (seciono o segmento) di kordo; V-157.

briocho.x: brioche; a buttered cake or roll.

brizanto.x: sunken-reef, -rock. V. exp.: Rifo salias super l'aquo, ma brizanto esas rokajo reze l'aquo, sur qua la ondi ruptesas; V

brodar.x: (tr.) to embroider: ornament with figures, needle-work.

brokolikaulo.x: broccoli: a hardy variety of cauliflower (Brassica oleracea botrytis).

broshuro.x: brochure: pamphlet stitched, with paper covers; (cf. pamfleto)

bruisar.x: (intr.) to make a noise: rustle, rattle, rumble, clatter, hum

bruisego.x: a loud noise; crash, din, tumult, uproar

bruisigar.x: to cause (ulo) to make a noise, to rattle.

brular.x: (tr., intr.) to burn: consume with fire (wood, coal, oil); to wound or injure with fire; to scorch, parch, dry up; (fig.) to be inflamed (with passion), to be ardent

brulodoro.x: smell of burning; Ex.: La Romani brulis Carthage. La suno brulas la planti. V. exp.:Brular esas la vulgara, kombustar esas la ciencala vorto. On uzas brular ne nur por kombusti videbla, kun flamo, ma anke por la vundi facita da bolianta aquo. Altraparte, on uzas kombustar por omna oxidigo, mem nerapida e nevidebla: ex: la respirado esas kombusto; explozo esas anke kombusto. Nur la vulgara vorta uzesas metafore; on dicas »Me kordio brulas de amo.« On povas dicar, ke ulo kombustar sen brular, se ol nek flamifas nek ardoras (t.e. divenas fairoreda); IV

brunigar.x: to make b., darken; (fig.) to sunburn

brunisar.x: (tr., tech.) to burnish (brass, gold, etc.). Def.: Procedo por polisar metali; III

bruo.x: husk, shell (of nuts). Def.: Verda shelo (generale, di nuco); III

bruska.x: brusque: gruff, abrupt, blunt (in address or manners)

budar.x: (intr.) to be sulky, sullen, look sour (cf. facar muzelo)

bufar.x: (intr.) to swell, puff out; to distend (as cheeks by blowing); to stand out (as stout silks, starched muslin, etc.)

bufeto.x: buffet: refreshment foom (at balls, R.R. stations, etc.).

bufigar.x: to cause to puff, swell out

bufonesar.x: to be a b.; (fig.) to be jocose

bugrano.x: buckram. Def.: Tolo forta e rigida (gumizita); III-73.

buletino.x: bulletin. Def.: Mikra jurnalo, revuo, o periodala raporto; III-199.

buleto.x: small ball, marble pellet (not E. bullet, vid. kuglo)

bulino.x: (nav.) bowline. Def.: Kordo qua tensas la seglo per l'infra angulo; VI-530.

bulo.x: ball (as for play in billiards, basseball, etc.)

bunta.x: many-colored; motley, streaked, checkered, piebald, dappled

burasko.x: (nav.) squall; (fig.) outburst of passion. Def.: To ne esas ventego, nek tempesto, ma subita e neduranta ventobato; III-8.

burelo.x: frieze, baize: a coarse woollen fabric.

buro.x: short-hair or other materials used in stuffing saddle-pads, making mortar, etc.; wad, wadding (for guns)

busto.x: bust: head and shoulders of body, or as represented in sculpture and painting.

bustrofedono.x: boustrophedon; an ancient mode of writing.

butar.x: (intr.) to stumble, butt, knock, run, strike (sur, kontre ulo)

cedar.x: (tr.) to cede, yield (up); give (up); to assign (property);(cf. alienar)

cedrato.x: (fruit) cedrate: a kind of citron (cf. citrono)

celar.x: (tr.) to hide, secrete, conceal, keep secret; -ita: hidden, clandestine

celebrar.x: (tr.) to celebrate, commemorate. Ex.: Celebrar mariajo, funero, jubileo, aniversario, meso; (III-199).

celulo.x: cell: small room in convent, prison, etc.; small cavity (as in a honey-comb)

cementacar.x: (tr., metall.) to cement: to convert iron into steel, to case-harden

cementizar.x: to c.; (of teeth) to fill a cavity with c.

cemento.x: cement: kind of mortar for building, as Portland c.

censo.x: »cense«: amount of taxes, income, which entitles a person to vote

cento.x: one hundred; (in reckoning interest or fractional parts) cent.

centrifugala.x: centrifugal. Def.: Agar, traktar per centrifugala forco; IV

centrifugar.x: (tr.) to act on something by centrifugal force

ceremonio.x: ceremony, formalities prescribed by authority or etiquette

cernar.x: (tr., milit., and fig.) to make a circle or ring around, encircle, to beset on all sides, besiege, beleaguer, blockade, invest, hem in; to cut or dig around (a tree)

certigar.x: to certify: make certain, assure, guarantee

ceruzo.x: ceruse: white-lead. Def.: Sub-karbato di plombo, uzata kom farbo blanka; IV

cesar.x: (tr., intr.) to cease; to come to an end, leave off, stop

cesigar.x: to put a stop or an end to, discontinue

cetere.x: besides, moreover, for that matter, in other respects

chagrenanta.x: sorrowful, sad. Ant. chagreno: joyo, gayeso.

chalenjo.x: challenge-cup (N.B. not the E. »challenge« (cf. defio). Def.: (Premio en) konkurso en qua la premio ne donesas, ma prestesas dum tempo a la vinkinto, til ke altra partiso vinkas ica e konquestas la premio; VII-198.

chamado.x: chamade: trumpet or drum signal for parley.

chamaro.x: (coat) polonaise. Def.: Speco di redingoto kun transversa kordoni avane, polona vesto de revolucional epoko dil XIX yarcento; V-222.

chambro.x: chamber, room; (fig.) a house of parliament

chanco.x: (good or bad) chance, luck, fortune; possibility

chanfreno.x: face of a horse (or other animal, from ears to nostrils). Def.: Avana parto di kapo di kavalo; VII-198.

chanjar.x: (tr., intr.) to change, shift; (cf. kambiar, permutar, alterar)

chanto.x: the small side or edge of a large flat body

chapelo.x: hat (with brim all around, for man or woman)

chareto.x: any light two wheeled cart, jaunting-car, cariole

chariotagar.x: to cart, truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo kun quar roti; IV

charioto.x: good van, truck: four-wheeled sided wagon for carrying goods

charjar.x: (tr.) to load, burden (somebody or something with something), to load (a gun), lade (a vehicle)

charmar.x: (tr.) to charm: delight, captivate, enchant; (cf. ravisar, facinar, sorcar)

charniro.x: hinge (of a door, a box, etc.); (mechan.) joint (as compasses)

charo.x: (antiq.) chariot; (modern) a two wheeled cart or a four wheeled ornamented car

charto.x: charter: document granting special rights or privileges.

chasta.x: chaste: untainted by lewdness; (fig.) refined, pure (in taste, style)

che.x: (prep) at, to, in (somebody's house, home, or place), with (to indicate customs)

chefala.x: chief's, relating to the leader; chief

chefesar.x: to be chief, be in command

chelato.x: (helmet) sallet. Def.: Speco di kasko uzata en la mezepoko e 16a yarcento; IV

chereskar.x: to become, grow dearer. Def.: Multe kustanta; IV

cherpar.x: (tr.) to draw liquids; (cf. rakar); (fig.) to take, borrow. Ex.: Cherpar aquo de fonto, de rivero. Cherpar vino de barelo. La autoro cherpas peco de altra autoro.

chevrono.x: (arch.) chevron (fig.) any inverted V-shaped object, as a rafter.

chifrar.x: (tr.) to write in secret cipher (cf. kriptografar)

chika.x: chic, stylish and original, natty, smart

chikeso.x: chic, knack, skill, address (in doing anything); originality and taste (as in dress).

chiniono.x: chignon: back hair of a woman.

chipa.x: cheap, low (in price). Def.: Poke kustanta; IV-690. Ant.: chera.

chomar.x: (tr., intr.) to be out of work, to suspend work on, to rest from work

chomeso.x: (state) cessation or want of work. Ex.: On chomas la sundii. La laboristi chomas pro blokal exkluzo.

chopino.x: a beer glass (containing about a pint); (fig.) a pint

choseo.x: roadway, causeway, travelling part (for horses, carriages, etc.).

cibolo.x: (bot.) cibol, a kind of onion. (Allium fistulosum).

cicisbeo.x: : cicisbeo. Def.: Amoranto di siorino, qua esas quaze oficale agnoskata e servas el publike; V-621.

cifreto.x: small number at side of a larger number, as 32. Def.: Tipo o signo qua reprezentas nombro (Araba o Romana).

cikatro.x: scar, cicatrice: mark remaining from wound or ulcer

ciklono.x: cyclone, tornado, typhoon; a violent rotary wind.

cikuto.x: (bot. tree or poison) hemlock (Conium maculatum and species of Cicuta).

cindrigar.x: to reduce (ulo) to ashes, incinerate (cf. kremacar

cindro.x: ash(es), cinders (of coal); embers (of wood); dust: remains of the dead; (cf. eskarbilo

cinemo.x: popular abbr. for cinematografilo or, more especially a moving-picture theater, cinema, picture-house.

cintilifar.x: to emit sparks, to shine brightly, glitter, glisten, sparkle, flash, twinkle, scintillate.

cintilo.x: spark (of fire); sparkle (of anything shining or vivid)

ciprino.x: (ich.) cyprinoid, scientific name for the carp: genus: Cyprinus.

circinata.x: circinate, rolled up like a young fern leaf.

cirkondanti.x: (fig.) confidants, friends, relations; Ex.: Me vidas oldi cirkondita da infanti.

cirkonspekte.x: cautiously. V. exp.: Cirkonspekta ne esas simple prudenta, ma predenteso desfidema, qua »regardas cirkum su«, konsideras omna lateri od elementi ante decidar od agar; III

cirkonstanco.x: circumstance: a fact, occurence, or condition attending something else

cirkonvoluciono.x: cirkumvolution; that which is rolled around something (cf. parafrazo).

cirkuito.x: circuit: circumference, compass; roundabout way; (Eng. and U.S.) circuit (of judges)

cirkular.x: (intr.) to circulate: to move around, to flow in a circuitous channel; (of money, etc.) to pass from hand to hand

cirkuligar.x: to cause to c., move around; (money) put into circulation, issue. Ex.: La sango cirkulas en la korpo. La tero cirkulas cirkum la suno. Cirkulado di idei.

cirkumlekar.x: to lick around (one's chops), (fig). to gloat over

civila.x: civil: pertaining to a citizen and his rights (not milit., or criminal) lay (opposed to ecclesiastical)

civilizeso.x: civilization: state of advancement in the arts and sciences (cf. kulturo).

civismala.x: civic. V. exp.: Civismo esas devoteso di homo a sua sam-civitani o sam-statani

civito.x: city: the older, most ancient part of a town (cf. urbo)

da.x: (indicating agent after passive verb) la patri esas amata da sua filii: the parents are loved by their children

dago.x: dirk: a short shord or kind of poniard.

damnito.x: person damned, a lost soul. (cf. maledikar, blasfemar) Ex.: Deo damnas la maligni. Doktrino damninda.

damo.x: married or widowed woman; dame; (in cards, chess, checkers) a queen

damoifar.x: (checkers) to go to king, (at chess) to go to queen.

damzelo.x: young lady, miss, maid, damsel; unmarried woman, spinster; (before a proper name) Miss

dandio.x: dandy: fop; coxcomb. Def.: Homulo eleganta, segun la modo.

dankar.x: (tr.) to thank (ulu, pri, pro ulo); (cf. gratitudar).

darfar.x: may, to have a right to, be permitted

darnar.x: (tr.) to darn (garments). Def.: Specala modo di rapecar stofi, vesti, ne pozante peco, ma imitante la texuro; III

daturo.x: (bot.) datura (genus: Datura); thorn-apple, Jimson weed (Datura stramonium).

dazlar.x: (tr.) to dazzle: to overpower by bright or moving lights; (fig.) to blind; (fig.) to excite to admiration by brilliancy, display (of beauty, money, honors, etc.) (cf. facinar). Def.: Trublar instantale la vid-povo per tro brilanta lumo, o per tro rapida movado, agitado, e.c. VI

de.x: (prep) (starting point, origin, derivation) la treno de Lyon: the train from Lyons: blinda de nasko: blind from birth

debar.x: (tr.) to owe (ulo, ad ulu); (intr.) to be under obligation (ad ulu, por ulo)

debatar.x: (tr.) to debate. Def.: Diskutar kun un o plura konversanti en ordinoza ed atencoza maniero, singlu prizentante l'argumenti servanta sua propra interesto o prefero; V

debetigar.x: to d. (a sum to somebody's account)

debeto.x: (com.) debit (after the balance of an account), debit-balance

debila.x: (of persons) weak, feeble; (cf. frajila), -igar: to debilitate, enfeeble

debitar.x: (tr.) to sell (goods, supplies, ordinarily at retail)

debochar.x: (intr.) to go to excess in sensual pleasures, to live dissolutely, to revel, carouse

debochigar.x: to debauch: entice to debauchery, to corrupt with lewdness

debutar.x: (intr., theat.) to make one's debut, first appearance; (fig.) to start, set out: take one's first steps

decar.x: (intr.) to be decent, suitable, correct, proper; (cf. esar justa)

decensar.x: (tr., intr.) to go down, descend: to move or pass from a higher to a lower plane

decenseyo.x: descent (place). Ex.: Decensar (de) monto en valo. Decensar (de) arboro. Decensar eskalero. La mareo, la temperaturo decensas. Ant.: acensar.

deceptar.x: (tr.) to disappoint, to defeat (the hopes, expectations of someone)

dechifrar.x: (tr.) to decipher: to discover the key to a secret writing. V. exp.: vid. chifrar.

decilitro.x: deciliter: tenth part of a liter: 6.1 cu. in.

decimetro.x: decimeter: tenth of a meter: 3.937 in.

decimo.x: decime. Def.: Dekimo di franko, o 10 centimi; III-324.

dedikar.x: (tr.) to dedicate: consecrate to a Divine Being; to devote to a sacred use; to inscribe or address to a patron or friend; (cf. konsakrar).

defensar.x: (tr.) to defend, protect (ulu, ulo, su, kontre)

defensiva.x: defensive. Ex.: Defensar sua patrio, sua honoro, sua opiniono.

deferencar.x: (tr.) to defer to, show deference to

deferenco.x: deference, regard, respect. Def.: Deferenco: Respekto qun on manifestas ad ulu exekutante lua volo o deziro. Nociono komplexa, qua ne esas simpla respekto. III-323. Ex.: On devas deferencar sua patri. Kun omna deferenceo qua esas debata a vu. Ant.: (deferenco) des-prizo, aarog-em-eso.

defiar.x: (tr.) to defy, challenge, dare (ulu, pri ulo, o facar ulo); -o: challenge, defying, defiance.

defilar.x: (intr.) to defile, file off, march past (avan ulu).

definar.x: (tr.) to define: give the definition of

deformar.x: (tr.) to deform, put out of shape; -it(ul)o: a deformed person

degradar.x: (tr.) to degrade: reduce in rank, remove from office.

dejunar.x: (intr.) to breakfast: (the first repast of the day); have b., -eto: a light b., frua -o: early b. Def.: Dejuno esas repasto di dimezo, VI-162.

dekadar.x: (intr.) to be decadent, be in state of decay, decline (physical or moral)

dekado.x: decadence: decline to a worse or less perfect state, tendency towards dissolution or extinction. Ex.: La dekado di l'imperio Romana. La dekado di arti. Ni vivas en dekandanta epoko.

dekalmar.x: (tr.) to declaim; to speak or deliver rhetorically

deklarar.x: (tr.) to declare (ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Deklarar sua intenci, sua opinioni, Deklaro di milito.

deklinar.x: (tr., gram.) to decline, inflect; (intr., phys.) to deviate from the true north, as magnetic needle; (astron.) to remove from the equator, as a heavenly body.

dekoltar.x: (tr.) to cut low (a dress); to bare the neck and shoulders

dekoltita.x: décolletté, in a low dress; (n.) dekolturo; -ach-ita: uncovered to an improper degress.

dekubitar.x: (med.) to like down in bed, decubation.

deliberar.x: (intr.) to deliberate. Def.: Ponderar en su ipsa o kun altri, pri questiono solvenda o rezolvo facenda, la motivi por e la motivi kontre la decido; V

delico.x: delight; high degree of pleasure or enjoyment; the cause of the pleasure

delikatega.x: exquisite, superfine. Ex.:Delikata infanto, organi. La delikateso di la pelo, di linguo, di gusto.

deliktar.x: (intr.) to commit an offence (against law and order); (cf. kontravencar)

delikto.x: offense; (jur.) misdemeanor: offense punishable by fine or imprisonment; (cf. krimino)

demandar.x: (tr.) to ask for (ulo); (N.B. Not the E. «demand», (cf. postular)

demarshar.x: (intr.) to take steps, measures (to obtain something)

demarsho.x: step, proceeding; act, measure taken in business; Def.: Demarshar implikas sempre l'ideo di «pazi» facata extere, en la socio, port atingar ula skopo, por obtener irga helpo, favoro, e.c.; IV-100. V. exp.: Esforco esas propre ago muskulala, o generale, mekanikala

dementiar.x: (tr.) to give the lie to (ulu, pri ulo); to deny (flatly, publicly)

demisionar.x: (intr.) to resign: give in one's rsignation; (milit.) to throw up one's commission; (parl.) to vacate one's seat. V. exp. vid. abdikar.

demokratiigar.x: to democratize. Def.: La rejimo en qua la populo guvernesas da su ipsa (t.e. da sua elektiti); lua principo esas la suvereneso dil populo; VII-154.

demolisar.x: (tr.) to demolish, pull down, break up (a house, a fortification, an old ship)

demono.x: (myth. and fig.) demon, evil spirit, genius

demonstrar.x: (tr.) to demonstrate: prove by arguments; to make evident

demonstro.x: (lig., polit., milit., naval) demonstration. Ex.: Demonstrar propoziciono. Lua redesko demonstas lua shamo. Demonstri enemikala.

denigrar.x: (tr.) to disparage (ulu, ulo): run down, decry, depreciate, vilify, blacken the record of; (cf. difamar, kalumniar, maldicensar). Def.: Inspirar mala opiniono pri ulu (o ulo) per severa o nejusta aserti e judiki; IV

densa.x: dense: having its parts crowded together; compact, close: (cf. dika)

densigar.x: to thicken (liquids); (cf. plu-dik-igar). Ex.: Densa turbo, vaporo. Platino havas la maxim granda denso de omna metali. Ant.: skarsa, dis-sem-ita, ne-, des-densa.

dentifar.x: to make teeth; to cut teeth

dentizar.x: to furnish with teeth; (fig.) to cog; indent; to put scallops in

denuncar.x: (tr.) to inform against, denounce (a guilty person).

departmentala.x: departmental. Def.: Teritoriala dividuro or resortiso; VI

dependar.x: (intr.) to depend: be conditioned or contingent (de); to rely on for support; to be a dependency (di)

deperisar.x: (intr.) to pine away, gradually lose strength; wither; slowly decline or perish. Def.: Debilesko duktanta ad (se ne til) la morto; III

deplorar.x: to deplore: to feel or express deep grief

deplorinda.x: deplorable, lamentable, wretched. Ex.: Deplorar la desfortunaji di ulu, la morto di ulu.

deportar.x: (tr.) to depart: to transport into banishment; to convey to a penal colony. V. exp.: vid exilar.

depozar.x: (tr.) to depost: to lay, set or put down; to lodge for safekeeping; to bond (in warehouses)

depozario.x: trustee, depositary, guardian, warehouse-keeper. Ex.: Depozar portajo. Nil(e) depozas omnayare slamo fekunda. Depozanto di pekunio en panko.

depozeyo.x: place of deposit, as a depot, depository, warehouse

depresar.x: (tr., phys. and moral) to depress: to press down; to deject

deputar.x: (tr.) to depute, deputize, send (ulu) as a deputy

derivar.x: (tr., math., gram.) to derive (ulo de); have its root (de)

derogar.x: (intr., jur.) to derogate: to act contrary, invalidate, annul (in part), to depart from (a custom)

desafabla.x: crabbed, cross, churlish, surly, ungracious, uncivil.

desegnar.x: (tr.) to draw, design, delineate, sketch, (cf. esbosar, skisar)

desertar.x: (tr., intr., milit. and gen.) to desert, abandon, quit, forsake.

deservar.x: (tr., intr., eccl.) to serve (a living), have the parochial duties of (a chapel, hamlet); (cf. oficiar).

despitar.x: (intr.) to be vexed; to fret. Def.: Despito: chagreno mixita kun iraco. Ex.: Ilua agi despitigas me (E. his acts vex me); Quo importas, sive il esas joyoza sive il esas despitoza (E. what do you care whether he is joyous or vexed). Lasar eruptar sua despito; (E. to vent one's ill humor).

destinar.x: to destine (ulo, ulu, ad ulo). Ex.: Destinar sua filiulo esar advokato. Esar kontenta pri sua destino (E. to be content with one's lot).

detachar.x: (tr., milit., nav.) to draft: to send away, to send off for a particular service (from the main body).

detale.x: in, with d.s, minutely, piece-meal, bit by bit

detaligar.x: to particularlize, state circumstantially, give the d.s of

detalo.x: detail, particular: a minute or distinct part

determinar.x: (tr.) to determine: to fix the limits of; to ascertain or settle the exact truth about (ulo); (gram.) to fix the extent, the meaning of a word or sentence

determino.x: determination (not resolution, cf. rezolvo). Ex.: Lavoisier determinis la kompozuro di l'aero. Determinar disto de la tero a la suno. La determino di la volo. Determinita nombro. La doktrino di determinismo. V. exp.: vid. definar.

detersar.x: (tr.) to deterge: to cleanse, purge away (as foul matter)

detrimentar.x: (tr.) to prove detrimental to, be prejudicial to; Ex.: Ica fakto detrimentis mea reputeso. Ica aranjo esas facita a mea detrimento, lo detrimentas me. V. exp.: Detrimentar e domajar esas diversa speci di nocar. Domajar (ulo) esas facar material altero, qua minbonigas kozo (o la korpo di persono). Detrimentar (ulu) esas efektigar a lu ula perdo, mem nerekte e nevole; IV-237-8.

devancar.x: (tr.) to out-run, out-strip, out-do, to distance. V. exp.: On preter-iras kozo senmova, ma devancar implikas ke la objekto movas, e movas en sama sinco kam la subjekto; IV-137.

devar.x: (tr.) to have the obligation of, have the duty of, ought, should

devastar.x: (tr.) to devastate, lay waste, ravage, desolate. Ex.: Ula uragano, ula pesto devastis la lando, la urbo.

developar.x: (tr.) to develop: make larger, fuller; to unfold (a plot, etc.)

deviacar.x: (tr., intr.) to deviate, swerve (de). Ex.: La deviaco di magneta agulo.

devo.x: duty, obligation. Def.: «Devar» konvenas ad omna ed omnaspeca obligesi (moral od altra), do devas uzesar en omna imperi, preskripti e konsili. Ex.: Se vu volas bone standar, vu devas esar sobra. Vu devas ne adulterar, furtar. V. exp.: vid. darfar; kp. mustar.

devoco.x: devotion: act of religion, external worship (cf. pi-eso)

dextrano.x: (parl.) member of party on right (a conservative)

dezertigar.x: to make a d. of (ulo). Def.: Qua esas sovaja (od arida) e ne habitata. Ex.: Insulo dezerta. Sahara esas dezerto. Lando dezerta e nehabitata (E. a wild and uninhabited country).

dezinenco.x: desinence: formative suffix, word-ending. Def.: Finalo di vorto, precipue por indikar la flexiono.

dezirar.x: (tr.) to desire: to wish for earnestly, long for, hanker for, covet

di.x: (marks the genitive, possession, belonging to) la domo di mea patrulo: my father's house

diachilono.x: diachylon: a kind of a plaster for wounds.

diafizo.x: (anat.) diaphysis: the shaft or main part of a long bone.

dialekto.x: dialect. Def. Vario regionala di linguo.

dialogar.x: (intr.) to dialogue: take part in a dialogue (kun)

dialogizar.x: to put in form of a d. (ulo).

dicar.x: (tr.) to say, tell, (ulo, ad ulu): -o, -ajo: saying, what one says

dicernar.x: (tr.) to discern: to see and identify by noting differences

dicernebla.x: distinguishable. Def.: Vidar o komprenar la difero di du kozi (t.e. ke li diferas); III

dicionisto.x: elocutionist. Def.: Arto, maniero parolar o deklamar; III

dietigar.x: to d. (ulu); impozar -o ad ulu: to place someone on a d.

difamar.x: (tr., jur.) to defame, traduce, libel, asperse

diferanta.x: different. Ex.: La sentimenti, la interesti di homi diferas. Diferar opinione de ulu. La difero inter tri e un esas du. V. exp.: Difer-anta: esence des-simila (per speco)

diferar.x: (intr.) to differ: be different, be unlike; (of opinion) to disagree

diferenciar.x: (tr., intr., biol., sociol.) to differentiate, to acquire or give a distinct or separate character (cf. diferencial-igar)

difuzar.x: (tr.) to diffuse: to spread, disperse widely.

digizar.x: to dike, dam. Def.: Konstrukturo por preventar indundado.

digna.x: worthy; meriting, deserving; having merit, worth, virtue

digneso.x: worthiness; (cf. respekt-ind-eso). Ex.: Digna de rekompenso, de laudo, de puniso.

digramo.x: digraph; a combination of two or more letters to represent one sound, as ch, sh.

digreso.x: (also astron.) digression: departure from main subject.

diktar.x: (tr.) to dictate; utter sentences to be written down; (cf. imperar, impozar).

dilatar.x: (tr.) to dilate. Ex. Kaloro dilatas korpi.

diletar.x: (tr.) to have a great liking for, be partial to, be an amateur in (music, etc.)

diligenta.x: diligent. Def.: Qua agas kun zelo e rapideso. V. exp.: vid. asidua. Ant. lenta, indolenta, ne-ag-ema.

dilutar.x: (tr.) to dilute; thin by admixture of a liquid

diminutar.x: (tr., intr.) to diminish, lessen, -iva, ivo: dimunutive; (cf. min-grand-igar, min-gros-igar). Ant. Augmentar, kreskar, ampligar; developar.

dina.x: thin; on dimension of a paper, plank, etc.

dinamismo.x: dynamism; the doctrine that all substance involves force.

dinear.x: (intr.) to dine, to be at dinner

dioptriko.x: dioptrics. Def.: Teorio di la optikala vitri (kp. katoptriko); IV

dioptrio.x: (opt.) diopter; unit of refractive power. Def.: Uneso di mezuro por la «okulvitri»; IV

dioptro.x: (opt.) diopter: sight-vane. Def.: La fesnestreto tra qua on regardas por vizar punto per l'instrumento nomata alidado; IV

diplasar.x: (tr.) to displace; to change the place of (ulo); to misplace; put out of place (ulo)

diplomaco.x: diplomacy, diplomatics; (fig.) tact, shrewdness; skill in conducting any kind of negotiation or social matter

diporto.x: (stock exchange) backwardation. Def.: Ajorno til proxima borsal liquidaco di la livro di valori vendita, pagante premio; la premio pagata por ta ajorno; II

diptiko.x: diptych: ancient tablet of two leaves.

direciono.x: (line of) direction, bearing (both ways). Ex.: Du paraleli havas la sama direciono; IV

direktar.x: (tr.) to direct; manage, conduct; put in a direction, (ulu, ulo, ad)

direta.x: direct (opposite to indirect, as: direct way, discourse, method)

diserto.x: dissertation; oral or written examination on a question; disquisition; (college) theme.

disidenteso.x: dissent. Def.: (Teknikala termino di religiala historio): qua ne konsentas kun la maxim multa samreligiani pri ula punto, dogmato; III

disimulanta.x: two-, double-faced, artful, sly. Def.: Celar sua pensi, opinioni, sentimeni, o fingar altri; III

disimular.x: (tr.) to dissimulate, dissemble; hide under a false appearance

diskontar.x: (tr., com.) to discount: advance money on a bill, deducting the interest

diskreta.x: discreet, -eso: discretion. Ex. Il esas saja e diskreta persono. Atingar la evo di diskreteso. Fidar a la diskreteso di ulu. V. exp.: Modesta esas ta qua havas pri su opiniono moderata, ne exajerata, e ne havas ecesa pretendi

diskursar.x: (intr.) to make a speech, deliver a discourse, an address to discant (pri)

diskursiva.x: (phil.) discursive: proceeding regularly from premises to conclusion.

diskutar.x: (tr.) to discuss (a questoin, project, point of law, etc)

dislokar.x: (tr.) to dislocate: disarrange, put out of order or place; (milit.) to break up (an army); to dismember (a state). Ex.: On dislokas, sive mobili, utensili, mashini, sive armeo od armeo-korpo; III

disociar.x: (tr., chem.) to dissociate; break up into consitutents.

disonancar.x: (intr., mus.) to make a dissonance, discord; (cf. des-, mis-, ne-akordar).

dispensar.x: (tr.) to dispense (ulu de ulo) to exempt, excuse from, give leave not to do or observe (ulo)

dispensario.x: dispensatory, dispensary (med.) Def.: Loko en qua la povri povas konsultar medicinisti e recevar flegi o medikamenti (sen lojar en ol); III

dispenso.x: dispensation; (cf. permisar). Ex.: Dispensar de la fasto. La granda evo dispensas la oldi militar. Ant.: obligar, koaktar.

dispersar.x: (tr.) to disperse, scatter. Ex.: La vento dispersas la nubi, la folii. Armeo vinkinta dispersas l'enemiki. Disperso di la Judi. V. exp.: Dispersar esas preske sinonima di dissemar, ma kun ideo plu agema, ideo di lanso, pulso ad fore; IV

disponar.x: (tr.) to have the disposal of, have (ulo) at one's disposal; to dispose of (ulo)

disputachar.x: to squabble, brawl, wrangle about trifles

disputar.x: (intr.) to have a dispute, to quarrel, wrangle, bicker

distingar.x: (tr.) to distinguish; set apart; to characterize; to make distinct or different by sign, mark or characteristic

distingiva.x: distinctive. Def.: Facar ulo por ke altru povez discernar; III

distributar.x: (tr., gen. and tech.) to distribute; to deal out, apportion, dispense; (cf. disdonar, repartisar). V. exp.: Distributar esas donar (o sendar) a siversa personi o loki, ma kun dicerno, ne hazarde. Exemple, on distributas premii a la skolani. Teknikale, on distributas la vaporo a la du parti di cilindro en oportuna tempo; VI

distrikto.x: district. Def.: Limitizita teritorio sub un judicial resortiso.

ditenar.x: (tr.) to detain; withhold, keep back (what belongs to another)

divagar.x: (intr., lit. and fig) to ramble, wander, rove, stray, divagate. Ex.: Bestii divigas. La divagi di aquofluo. Alkoholiko divagas en sua parolado, t.e. vagas en sua parolado o mem sua pensado, sen ordino nek raciono; III

divano.x: divan. V. exp.: Divano ne havas dors-apogilo, ma nur movebla kuseni. Sofao havas dors-apogilo (esas quaze repozlito). Kanapeo esas quaze larja stulego por plura personi, kun dors-apogilo e brakio-apogili; II

divenar.x: (intr., tr.) to become; to get, grow, pass into some new state or condition; to become of; be the final condition of

divergar.x: (tr.) to diverge (de, ek). Def.: Deviacar, dispersar di un punto a diferanta direcion-o, -i; (fig.) esar ne-konkordanta. Ex.: Lumradii divergas. Divergo di opinioni. Ant.: konvergar.

diversaji.x: sundry articles: distinct things, not necessarily different in kind

diverseso.x: diversity; variety, multiplicity. Def.: Qua esas plu multa kam un, ma ne granda nombro. Ex.: Diversa personi. La diversa interesti di la nacioni. La diversa senci di vorto.

diversionar.x: (intr.) to make, cause a d. Def.: Atako (en kombato) por deturnar l'atenco e la fortaji di la enemiko; simila taktiko en la konversado, por deturnar ol de temo jenanta, desagreabla, nekonvenanta, e.c. (Ne konfundenda kun digreso); III

dividar.x: (tr., math. and gen.) to divide (ulo, per ulo)

divulgar.x: (tr.) to divulge; reveal, make known (a secret, news, etc.).

dizastro.x: disaster. Def.: Desfortuno tre granda e subita, generale koncernanta multa homi o tota socio, ex. grava vinkeso, granda incendio, naufrajo; III

do.x: (prep.) therefore, then, so, consequently, (introduces a conclusion). Ex.: Me pensas, do me existas. Il esas vua patro, do vu devas respektar il. L'alkoholo foligas, do ol esas veneno.

doario.x: jointure, dower, marriage-settlement (provided by the bride-groom or his family; cf. dotar)

docento.x: private docent; private teacher or lecturer (university).

docila.x: docile, tractable. Def.: Facile docebla e duktebla; II-19. Ex.: Skolano docila. Docila kavalo.

doko.x: dock. Def.: Mar-baseno por konstruktar o reparar navi; baseno cirkondita da kayi o warfi por charjar o descharjar navi.

dolca.x: pleasing to the taste: -a oranjo, vino: sweet orange, wine

doliiero.x: dolly, holding-on-tool. Def.: Doliiero esas specala instrumento, qua uzesas en la rivetago pro impedar la riveto ekbatesar per la martelagi. Dolio esas la kavajo, qua esas ye l'extremajo di la doliiero; III

dolmeno.x: domen, cromlech: table-stone. Def.: Speco di megalita monumento; VI

dolo.x: (jur.) fraud, deception, malice; evil or criminal intent

dolorar.x: (intr.) to feel a pain, to suffer (physically; cf. chagrenar)

dolorigar.x: to cause pain to (ulu), to make sore, make suffer

domajar.x: (tr., phys. sense) to damage; to injure, harm, impair, spoil

dominacar.x: (tr.) to have dominion over, sovereign authority, sway over; (fig.) tower, rise above, command, control

domtar.x: (tr.) to subdue, subjugate, quell. V. exp.: On domtas propre la sovaja bestii (sen vere amansar oli, nek igar oli domestika). On domtas figurale la pasioni, la furioza amaso (turbo), e.c.; III

donacar.x: (tr.) to give: make a donation, a gift, a present of (ulo, ad ulu), to give away, bestow

dop.x: (prep., in space) behind, back of, after, posterior; (cf. pos)

dorado.x: (ich.) dorado: a species of dolphin (Coryphaena hippurus).

dormar.x: (intr., tr.) to sleep, be asleep, slumber

dorso.x: (anat. and of knife, book, hand, etc.) back

doselo.x: dais; raised, canopied seat, fixed or portable.

dotar.x: (tr.) to endow: furnish a dowry, dower, marriage-portion to (ulu); supply (some public institution with a permanent fund)

dozigar.x: (tr.) to put up a doze of, to apportion a dose of (ulo).
