dragar.x: (tr.) to dredge (out) (a river, etc.), to explore with a drag

dragomano.x: dragoman. Def.: Interpretisto en Oriento; IV

drajeo.x: sugar-plum. Def.: Mandelo od altra kozo kovrita per harda sukrajo; V

drakmo.x: (Gr. money) drachma; (weight) dram: eighth part of a troy ounce.

drapirar.x: (tr.) to drape: to cover with drapery, hang in folds.

drenar.x: (tr.) to drain (a field, a wound, etc.)

dresar.x: (tr.) to train, break in (animals). V. exp.: On dresas l'animali por igar li exekutar ula determinita (ofte ne naturala) movi, sive por servar la homo (ex. kavalkado), sive por facar irga prodaji. Omna domestika animalo esas edukata da sua mastro; ma ne omni esas dresita. Me povas edukar chasokundo (t.e. hundo de chasala raso) sen ule dresar lu (por la chaso o por irga altra agado); VI

driftar.x: (intr., nav.) to drift. Def.: Esar pulsata da vento o mar-fluo exter sua voyo; II

drilo.x: (tech.) drill-handle, holder; (cf. borilo, trepano). Def.: La instrumento qua portas e movas la borilo (en metalo).

drogizar.x: to physic, give a d. to (ulu, su).

dronar.x: (tr.) to drown; (of ships) to founder, go to the bottom

dronito.x: a d.ed person. Def.: Mortigar ulu, su per asfixio en liquido. V. exp.: La navisti ne dronesis, nam la navo ne dronesis, ma nur sinkis til la bordo; (cf. II

dubar.x: (intr.) to doubt; waver in opinion, hesitate to believe

duelar.x: (intr.) to fight a duel (kun, kontre ulu).

duktar.x: (tr.) to lead, conduct, bring along (ulu, ulo). V. exp.: vid. guidar.

dum.x: (prep.) during (the whole period spoken of); marks interval of time an event has taken place in

dume.x: meanwhile, in the mean time, yet, still

durar.x: (intr.) to last, endure, remain, continue, hold out; (cf. permanar, kontinua)

duronta.x: to be continued (cf. pluso sequos). Ex.: La piramidi di Egiptia ankore duras. La skribado duras. Durigar diskurso, letro. Spaco e duro. Dur-iva stofi, instrumenti. Duranta joyi, chagreni.

durstar.x: (intr., also fig.) to thirst, be thirsty

dushar.x: (tr.) to douche: give a shower bath to.

duvo.x: (barrel-) stave. Def. Duvi esas planki di specala formo, ek qui on kompozas la bareli; III

duyongo.x: dugong (Halicore dugong). Def.: Mar-hundo di la Malayal insularo (India-oceano, e.c.); III

ebenisto.x: a worker in ebony: (fig.) an inlayer (of wood), cabinet maker (vid.: V. exp. karpentisto).

ebuliar.x: (intr.) to form bubbles, to bubble up or froth (as water from a spring, blood from a vein; (fig.) to be boiling from anger or passion); (cf. efervecar, boliar)

ecelar.x: (intr.) to excel; be excellent, be eminent, be superior (en, pri). Ex.: Ca homulo ecelas en omno quon il entraprezas. Ecelar pri natado; ecelanta libro, homo. Ecelo di frukto.

ecelenco.x: (title) excellency. Ex.: Lua ecelenco, la ambasadisto di …

eceptale.x: by way of exception. Def.: Ne inkluzar en, exkluzar de ula nombro. Ex.: Eceptar ula kondamniti de amnestio. Existas nula regulo sen eceptajo. Ecepte ica personi, omni iros. Me ne permisos ke vu iros, ecepte ke vu pagos la domaji.

eceptar.x: (tr.) to except; leave out, exempt, exclude

ecesar.x: (tr., intr.) to exceed; go beyond the proper limits; be guilty of excesses (in eating, drinking, etc.)

ecese.x: to excess, immoderately. Ex.: La debajo ecesas mil franki. Mea spensi ne ecesas mea recevaji. Ecesar pri manjado. Eceso en laborado. Koldeso ecesanta. Ecesanta superbeso. Preco ecesiva. DEFIS

ecitar.x: (tr.) to excite: arouse, impel, incite, urge, provoke, prompt. Ex.: Ecitar ulu laborar, revoltar. Ecitar l'iraco, la jaluzeso. La novaji efektigas granda eciteso. Ecito di la nervi. Vivo ecitanta. Ecitiva medikamento. Ecitema homo.

edifico.x: edifice; large building. Def.: Expresas ulo plu general kam domo, kastelo; palaco; edifico esas quaze meza inter ta tri vorti; III-200.

edifikar.x: (tr.) to edify: instruct, improve morally. Ex.: Edifikar ulu per prediko, per exemplo. Konduto, paroli edifik-anta, -ema, -iva.

ediktar.x: (tr.) to enact: to order (by an edict); (cf. dekretar). Ex.: Draco(n) ediktis punisala legi di senkompata severeso.

editar.x: (tr.) to publish (a book, a paper) (not E. «edit» cf. redaktar): -(ad)o: publishing

edro.x: (geom.) face, outer surface of, superfice; outer configuration of a regularly crystalizing mineral, as a dodecahedron.

edukar.x: (tr.) to educate (children, people); to develop and cultivate the physical, intellectual and moral faculties; to form the manners of; to rear, raise, breed (cattle and other animals); to train, rear (plants)

efacar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to efface: erase, rub out, expunge

efacesar.x: to be effaced, obliterated. (cf. obliterar), -ilo: eraser. rubber. Ex.: Efacar la skriburo qua esas sur tabelo. Esas neposibla efacar la impreso de mea mento.

efektigar.x: to effect, effectuate, produce, bring about, cause; (cf. produktar, en-duktar, efikar)

efektigo.x: effecting, execution, action, causation. Ant.: kauzo, motivo.

efektivo.x: (milit.) effective force, strength. Def.: Vorto militala por expresar la fakte existanta nombro di la trupi de homi, kavali, kanoni e vehili; V-420.

efervecar.x: (intr., pr. and fig.) to effervesce, be effervescent. Def.: Ebuliado di gaso tra liquido; (fig.) emocar vivace, ma nedurante (ex. la eferveco dil pasioni).

efikar.x: (intr.) to be efficient, be effectual, be efficacious

efikeskar.x: to come into play, begin to take effect

eflorecar.x: (intr., chem.) to effloresce; (cf. flor-ifar); (med.) to come out in a rash, break out in pimples. Def.: Indikas fenomeno kemiala (formaco di kristali ye surfaco di solido o liquido), e fenomeno fiziologiala (mikra influro di la pelo); III-74.

egarar.x: (tr.) to mislay: lose for the moment

egardar.x: (tr.) to pay regard to, take (ulu, ulo) into account

egaresar.x: to be mislaid, missing. V. exp.: One ofte egaras kozi sen perdar oli. «Me mis-pozis mea plumiero sur la tablo; ol falis en la paperkorbo, e tale egaresis: ma ol ne esis perdita».

egorjar.x: (tr.) to cut the throat of (ulu). Def.: Ocidar per kultel-frapo en la kolo (fauco); III-698.

ejektar.x: (tr., tech.) to eject, cast out, expel, discharge, void.

ek.x: (prep.) (general sense) out; (indicating motion) adportez stulo ek ta chambro: bring a chair out of that room

ekidno.x: (zool.) echidna (genus: Echidna, sp. Hystrix). Def.: Australiana mamifero sendenta, qui ovifas, nutras su per insekti; V-484.

ekigar.x: to echo. Ex.: La vakua chambri ekigis nia pedopazi. (fig.) Kelki ekigas stultaji di altri.

eklampsio.x: (med.) eclampsia. Def.: Specala konvulso dum infanteso, uremio o parturo-stando; VI-480.

ekonomio.x: economy; pecuniary management, administration; (not saving, cf. sparo). Def.: La administrado financala di domo, societo o stato; metafore on parolas pri l'ekonomio di organismo, konsiderante lua gani (nutrado) e spensi (perdi di materio e di energio); VII-399. Ex.: On parolas pri ekonomio hemala (menajala), urbala, rurala, nacionala.

elevaciono.x: (design) elevation, raised-plan, side-view. Def.: Desegno di l'extera formi di ula korpo vidata en horizontal direciono; III-81.

elevar.x: (tr.) to elevate, raise on high; (not to make higher in dimension; cf. plu-alt-igar)

elevilo.x: elevator. V. exp.: Elevar adjuntas a levar ideo di alteso, di supera nivelo. On levas de tero (til su) ulo falinta; on elevas aquo, stoni a la supro di domo konstruktata; II-648. EFIRS

eliminar.x: (tr.) to eliminate. Ex.: Eliminar nomo de la listo di kandidati. Eliminar toxikaji de la korpo. Eliminar de equaciono.

elito.x: (milit. and fig.) the elite (of any army); choice troops, best men, flower (of army); (cf. eminent-aro).

eloquenta.x: eloquent; (fig.) which produces the same effect as an eloquent speech. Ex.: Eloquenta parolanto, stilo. Lakrimi, silenco eloquenta.

emanar.x: (intr.) to emanate (de, ek). Ex.: Lumo emanas de la suno. Odori esas emani.

emancipar.x: (tr.) to emancipate (ulu, de). Ex. Emancipar sklavo, populo, (fig.) emancipar la mento.

embarasar.x: (tr.) to embarrass; to obstruct, clog up; to encumber, hamper, hinder; (in gen.) to hinder movement (physical, mental)

embargar.x: (tr., naut. and fig.) to embargo, lay an e. on: prohibit to leave port; (jur.) to distrain, to levy a distress or execution, to garnishee or attack (for debt)

embarkar.x: (tr., intr.) to embark: go or put on board (ulu, ulo, en); Def.: Enirar navo; pozar en navo; II-75.

emblemo.x: emblem. Ex.: La hanulo esas emblemo (E. symbol) di vigilemeso. Emblemi di rejeso.

embotar.x: (tr., tech.) to cold-roll, to stamp, bend or beat out (sheet metal)

embracar.x: (tr.) to embrace, clasp, hug (in arms); to bracket

embragar.x: (tr., intr., tech.) to clutch, put in gear; establish contact between the motive power and that which starts the movement. Def.: Solidigar (en un instanto, e por irga duro) du axi per diversa mediata instrumenti ed organi; III-87. Ex.: Rimen-transmiso "embragas", kande on igas la rimeno pasar de libera pulio sur fixa pulio sam-axa e sam-periferia; (kp. ingranar, kuplar).

embrokar.x: (tr., med.) to embrocate; rub with a lotion.

embuskar.x: (tr.) to ambush; lie in concealment for

emendar.x: (tr.) to emend (a fault), rectify, free from error; (leg.) to amend (a law). V. exp.: On plubonigas o korektigas kozo, verko, ma ne defekto; on ne povas igar defekto "bona" o korekta, on simple supresas ol. Konseque on devas dicar: emendar defekto. On korektigas la kozo, emendante lua defekti; V-282.

emersar.x: (intr.) to emerge (from a liquid); (fig.) to rise into view. Ant.: imersar, submersar.

eminenco.x: (title) Eminence. Ex.: Lua eminenco, la kardinalo.

eminentaro.x: the elite, pick of a group

eminentega.x: most e. Ex.: Eminenta homulo, ofico, rango. Vertuo, servo eminenta.

emisar.x: (tr.) to emit: send forth, give out; (finan.) to issue (for circulation). Ex.: La kalor-radii quin la suno emisas. Emiso di monet-papero.

emocigar.x: to cause e. to. Ex.: El parolis tote sen emoco. Lua aspekto emocigis me. Quik kande me vidis il, me emocis.

emperialo.x: top, roof, outside (of a coach with seats).

empireo.x: empyrean. Def.: Maxim alta cielo di antiqua mitologio e kosmologio; (poet.) la cielo.

emula.x: emulous. Def.: Qua penas egalesar od superesar la ceteri en laudinda kozi o loyala konkurso; III-468. Ex.: On kurajigas la emuleso inter la lernanti.

emundar.x: (tr., hort.) to lop, prune, trim; (fig.) to remove anything useless, noxious or inferior. Def.: Branchotaliar; (vulgarasenco) netigar, beligar o preparar kozo per depreno di omna parti o peci neutila, nebona o nebela; (IV-106). Ex.: Emundar arboro. Emundar legumi, salado, ucelo, fisho (por koquar oli). Metafore, on emundas kalkulo, la konduto di ulu, verko literatural od artal, e.c.

en.x: (prep.) in, of time and place; when really necessary to indicate motion into a place (into) ad should be prefixed: la ucelo flugis aden la kajo: the bird flew into the cage. (En la kajo may mean that the bird was flying about the cage)

energetiko.x: energetics : theory or science of energy.

engajar.x: (tr.) to engage: to hire (ulu); (milit.) to enlist (ulu, su).

enluminar.x: (tr.) to illuminate (a book); (cf. ascendar, lum-izar, iluminar); to color (an engraving, map).

enorma.x: enormous. Def. grandega, grosega, kolos(atr)a, monstr(atr)a.

enoyar.x: (intr.) to feel dull, be bored, be weary (because of inaction or monotony)

ensemblo.x: the whole, ensemble; all parts taken together; general effect, collectivity, aggregate, totality; (cf. kune, entote)

entamar.x: (tr.) to cut the first piece of, make a first cut, incision; (fig.) to encroach upon, begin upon, open up. Def.: Facar l'unesma trancho, l'unesma frapo, brecho, nocho, e figurale komencar; iniciar od inaugurar ulo; IV-102. Ex.: Entamar pano, botelo, pasteto, poto de konfituri; frapo (stroko di kultelo, o spado). Entamar (E. incise, cut) la pelo, la muskuli, la osto. Prodigemo entamas sua kapitalo.

enternar.x: (tr.) to intern: confine in a place or country.

entote.x: on the whole, in all, altogether.

entraprezajo.x: what is u.; the enterprise, contract

entraprezar.x: (tr.) to undertake, engage to perform, take in hand, contract for; (cf. asumar)

entraprezema.x: enterprising. Ex.: Columbus entraprezis la deskovro di la kontinento ocidental. Entraprezar voyajo, konquesto. Me entraprezis la feliceso di mil homi desfortunoza: (E. I undertook to make a thousand unfortunate beings happy.) Ta firmo entrapezis la furniso di liti ad la armeo. La entraprezo di la kanalo di Suez esis laboro kolosala. Homulo entraprezema.

entratenar.x: (tr.) to support, keep (with the needs of life) (ulu); -o: maintenance, livelihood.

entravar.x: (tr.) to shackle, fetter, trammel (a horse); (fig.) to clog, impede, embarrass. Def.: Impedar o jenar la marcho di animalo per irga moyeno; III-468.

entremeso.x: (cook.) entremets, side dish. Def.: Disho inter la repasto propre dicita e la desero; V-621.

entreo.x: (cook.) entrée, side-dish. Def.: Disho qua venas pos la fisho ed ante la rostajo; V-621.

enumerar.x: (tr.) to enumerate; reckon up singly, count or tell off.

enuncar.x: (tr.) to enunciate: express by speech or by writing: -uro, -ajo: enunciation, statement. Ex.: Enuncar sua idei, opinioni, problemo.

envelopar.x: (tr., pr. and fig.) to envelop; cover up (ulu, ulo, su); -ilo: covering, wrap, casing (not of letter-envelope; cf. kuverto). V. exp.: Envelopar signifikas nur: tegar omna parti di l’objekto, enklozar ol en tegilo. Envolvar implikas la ideo di volvar, qua ipsa implikas ideo analoga a rular: volvar esas pozar ula objekto sur altra, turnante ol cirkum ica

enverguro.x: span, extent of wing or sail spread. Def.: Dimensiono di ucelo, o di flugilo (o di seglo) inter la extremaji di la ali extensita.

envidiar.x: (tr.) to envy, (be)grudge, be envious of (ulu, pri ulo; ulo, ad ulu). Ex.: Il sempre envidias la suceso di sua frato. Envidio esas kompozita de jaluzeso e de odio. Il havas envidi-ema, -oza mento.

epigono.x: epigone; a successor, ordinarily an inferior one.

epigrafio.x: epigraphy. Def.: La cienco dil epigrafi; VII-155.

epigrafo.x: epigraph, inscription. Def.: La skriburo quan on trovas o pozas sur la monumenti; VII-155.

epiteto.x: epithet. Def. Vorto adjuntata a substantivo por qualifikar ol.

epizodo.x: episode; an incidental narrative or digression; an event.

equilibrar.x: (intr., tr.) to be in state of equilibrium, balance, counterpoise

equilibrigar.x: to equilibrate; to put in balance equilibrium (ulo)

equilibristo.x: equilibrist, juggler. Ex.: "A equilibras B", o: "A e B equilibras" = "Existas relato di equilibro inter A e B". "X (aganto) equilibrigas A e B", o "A per B". On uzas equilibrigar nur por l'extera aganto, qua pozas la forci (pezi, e.c.) en equilibro, qua efektigas l'equilibro sen partoprenar ol; IV-171.

equipar.x: (tr.) to equip, fit out (a ship, an expedition, a soldier); (cf. provizar).

equitato.x: equity; natural justice. Def.: Yusteso natural, segun la komuna raciono, quan on opozas a la yusteso legal, a la yuro; IV-9.

eratika.x: (geol.) transported from its original location or bed (stones, etc.); (fig.) erratic; deviating from the common course.

erektar.x: (tr.) to erect; stand (ulu, ulo) straight up, set up (u1o). V. exp.: On erektas monumento, statuo, kolono, masto. Persona anke erektas su, mem kande lu ja stacas. "Il levis su, stacas senmova dum kelka instanti, e pose erektas su sur la pedo-pinti (por regardar super la muro)". On ne povas dicar rekt-igar, nam on ne rektigas masto ja rekta; pluse on rekt-igas en omna direcioni, ma on erektas nur vertikale, ad-supre; VI-383.

ergotismo.x: (med.) ergotism, state of health caused by eating ergot.

erodar.x: (tr., geol., med. etc.) to erode, corrode, eat away.

erorigar.x: to cause (ulu) to err, lead astray, deceive (without bad intention; cf. trompar)

erste.x: (of time) not before, not until (then), only (not earlier than), for the first time

eruptar.x: (intr. geol. and gen.) to erupt: to break forth from an inclosure, to make an outburst; (med.) to break out in pimples, pustules, rash

eruptigar.x: to cause an e. in (ulo, ulu)

esamifar.x: to swarm: collect in a s.

esbosar.x: (tr., of plastic arts and fig.) to rough-hew, cut, to boast (in order to make the outline of a figure)

esbosuro.x: rude outline; (fig.) first draft (of a plan, etc.), -ilo: (sculp.) boasting tool; mortise chisel. V. exp.: Skisar relatas la desegnal arti

esforcar.x: (intr.) to make an effort, strive, strain, exert oneself

eshafodo.x: scaffold(ing); staging (for a mason, etc.); frame-work of timbers for a spectator's stand, for execution of criminals

eskalar.x: (tr., nav.) to touch (or call) at (a port)

eskaldar.x: (tr.) to scald; injure the skin with hot liquid; to expose to the action of boiling water (a jug, etc).

eskaleyo.x: port of call. Def.: Haltar en portuo dum voyajo por embarkar o desembarkar pasajanti o vari; II-75.

eskamotar.x: (tr.) to perform conjuring tricks, cause (ulo) disappear by legerdemain. Def.: Habile desaparigar objekto, por ludo; II-647. V. exp. vid. furtar.

eskapar.x: (intr.) to escape, find a way out (ek, de) (tr.) to e. from, get away from, slip away from, avoid (ulu, ulo); (cf. fugar)

eskapmoyeno.x: any means of e.; (fig.) shift, subterfuge, means of evasion

eskaro.x: (med.) eschar: a dry slough, crust, or scab.

eskarpigar.x: to make slope sharply. V. exp.: Eskarpa indikas granda inklineso (o prefere rampo)

eskartar.x: (gen. sense, tr.) to put aside, apart (ulo, ulu); to go aside, apart, swerve, turn aside (de)

eskopeto.x: blunderbuss. Def.: Speco di karabino (anciena); V-219.

eskrokar.x: (tr.) to swindle, cheat (ulu); to cheat out of (ulo). Def: Speco di furto per trompo o ruzo; III-200.

eskupar.x: (tr.) to bail (water out of a boat, etc.)

espadagar.x: (tr., intr.) to use, wield the s.; to put (ulu) to the sword

espalero.x: (hort.) espalier; a row of fruit-trees trained up to a lattice or wall; the trellis or wall on which trained.

esparo.x: (nav.) spar: a timber used for masts, yards, booms etc.

esparto.x: (bot.) esparto (grass); a Spanish grass (Stipa tenacissima) used in making cordage, papar, shoes, baskets, etc.

espellibro.x: spelling-book. Def.: Lektar la vorti literope e formacante la silabi; II-582.

esperar.x: (tr.) to hope for, to expect with desire (ulo); (intr.) to hope: have confidence, trust (de, en); -ajo: thing hoped for

espruva.x: proof (kontre) –igar: (tr.) to make (water-, lire-, etc.) proof (ulo); aquespruva: water-proof, -tight.

esquadano.x: member of a squad, of a gang.

establisar.x: to establish; to settle or fix firmly; place on a permanent footing; make firm, stable or constant; (cf. instalar, pruvar). Ex.: Establisar la fundamento di edifico. Establisar komercal societo, fabrikerio, kolonio. Establisar su en urbo. La establiso di banko. Note “Establishment in the sense of “institution” is translated by the suffix –erio; educational establishment: eduk-erio).

estakado.x: boom, chain or row of piles across a harbor for defense; (cf. palisado).

estampar.x: (tr. tech.) to make an impress, imprint, in relief of a mark or figure

estampilo.x: stamp, die. Def. Estampilo esas utensilo uzata ye la forjo. Ol esas facita ek harda materio ed havas la negativa formo di la forjenda peco, tale ke per simpla preso la dezirata formo obtenesas; III-81.

estanchar.x: (tr.) to stanch, (blood), stop (a leak, tears, etc.). Def.: Haltigar la fluo di liquido (ne sikigar); IV-9.

estimar.x: (tr.) to esteem, have e. for; hold (ulu) in high regard

estompar.x: (tr., draw.) to stump; shade, shadow with a stump

estompilo.x: stump: artist’s soft pencil or rubber.

etajero.x: what-not, set of selves. Def. Tabuli dispozita erajatre.

etajo.x: story, floor (of a house, etc.); tier

etapar.x: (intr.) to halt at a stage (in travel)

etiketo.x: (on bottles, etc.) label; (on goods, parcels) ticket

etiolar.x: (tr.) to etiolate; blanch. Def.: Privicar vivanti (precipue planti) de lumo ed aero, de quo lia feblesko, palesko o senkoloresko; III-603.

etuyo.x: case: flat box, opening sideways or from the top

eufonio.x: euphony. Def.: Agreabla e facila kombinado di la soni en linguo; III-138.

evakuar.x: (tr., milit., med., tech.) to evacuate, empty (N. B. not to empty a vessel, etc., cf. vaku-igarevacuation; (med.) discharge of matter by natural passage or artificial opening. Ex.: Evakuar )

evaluar.x: (tr.) to evaluate, value; to estimate the worth of, to rate at a certain price; to reckon the amount of; to appraise; (cf. expertisar)

evaluebla.x: ratable; appreciable: that may be estimated, appreciated. V. exp.: Evaluar esas determinar valoro o quanto, per kalkulo o per konjekto (se on uzas mezurilo, on dicus mezurar). Taxar esas fixigar la quanto de imposto o kontributo, quan on debas pri ulo. Exemple (en la hipotezo di imposto pri revenuo): "on evaluas la revenuo di ta sioro a 10000 franki; ed on taxas ol a 400 franki, segun la proporciono di 4 po 100;" V-221.

evar.x: (tr., intr.) to be so many years old; to be aged (so many years)

eventar.x: (intr.) to happen, occur, come about, befall

eviero.x: (kitchen-) sink. Def.: Speco di tablo kava, o kuvo ek lapido o ceramikajo, sur qua on lavas (generale en koqueyo); IV-9.

evitar.x: (tr.) to avoid, shun, evade, obviate, (cf. eludar). Ex.: El evitas (E. shuns) me. Evitar frapo, danjero, disputo. Evitar (E. obviate; prevent) skandalo. Ant.: serchar.

evolucionar.x: (intr., philos.) to evolve; (milit.) to perform evolutions

exajerar.x: (tr., intr.) to exaggerate. Ex.: Exajerar vinko, la meriti di amiko.

exakta.x: exact, accurate (not used of persons; cf. akurata, preciza)

exakte.x: exactly. Def.: Qua esas konforma a la verajo, a la realajo, a la normo; IV-101. Ex.: Kalkulo exakta. Sequar exakta dieto. Matematiko esas exakta cienco. Verifikar la exakteso di kalkulo. V. exp.: Mezuro preciza povas ne esar exakta (se l'instrumento, quankam subtila, esas nejusta).

exaltar.x: (tr.) to exalt: raise the spirits of (ulu), to carry (the senses) to a high degree: (not to praise, cf. laudegar). Def.: Ecitar sentimento (precipue nobla, religiala) til extrema grado; IV-9.

examenar.x: (tr.) to examine (ulu) (not used with things, cf. explorar)

exaucar.x: (tr.) to hear and grant (a prayer, a request); to hearken favorably or willingly to (ulu). Ant.: repulsar, refuzar.

exekutar.x: (tr.) to execute, to perform, to do (ulo); to e. a criminal, cf. mort-igar; -(ad)o: execution; performance, carrying into effect

exemple.x: for example, for instance; (abbr.: ex.); segun la -o: following the e. (di ulu); punisar ulu kom -o: to make an e. of someone

exemplero.x: copy (of a book, paper, engraving, etc.).

exercar.x: (tr.) to exercise (the legs, the body, one's senses), to exert (strength, one's memory, eloquence); (milit.) to drill

exergo.x: (numis.) exergue. Def.: Infra feldo di medalio; III-672.

exfoliar.x: (tr.) to exfoliate, scale (off). Def.: Forprenar foliope, deprenar folii, t. e. strati sucedanta; III-603

exhalar.x: (tr.) to exhale, send forth, emit (odors, etc.; cf. expirar). Ex.: Ca marshi exhalas vapori pestizanta. La exhalo di rozo.

exhaustar.x: (tr., also fig.) to exhaust: drain, spend

exhortar.x: (tr.) to exhort. Ex.: Exhortar ulu reformar sua konduto. Ant.: des-konsilar, des-persuadar.

exilar.x: (tr.) to exile, banish (ulu, su de); (fig.) to expatriate

exilito.x: an exile, V. exp.: On exilas ulu, interdiktante a lu restar en la lando: lu esas tote libera extere; e se lu rieniras sen permiso, on simple ekpulsas lu. Proskriptar esas serchar la kondamnito (mem po premio por la denuncanti) e punisar lu severe (generale per morto), se on povas trovar e kaptar lu en la lando (ex. la proskripti da Marius e Sylla). Relegar esas enkarcerigar en fora lando (kolonio)

exkluzar.x: (tr.) to exclude, drive or shut out, debar, deny admission

exkluzive.x: exclusively. Ex.: Exkluzar ulu de la Akademio. La bonfacemeso exkluzas la avareso. La exkluzo di homini. Exkluzite altra yuri, devi. Exkluziva yuro. La spirito di exkluzemeso. Ant.: admisar, inkluzar, recevar.

exkoriar.x: (tr.) to excoriate, to rub off, abrade, scratch, gall (the skin) Def.: Lacerar la polo (ne sen-pel-igar), deprenar peco de la pelo; IV-136

exkursar.x: (intr.) to make an excursion, take a trip

exkuzar.x: (refl.) to apologize, make excuses, beg pardon (su pri ulo)

exkuzebla.x: excusable (of persons, cf. pardon-ebla). V. exp.: Se vu facis kulpo relate ulu, vu exkuzas vu avan lu, e lu povas pardonar ol a vu. La persono ofensinta facas exkuzo, e la persono ofensita facas pardono; IV-100.

exorcisar.x: (tr.) to exorcise, cast out evil spirits.

exordiar.x: to make an e. Def.: Unesma parto di diskurso. Ant.: peroraciono.

exotika.x: exotic. Def. Qua venas de fora landi, e konseque havas karaktero di rareso o stranjeso; III-603. Ex.: Flori exotika.

expansar.x: (tr., intr., also fig.) to expand, to develop in volume or surface, spread, widen

expansema.x: expansive; (fig.) unreserved (of persons). Ex.: Expansar aero per kaloro. Expanso di autoritato. Forco expansiva. Naturo expansema. Ant.: kontraktar.

expediar.x: (tr., com.) to despatch, send off, forward (goods)

expediciono.x: (milit., nav.) expedition. Def.: Sendo di homi por militar, o por explorar regiono; IV-706. Ex.: Naval, ciencala expediciono a la suda polo.

expektar.x: (tr.) to expect, be in expectation of, look forward to

expektorar.x: (tr., med.) to expectorate, discharge phlegm, mucus from the lungs, to cough up. V. exp.: Expektorar ne esas sputar; l'expektorajo venas de la pektoro, t.e. de la pulmono, quale indikas l'etimologio.

experiencar.x: (tr.) to experience (ulo): to have the lot or fortune of, to undergo

experimentar.x: (intr.) to experiment (per); (tr.) to test, try (ulo, pri ulo)

expirar.x: (intr.) to expire: to breath out (cf. respirar); (fig.) to come to an end (of time), terminate

explikar.x: (tr.) to explain, make plain what is obscure, elucidate, expound; (cf. klar-igar). Ex.: Explikar signifiko, sua desfacilaji, doktrino, sua intenco. V. exp. vid. definar.

explorar.x: (tr.) to explore (a country); to investigate, examine, search into (things, cf. examenar, inquestar); (milit.) to reconnoiter, scout; Ex.: Explorar lando nekonocata. Explorar (E. examine) libro. Exploro, exploranto di subjekto, objekto.

explotachar.x: to exploit, to draw an illegitimate profit from, as to e. workers (by underpayment)

explotar.x: (tr.) to exploit, to get the value out of, as to e. a mine; to work, cultivate (a farm, estate with intent of profit)

expozar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to expose, set in public view; (of houses, etc.) to turn toward, present a side to; to set forth (a situation); explain (a doctrine)

expresar.x: (tr.) to express (by symbols, gestures, words, etc.); Ex.: Vorti expresas la penso. Lakrimi esas la expreso di doloro. Aspekto expres-oza, -iva, -ema.

extazar.x: (intr.) to be in ecstacies, be enraptured; (med.) to be in a trance (cf. katalepsio).

extensar.x: to extend, stretch, draw out, spread

extenuar.x: (tr.) to extenuate, palliate. Def. Igar min grava (kulpo, krimino, aserto, e. c.) II-707.

exter.x: (prep.) without, outside (without motion; cf. ek); except, besides

externerio.x: day-school. Def. Skolano (lernanto) qua ne habitas la lerneyo; III-672.

extingar.x: (tr., intr.) to extinguish, put out, quench (a fire, a light; also used fig.)

extingo.x: di raso: (fig.) the extinction, the extermination of a race. Ant.: Acendar.

extirpar.x: (tr.) to extirpate, uproot; (surg.) to cut out, remove totally; (fig.) to destroy wholly, eradicate, weed out; (cf. arachar). Ex.: Extirpar la mala herbi, kancero, dento, raso.

extorsar.x: (tr.) to extort, wrest; to blackmail (ulu): -(ad)o, -ajo: extortion, exaction

extradar.x: (tr.) to extradite. Def.: livrar stranjera kulpozo (akuzato) a la guvernerio di lua patrio; III-672; kp. exilar.

extraktar.x: (tr.) to extract: to draw from, out. Ex.: Extraktar frazo de libro, dento, kugleto de la korpo. Extraktar radiko dua (math.: to extract the square root). Extraktado di sukro de betravi. Extrakt-uri opiumo.

extravagar.x: (intr.) to talk extravagantly, wildly, to rave; (in fever) to be delirious; to act extravagantly, wildly, unreasonably, eccentricly

exudar.x: (tr., intr.) to exude, ooze out. Def.: Ekiro di liquido ek korpo, analoga (e tam lenta) kam sudorifo (N.B. sen gutifar); III-672.

exultar.x: (intr.) to exult. Def.: Esar kaptata da profunda joyo o sentimento (amo), qua expresas su per movi, kanti, e.c.: III-324.

fa.x: (mus.) fa: fourth note of the diatonic scale.

fabrikuro.x: object made, -erio: factory, works, mills. (cf. manufakturo)

facar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to make (a concrete object); to do, perform (a certain act)

facetizar.x: to put f.s on, cut with f.s

facies.x: (anat., geol., biol.) facies: general aspect or appearance of anything.

facigar.x: to cause (ulu) to make (ulo); to have (ulo) done (da ulu); (cf. igar)

facinar.x: (tr.) to fascinate. Ex.: L'amoro facinas la okuli. On dicas ke la serpento facinas sua viktimi.

facio.x: (gen.) front part or view (of anything); (cf. vizajo, averso)

facionar.x: (intr.) to be on sentry duty, mount guard

faketo.x: pigeon-hole; small specialty of duty, in research

fako.x: anything portioned off, as a compartment, division (in a desk), stall (in a stable); branch, proper office, province, department, speciality (in a business, profession, government, field of knowledge)

faktorio.x: (com.) factory: trading agency. Def.: Kontoro di agenti di kompanio komercala en lando stranjera.

faktotum.x: factotum: a doer of all kinds of work.

fakultato.x: faculty, power of doing anything; (of a university) faculty

falchar.x: (tr.) to mow down (with a scythe); (fig.) to cut down, destroy

falco.x: (carp.) check, rebate, ledge (of a door or shutter). Def.: Speco de kanelo en la kadro di pordo, por recevar la bordo di ca pordo; V-621.

faliar.x: (tr., intr.) to fail, miscarry, miss (an aim), not to succeed; (com.) to fail, to become insolvent without implication of disgrace; (cf. bankrotar)

faliigar.x: to cause to miss, to fail; to frustrate

falinta.x: fallen, -igar: to cause to fall, to fell, (ulo, ulu)

falsa.x: false, imitating in order to deceive as, f. hair, teeth, windows, signatures, money, jewels, drugs, etc.; not genuine, spurious

falva.x: fallow, fawn-colored, tawny, of a yellowish-brown color, pale red

famino.x: famine. V. exp.: Ne esas hungro, mem general, ma manko di la maxim necesa nutrivi en tota lando o populo; IV-10; (cf. indijar).

famizar.x: to cover with fame, render illustrious.

fanatikeskar.x: to become a f., infatuated (cf. fol-eskar). Ex.: Fanatika zelo, doktrini, homi.

fanfaronar.x: (intr.) to bluster, boast, brag, swagger, bluff. V. exp.: Fanfaronar esas exajerar sua avantaji, sua forteso, e.c., per paroli od altra signi, por trompar la ceteri. Ostentar esas montrar ed expozar kun afektaco e superbeso sua avantaji, precipue la luxo, richaji, belaji, por ecitar l'admiro di la ceteri; II

fango.x: mud, mire, watery dirt as on streets, etc.

fantasmagorio.x: phantasmagoria, dissolving view. Def.: Arto produktar fantomi, t.e. ombri od imaji iluzioniganta; IV

fantastika.x: fantastical, fanciful. Def.: Qua relatas kozi od enti nereala o neposibla; IV

fantaziar.x: (tr.) to have a fancy for (ulu, ulo), to have an idea an inclination (facar ulo); agar segun sua -o: to act according to one's fancy

fantomo.x: phantom, shade, ghost, specter, apparition; (fig.) something unreal

faradizar.x: (tr., med.) to faradize, to stimulate with faradic electric currents.

farbo.x: paint, artificial coloring matter (cf. fardo, pigmento)

farcino.x: (vet.) farcin, farcy, a form of glanders.

farso.x: (cook.) farce: stuffing, forcemeat; (theat. and fig.) farce.

fasado.x: facade, the front or chief face of a building.

fasko.x: bundle, a number of things of a certain length, put together; sheath; stack; bunch; (opt.) pencil (of luminous rays); (antiq.) fasces

fatigar.x: (tr.) to fatigue, tire, weary; (cf. tedar, enoyar)

faucala.x: (anat.) jugular. Def.: Indikas l'extera ed avana parto di la kolo (do anke la laringo, ma extere vidata); e, pro ke ta parto formacas kava profilo (inter la mandibulo o mentono e la pektoro), la vorto fauco uzesas per metaforo internaciona por expresar multa formi kava, en tekniko, en geografio (montala fauco), e.c.; III-165. IL

fauco.x: (anat. and fig.) (exterior) throat, gullet, fore part of neck (cf. guturo); (geog.) space from which something has been gouged, defile, ravine, deep glen

favorar.x: (tr.) to favor, treat or regard with kindness, befriend

febla.x: (lit. and fig.) feeble, weak, faint; (cf. debila, frajila)

feblajo.x: a weak object or spot, foible

federar.x: (tr.) to (con-)federate, federalize, ally, form an alliance (of states, nations; cf. aliancar)

fekifar.x: to void the bowels, defecate (cf. kakar)

fekunda.x: fecund, prolific (of living beings only; cf. fertila)

fekundigar.x: to make f., impregnate. V. exp.: vid. fertila. Ant.: ne-fekunda, sterila.

felo.x: hide, pelt, fell, skin detached from body and dressed; (cf. furo).

felpo.x: (fabric) a kind of plush, shag, velveteen.

fendar.x: (tr.) to split (lengthwise), slit, cleave; (cf. krevis-ar); (fig.) to rend (the heart)

fenomenologio.x: phenomenology, description, history, or explanation of phenomena.

ferizar.x: to put iron on (ulo), to bind, fit, hoop (with iron)

ferma.x: firm: solid, stable, fixed, compact, stout; (cf. solida, stabila); (fig.) which does not tremble, steady, steadfast, bold, resolute

fermentacar.x: (intr.; also fig.) to ferment; (of dough) to rise.

fermento.x: a ferment (as yeast, leaven); (fig.) which excites or gives rise to.

fermeskar.x: to become firm, strong, established, settled. -e: firmly, steadily; (interj.) hold fast; do not flinch! Ex.: Ferma tero. Stacar ferme. Karno ferma. Parolar en tono ferma. Fermigar sua rezolvo. Ant.: mola, shancel-anta, vacil-anta, febla.

feroca.x: ferocious. Def.: Sovaja, kruela e violentoza; III

fertiligar.x: to fertilize. V. exp.: Fertila ne esas la sama ideo kam fekunda: ento fekunda genitas ento simila a su

fervorar.x: (intr.) to be fervent, be earnest, eager, zealous; (cf. ardorar, zelar)

festar.x: (intr.) to observe a holiday; (rel.) to keep a feast

festinar.x: (tr., intr.) to feast, eat sumptuously, banquet

fi.x: fie! shame! faugh! ugh! pish! phew!

fiancar.x: (tr.) to betroth, affiance, pledge in marriage

fibrigar.x: to thread out (ulo); -eskar: to become fibrous.

fibulo.x: (antiq.) fibula, a buckle or clasp (cf. peroneo); -izar: (surg.) to infibulate.

fidar.x: (intr.) to trust, put one’s trust (in); rely (upon); put confidence (ad ulu, ulo); (cf. konfidar); o-: confidence, reliance, faith

fideikomiso.x: (jur.) a trust (of an estate or property)

fideleso.x: fidelity, fealty, allegiance (cf. vasal-eso, devot-eso, loyal-eso); -o-juro: oath of allegiance

fiera.x: proud, proper sense of self-respect or self-esteem

figurizar.x: to figure, form into a determinate shape, represent (in picture) or statuary

figuro.x: (also geom. rhet.) figure, outside form, shape of a body; appearance, representation

fiktiva.x: fictitious, imaginary, not real. Ex. Fiktiva persono, valoro.

filaso.x: tow, harl (of flax, hemp, for spinning). V. exp.: La materio ek qua on filifas. Filaso ne esas stupo; nam on ne povas filigar stupo; III

filetizar.x: to cut a thread on. Ex.: Fileto de soleo. Skrub-fileto.

fileto.x: fillet, chine (of beef, fish); thread (of a screw, worm)

filharmoniala.x: philharmonic (society, etc.). Def. Amo pasionoza por muziko.

filieso.x: filiation, relations of children to parents

filigar.x: (tr.) to spin (ulo), to make into threads

finar.x: (tr., intr.) to finish, to end, leave off, to have done, come to an end

fineskar.x: to draw to, to approach the end

fingita.x: feigned, fictitious. Def.: Simular por trompar. Ex.: Fingar joyo, maladeso. Il fingis amorar me.

finigar.x: to finish (ulo), to cause to end, put an end to, terminate

finisar.x: (tr., tech.) to finish off (an article), to put the finishing touches to (ulo)

finislimar.x: (tr.) to finish off (ulo) with a file. Def.: Finisado esas la lasta laboro, quan on facas pri ula material produkturo, por ke ol havez sua definitiva forma ed aspekto; VI-383.

fintar.x: (intr.) to (make a) f. Def.: Simulita atako. Termino teknikal di la skerm-arto, uzata anke metafore; V-484, 676.

firmamento.x: (lit. and fig.) firmament. Def.: L'antiqua nociono di la cielo (kom solida vulto); V-484.

fisko.x: fisc: state or royal treasury; an exchequer

fitar.x: (intr.) -igar (tr.): (mechan., also of garments) to fit: suit as to shape, size

fixigar.x: to fix, fasten (ulo), to appoint (a day)

flado.x: flawn, a sort of flat custard cake.

flagizar.x: to dress with f.s. Def.: Flago esas insigno (generale min granda kam standardo), qua indikas la lojeyo, navo o loko di ula chefo o di ula establisuro: ex. la Reda Kruco; III-31.

flagrar.x: (intr., chem.) to deflagrate: to blaze suddenly, flare up; (fig.) to be flagrant, flame into notice, be notorious

flako.x: small pool, puddle (of water, blood, etc.)

flamagar.x: (tr.) to pass (ulo) over a fire, to singe

flamo.x: flame, blaze, flash, flare; (fig.) flame (of passion), ardour, warmth (of affection)

flanjo.x: flange (of a tube). Def.: Diskatra, salianta parto di tubi, stangi, e.c., qua uzesas por ligar li per skrubi; III-82. V. exp. vid. rebordo.

flankapogar.x: (tr.) to prop up (ulo) on one side

flanke.x: at or from the side, flank

flankizar.x: (milit., arch.) to f., cover the f. of (ulo, per)

flanko.x: side (of body); flank (of enemy); breast (of ship)

flankumar.x: (tr.) to be on the f. of (ulo)

flarar.x: (tr.) to smell, scent (an odour, an object; cf. odorar)

flatachar.x: to f. servilely, fawn upon, toady to (ulu)

flatuar.x: (intr.) to break wind, -(ad)o: breaking wind, flatus, poop

flecho.x: (weapon) arrow; (arch.) spire; (fort.) bonnet, fleche, simple redan; (geom.) absciss (of a curve); (trig.) versed sine

flegar.x: (tr) to nurse, care for (sick person, child; cf. sorgar)

flegeyo.x: sick-ward, place for nursing. V. exp.: vid. suciar.

flereto.x: (fencing-) foil. Def.: Speco di espado tenua e flexebla por skermado (generale kun butono ye la fino); IV

flexar.x: (tr., intr.) to bend (out of the straight), bow, flex

flirtar.x: (intr.) to flirt, coquet, make love in a trifling manner

flitrizar.x: to spangle. Def.: Ronda plaketo quan on sutas exemple sur vesto por igar ol brilanta; VI

flogar.x: to flog, whip, lash, flagellate, scourge (cf. verg-agar): -ilo: whip, lash.

floko.x: flake (as of snow); flock: lock of wool or hair; tuft

florifar.x: to bloom, blossom, be in flower

floro.x: flower, bloom, blossom; (fig.) flower (of speech), prime (of life), bloom (of innocence), etc.

flotacar.x: : (intr.) to float, to be afloat on the surface of a liquid

flotacigar.x: to (cause to) float, waft, raft (wood, etc.)

floteto.x: a small f. V. exp.: Floto indikas «ensemblo de navi» naviganta kune e komandata da un chefo

flotilio.x: (nav.) flotilla. Def.: Floto (ne flot-eto) de mikra navi; VI

fluar.x: (intr.) to flow, run, glide (of liquids, elec.)

flugar.x: (intr.) to fly (in air), fly about, be wafted (by wind)

flugfolio.x: loose or detached sheet of paper

fluida.x: fluid, having parts freely mobile, separate and penetrable, as water, vapor, and air

fluideso.x: fluidity. V. exp.: Fluido esas gaso o liquido; IV-162; (cf. liquida).

fluktuar.x: (intr.) to fluctuate, waver, float, move to and fro; (fig.) to be irresolute

fluvio.x: (large) river, a large stream of water flowing into the sea; (fig.) copious flow, torrent

fola.x: mad, crazy, mentally deranged; (fig.) foolish, nonsensical, senseless

foleta.x: (fam.) cracked, touched (in the head); mad after, infatuated, doting on; (cf. dementa)

folietono.x: feuilleton, literary part of a F. newspaper

foligar.x: to make (ulu) crazy, to make some one foolish

folio.x: (bot.) leaf; thin sheet of something; folio: page number (folio 12 = pagino 12 of a sheet of which the reverse side is blank)

foliumar.x: to turn over the leaves of a book.

folkloro.x: folklore. Def.: Ico esas nek populala literaturo, nek populala tradicionaro, ma l'ensemblo di la verki, rakonti, kanti, kustumi qui naskis de la populo e karakterizas ol, e lua studiado: VII-279.

fomentar.x: (tr., med.) to foment, apply warm lotions to; (fig.) to encourage, stir up.

fondar.x: (tr.) to found, establish (ulo, sur ulo); (cf. establisar)

fontaquo.x: spring-water. Ex.: La fonti di Nil. Acensar rivero til la fonto. La fonto di lo bona e di lo mala. Laboro esas la fonto di richaji. Recevar novaji de bona fonto.

fonto.x: (pr. and fig.) font, spring: natural source (cf. fonteno)

forcepso.x: (surg.) forceps, an instrument used in midwifery (cf. pinc-eto).

forco.x: (mechan.) force. Ex.: La forci natural esas l'aero, l'aquo, e.c. Forco centripetala.

forfetale.x: by contract, by the job, at a lump sum

forfeto.x: contract, tender (at a stipulated price, whether the contractor lose or gain)

forko.x: (agri.) pitchfork, hayfork, dungfork; (fig.) any two or three-pronged instrument

formato.x: format, shape, size of a book.

formikumar.x: (intr.) to swarm, teem, be full of (like ants)

foronomio.x: phoronomics: geometry of kinematics. Def.: Geometrio di la movo, o cinematiko geometriala; III-263.

forsan.x: (adv.) perhaps, may be, perchance. Ex.: Forsan il kredas lo. Forsan il venos, forsan no. Me ne savas precize quanta komizi laboras en ica kontoro; forsan tri o quar.

forsar.x: (tr.) to force, break open (a door, a lock), to compel (by mechanical means or power) ; (cf. koaktar).

forteskar.x: to get s.; (of wind) to freshen

fortreso.x: fortress, a large fort holding a garrison.; (fig.) a stronghold.

fortunoza.x: fortunate, lucky; (cf. hazard-oza). Def.: Bona chanco; V-492. Ant.: des-fortuno, des-felic-eso.

fosato.x: ditch, trench; (milit.) moat. Def.: Foso longa o plu juste linea, qua formacas limito od obstaklo; IV

foseto.x: small hole; (of face or body) dimple

fosifar.x: to dig or make a pit. Def.: Kavajo o exkavajo plu o min larja e profunda (en tero).

fosto.x: post, a piece or timber set upright; stake (cf. paliso); jamb (of a door)

fragmentigar.x: to make into or reduce to f.s.

frajila.x: (also fig.) fragile, brittle, easily broken or destroyed, not durable

frakasar.x: (tr.) to break to pieces, shatter, smash

frakasbruiso.x: crash (sound). (cf. ruptar). Ex.: Frakasar porcelana taso. Omna osti en lua korpo esis frakasata.

frambizar.x: to cover with r.s; (fig.) to give a r. flavor to.

framo.x: (tech.) frame (work) (of a machine, wagon, etc.); chassis (of autom.); sash (of a window, etc.) N.B. not frame of picture; cf. kadro.

francisko.x: (French) battle-axe. Def.: Armo di l'antiqua Franki: hakilo kun du tranchivi; V

frangulo.x: (bot.) black alder tree, alder buckthorn Frangula (Rhamnus).

franjipano.x: frangipane, jasmine perfume, also a liquor.

franjizar.x: to f. (ulo): adorn, trim with a f.

frankolino.x: (orni.) francolin: a species of partridge (genus: Pternistes).

frapar.x: (tr.) to strike, knock, hit, slap, rap; (fig.) to make an impression on (ulu)

frayo.x: spawn, eggs of fish and also of frogs

fremisar.x: (intr.) to shudder, quiver, tremble (from passion; cf. tremar)

fremisigar.x: to cause to shudder. Ex.: On fremisas de (pro) hororo, iraco, de multa pasioni.

frequala.x: (gram.) frequentative. V. exp.vid. ofta. Ant. rara, ecept-a, -ala, unika.

frequentar.x: (tr.) to frequent, visit often, haunt; attend (a school)

fresha.x: fresh, recently made, gathered, done, obtained; not stale; sound, not impaired by time

frezar.x: (tr., tech.) to countersink; to widen, chamfer the upper part of a hole

friabla.x: friable. Def.: Qua esas facile reduktebla a pulvero.

friandajo.x: titbit, dainty morsel, sweetmeat, table delicacy

friciono.x: rubbing, friction. V. exp. vid. frotar.

frigoroizar.x: (tr.) to refrigerate, preserve bt cooling, -iz-(ad)o: refrigeration

fripisto.x: old clothes dealer; second hand dealer.

fristo.x: (jur.) fixed space of time; (legal) term; respite, delay, postponement. Def.: Tempo - quanto grantenda o grantita por efektigar ulo; VI

frivola.x: (of persons) frivolous, light-minded; (of things, acts) trifling, futile, petty

frizar.x: (tr., intr.) to curl, frizzle (the hair of the head, beard, mustache, etc.)

frogo.x: frog: coarse braid or gallon crossing the breasts of a coat. (Not amphib. cf. rano).

froko.x: (monk's) cowl, hood (cf. kapuco); (in an extensive sense) (monk's) frock, gown

frolar.x: to graze, touch slightly in passing, brush past. Ex.: La kuglo frolis mea kapo.

frondo.x: a sling ( as for throwing stones); (surg.) a sling (as used for arm) (cf. sharpo)

frontiero.x: frontier. Def.: Limito inter du landi; II

frontispico.x: (book) frontispiece. Def.: Ilustruro qua opozesas (E. faces) a titul-pagino di libro e libro-parto; IV

fronto.x: (anat.) forehead; (fig.) the fore part of anything

frontono.x: (arch.) fronton, pediment; -eto: a little pediment over a door or window. Def.: Arkitektural ornivo triangula o mi-cirkla super la enireyo di edifico.

frotar.x: (tr., household term) to rub, scrub, shine up; polish (ulo) by rubbing; wax and polish (a floor, furniture) (cf. polisar). V. exp.: Frotar esas ekonomiala ago: on frotas parqueto, mobli, etc. Fricionar havas teknikala senco, sive en medicino, sive en mekaniko; II

frugala.x: frugal; (cf. spar-ema) Ex.: Frugala homo. Frugaleso di repasto.

frumentizar.x: to sow (ulo) with w., cover with w.

frusta.x: worn out, defaced, corroded (of coins), weather-beaten (of statues)

frustrar.x: (tr.) to deprive unjustly (ulu, de ulo), to defraud; (N.B. not E. frustrate; cf. deceptar, fali-igar, van-igar). Def.: Privacar neyuste o neloyale; III

fudro.x: ton, large cask. Def.: Tre granda barelo (de 800 litri e plu multo); V

fugigar.x: to put (ulu) to flight, drive away, rout

fuko.x: (bot.) fucus, sea-weed, kelp. Def.: Ordinara genero di algo.

fular.x: (tr.) to tread (grapes), trample on (ulo); to full (cloth) (cf. tramplar). Def.: Pedo-presar (ulo) o marchar sur (ulo); (fig.) specala maniero traktar drapi; VI-114. Ex.: Fular la vitberi. La kavali fulis la gazono e la flori.

fulgurar.x: (intr.) to fulgurate, flash as or like lightning (cf. fulminar)

fulminar.x: (tr., intr.) to fulminate, to lighten; to thunder and lighten; to flash; to blast (ulu); (fig.) to thunder forth (menaces, excommunication, etc. kontre ulu)

fumizar.x: to cover with s.; to s. dry

funcionar.x: (intr.) to function (all senses): to function, act (kom), to perform the duties, fill an office, to work properly (of machinery, etc.); (cf. agar, laborar)

funcionigar.x: to make work, set going, put in play

fundamentizar.x: to lay the f.s of (ulo). Ex.: La fundamento di edifico. La fundamenti di la universo, di la homala vivo, di la arti; Lua sistemo esas fundamentale nejusta.

fundamento.x: (pr. and fig.) that on which anything rests; foundation, groundwork, underpinning; (fig.) basis, ground; (cf. fond-uro, basamento)

funde.x: at bottom, in the main, in reality

fundo.x: bottom, lowest part of something hollow, as b. of a vase, a well; that which stands at the bottom, as a liquid at the bottom of bottles; ground, solid substance under water, as of sandy b.; (fig.) basis, essential part

funesta.x: baleful, disastrous, distressing, pernicious, malign. Def.: Expresas ideo plu forta kam nociva, ma ne esas exakte nek sempre mortigiva; signifikas kauzo od okaziono di nefeliceso; IV-267. Ex.: Funesta evento, novajo, pasiono, milito. Ant.: favoroza.

fungo.x: (also med.) (bot.) fungus, mushroom, (edible or poisonous as toadstool)

funikulara.x: funicular, dependent upon the tension of a cord, cable

furgono.x: closed van or goods wagon (cf. kamiono); (milit.) baggage cart, ammunition wagon. Def.: Kargoveturo qua esas konstitucita ek kestego klozita en qua on inkluzas la vari; IV-291.

furiar.x: (intr.) to be in a state of extreme anger, momentary madness, immoderate passion

fushfabrikar.x: to make worthless merchandise, shoddy goods.

fusto.x: (arch.) fust: shaft of a column; (of a cannon) chase.

fuzelo.x: (geom.) spindle: a solid generated by the revolution of a curved line about its base; a fusiform figure

fuzeo.x: rocket (as in fireworks); fuse (to a bomb, etc.)

gabano.x: water proof cloak with hood and sleeves; (naut.) pilot-coat.

gabaro.x: lighter, barge (for loading and unloading ships).

gafo.x: boat-hook; (fig.) gaff (as used to secure heavy fish).

gaino.x: a long narrow vertical holder, sheath, scabbard (as for a sword, bayonet, etc.: en- -igar: to sheath) a sword, etc. V. exp: vid. etuyo.

gajizar.x: to give as a pledge, secure

gajo.x: pledge, pawn, deposit, gage; something given as security for repayment of money borrowed

galanta.x: gallant; polite and attentive to ladies

galantajo.x: act of gallantry, courteous act (to ladies).

galarobo.x: a gala robe, festive dress. V. exp.: Ica vorto uzesas precipue adjektive, por qualifikar festo, dineo, reprezento, e.c. On uzos do ol kom unesma elemento di kompozita vorti; IV-11.

galerano.x: one of the crew of the g.; (fig.) g.slave (cf. bagn-ano).

galerio.x: gallery, a long narrow room, hall or passageway; highest balcony (in theaters, churches); balcony on stern of ship; drift tunnel, (in mining or fortification) -spekt-anti, -ant-aro: the gallery, people seated in g.

galimatiaso.x: galimatias, jargon, gibberish. V. exp.: Galimatiaso ne estas linguo, ma diskurso o parolado qua estas gramatikale korekta ma konfuza ed obskura per la stilo; VII-158.

galono.x: galoon, a narrow trimming, lace of gold, silver, silk, etc.

galosho.x: galosh: a shoe with a wooden sole.

galvanizar.x: (tr. elec., and fig.) to galvanize, electrify; (cf. galvano-plastar).

gambitar.x: (tr.) to trip up (ulu); (fig.) (in chess) to play a gambit.

gambolar.x: (intr.) to gambol, skip about in frolic, romp.

gamo.x: (mus.) gamut, scale. Def.: Sequo di la soni di ula tono en l'ordino di alteso (ex.: c, d, e, f, g, a, b esas la gamo di la tono di C); IV-467.

ganar.x: (tr.) to gain, to earn, to win

gangrenar.x: (intr. med.) to be affected with gangrene

gapar.x: (intr.) to gape with wonder or curiosity (like a simpleton).

garantiar.x: (tr.) to guarantee, warrant; (cf. cert-igar, responsar, kaucion-igar). Ex.: Garantiar la pago di debajo. Me garantias ca posh-horlojo pur un yaro. Me ne povas garantiar la vereso di ta aserto.

garar.x: (tr.) to put or place to one side of a road or way (temporarily for protective purposes); to shunt, switch, (trains on a siding)

gareyo.x: a side place; (fig.) a garage (for autos). Def.: Pozar latere ad ula voyo, en halto o rezervo, quaze depozita o shirmata; IV-103. Ex.: On garas treni sur gar-voyi (N.B. gareyo ne esas staciono). On garas bateli en la protui o gareyi (larjigita parti) di kanalo. La pasanti en la stradi garas su de la veturi o por lasar altru pasar. La skermanto garas su por «kovrar» (protektar) sua korpo ed evitar la stroki di espado.

gargarar.x: (tr.) to gargarize, to gargle (the throat) (ulu, su)

garnisar.x: (tr.) to furnish with things necessary to complete or embellish

garnituro.x: garniture, ornamental appendages, embellishment, furniture, dress.

garotligar.x: to make fast, with or in a garrote; (fig.) to pinion, strangle.

garoto.x: short piece of wood used to tighten anything, especially cords by twisting around; packing-stick

gastesar.x: to be a g., to stay, lodge (che ulu)

gastigar.x: to receive (ulu) as a g.; to lodge (ulu)

gastralgio.x: (med.) gastralgia: gastric neuralgia, pain in the abdomen; belly-ache.

gastronomio.x: gastronomy. Def.: Quaza arto di la gastronomo.

gastronomo.x: gastronome, epicure. Def.: Homo qua havas subtila gusto e savas dicernar la qualesi di la manjaji e drinkaji; VII-155. V. exp.: vid. gurmando.

gaujar.x: (tr.) to gauge, measure (the capacity of), to take the g. of. Def.: Mezurar la konteno (interna volumino) di navo, barelo. e.c.; III-75.

gavar.x: (tr.) to cram, gorge (with food), (artificially) to fatten (animals).

gavoto.x: gavot(te): a kind of lively dance or tune (French).

gayigar.x: to make (ulu) merry, cheer, enliven, gladden

geisha.x: geisha, Japanese singing or dancing girl.

gelto.x: commission money, percentage on sales, bonus. Def.: Sumo po cento pagata a komizi, vendisti, e.c. ek lia vendi; II-75.

genio.x: genius, particular natural talent, uncommon intellectual power; (fig) attendant spirit

genitar.x: (tr.) to beget, breed, generate, procreate (living beings); cf. produktar (ulo); (geom.) to generate

genituro.x: offspring, a progeny; (of animals) a litter; -ema: prolific; V. exp.: On genitas filio; luxo produktas vicio.

gesto.x: gesticulation, gesture, deaf and dumb sign

gicheto.x: wicket, small gatelike window in ticket-offices, etc.; also as in game or cricket.

gildo.x: guild, gild. Def.: Ensemblo di samspeca mestieristi. M.-X.132.

gilochar.x: (tr., arch.) to furnish or decorate with a guilloche

gimnazio.x: gymnasium, classical preparatory school (esp. in Germany); (cf.kolegio; liceo).

gipso.x: gypsum, plaster-of-paris; ordinary plaster (as used for house interiors); (cf. mortero)

girlando.x: garland: wreath of flowers, leaves, etc.

gisar.x: (tr.) to cast: found molten metal; (cf. muldar)

gisdefekto.x: defect in casting, blow-hole. Ex.: Gisar kanono en mulduro. III-82.

gizardo.x: (anat.) gizzard. Def.: Triesma stomako di l'uceli; V-87.

glacar.x: (tr., tech.) to gloss, glaze (paper, leather, etc.) (cf. glezar); to calender (fabrics).

glaciala.x: relating to ice, -igar: to freeze (ulo) into ice (cf. konjel-ar, frost-igar, frigor-izar)

glaciero.x: glacier: -ala: glacial: relating to g.s (cf. glaci-ala).

glavo.x: (also fig.) sword; -di yusteso: (fig.) the s. of justice. Def.: Espado tranchanta.

glezar.x: (tr.) to glaze, apply a vitreous coating to pottery. Def: Aplikar vitra strato sur ceramikajo; IV-579.

glinar.x: (tr.) to glean (ears of grain); (fig.) to gather (things thinly scattered). Ex.: Glinar la spiki pos la rekolto. Li studiabis ta epoko tante komplete, ke nun ni povas nur glinar poka fakti nova.

gliptarto.x: glyptography. Def.: Skultar medali e lapidi; IV-291.

glitflugar.x: (aviation) to plane; -shuo: snow-shoe. Ex.: On glitas sur voyi kovrita per frosto-pluvo. Il sizis la kordo e glitis til la tero. La batelo glitas sur la kalma maro. La taso glitis de mea manuo. Glitigar sua manuo en la posho di ulu. Vua remonstri glitas de lua mento.

glosario.x: glossary: partial dictionary explaining the harder words.

gluglar.x: (intr.) to gurgle (cf. gorgolar, klukar). Def.: Bruiso di liquido ekiranta botelo; IV-11.

glutar.x: (tr.) to swallow, gulp, gobble up (food, etc.); to quaff, swill (liquids); (fig.) to take in, to look at, with eagerness, avidity

glutinar.x: (tr., intr.) to stick, fasten or be fastened by adhesion; adhere, paste, glue, agglutinate; (cf. adherar) kun- -ar du kozi: to stick two things together

glutinisto.x: paster, sizer, paper-hanger, bill-sticker. (cf. glu-izar, gum-izar).

godrono.x: (arch. and ornamental) godroon, a kind of edge molding or fluting.

golfo.x: (geog.) gulf, a large bay; (game) golf; (cf. bayo).

golpo.x: smut, blight (of grain) (Ustilago carbo). Def.: Fungo parazita dil frumento; VI-540

gondbendo.x: pintle-brace, iron-work clamped on a door to sustain the pintle.  V.exp.: Charniro kompozesas ek du metal peci ocilanta sur un axo komuna, e quan on skrubagas sur pordo, kesto, e.c. por apertar o klozar. Gondo esas axala fer-peco kudatra e pivotoza, sustenanta la gondobendo, sur qua rotacas la pordo, e.c.

gondolisto.x: gondolier. Def.: Vehilo suspendita ad aerostato (direktebla o ne); speco di batelo uzata en la laguni, aparte en Venezia (E. Venice); VI-26.

gorgeetar.x: to cheep, peep. Def.: La specala kanto di mikra uceli; VI-27.

gorgolar.x: (intr.) to gurgle, to fall with a purling, splashing noise (as noise of brooks); to rattle, rumble (of water in stomach); cf. gluglar).

gorjereto.x: (surg.) gorget, a cutting instrument used in lithotomy.

gracila.x: gracile, slender and graceful, svelte, lithe. Def.: Gracioze tenua ed alta; VI-569.

gracio.x: gracefullness, charm, elegance of manner or form

gradizar.x: to put steps into (ulo); to graduate (an instrument); (university) to confer a degree on (ulu)

grado.x: step (of stairs); degree (as of temperature); degree (in university); grade, rank (in order of dignity); step (in progress); size (of shoes, gloves, etc.)

grafikarti.x: g. arts (as opposed to plastic arts); (N.B. «a g. account» = pitoreska deskripto).

granario.x: loft, attic (in country houses for grains, hay).

granda.x: a term of comparison denoting more magnitude than something else, or beyond what is usual; as great, large, big; also used fig. in the sense of the E. «grand» apart from material dimensions: -a vazo, domo: a large vase, house

grandeso.x: (quality) magnitude, largeness of bulk or dimensions, bigness, bulk; (fig.) high degree, grandness

grandulo.x: a large man; a great man (in power, dignity), grandee (Spain)

grantar.x: (tr.) to grant, allow, concede, confer (demands, favors, privileges, etc.); to award (damages)

granulo.x: (med.) granule (of a granulation, as from wounds, ulcers)

grapo.x: cluster, bunch, a number of fruits or flowers growing along a common stalk.

gratar.x: (tr.) to scratch (so as to allay itching); (of animals) to claw; (of noise) to scrape, grate. (cf. skrachar).

gratifikar.x: (tr.) to bestow (money) on; to tip (ulu per ulo)

gratifikuro.x: bounty, gratuity, tip. Def.: Donar pekuniala rekompenso exter la salario o preco debata; IV-12. Ex.: La rejo gratifikas il per pensiono. Ni donis drink-moneto a la garsono kom gratifikuro.

gratinizar.x: (tr.), -ifar (intr.): to gratinate, to cook, as with a covering of buttered crumbs, until a crust or crisp surface forms

gratitudar.x: (tr.) to be grateful, thankful to (ulu, pro, pri ulo)

gratuite.x: gratis, for nothing. Def.: (adj.) recevata sen pago; (adv.) sen demander pago; II-75, III-322.

gratular.x: (tr.) to congratulate, felicitate. Ex.: Gratular ulu pri lua vinko.

grava.x: (phys.) heavy, ponderous; (fig.) weighty, momentous, not frivolous, grave, (cf. importanta, serioza); (mus.) low (note), deep (tone); (gram.) grave (accent)

gravelo.x: (med.) gravel, stone in the kidneys or bladder

gravideskar.x: to become pregnant, conceive a child

gravidigar.x: to make pregnant, get with child

gravio.x: gravel, small stones or pebbles intermixed with sand

gravitar.x: (intr., phys. and fig.) to gravitate, be attracted, tend to a center

gremialo.x: gremial, lap cloth worn by a bishop. Ex.: El tenis sua infanto sur sua gremio.

gremio.x: lap (of a sitting person); (fig.) -o di l'eklezio: bosom, pale of the church

grenadisto.x: a soldier who throws g.s; (fig.) grenadier: a foot soldier of a special corps.

gretizar.x: to inclose or cover with railing, to rail in

greto.x: grating, a partition of iron or wood bars; grate (of a stove), (metal or wood) railing or fence (used to partition off)

grifono.x: (myth.) griffon; griffon, a kind of European water-dog.

grimar.x: (tr., theat.) to make up (su), by painting wrinkles, etc., the appearance of an old person; to make up (ulu) as an old person.

grincar.x: (intr.) to gnash, grind (per la denti); to grate (as a door, etc.).

grindar.x: (tr.) to grind, rough down as on a grindstone, or as with emery, etc.

grondar.x: (intr.) to roar, rumble (of thunder, storm, wind, waves); to growl, snarl (of animals). Def.: Audigar bruiso duranta e nelauta, quale la tondro fora, od ula animali iraceskanta; IV-12.

gropo.x: croup, rump (of a horse and some other animals); (arch.) hip-roof

grosa.x: thick and long; (fig.) large, great, gross, thick, bulky; (cf. granda), -a arboro: a large tree

grosiera.x: (of persons, acts or objects) without delicacy, coarse, rude, blunt, boorish, low

grosierajo.x: coarse language or word; vulgarity, rude act

gruchiero.x: one who carries c.s; (fig.) a cripple

grumelo.x: grume, a clot (in the blood, in milk, etc.)

grumo.x: groom, a manservant, esp. one in charge of horses.

grupo.x: group (of persons or objects), clump (of trees), flock (of sheep)

gruzo.x: (orni.) grouse, ptarmigan, white, black, red (Lagopus scoticus) M. XI. 348.

guatar.x: (tr.) to watch, be on w. for; to lie in wait for

guidar.x: (tr.) to guide, to lead, to conduct in a way

guidlibro.x: g. book. V. exp.: Guidar esas esence montrar la justa voyo ad ulu, qua ne konocas ol, qua povas hezitar od erorar. Duktar e guidar esas direktar ulu od ulo akompanante lu: ex. Kapitano duktas sua kompanio, ma generalo nur direktas armeo, restante en sua quartero. On duktas o direktas navo, aer-navo, kande on esas «ye bordo» (en oli); ma per Hertzala radii on povas direktar torpedo sen duktar ol; IV-162.

guindo.x: heart cherry. Def.: Frukto simila a cerizo; IV-136

gumo.x: gum, vegetable substance which exudes from certain trees; (cf. kauchuko)

gurmandacho.x: glutton. Def.: Homo qua prizas la bona (bon-saporoza) dishi e manjas multo de li; VII-155. V. exp.: Manj-eg-ero (gurmand-acho) esas homo qua manjas multo, sen dicerno, kun apetito brutal

gurmando.x: gourmand, one fond of good living

gurmo.x: milk-scall, -crust, scabs on an infant’s head (crusta lactea).

gustexperto.x: expert taster (as of tea), connoisseur (of wines, etc.)

gutifar.x: to drop, drip, trickle, run down

guturalo.x: (gram.) a gutteral. Def.: L’interna kavajo supre en la kolo (ciencale: la faringo, la laringo e la supra ezofago): ex. on parolas pri soni guturala (ciencale, li esas velala od uvulala); III-165

guvernar.x: (tr. general sense) to rule with authority, to have physical power over, to direct: -ar navo: to steer a ship; to rule over a ship

habila.x: (physical, intellectual) able, clever, skilful, adroit, dextrous, handy

habilitar.x: (tr.; esp. juris.) to habilitate, to qualify, to render competent, to enable. Ex.: Habilitar minor(ul)o kontraktar. Habilitar su por ula ofico. La habiliteso heredar cesas en fora gradi di parenteso.

habitar.x: (tr., intr.) to inhabit, to live (in) (permanently); (cf. rezidar)

habitebla.x: (in)habitable. V. exp.: Habitar esas rezidar permanante en propra o fixa domo

hachar.x: (tr.) to hatch, shade by lines cut or drawn; to hash, to mince, cut into very small parts

hachilo.x: (cook.) chopping-knife. Def.: Pece-tigar (karno, e.c.); IV-562. Ex.: On hachas karno per multa densa tranchuri preske paralela; simile on hachas desegno per multa linei preske paralela; V-31.

hakar.x: (tr.) to chop, (rough) hew, cut up (with an axe or large cutting instrument), (cf. hachar)

halo.x: a large room of considerable size; (merkato-) market, public place, ordinarily covered, where marketing is carried on

haltez.x: (command.) halt! stop there! that will do!

haltigar.x: to cause (ulu) to halt; to stop (ulo)

halucinigar.x: to cause h.s in (ulu); to affect with visions or imaginary perceptions.

handikapar.x: (tr., in sports and fig.) to handicap.

hangaro.x: shed (esp. for vehicles), outhouse; (aviation) hangar. Def.: Tekto pozita sur fosti o pilastri; II-709.

hardeso.x: hardness. Ex.: Fero esas metalo tre harda. Ovo harde koquita. Lito harda. Hardigar sua korpo. Havar harda kordio (fig.). Kavalo kun harda boko. Ant.: mola.

hardigar.x: to harden (ulu, ulo); to temper (iron, etc.); (fig.) to indurate, toughen, inure

harmoniar.x: (intr., lit. and fig.) to be in harmony (kun)

haro.x: a hair (of a person's head; cf. pilo)

hastigar.x: to hurry (ulu, ulo, su); to press, push forward expedite; (cf. acelerar, plu-rapid-igar, avancar)

haueto.x: mattock. Def.: Instrumento fera kun ligna mancho, por exkavar la tero; la fera parto esas larja, plata e tranchanta, kun aristo en plano perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.

haular.x: (tr., nav.) to haul, heave in (cf. tirar); to tow

havar.x: (tr.) to have (ulo: money, occasion, motive, time, etc.; N.B. not to be used as verbal auxiliary)

hazardo.x: (hap-)hazard, luck, chance, something uncertain and unplanned

hegemonio.x: hegemony. Def.: Speco di dominaco o prepondero di un naciono inter altri (historial e politikal termino); III-603.

hego.x: hedge, hedgerow. Def.: Barilo o klozilo (cirkum agro) formacita ek arbusti; IV-204.

helico.x: (arch., geom.) helix; (of a ship) propeller; (bot.) tendril

helmo.x: (ancient) helmet. Def.: Specala formo di kasko (mezevala e blazonala); IV-78.

helpar.x: (tr.) to help, aid, assist (ulu, pri, por, ulo)

hepatito.x: (med.) hepatitis, inflammation of the liver; (min.) hepatite, liver stone.

herbario.x: herbarium, classified collection of dried plants.

herbo.x: herb, a plant which does not have a woody stem (cf. herboro)

herboristo.x: herbalist. Def.: Medicinala planto sikigita o preparita (en la formo en qua ol vendesas da herboristo); VI-213.

herdo.x: hearth, fireplace, hearthstone; floor or bottom of an oven.

heredar.x: (tr.) to inherit, be the heir to (ulo, de ulu)

hibridigo.x: hybridization. Def.: Animali e planti qui venas de mixo di du speci; V-33. Ex.: Mulo esas hibrido de kavalino ed asnulo.

hidalgo.x: hidalgo: Spanish nobleman of lower class.

hidro.x: (myth., astron.) Hydra; (zool.) hydrophis, a genus of fresh water polyps.

hidroskopio.x: bletonism, art of finding under-water sources.

hipar.x: (intr.) to have the hiccoughs, to hiccup.

hiperbato.x: (gram.) hyperbaton. Def.: Figuro di retoriko konsistanta en renverso di l'ordino dil vorti; VI-135.

hipertrofiar.x: (tr.) to cause hypertrophy to; to develop to an unusual or abnormal degree

hipnotar.x: (intr.) to be in a hypnotic state

hisar.x: (tr., nav.) to hoist, raise, haul up (sails), to run up (a signal, a flag)

histerotomio.x: (surg.) dissection of the womb; Caesarian operation.

historiografo.x: historiographer: official historian of a prince or state.

hivernar.x: (intr. of animals and persons) to hibernate, to winter (cf. estivar); (milit.) to go into winter quarters.

ho.x: Oh! ho! (denoting pain, sorrow, regret); ho there! holla! (nav.) ahoy

holografa.x: holographic: -a testamento: will written in testators own hand.

holokausto.x: (also fig.) holocaust, burnt offering. Def.: Sakrifiko en qua la viktimo esis tote kombustata; IV-79

holoturio.x: (zool.) holothurian: a kind of water polyp (genus: Holothuria), trepang, beche de mer.

homajar.x: (tr.) to do (or pay, render) homage to (a prince, a sovereign); (fig.) to pay one's respects to (ulu)

homeso.x: humanity, quality or condition of being human (cf. human-eso)

homo.x: (species, inclusive of both sexes) man, a human being, person

honesta.x: honest, fair and straightforward in conduct, thought, etc., free from deceit or fraud, upright, worthy

honorario.x: honorarium, fee, emolument. Def.: Salario di la "liberal arti" (advokato, medicinisto, e.c.); IV-163.

honorizar.x: to h., pay h. to (ulu, per ulo)

hordegrano.x: a grain of b.; (fig., med.) stye

hordo.x: horde, a nomadic group; (fig.) crowd, band, pack.

horo.x: hour, the twenty-fourth part of a day; (cf. kloko)

hororar.x: (intr.) to feel dread mixed with detestation, to abhor, detest, loath, dread, have a horror of (pri, pro, ulu, ulo)

hororinda.x: horrible, horrid. V. exp.: vid. pavorar.

hospico.x: asylum, convalescent hospital, refuge (for the infirm, poor, aged, etc.); (as in the Alps) hospice, inn for travelers (kept by religious order). V. exp.: En hospitalo on kuracas maladi; en hospico on mantenas (longe, o mem por lia restanta vivo) oldi, infirmi, infanti, e.c. Malado konvalecanta povas ekirar hospitalo por enirar hospico; IV-136.

hospitalo.x: hospital (cf. ambulanco). V. exp. vid. hospico.

hosto.x: host, one who receives or entertains a guest.

hueto.x: owlet; tawny owl, brown owl (Syrnium aluco, Strix aluco)

humanisto.x: humanist, a student of the humanities

humiligar.x: to humble, humiliate, cast down. Def.: Qua basigas su vole, qua subordinas o submisas su (etikal senco). Per extenso, on darfas parolar pri gesti, paroli, agi, e social situeso humila, humil-iganta; III-226. V. exp. vid. diskreta. Ant.: superba.

humoro.x: (bona, mala) humor, temper, mood, disposition; (old physiol.) one of the four bodily fluids determining the temperament

humuro.x: humor, humour, jocose imagination (less intellectual and more sympathetic than wit). V. Exp. vid. humoro.

huo.x: (orni.) owl, particularly the white owl (Athene noctua)

hura.x: hurrah! hurray! hura-o: a hurrah, huzza.

hurdo.x: hurdle, a movable frame, as of wattled twigs, for folding sheep, gates, etc.; hurdle, an artificial barrier to be leaped.

identigar.x: to identify, to make identical (N.B. not used for persons: ri-konocar ulu kom ulu). Ex.: Me prestis a B. la sama libro kam ad A. (t.e. libro tote identa, un libro). La du propozicioni esas identa l'una a l'altra.

idiomala.x: idiomatic, vernacular, relative to a particular language

idiomo.x: idiom, language of a people, tribe, etc.; (cf. idiotismo)

idiotismala.x: idiomatic, relating to the grammatical construction of a sentence; (cf. idiom-ala). Dei.: Frazo ne komprenebla per logikal analizo; VI-192. Ex.: "How do you do" esas Angla idiotismo.

idiotismo.x: idiotism, idiom, an expression peculiar to itself in grammatical construction; an expression the meaning of which as a whole cannot be derived from the conjoined meanings of its elements; (cf. idiomo)

igar.x: (tr.) to make, cause, render (= suffix -ig- used as an independent verb). Ex.: Igar B. dicar ulo ad A. Igar ulu savar ulo = savigar ulo da ulu. Igar ulu facar ulo = facigar ulo da ulu. Lu igis sua flechi (esar) venenoza. La rejo igis la generalo arestar la policestro.

ignorar.x: (tr.) to ignore, to refuse to notice; disregard wilfully; to overlook (ulu, ulo) intentionally. Def.: Ne volar savar; simular nesavar; VI-165. Ex.: Me savas ke altra faktori existas en la problemo, ma me ignoras li. Ignorar la prczenteso di ulu.

ikonoklasto.x: iconoclast, image breaker; (fig.) one who attacks cherished beliefs as shams; a determined enemy of image worship.

iktiokolo.x: ichthyocol(la), fish-glue, isinglass, a glue prepared from the sounds of fish.

iluminar.x: : (tr.) to illuminate, decorate with festal lights or bonfires (cf. lumizar); (fig.) to enlighten the mind of (ulu)

ilustrar.x: : (tr.) to illustrate, to provide or adorn (as a book with pictures); (cf. enluminar, klarigar, explikar)

iluzionar.x: : (intr.) (cf. trompar), to be laboring under an illusion, delusion

imaginajo.x: : that which one imagines, fancy, conceit

imaginar.x: : (tr.) to imagine, to form a notion, a mental image

imajo.x: : image, a visible representation of something; statue, effigy, picture, idol, etc.; a picture produced by reflection, refraction, etc.; a natural resemblance, likeness; a mental or printed picture. Ex.: La ikonoklasti kombatis kontre la kulto di imaji. Vidar sua imajo en l’aquo. Deo kreis la homo segun sua imajo (E. likeness); Esas bela imaji (E. pictures) en ca libro.

imanar.x: : (intr., philos.) to be immanent, to indwell

imbastar.x: : (tr., of tailors, seamstresses) to baste, to run or tack together (the different parts of a garment, cloth). Def.: Sutar per longa steburi e (ordinare) blanka filo, por pose probar; IV-167.

imbecila.x: : imbecile, weak-minded. (For discussion of scientific meaning of this and related word, cf. VI-243.

imbibar.x: : (tr.) to imbue, to permeate, soak in, drench (speaking of liquids)

imbrikar.x: : (tr.) to imbricate, to overlap (ulo, per ulo)

imersachar.x: to ape, mimic. Ex.: Imitar la signaturo, la manieri, la agi di ulu. Juveli imitita (E. imitation jewels) (cf. kontrafaktar).

imersar.x: : (tr.) to immerge, immerse, to dip, plunge (ulo) into (a liquid)

imersvorto.x: word of command; Ex.: La patrulo imperis a sua filio departar. Devos imperas a me. V. exp.: vid. komandar.

impregnar.x: : (tr.) to impregnate, to fecundate; (fig.) to imbue.

imprekar.x: : (intr.) to imprecate, to invoke evil on a person, to curse (kontre ulu); (cf. maledikar). EFIS

impresar.x: : (tr., materially and morally) to impress, make an impression on (ulo), to move, affect (ulu); (cf. imprimar)

impresionisto.x: : impressionist. Def.: Artala verko, qua tendencas expresar o reprezentar l'impresi recevita da l'artisto de la naturo o de la temo; VI-323.

improvizar.x: : (tr.) to improvise, to compose, recite, sing, etc., extemporaneously; to extemporize; to make, do, or provide offhand

impulsar.x: : (tr., phys. and moral) to give impetus to, to impel

inaniciono.x: : inanition. Del.: Febleso efektigita da manko de nutrivi. DEFIS

incendiar.x: : (tr.) to set fire to; to burn down (maliciously)

incidar.x: : (tr. phys. and gen.) to impinge upon, fall upon or affect

incitar.x: : (tr) to incite, to spur or urge on (ulu, ad ulo); (cf. instigar)

incito.x: : incitement, incentive; (med.) stimulus. Ex.: Incitar la populo revoltar. Ica pensi incitis il a la venjo.

incizar.x: : (tr.) to incise, to cut in or into (cf. tranchar)

indemnizar.x: : to indemnify, compensate, recoup. Def.: Kompensal pekunio donita pro domajo, e.c.; II-75

indexo.x: : index, table of contents of a book; hand of a dial, etc.: (R.C. church) forbidden books; (of Bible) concordance; (cf. indik-fingro).

indico.x: : indication, sign, token, mark, clue; -i tromp-anta: deceitful tokens

indiferenta.x: : indifferent, unconcerned, immaterial; (of persons) cold, unmindful, insensible. Ex.: Sive ni selektas ca voyo sive l'altra, to esas indiferent a me. Il esas indiferent a la laudo ed a la kritiko. Indiferenteso pri temi religiala.

indijar.x: : (tr) to be destitute and in need of (ulo)

indikar.x: to indicate, to show or point out, denote, designate (ulo ad ulu)

individuale.x: individually, in an i. or distinct manner, (cf. single)

individueso.x: individuality, character peculiar to an individual

individuo.x: individual, single person, animal or thing

indolentigar.x: : to render i. Def.: Expresas nelaboremeso qua venas de la mental karaktero, de speco di moleso o deskurajo, II-19. Ant. : ag-iva, -ema; vivaca, impetuoza, diligenta.

induktar.x: (tr., log.) to induce, to reach (a general conclusion) by inference from a number of individual cases; (phys.) to induce, to influence without direct contact; (phys. log.) induction, inference.

indulgajo.x: infirmily; Def.: Qua ne povas uzar (libere, normale) irga membro od organo: V-95. V. exp. vid kripla.

indulgar.x: (tr.) to be indulgent to, make allowance for, forbear to inflict, spare; (cf. komplezar, absolvar)

inflexar.x: (tr., gram.) to inflect; -o: (gram., geom.) inflection, inflexion; (cl. flexiono, modulacar).

infra.x: lowermost, bottom; inferior: lower in space, degree of importance. quality (cl. suba, inferiora); -ajo: lowermost part, bottom part

infre.x: down (as opp. to supre); below, at the bottom (point in space; cl. sube)

infuzar.x: (tr.) to infuse: to steep (without boiling); (surg.) to introduce a liquid into veins; (fig.) to instil, inculcate (principles, etc.).

inglobar.x: (tr., chiefly medic., pharm.) to bland together, put together, (in spherical form). Def.: Ne simple unionar, ma mixar en un sola substanco (globo, quale indikas l'etimologio); anke inkluzar ula substanco (farmaciala) en altra (di altra naturo e saporo), qua envelopas e celas olu; VI-244

ingranar.x: (tr., intr., mechan.) to put in (or throw into) gear, to engage; (cf. embragar, kuplar). Ex. Un roto ingranas (kun) altra, kande ol movas (turnigas) ica per sua propra movo, per denti qui pulsas la denti di l'altra; III-87.

inhibar.x: (tr.) to inhibit: to check, restran (the activity of); (jur.) to phohibit, interdict.

iniciar.x: (tr.) to initiate: to introduce by a first act, take the initiative in; to instruct in the rudiments or pronciples; to introduce into a society, club, etc. by formal rites

injektar.x: (tr.) to inject (a fluid or other substance into something)

injektizar.x: to inject (a person or thing with an injection)

injeniar.x: (tr.) to exercise one's wits, to set one's wits to work; to contrive (tax one's ingenuity)

inkar.x: la fingro aden vunduro: to insinuate a finger in a wound

inkebla.x: intelligible: that can be known by intellection, opp. to sensible. Ex.: On parolas pri la mondo «intelektebla» opozata a la mondo "sentebla". Do on devas dicar «intelektebla» (qua povas esar objecto dil intelekto). intelekto esas l'ago intelektar; IV-231-2. V.exp.: Me intelektas problemo. Me komprenas vua sentivesopri la morto di vua patro.

inkigar.x: to internationalize.  inter-nunci-o: (papal) internucio. interogativ-a, -o*: (gram.) interrogative. Def.: La questionala partikli (adjectivi, pronomi ed adverbi); V-279.

inkuro.x: institution. Ex.: Jesu Kristo dicesas institucir la sep sakramenti Instituco (E. appointment) di judiciisto.

intestini.x: : intestines, entrails, bowels: -o tenua: small intestine.

intima.x: : intimate: inmost, inward; near, close; close in friendship, familiar, bosom

intimeso.x: : intimacy, -ajo: inward part, heart (of a subject)

intoxikar.x: : (tr.) to poison, drug, envenom; (N.B. not E. to intoxicate with liquor; cf. ebri-igar); V. exp.: Intoxikar expresas ido plu general kam venen-izar. On povas drinkar veneno sen esar intoxikita; IV-517.

intradoso.x: : (arch.) intrados: interior curve of an arch.

intrigar.x: : (intr.)to intrigue: to contrive by secret artifice; make plots; scheme

intrikar.x: : (tr.) to tangle, entangle, embroil, implicate (ulu, en ulo); to make (ulo) intricate.

introduktala.x: : preliminary. Ex.: Me volas introduktar il che vu. Donar introdukto-letro ad ulu. Ca libro servos kom introdukto a la temo. III-71.

introduktar.x: : (tr.) to introduce (ulu), to bring (ulo) into notice; to preface; (cf. en-duktar, prizent-ar)

intruzar.x: : (tr.) to intrude, obtrude, (su en ulo); to interfere, meddle; (geol.) to enter, or cause to enter, by force.

inuleskar.x: to become angry, get in a temper

irge.x: again anew, once more, over again. V. exp. vid. repetar.

irgizar.x: to give the hues of the rainbow, become iridescent

ja.x: (adv.) already; before or by this time or the time mentioned, even now

jaboto.x: jabot: ruffle on shirt bosom; lace frill worn on woman’s bodice.

jacar.x: (intr.) to lie (position of persons or things living or dead)

jardiniero.x: jardinière; flower stand or receptacle for plants; a dish of mixed vegetables. – V. exp.: Ne vazo, ma mobl(et)o por suportar flori o buketo; VI-528.

jargonar.x: (intr.) to talk jargon, gibberish, to jabber, to use unintelligible language; (cf. slango, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo o dialekto nekorekta, ma ne esencale od intence diferanta de la ordinara linguo; VII-158. Ex.: La stranjeri ne parolas la Franca, li nur jargonas. La jargono di la infanti, di la rurano.

jaro.x: jar: large earthen jug for water, etc.

javelino.x: (weapon.) javelin. Def.: Speco di dardolonga e dina.

jelozio.x: Jalousie: Venetian blind, curtain blind. Def.: Klozilo kompozita ed multa lati (lameni) superpozita, quin on povas generale inlinar per rotaco cirkum lua longesal axo, e quin on povas levar o deslevar quale kurteno, per kordo o kordono. Kande ol esas tote levita, la lati esas aplikita uni sur altri; III-290.

jemar.x: (intr.) to groan, moan, to give forth a dull, low sound of grief or pain

jenar.x: (tr.) to hinder the movments of the body, (of clothing, etc.) to pinch, be too tight; (fig.) to hold in constraint, prevent, hinder from doing something

jendarmo.x: gendarme: one of a body of military police, esp. in France.

jeniano.x: e. soldier, a sapper and miner; (cf. injenioro).

jerar.x: (tr.) to manage, administer, conduct (a hotel, business (for an owner))

jibeto.x: gibbet. V. exp.: La objekto havas la formo di la litero Greka G (ne ta di la litero ?); kp. patibulo; IV-511.

jineto.x: (zool.) genet(te): species of civets (Viverra Genetta); a Turkish ringcurb, -bit.

jirachar.x: to prowl around. V. exp.: Turnar, rotacar, jirar: La verbo turnar esas la maxim generala e suficas por l’ordinara uzado. La du altri esas teknikala.
