Korpo rotacas kande ol turnas cirkum axo qua trairas lu (ex. roto cirkum sua axo: to esas l’etimologiala origino di la verbo: L. rota, rotare). Korpo jiras, kande ol turnas cirkum axo o punto situita exter lu, plu o min fore (ex. veturo, navo jiras deskriptante arko di cirklo o di altra kurvo; II-644.

jirar.x: (intr.) to turn about, gyrate; (nav.) veer around, tack about, put about

jiravolto.x: (horsemanship) volt right and left, quick turning.

jokante.x: by way of a joke, in jest

jokar.x: (tr.. intr.) to joke, banter (ulu); to joke, jest (kun ulu, pri ulo)

jonglar.x: (intr.) to juggle (per): to play tricks by sleight of hand.

jorneskar.x: it begine to be light, day is coming

jorno.x: (opp. to night) day, daylight, daytime; (cf. dio)

joyar.x: (intr.) to be joyous, be delighted, be glad

joyigar.x: to cause (ulu) to rejoice, to fill with joy; (cf. gay-igar)

juar.x: (tr.) to enjoy: to have a satisfaction in, feel with pleasure, revel in

jubeo.x: jube: a gallery in a church containing the rood.

jubileo.x: (R. C. Church and Jewish) jubilee; 50th anniversary, golden wedding

judiciar.x: (tr., jur.) to judge judicially (ulu, ulo); (cf. judiko)

judikar.x: (tr., intr.) to judge: to conclude or determine by the exercise of judgment (not legal; cf. judiciar); to exteem, deem, think

julepo.x: (pharm.) julep: a sweet demulcent mixture, used as a vehicle.

jungar.x: (tr.) to put to, «inspan» (as horses to a carriage), to yoke up (oxen)

junkizar.x: to cover with rushes; to cane (chairs, etc.).

juntar.x: (tr., material sense) to join: place one thing in contiguity to another; (of hands) to clasp; (cf. unionar) -uro, -eyo: joint, junction

jurar.x: (tr., intr.) to swear: make solemn declaration, to give one’s oath

jurigar.x: to swear in (ulu), administer the oath to (ulu)

jurinto.x: person sworn (cf. juri-ano). Ex.: Jurar dicar la verajo. Jurar fideleso ad ulu. Jurar amikeso ad ulu.

juriskonsulto.x: jurisconsult: a man learned in law, esp. Civil law; a jurist; counsellor at law.

jurisprudenci.x: precedents. V. exp.: Ne en la senco; yuro- (lego-) cienco, ma en la senco; interpretado di la legi per la verdikti di la judiciisti, o generale: maiero aplikar la legi a la partikulara kazi; IV-200.

jurisprudenco.x: judicature: ordinary method which tribunals use in judging points of law

jus.x: (adv.) just: just now, this last minute, the moment just passed

jusa.x: of a moment ago. Ex.: Vu venas tro tarde, lu jus mortis. Me jus arivis.

justa.x: conforming to some proper standard (N.B. not legal sense; cf. yusta); right, correct, well grounded, exact, proper (of measure, time, balance, word, thought, etc.)

justifikar.x: to justify: prove or show to be right; to vindicate, warrant

justifikeble.x: justifiable, warrantable. Def.: Montrar ke ulu od ulo esas justa. (kp. yust-igar); II-673.

kakofonio.x: : cacophony. Def.: Desagreabla kunligo di soni, sive en parolo, sive en muziko; III

kalamitato.x: : calamity. Ex.: La famino, la milito esas kalamitati.

kalamito.x: : calamite: a gum-resin; a fossil plant. Def.: Speco de gumo (Styrax calamita); fosila planto.

kalamo.x: : (ant.) a reed pen used in the East.

kalandrar.x: : (tr.) to calender (paper, cloth); to mangle (household linen).

kalcinar.x: : (tr.) to calcine: to oxidize (as by heat); to roast (ores).

kaldiero.x: : boiler (steam generator); copper: large boiler for brewing, washing, etc. Def.: Klozita vazo (apartenanta generale a vapor-mashino), en qua on boliigas aquo e konservas la vaporo sub preso; III

kaldrono.x: : caldron: kettle for cooking. Def.: Apertita vazo uzata en koqueyo; III

kalemburisto.x: : punster. Def.: Speco di vortoludo, en qua vorto o serio de vorti prizentas du senci; III

kalenturo.x: : (med.) calenture: a tropical fever attributed to heat

kalesho.x: : calash, open barouche, open buggy. V. exp.: Kalesho, karoso: La du esas veturi kun quar roli e quar plasi, ma kalesho esas apertita, karoso esas klozita (kun plafono). Pluse, karoso esas generale suspendita per specala modo (per rimeni); II

kalico.x: : chalice, communion-cup; (bot.) calyx. Def.: Granda kupo, uzata precipue en religiala ceremonii; II

kalkaneo.x: : (anat.) calcaneum: the great bone of the heel.

kalkolo.x: : (med.) calculus: stone in bladder, kidneys, gall-ducts.

kalma.x: : (of objects, fig. or persons) calm, unagitated, quiet, still, placid; serene (of the elements, passions, etc.); unruffled, composed, sedate (in manner and deportment)

kalmaro.x: calamar, calamary, cuttlefish, squid, (genus: Loligo vulgaris). Def.: Genero di molusko cefalopoda kun dek brakii; V-420.

kalmesko.x: lull. V. exp.: Kalma signifikas tote pasiva e materiala stando di kozi, qua ne movas: aero, aquo, maro kalma (t.e. ne agitata da la vento). Tranquila havas senco samtempe material e mentala, ma prefere aktiva: qui ne agitas su, ne movas su sen utileso o skopo; on dicas ad infanto: restez tranquila! on parolas pri vicini tranquila (qui ne lacas bruiso). Quieta expresas stando mentala, qua plu klare definesas per lua kontreajo, desquieta; I-713.

kaloriko.x: (hist.) caloric. Def.: Historiala koncepto di la kaloro, kom material substanco.

kalorio.x: (thermal unit) calory. Def.: Unajo di kalor-quanto. On distingas la granda kalorio, qua korespondas ad un kilogramo de aquo, e la mikra kalorio, qua korespondas ad un gramo; V-420.

kaloto.x: callotte; (soldier's) rimless cap; (eccl.) skull-cap; (math.) segment of a sphere divided by a plane.

kalquar.x: (tr.) to counter-draw: to trace (a design through transparent paper)

kalumniar.x: (tr.) to calumniate; (cf. difamar, maldicensar, denigrar). Def.: Dicar mala neveraji pri ulu.

kalva.x: bald: having but little hair. V. exp.: Kalveso ne esas kompleta senhareso; III-201.

kalvario.x: Mount Calvary; a calvary: hill with a cross on top; (fig.) punishment, expiation.

kam.x: (adv.) than, as, to (in comparison, degree); (cf. tam)

kamalio.x: (ancient armor) camail: chain mail guard for neck; a hooded cloak or mantle (esp. worn by bishops).

kambiar.x: (tr.) to exchange (money, goods), to barter (ulo por ulo); -o, -eyo, -erio: money or goods exchange

kambrar.x: (tr.) to camber: make slightly convex (a piece of wood, a road, a ship's deck, etc.); to throw out one's chest.

kamioneto.x: small dray; two wheeled hand truck. Def.: Kargo-veturo konstitucita ek platformo sur qua on pozas la vari; IV

kamiono.x: dray, truck, lorry: long sideless four-wheeled, goods vehicle

kamputensili.x: c. utensils. V. exp.: vid. bivakar.

kanaligar.x: to canalize: make like a c.

kanalizar.x: to canalize: to provide with c.s (a field)

kandeagar.x: to go boating. Def.: Mikra batelo senlerdeka, movata per remili, segli, motori, e ordinare uzata en maral aqui.

kapabla.x: : able (to do, to execute), capable; (cf. kompetenta, apta, suffix -iv-); V. exp.: vid. habila. Ant.: ne-povanta, ne-potenta, ne-kapabla.

kapelino.x: : sun-bonnet: hood to shade head and neck from sun.

kapistro.x: : (surg.) head bandage for fracture of lower jaw.

kapoto.x: : overcoat: storm or heavy coat (as worn by soldiers: cf. gabano, surtuto) (nav.) hood: a cover for a companion hatch, engine, etc.; (engine) bonnet; (auto.) hood.

kapriolo.x: : capriole: a leap, caper (as in dancing), a leap that a horse makes with all fours without advancing.

kaptacar.x: (tr.) to inveigle: to obtain by underhand manoeuvers or bribery or ruse, to captivate (in an ill sense)

kaptar.x: : (tr.) to capture: catch hold of, gripe, snatch; (cf. sizar, prenar)

kapuco.x: (person's) hood, cowl; -izar: to hood, put cowl on.

karafo.x: carafe, decanter (for wine, water, etc. at table).

karaktero.x: (distinctive quality of a person or thing) character

karato.x: carat: part or weight of precious stones or gold.

karbonigar.x: to make into or change to coal

karbonizar.x: to cover with c.; (fig.) to besmut

kardamomachar.x: to fawn upon, cajole, wheedle. Ex.: Karezar infanto. La zefiro karezas la flori. Karezachar oldulo por igar il facar sua testamento.

kardamomajo.x: a fleshy object, a piece of meat

kardamomifar.x: -igar: (intr., tr.) to produce, to make flesh (on)

kardamomizar.x: to pave (a surface with tiles, bricks, etc.)

kardamomo.x: (bot.) cardamon (Eletaria cardamomum, an species of Amomum).

karnaciono.x: carnation: flesh-tint, complexion. Ex.: Ica koloro ne konvenas a mea karnaciono. La karnacioni en ica pikturo (protreto) esas tre natural.

karonado.x: (artil.) carronade. Def.: Speco di navala kanono (anciena); VI

karoso.x: coach: a large closed carriage; ornamental coach (for state occasions). V. exp.: vid. kalesho.

karpentar.x: (tr.) to work timber, do carpenter work. V. exp.: La karpentisto facas nur grosa laboruri ek ligno, generale por domi e konstrukturi. La menuzisto facas plu mikra laboruri, konseque plu preciza e delikata, exemple por mobli, parqueti, eskaleri, e.c. La ebenisto juste plakizas ebono(-plaki) sur mobli, tabli, e.c., ma per extenso on povas uzar ica vorto por plak-laboristo en altra ligno kam ebeno, en senco simila a menuzisto; IV

kartelo.x: cartel: letter of defiance or challenge, as to a duel.

karteziandiablo.x: (phys.) C. Devil or diver, bottle-imp; (cf. ludiono).

kartomanciisto.x: fortuneteller (by cards). Def.: Speco di divinado, predicado per ludkarti; V

kartuyo.x: c. case: intermixar la -i: to shuffle the c.s

kasacar.x: (tr.) to quash, annul, reverse, to declare null and void, to invalidate

kasisiero.x: b.c. bush or tree; -liquoro: b.c. cordial.

kasono.x: caisson: under-water cofferdam; cradle to lift ships from the water; (cf. municiono-furgono).

kasqueto.x: (for men or boys) cap with visor (as golf-cap, naval officer's cap, etc.).

kataklismo.x: cataclysm. Def.: Irga subverso di la teral surfaco per granda fenomeno: inundo, tertremo, erupto; IV

katalogizar.x: to c. V. exp.: vid. avizo.

katastrofo.x: catastrophy (cf. kalamitato, kataklismo). Ex. L'erupto di Vesuvius esis granda katastrofo.

katedro.x: desk (of a professor); pulpit (in a church)

katekizero.x: catechist. Def.: Docar la katekismo; instruktar ulu per questioni et respondi pri la precipua punti di (Kristana) religio.

katisar.x: (tr.) to give a gloss, a luster to (cloth, by hot or cold pressing).

katoptriko.x: (opt.) catoptrics; (cf. dioptriko). Def.: Teorio di la speguli (omnaspeca) ed optikal instrumenti kompozita ek speguli; IV

kaucionizar.x: to stand bail or go surety for (ulu); (cf. garantiar)

kaustika.x: caustic; (chem.) burning, corrosive; (fig.) biting, stinging, satirical (language, etc.)

kauzo.x: cause: that which produces an effect

kavalkbloko.x: h. block. Ex.: Kavalkar kavalo, asno. La sorcistini kavalkas bastoni. Sidar kavalke (E. astride) sur benko.

kavalstulo.x: pannier -leg-ilo, -reto: covering for a h.: -vend-isto: h. dealer.

kayero.x: blank-book: a few sheets of paper stiched together and covered with a wrapper.

kayo.x: quay; (R.R.) platform. Def.: Rivo masonita et vertikal (alonge rivero, lago et metafore la senco fervoyala), qua posibligas l'embarko o desembarko di personi, vari, o por charjar e descharjar navi; VI

kazako.x: cassock: a large sleeved coat formely worn by soldiers; (woman's) long jacket (for outdoor wear)

kazino.x: casino: assembly room for cardplaying, etc.

kazo.x: (o, questiono) di koncienco: a case of conscience

kazualo.x: a contingent thing (as, a prequisite, extra salary, etc.)

kazuistiko.x: casuistry: science or doctrine of right and wrong

ke.x: (conj.) that (where it unites a clause with the principal sentence; it is often united with prepositions to form subordinating conjunctions): pro ke: because

keglaro.x: a set of skittles or ninepins

kepio.x: : kepi: milit. cap worn by French soldiers.

kerlo.x: : fellow, chap, (N.B. this word carries no proper moral valuation and is not used as an insult; cf. II

kerno.x: : kernel, stone (of fruits); core (of statutes, etc.)

kesto.x: : packing-case, box, chest (of tea, soap, etc.); case (of wine, etc.); (cf. kofro, buxo)

kikar.x: : (intr.) to kick (out behind, of horses, and other animals); (cf. pedo-frapar)

kiragro.x: : chiragra. Def.: Goto en la manui.

kisegar.x: : to give a hearty kiss to.

klakar.x: : (intr.) to clap (per) (as with the hands), to clack, smack (as the lips, the tongue against the palate), to chatter (as teeth from cold)

klakigar.x: : to clap, to crack (the fingers, a whip, etc.)

klamar.x: (tr.) to shout, exclaim, vociferate, cry aloud (words)

klapo.x: any flat piece turning on a axis; as: flapvalve; leaf (of a folding door); flap (of a pocket or envelope or table)

klara.x: clear: free from all dims, blurs, obscures, obstructs; (fig.) plain, evident

klariono.x: clarion: military bugle; (cf. buglo, trumpeto). Def.: Speco di trumpeto kun sono akuta e penetranta, uzata da soldati e milit-navisti.

klaudikar.x: (intr.) to be lame, to hall, limp, hobble, (in walking)

klaudikigar.x: to cause (ulu) to limp, to make lame (in legs): -ar en la du pedi: to be lame, to limp with both feet.

klauzo.x: clause, stipulation, article (in a contract, will, etc.; N.B. not in sentence; cf. membro di frazo).

klavaro.x: keys (collect.), key-board. Def. La extramjo di levero quan on presas por produktar ula efekto (en piano, orgeno, telegrafilo, tiposkribilo, e.c.); VI

klemar.x: (tr.) to press closely together, squeeze, tighten, clench

klementa.x: clement, merciful, lenient. Def.: Indulgema e pardonema (anke teologiala senco); III593. Ant. severa, ne-pardon-ema.

klientizar.x: to get costumers for (a shop, etc)

kliento.x: client (of a lawyer); patient (of a physician); cutomer (of a tradesman)

kliktar.x: (intr.) to clank, click, clack, clash, clatter: to make a sudden, sharp noise by striking

klimar.x: (tr., intr.) to climb (up), clamber (over), mount, ascend (by hand or foot or tendrils). Ex.: Klimar (sur) arboro, monto. La planto klimas til la duesma etajo.

klinar.x: (tr., intr.) to overlap, to cover partially, to clinkerbuild. Def.: Superpozar la bordi di la folii di tolo o la planki qui kompozas la kareno di batelo, e.c.; IV

klishar.x: (tr.) to take a stereotype of something to be printed

klosharo.x: collections of b.s; chimes: -turmo: b. steeple, belfry

klosho.x: a bell; anything in the form of a b.: -eto: little b., hand b.

klostro.x: cloiter: coverered arcade, especially around a monastic building.

klozar.x: (tr.) to close, shut (up) (a door, a window, a room, a way, the eyes, a wound, etc.)

klozpunisar.x: to keep in (for punishment), to restrict liberty (mililt.).

knikar.x: (tr.) to bend a thing so as to occasion a flaw in it (yet no entirely to break it), to crack, flaw; (cf. krakar, flexar, fendar). Def.: Strenar korpo relative longa, ex. stango, per preso en la longesal directiono sur la du extremaji .

koagular.x: (tr., intr.) to coagulate, curdle, clot, curd.

koaktar.x: (tr.) to constrain, coerce, oblige, compel, force (N.B. this refers espacially to moral; social, intellectual compulsion, rather than physical force; cf. forco, forsar)

koaltaro.x: coal tar: tar made from coal.

koboldo.x: koblod: imp, hobglobin, familiar spirit or brownie, puck, sprite.

kofio.x: bonnet, cap, coil (such as worn only by country women).

koitar.x: (tr.) to perform the sexual act (cf. kopulac-ar).

kolacionar.x: (tr.) to collate: compare two writings; to assemble and verify the sheets of a book for binding.

kolareto.x: collarret (of cambric, lace, etc, for women and children).

kolda.x: (pr. and fig.) cold, frigid, cool: -eso: coldness

kolektar.x: (tr.) to collect (books, plants, etc.); to gather (of persons, objects, matter, into a mass)

koliar.x: (tr.) to gather, cull, pluck, pick off (fruits, flowers, etc.).

koliaro.x: necklace, neck-badge, collar (as on dogs or horses); (natural marking of birds, and other animals) collar

kolikar.x: (intr.) to have severe pain in the bowels

kolineto.x: hillock, knoll, ridge. Ex.: Roma esis konstruktata sur sep kolini.

koliziono.x: collision: mutual striking of two bodies

kolmo.x: highest part, top (of a building or any elevation); ridge (of a roof)

kolono.x: (anat.) colon; (arch., fig. in anat.) column, pillar; (of  troops) column

kolorito.x: color(ing), hue, shade: effect which results from the mixture or use of colors; (fig.) brilliancy of style

kolorizar.x: to color: -aro, izo, -iz-eso: iz-uro: coloring, coloration

kolportar.x: (tr.) to hawk about, peddle: carry about wares for sale.

kolubro.x: (genus) coluber: a common non-poisonous snake, ring or grass snake.

koluzionar.x: (intr., jur.) to collude: to conspire in a fraud

koluziono.x: collusion. Def.: (koluziono): Interkonsento sekreta por facar kune ula fraudo o nelegalajo; V

kom.x: as (being), being, to be, in the capacity, character, role, quality of

komandar.x: (tr. milit, nav, tech) to command (an army, a ship), to give word of command to (ulu)

komanditar.x: (tr.) to finance a commercial undertaking, to become a sleeping partner in: -ala societo: a (French) limited, joint-stock company (in which some of te partners take no active part)

komao.x: (mus.) comma: a minute interval or difference in pitch.

kombatar.x: (tr., intr.) to fight, combat, make war on: -ema: combative, pugnacious, quarrelsome

kombateskar.x: to start a fight: (milit.) to go into action

kombinar.x: (tr.) to combine: -o, uro: combination. Ex.: On povas kombinar la quar literi a, b, c, d, en duadek e quar manieri diferanta. Kombinuro di kolori, di soni.

komendar.x: (tr., com.) to order (goods, a dinner, etc.)

komentar.x: (tr.) to comment on (by speaking or by annotation)

komercar.x: (intr.) to trade, traffic, deal (pri ulo, kun ulu)

komico.x: comitia. Def.: Specala nomo di popul-asemblo (pricipue antiqua Romana).

komisar.x: (tr.) to commission: to charge, empower (ulu facar ulo), to appoint (ulu por ulo)

komisato.x: person commissioned: commissioner, representative; (cf. prokuraco): -it-aro: commission: body of commissioners, board. Ex.: Komisar ula komision-firmo komprar o vendar acioni por su, por ulu. Komisar komisitaro studiar temo. Ca oficiro ne ja recevis sua komiso. Komisar milit-navo. Komisitaro pri la budgeto. Facar la komisi: (E. to carry out the instructions; (fig.) do the errands).

komisiono.x: (com.) commission: order by which a person buys or sells goods for another: -isto, -ero: c; merchant, c. agent

komizo.x: clerk; writer, copyist in an office or counting-house; salesman in a store or shop .

komocionar.x: (tr., med. psychol.) to affect strongly, unnerve, unstring, cause to shake; la violentoza pafado -is la trupi: the hot fire unnerved the troops; san-eso konocion-ita: shattered health.

komoda.x: (of things) convenient, commodious: adapted to its use or purpose, suitable; affording convenience, conductive to comfort

komonano.x: an inhabitant, a member of the commune or parish.

komono.x: commune (in France); parish, township (the political division)

kompatar.x: (tr., intr.) to pity, have compassion, be compassionate, commiserate, have mercy on: (cf. simpatiar)

kompatinda.x: worthy of compassion, pitiable, miserable, piteous

kompensar.x: (tr.) to compensate: to be equivalent to, to counterbalance, to make amends for, to make up for; (com.) to offset.

kompetenta.x: competent (pri), capable, having (legal) power. Ex.: Kompetenta autoritato. Vu ne esas kompententa facar to. Kemiisto kompetenta.

komplemento.x: complement: that which it is necessary to add to make a thing complete; (trig.) the difference between an angle and 90°; (gram.) object, the added word to complete a predication

komplexa.x: complex: not simple, consisting of many parts; complicated intricate. Ex.: Temo, ideo komplexa. Komplexa nombro, questiono. Ant.: simpla.

komplexiono.x: (med.) complexion: constitution, natural disposition of body; (cf. konstituciono); (N.B. not color of skin).

komplezar.x: (intr.) to please, gratify, humor; to be complaisant, obliging (ad ulu)

kompliceso.x: complicity. V. exp.: Indikas la neegaleso (etikal e legala) la precipua kulpanto e di lua komplico o complici.III-264

komplikar.x: (tr.) to complicate: render complex, make intricate

komplimentar.x: (tr.) to compliment: to address with expressions of civility: (cf. gratular). Ex.: La generalo komplimentis la soldato pri lua kurajo. Il sendis la donacajo kun sua komplimenti.

komplotar.x: (tr.) to complot: to plot (ulo, kontre ulu). V. exp.: Komploto esas plu generala

kompozachar.x: : to scribble; Ex.: Omna parti qui kompozas ca mashino. La vorti esas kompozata da literi. Kompozar libro, diskurso, opero. Kompozita vizajo.

kompozar.x: : (tr.) to compose: to compound; to form (by uniting two or more things; N.B. not to set up in type; cf. kompostar); to constitute; to invent and set in order; to fashion, adjust

komprenar.x: : (tr.) to comprehend: to understand, apprehend by the senses; (cf. intelektar, konceptar, konocar, savar; kontenar, inkluzar)

kompresar.x: : (tr.) to compress: press or squeeze together.

kompromisar.x: : (tr.) to compromise: to imperil or injure (the reputation, credit, etc. of a person)

kompunciono.x: : compunction: reproach of conscience; contrition, remorse.

komuna.x: : common: pertaining to, connected with, or participated in by two or more persons or things; joint, general

komuniar.x: : (intr., rel.) to communicate: to receive the sacrament

komunikar.x: : (intr.) to communicate; have communication (by intercourse), be connected by passage; (tr.) to communicate; impart, transmit, acquaint with

komunikigar.x: : to put (uli) into communication; to make a connection between (buildings, etc.)

komuniono.x: : communion: religious fellowship; a denomination. Def.: Uniono en komuna kredo (religiala); III-605. Ex.: La protestanta komunioni.

komutar.x: : (tr., elec., math.) to commute, commutate (a current)

koncentrar.x: : (tr.) to concentrate: to draw or converge to or toward a common center (troops, rays of light, the mind, the affections, etc.); (chem.) to concentrate: free from extraneous matter; (cf. pludens-igar).

konceptar.x: (tr. physiol. and psychol.) to conceive (a child, an idea); (cf. gravid-eskar)

koncernaar.x: (tr.) to concern: relate or belong to (ulu, ulo)

koncernao.x: concern: affair: -ant-a, -e: concerning, relating to, regarding, (jur.) appertaining to (cf. aparten-ante)

koncesar.x: (tr.) to concede (a point in argument). Def.: Grantar ulo por obtenar konkordo; III-168.

koncesionar.x: (tr., intr.) to grant a (public) concession to, to enter into (public) contract (with)

konciliar.x: (tr.) to concilliate: bring to a state of friendship, gain, win by moral influence; to reconcile: make consistent or suitable; (cf. ri-konciliar)

konciliema.x: conciliatory, accommodating, compliant, easy to get along, tractable

koncio.x: consciousness: the knowlegde or perception of what passes in one's own mind.

kondanmar.x: (tr.) to condemn: to sentence, doom; to censure; to judge to be unfit for service. Ex.: Kondamnar ulu a morto. Kondamnar libro. Il kondamnis ca entraprezaji: (E. he has condemned (censured) these undertakings). Kondamnar navo, furnisaji. Ant. : absolvar.

kondensilo.x: condenser. Ex.: Koldeso kondensas la aquo-vaporo. Ant.: vapor-igar.

kondicionalo.x: (gram.) conditional, -e ke: on condition that, provinding that

kondicionar.x: (tr.) to stipulate, make conditions about; (cf. stipular)

kondimentizar.x: to season, flavor; (fig.) to give a relish to; (cf. saporar). V. exp.: Kondimento havas senco tre generala, plu larja kam spici, pikli, e.c. Omno quo servas por kondimentizar; III-264

kondolar.x: (tr.) to condole with (ulu): to express or feel sympathetic sorrow

kondominiar.x: to have c. Def.: Kunposedar e komune dominacar.

kondominio.x: condominium: joint dominion or sovereignty; (Rom. law) joint ownership

konduktar.x: (tr., phys.) to conduct, transmit, convey (by tubes, wires, etc.) gas, electricity, heat, etc.

konduktoro.x: (on trains, trams, omnibuses, etc.) (Europe) guard; (U.S.) conductor.

kondutar.x: (intr.) to conduct onself, behave, demean oneself

konektar.x: (tr.) to connect (ulo kun ulo). Def.: Juntar du organi qui servas por transmiso di energio, sive elektrala, sive mekanikal (la energio esas una); III-417.

konestablo.x: constable: a former title of commander-in-chief of French armies.

konfekto.x: confection, sugar-plum. Def.: Diversa-speca sukraji generale mola; V-722.

konferar.x: (intr.) to confer: discourse with any one on some subject; (cf. grantar).

konfervo.x: (bot.) conferva: any of the threadlike green algae that form in scum in ponds and ditches.

konfeseyo.x: confessional (cabinet): irar por -ar: to go to confession

konfesiono.x: (theol.) confession: a formulary of articles of a religious creed, profession of faith; creed

konfidar.x: (tr.) to confide: instrust, commit, to the care of; (cf. fidar, konfidencar). Def.: Livrar ula kozo (su, ulu, ulo) a la sorgo, a la fideleso, a la habileso o la kapableso di ulu, di ulo. Ex.: Me konfidas a vu la maxim kara e maxim precosa kozi quin me posedas.

konfidencajo.x: that which is confided: the information

konfidencar.x: (tr.) to tell in confidence (ulo, ad ulu)

konfirmar.x: (tr.) to confirm: assure by added proof, corroborate, verify; add firmness to, to strenghten; (jur.) to ratify, sanction; (rel.) to receive into the church by confirmation

konfliktar.x: (intr.) to (be in) conflict (kun). Ex.: Nia interesti konfliktas. Konflikto di armei.

konformigar.x: to (make) conform (ulo, su, ad ulo). Ex.: Kopiuro konforma a la originalo. Vua interesti konform-esas a nii. Konformeso a la volo di altru. Konform-igar su a la manieri di vua tempo.

konfrontar.x: (tr.) to confront. Ex.: Konfrontar la testo ad akuzato.

konfundar.x: (tr.) to confound: to make a muddle of serveral things in not distinguishing them properly (with kun); to confuse the indentity of something with something else (with ad). V. exp.: Kunfundar kun ..., kunfundar ad ..: Se ek plura kozi on facas pelmelo per mala o nesuficanta dsitingo mentala, qua mixas iti kun ici, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas kun. Ex. : «Nun il konfundas omno en sua odio, la kulpozi kun l'inoncenti, la boni kun la mali». Se la spirito transportas erore la qualesi od individueso di ulu od ulo ad altra, lore la prepoziciono uzenda esas ad. Ex.: «Vu konfundis manekino ad homo. - Ne konfundez lampiro a lanterno». En l'unesma kazo (kun) la konfundo esas reciproka; en la duesma, ol ne esas reciproka; VI-513-4; also Talmey's Test Book, p.90) Ant.: dicernar.

konfuza.x: (physical and mental) confused: jumbled together, indistinct. Ex.: Bruiso konfuza. Nepreciza e konfuza idei. La multa intrucioni konfizigas mea mento. La konfuzeso di la tempo. Ant. klara, preciza.

koniumar.x: to shape like (or, form into) an angle.

konivencar.x: (intr.) ton connive (kun): to feign ignorranc; (fam.) to wink at

konjedar.x: (tr.) to give leave or holiday to; to furlough. Def. : Donar tempala libreso: IV-67.

konjektar.x: (tr.) to conjecture: to surmise, presume, guess, suppose; (cf. divinar).

konjelar.x: (tr., intr.) to congeal; to freeze; (cf. koagular, glaci-igar, forst-igar). Def.: Transformar liquido a solido per la ago di koldeso. Ex.: Temperaturo di 130°K konjelas alkoholo. V. exp.: Frosto povas aplikesar nur a vetero, a la meteorologiala stando, di qua konjelo di l'aquo esas nur elemento o signo; III-330.

konjestiono.x: congestion. Def.: Akumulo morbala di sango en parto limitizita di la korpo.

konjugar.x: (tr., gram.) to conjugate: to inflect (a verb).

konkavigar.x: to make c., scoop or hollow out.

konkluzar.x: (tr.) to conclude: to bring to a conclusion, settle, to come to a decision about; (cf. inferar)

konkluze.x: in conclusion. Ex.: Konkluzar kontrato, pakto, mariajo, diskurso. La konkluzo di la kontrato prizentis poka desfacilaji. Konlkuziva pruvo. Konkluze me volas dicar.

konkordar.x: (intr.) to agree, be in harmony, concord, concordance, (kun)

konkordatario.x: certified bankrupt. Def.: (Kormercala) Konkordo di faliinto kun sua kreditanti por pago di sua debi; II-76.

konkordigar.x: to bring into concord, to reconcile

konkupicenco.x: concupiscence. Def.: Inklineso juar la bonaji di la mondo, particulare la kozi sensual.

konkurencar.x: (tr.) to compete (in business, for personal profit); (cf. emul-esar)

konkursar.x: (intr.) to go into a competition, match (for prizes)

konkusionar.x: (intr., jur.) to peculate, practice extortion, graft. Def.: (konkusiono): Prevariko o pekuniala extorso facita da publika funcionero.

konocar.x: (tr.) to know: be aware of, be acquainted with; (through the senses)

konosmento.x: (com., nav.) bill lading. Def.: Dokumento signatata da kapitano o navestro, deklaranta la naturo e quanto di la vari transportata e la kondicioni di transporto; II-76.

konsakrar.x: (tr.) to dedicate, consecrate (a church, one's life, etc.); (cf. sakr-igar).

konsekracar.x: (tr., Cath. lit.) to consecrate: to convert the bread and wine into the proper substance of Christ.

konsentar.x: (intr.) to consent, give consent, accede, agree, acquiesce

konservar.x: (tr.) to conserve: keep in a safe and sound state; (of fruits, etc.) to preserve

konsiderar.x: (tr.) to consider; (cf. egardar, regardar, atencar, pensar, judikar, evaluar, reflektar, deliberar, meditar)

konsignario.x: consignee. Def.: Sendar vari por vendo segun posibleso; II-76.

konsilar.x: (tr.) to advise, offer counsel to (ulo ad ulu)

konsistar.x: (intr.) to consist: have as its foundation, essence, be composed, be made up of. Ex.: Feliceso konsistas en moderemeso e vertuo. Ca armeo konsistas ek infantrio ed ek kavalrio (kp. kompozar).

konskriptar.x: (tr.) to conscript: to enlist by compulsion

konsolacar.x: (tr.) to console: comfort (a person) in grief.

konsonancar.x: (intr.) to be agreeable or uniform in sound

konspirar.x: (intr.) to conspire: to hatch a treason against a government

konsputar.x: (tr.) to treat (publically) most contemptuously, scorn, spurn, flout (cf. mok-egar). V. exp.: To esas nek desestimar, nek abominar, ma expresar extere, per paroli, gesti, agi, la desestimo od abomino (etimologie: kovrar per sputaji); III-203.

konstante.x: constantly. Ex.: Job esis konstanta (E., steadfast) (od, ferma) en desfortuno. Konstanta en amikeso. (math.) Konstanta quanto (od, konstanto). Konstanta (od, sen-cesa) venti. Konstante bona. Konstanteso di valoro.

konstatar.x: (tr.) to establish, substantiate (for oneself by observation or experiment), to attest, state (after investigation, to other people). (Note: This word applies to serious even scientific observation and proof, rather than to the perceptions of everyday life). La mediko konstatis la prezenteso di…: the physician observed (verified, proved, established) the prescence of…

konstatebla.x: ascertainable, able to be verified or determined. Def.: Certeskar pri la vereso di ula fakto, generale per percepto, observo; VII-207. Vidar tote certe, explorar tale, ke la fakto esez por vu tote nedubebla. Mondo, XII, 226. Ex.: Fakto konstatita (E. established fact). Me verifikis la fakti per exameno di la konstati (E. statements) en la protokolo (od, me konstatis la fakti per exameno di la protokolo).

konsternar.x: (tr.) to dismay, to strike with, or throw into consternation

konstipar.x: (tr.) to constipate; render costive, bind (the intestines).

konstitucar.x: (tr.) to constitute: to form, compose, make a thing what it is, make up

konstriktar.x: (tr.) to constrict; to draw together, bind, cramp. Def.: (Konstrikto) La diminuto di ampleso di kavajo (stomako) o truo (ex. La natural aperturi di la korpo esas cirkondita da muskuli konstriktiva); II-645.

konstruktar.x: (tr.) to construct: to put the parts of anything together in their proper order, to build.

konsultar.x: (tr.) to consult (ulu, ulo, pri ulo); (cf. konferar, deliberar)

konsumar.x: (tr.) to consume, destroy, use up, wear out, expend. Ex.: La rusto konsumas la fero. La fairo konsumas la domo (kombustante ol). Maladeso konsumas la energio. On konsumas vino, karno, korbono, petrolo, papero, aquo, e energio en la vapor-mashini e mem la mashini ipsa, uzante li. kp. IV-397.

kontagiar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to communicate a contageous disease to (ulu)

kontagio.x: contagion, pestilence. Def.: Transmisar morbo per kontakto mediata od nemediata kun ulu; (fig.) transmisar etikala malajo per frequento, per imitado nevolata. Ex.: La kontagio di morbo, di vicio. Rido kontagiiva.

kontaktar.x: (intr.) to be in touch, have contact (kun)

kontakteskar.x: to come into c.; -igar: to place in c. (ulo, kun ulo)

kontaminar.x: (tr.) to contaminate, defile; (cf. polutar, koruptar, sordid-igar).

kontar.x: (tr.) to count, reckon (money, trees, people, hours, etc.); to take a census; (cf. kalkular, enumerar)

kontemplar.x: (tr.) to contemplate. Def.: Regardar longe, ma aktive, kun reflekto o fervoro por studiar o admirar l’objekto; V-35. Ex.: Kontemplar la belaji di naturo. Kontemplado di la boneso di Deo.

kontentigar.x: to content, satisfy. Ex.: Kontenta mieno. Havar kontenteso esas plu bona kam havar richaji. V. exp.: vid. saci-ar.

kontestar.x: (tr.) to contest, dispute, call into question. Ex. Kontestar la yuro di ulu. Kontestar debajo, heredajo. Il havas ne-kontestebla yuro facar to.

kontigua.x: contiguous, adjoining; meeting at the surface or border, touching

kontinenco.x: continence: forbearance of lawful pleasure, restraint of passion for sexual enjoyment.

kontingenta.x: (philos.) contingent: happening by chance, casual, accidental

kontinua.x: continuous: uninterrupted, unbroken, which goes on without intermittance or break; joined without intervening space

kontrabaso.x: contrabasso: the largest kind of bass-viol, violone, double-bass.

kontradanso.x: contradance, country dance, old fashioned quadrille.

kontraforto.x: (arch.) counterfort: a buttress, spur or pillar serving to support a wall.

kontraktar.x: (tr., phys., anat., gram.) to contract: to draw into a smaller compass, draw together or nearer; to shrink (together); (cf. konstriktar, astriktar, plu-kurt-igar). Def.: Diminuto di longeso, di larjeso o di volumino; II-645. Ex.: La maxim multa korpi kontraktesas da la frigoro; muskolo aganta kontraktesas.

kontrakturo.x: (med.) rigidity, stiffness of muscles. Def.: Rigideso duranta, ma nevolita, di muskolo. Ex.: Tetano efektigas grandega kontrakt-uro.

kontrastar.x: (intr.) to contrast: stand, be in contrast

kontrastigar.x: to (put in) contrast (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontrastigar to quon on facas a to quon on intencas facar. Kontrasto di ombro e di lumo.

kontrato.x: contract: agreement or covenant between two or more persons; bargain; (cf. paktar). Ex.: Kontratar facar ulo. Kontratar kun la stato facar ulo laboro. Donar vendo-kontrato (E. to give a deed of sale).

kontravencar.x: (tr., intr.) to contravene: transgress, infringe on (regulations, orders, the law, etc.). Ex.: Kontravencar la dekalogo. V. exp.: vid. krimino.

kontre.x: (prep.) against: in opposition to, with; in contradiction to, contrary to; in an opposite direction; opposite; (law term) versus

kontreagar.x: (tr.) to act contrary or in opposition to (ulu, ulo), to thwart

kontree.x: by way of compensation, as a set off, per contra; on the contrary, on the other hand

kontributar.x: (tr., intr.) to contribute (ulo, ad ulo). Ex.: Kontributar duimo di la sumo. Kontributajo a la suceso di la afero. To esos kontributiva a vua feliceso (E. that will be conducive to your happiness).

kontricar.x: (intr., rel.) to feel deep sorrow for sin; -o: contrition, remorse, repentance

kontrolar.x: (tr.) to control by checking, verification, entering into a counter-register or counter-roll

kontroversar.x: (tr.) to controvert, dispute, discuss. Def.: (kontroverso) Debato pri questiono, opiniono, e.c., precipue pri temi religiala, filozofiala.

kontumaca.x: (jur.) contumacious: disobedient to a lawful summons; non-appearing; defaulting

konturo.x: contour, outline: the line that bounds a figure

kontuzar.x: (tr., med.) to contuse, bruise (by blow or fall).

konvektar.x: (tr., phys.) to transfer (heat, electricity) by means of currents in liquids or gases

konvekto.x: convection. Def.: Modo di transporto di la koloro, dil elektro; III-139.

konvenar.x: (intr.) to suit: be suitable, be fitting, be congruous, be proper, fit in, match; (cf. decar); (impers.) to be expedient, be advisable, be convenient

konvencionala.x: conventional: stipulated; tacitly understood, arising out of custom

konvencionar.x: (intr.) to make an agreement, come to a (written) understanding

konveno.x: fitness, suitableness, pertinence; (pl.) good manners, decorum, proprieties

konvento.x: convention, assembly; conventicle: assembly, usually secret, as of freemasons

konvergar.x: (intr.) to converge: tend to a point. Ant.: divergar.

konvoyar.x: (tr.) to convoy: transport, convey troops, munitions, etc. (usually under armed escort)

konvulsar.x: (intr.) to have a violent and involuntary contraction of the muscles

kooperar.x: (intr.) to cooperate ( in a co-operative institution); (cf. kunlaborar, kontributar (ad)

kooptar.x: (tr.) to co-opt: to choose or elect a fellow member. Def.: Adjuntar a su membro per interna elekto. Ex.: La elektita komisitaro havis la yuro di koopto, e kooptis Sro. X. pro la specala autoritato; IV-105.

koordiniti.x: (geom.) coordinates. Def.: Kombinar en la ordino asignita da la formo o la naturo id l’elementi. Ex.: Koordinodi la muskuli.

kopiar.x: (tr.) to copy: write, print, engrave, or paint, alter an original; (cf. imitar)

kopulacar.x: (intr.) to copulate: unite in sexual intercourse (kun)

koquar.x: (tr.) to cook (food) by baking, boiling, broiling, roasting, etc.; (cf. bakar, stufar, boli-igar, grilar, rostar)

kordio.x: (anat., fig. of affections and cards) heart

kordo.x: line, cord, rope; (geom.) chord; (of an arch.) span, chord

kordono.x: a short cord or ribbon; as: klosh-(et)- -o: bell-cord, -pull

korekta.x: correct: conforming to the rules or the conventional standard, accurate, exact, right, faultless

korespondar.x: (intr.) to correspond: to hold communication by letters, (kun ulu); to answer in character, function, etc., be adequate (ad ulo); (cf. konform-esar, konkordar).

korifeo.x: (antiq.) coryphæus (ballet) coryphee; (fig.) one distinguished in his profession or in a society.

koriono.x: chorion, the outside membrane of the foetus.

korkizar.x: to cork (a bottle), to lay c. on (a floor, etc.)

korno.x: horn (of animals, as material or as used in wind instrument)

korpo.x: body: total organised substance of a person, animal or plant; the principal part of anything; (milit.) corps

korpulenta.x: corpulent, stout (cf. obeza, repleta). Def.: Ta qua havas la tota korpo (anke la membri) grosa, dika; lu esas muskuloza, do generale forta e sana; VI-601.

korso.x: public-drive, -walk. Def.: Speco di promeneyo en urbo; III-203.

korto.x: (of justice, of sovereign) court: (of a house) court(-yard)

koruptar.x: (tr., phys., moral) to corrupt: taint, spoil; deprave, demoralize. Ex.: La kaloro balde koruptas karno en la somero. Koruptar linguo, texto, judiciisto, la mori di ulu.

korvear.x: (intr.) to do corvee; to do compulsory (or, statute-) labo(u)r (on highways, etc.); (milit.) to do fatigue duty.

kreditar.x: (tr., com.) to credit: to enter upon the credit side of an account; to give trust or credit to (ulu) (cf. kredar)

kredito.x: credit: reputation for solvency; delay in payment (cf. estimo)

kremo.x: cream; (fig.) the best part of anything

kremono.x: window-fastening (vertical, as in car windows). Def.: Stango qua restas vertikala, e qua, sive rotacante cirkum sua axo, sive per shovo-movo (komandata per maneto) engajas su (o sua hoki) en trui supre ed infre en la fenestro; IV-448; (kp. spanyoleto).

krepisar.x: (tr.) to rough-cast, rough-coat, parget, give a coat of plaster to (a wall).

krepitar.x: (intr.) to crepitate; to make a crackling sound (also surg. of noise of fractured bones).

kreskante.x: (mus.) crescendo. Ex.: Herbi, hari, homi kreskas. La pluvo kreskigas la frumento.

kreskar.x: (intr.) to grow (esp. of living things; cf. augmentar, plu-grand-igar, divenar)

krestomatio.x: chrestomathy: select passages to be used in learning a language.

krevar.x: (tr., intr.) to burst, break suddenly, fly open. Ex.: Se vu tro plenigus la sako, ol krevos. La abceso krevis. Krevar pro rido.

krevisar.x: (tr., intr.) to crack, chap, chink (surface only, as in china, hands). V. exp.: Expresas surfacala fendeto, qua eventas ex. en la sulo, en la muri, en la glacio, en la pelo, e.c. To esas altro kam fendeto: nam ex. vazo krevisita nule esas fendita; III-203.

kriachar.x: to bawl (cf. plor-achar). V. exp.: vid. klamar.

kriar.x: (intr.) to scream, cry out: make inarticulate noise (men and animals)

kriblo.x: screen: a coarse sieve for separating stones from earth, dust from coals, etc.; (cf. sivo)

kriminanto.x: criminal, malefactor, -al-igar: to make a criminal out of (ulu)

krimino.x: crime (such as treason, murder, arson, etc.)

kripligar.x: to cripple, maim. Def.: Qua perdis membro, o lua uzebleso per deformo; V-157. V. exp.: On povas esar infirma sen esar kripla: multa oldi esas infirma (blinda, surda, nekapabla marchar, e.c.) nam li ankore konservas omna sua membri e korpala integreso, sen esar kripla. Ed on povas esar kripla sen esar infirma (ex. ulu a qua mankas nur un fingro o falango esas kripla, ma ne remarkeble infirma: segun la legala termino, lua labor-kapableso ne diminutesis); V-95.

kriticismo.x: critical philosophy: the metaphysical system of Kant.

kritikachar.x: to make unjust criticism of, to carp at.

kritikar.x: (tr.) to criticise (ulu, ulo); to examine and judge critically; (cf. blamar)

krizo.x: crisis, decisive moment, critical time, turning point

krizokalko.x: pinch-beck: an alloy of copper and zinc resembling gold.

kroasar.x: (intr.) (of crows) to caw; (of frogs) to croak.

krokar.x: (tr.) to craunch, crunch (with the teeth and fig.). Def.: Mastikar ulo harda qua ruptesas bruise; IV-137.

kronizo.x: crowning, coronation; (fig.) crowning (as of a career)

kronometrio.x: chronometry: the art of measuring time.

kroso.x: (gen.) any long object with a hook-like end; (of bishop) crozier, pastoral staff; (in hockey) hockey-bat; (of a pistol or musket) butt-end. Def.: Senco generala: kurvigita extremajo; VI-116.

kruchedo.x: pitcherful. Def.: Tera o porcelana vazo kun larja ventro e streta kolo, kun anso e kun varsilo.

kruda.x: crude: not changed from its natural state; (of foods) uncooked; unwrought; (fig.) lacking finish, polish

krugo.x: (wooden or metal) mug, pot (as used for carrying or measuring liquids).

krular.x: (intr.) to fall in, collapse, tumble down (in pieces with noise); (fig.) to sink in ruin

krumo.x: soft part of bread; (cf. pano-pec-eto). Def.: Parto interna e mola di pano; VI-140.

krumplar.x: (tr.) to rumple, crumple, (rough) crease. Ex.: Krumplar robo, papero.

krusto.x: crust (of bread, of earth, etc.); (of a sore) scab

kuafisto.x: hair-dresser, coiffeur. Def.: Aranjar la hararo di ulu.

kudapogar.x: to lean on the e., -apog-ilo: e. rest

kudpulsar.x: od, shokar, frapar per la kudi): to elbow, jostle (with elbows)

kukurbitaceo.x: cucurbitaceous plant (as cucumber, melon, squash, pumpkin, gourd).

kulbutar.x: (intr.) -igar: (tr.) to somersault, turn upside down; (nav.) to capsize

kuli.x: coolie, cooly: cheap laborer in the Orient.

kuliso.x: coulisse: (tech.) a groove in which something glides; (theat.) side scene, wing; (finan.) outside stock-exchange, or «curb market»

kulminar.x: (intr.) culminate: to reach its highest altitude or meridian; to reach the highest point, as of rank, number, size, glory, power, etc.

kulpar.x: (intr.) to commit a fault, to err

kulpo.x: fault, blunder: deviation from duty, propriety through human weakness; deviation from rule through indolence or ignorance; (cf. pekar)

kultivar.x: (tr.) to cultivate: till (land); raise, as plant or crop, by tillage; (of arts, letters, the mind, etc.) to improve and develop by study and training; (of friendship, acquaintance, etc.) to pay assiduous attention to, to foster

kultivebla.x: cultivable, arable. Ex.: Kultivar agro, viti, flori. Kultivar sua spirito, sua memoro, mem sua korpo (on parolas pri korpala kultivado). Instruktisto, edukisto, anke kultivas la spirito di sua dicipuli, lia atenciveso, lia kurajo, ed altra fakultati e vertui. Individui o populi povas kultivar ca or ta cienco, arto, mestiero; ed on povas anke dicar, pri individuo o populo, ke ol esas plu o min «kultivita»; (IV-349-350). Vu devas kultivar amikeso kun ta bona homulo.

kulturoza.x: cultured. Def.: Etikala, intelektala e sociala parto di civilizeso (kontraste a progreso en la cienci, l’arti: la civilizo). Ex.: On povus dicar, ke Rusia esis kulturlando, pro ke tanta rusa autori, muzikisti, e.c. pruvis la alta stando di la maxim progresinta Rusi, ma ke Rusia esis apene civilizita, quale aparas per la sistemo di guverno e per la nesavo di la amasi; III-561.

kumis.x: kumiss, koumiss: a fermented (or distilled) liquor made from milk.

kumular.x: (tr.) to hold a plurality of (offices). V. exp: Kumular havas specala, quaze teknikal senco: to esas akumular sur su (akaparar) plura ofici, funcioni . . . e salarii; II-645.

kun.x: (prep.) with, in company with, in connection with

kune.x: together (with); both; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 108). Ex.: La matro arivis kun la filiino. Lu drinkas teo kun lakto. Me kompris ca domo kun la gardeno. La matro e la filiino arivas kune. La infanti dormas kune en la lito. El esas kune (E. both) bela e bona. Ant.: sen.

kunjunturo.x: concurrence, combination of events and circumstantces, conjuncture. Ex.: Me nultempe trovis plus desfortunoca konjunturo.

kupelo.x: (chem., tech.) cupel: a small dish made of bone earth used in assaying.

kuperosika.x: blotched and pimpled. Def.: Specala dermatoso di la nazala regiono; V-675.

kuplar.x: (tr., mechan.) to couple, link together. V. exp.: Kuplar implikas fixa, konstanta ligo di la peci, exemple per skrubi, per kelo, per stango artikizita, e.c. tale ke li nultempe povas movar nedependante (tam longe kam on ne desmuntas la mashino). Ex.: on parolas pri lokomotivi kun 2 o 3 axi «kuplita»; e l’organo di la kuplo esas «kuplo-stango»; III-88.

kupleto.x: couplet, stave, stanza (in song). Def.: Strofo di kansono; III-605.

kupo.x: (wine-)glass, vase (as for prize). Def.: Vazo antiqua e ceremoniala, kun pedo, e plura larja kam profunda (on drinkas ex. champano en kupi); II-645.

kuprizar.x: to cover with c.; (fig) to copper-plate

kuracisto.x: healer (whether by medicine or not; cf. mediko).

kurar.x: (intr.) to run, to race; (cf. fluar, vehar)

kurasizar.x: to put armo(u)r-plate on; to put a breast-plate on

kurato.x: (jur.) guardianship over an orphan, minor, etc.); trusteeship (of a property)

kurbaturar.x: (intr.) to over-fatigue, become stiff all over, be knocked up; (vet.) to founder. Def.: Indikas la specala doloro quan on sentas en la muskuli pro granda fatigeso; III-266.

kurbetar.x: (intr., of horses) to curvet; (cf. kabrar). Def.: (kurbeto) Galopo per kurta salti en qua la kavalo levas la avana pedi e preske samtempe kontraktas la dopa gambi; VI-76.

kure.x: od, per kuro): by the run

kureajo.x: quarry; the part of the beast given to the hounds (to encourage them). Def.: Precipitar su amase sur ulo por arachar, raptar sua parto interlukante e disputante, de qua derivos «kureo» kom ago di la chashundi, o, metafore, di homi os altra animali; VI-162-3.

kurear.x: (tr., hunt. and fig.) to set (on): to precipitate in a mass on something (as dogs on a quarry); to grab one’s part while quarreling or fighting

kurioza.x: (of persons) inquisitive, curious; (cf. vid-inda, stranja, rara, remark-inda)

kurso.x: course (of lessons, of lectures, of study, etc.); (fin.) rate (of exchange), current price, market price, ruling price

kursoro.x: (instr.) cursor; (tech.) slide-weight (on scale). Def.: Indikas irga peco shovebla segun lineo, e quan on povas fixigar en ula punti (ex. Sur vekto di balanco); IV-579.

kurtajar.x: (intr.) to carry on the business of a broker

kurte.x: in short, briefly. Ex.: Kurta homo, kolo, tempo, vivo, parolado. Ant.: longa.

kurteno.x: curtain (as of a window, a bed); (fig.) screen (as of trees); (fort.) rideau.

kurtezar.x: (tr.) to pay court to (a king, etc.), to woo (a woman)

kuseneto.x: pad. Def.: Stofo mola quan on pozas sur lito, divano, irga sidilo; II-647.

kushar.x: (tr.) to put (ulu) to bed; (su) to go to bed; to lie (su) down on (the ground, etc., to sleep); (cf. jacar, sternar).

kustar.x: (tr.) to cost, to be bought for (nulo, cher-ege, e.c.)

kustumar.x: (intr.) to be accustomed to, to be in the habit of, to be wont to (followed by infinitive)

kutio.x: (fabric) ticking (as for a bed), drilling, duck (as for tents, trousers).

kutro.x: (nav.) cutter: small armed vessel with one mast.

la.x: (def. article) the; (cf. le). When the following word begins with a vowel, the «a» may be omitted; as: l’infanto. (mus.) la: sixth note diatonic scale.

laborar.x: (intr.) to work, labo(u)r (pri ulo); (tr.) to work (the earth, iron, wood, etc.)

laboreso.x: workmanship, manner in which work is executed

lacerar.x: (tr.) to lacerate, tear, rend, to fray out (by rubbing).

laciva.x: lascivious, libidinous, lewd, lustful, wanton, lecherous.

laco.x: lace: a plaited string to fasten something through eyelet holes; shoelace, etc

lakrimifar.x: (intr.), -igar: (tr.) to produce tears, to cause to shed tears

laktifar.x: to secrete or yield m.; (cf. melkar): -ifo: lactation

lakuno.x: lacuna, blank space, gap. Def.: Mi-teknikala vorto uzata en diversa faki: indikas generale manko o vakuajo en loko, qua devus esar normale plena (lakuno di texto; lakuno un ula organal texuri); III-204.

lamentinda.x: lamentable: worth lamenting. V. exp.: Lamento esas expreso vocala di doloro, ne nur per paroli, ma per krii, jemi, sospiri

laminar.x: (tr.) to laminate: to flatten out, roll flat

lamo.x: thin plate, sheet (-metal); blade (of sword, knife, etc.)

lampiono.x: cup or small pot filled with tallow or oil with a wick, for illumination.

langorar.x: (intr.) to languish, pine away, droop (from hunger, love, etc.); to be languid. Def.: Deperisar pokope pro maladeso od afekto qua deprenas la vigoro. Esar komplete senenergia. Ex.: To esas morbo en qua on langoras longatempe ante mortar. Langorar en karcero. La ardoroza suno langorigas la flori. Depos la milito esas granda langoro en komerco. Langor-anta, -oza, -ema spirito.

langusto.x: spring (or spiny) lobster, sea crayfish (Palinurus vulgaris); (cf. homardo).

lansar.x: (tr., pr. and fig.) to fling, hurl, throw out or forward, cast, lance, dart (stones, darts,etc.) to shoot (an arrow); throw, cast (a look); throw in (an epigram, a word); to send forth (a book, a pamphlet); to cast (a beam of light); to launch (a ship); (cf. jetar, spricar, impulsar, iniciar).

lanugo.x: fine soft hair or hairlike growth; down (of birds); (anat.) lanugo; (of fruit) wool; (of cloth) soft nap (cf. pilo).

lapar.x: (tr.) to lap (up): take into the mouth with the tongue; (cf. lekar).

larja.x: broad, wide; (N.B. not «large»; cf. grosa, granda)

lasar.x: (tr.) to let, give leave, permit, allow: not to hinder to have, to do; to let alone; (pos) to leave behind

laste.x: lastly (of time) lately (cf. recente). Ex.: La lasta horo di la dio. Lasta yaro. La lasta domo en la strado. Laste naskinta. En lasta instanco. Laste, me parolis pri.

latenta.x: latent. Def.: Qua ne aparas extere; II-20. Ex.: Defekto latenta (en mashino, en animalo). Latenta kaloro.

lavar.x: (tr.) to wash, wash off or up, lave; (of clothes) to launder: (fig.) cleanse (cf. net-igar, skurar)

laxa.x: loose, slack, lax, not tense, not tight, not close; (med.) flaccid; (cf. mola)

lazarone.x: lazzaroni: the poor class in Naples.

le.x: (pl. of def. article la) the: only to be used when there is no other sign of plural, e.g. «the ayes and the nayes»: le yes e le no.

legacario.x: legatee. V.exp.: Legacar diferas de testamentar, per ke ol koncernas specale la kozi, havaji donata per testamento, e konseque havas sempre ta kozi kom rekta komplemento. On povas testamentar sen legacar ulo; III-160.

legitima.x: legitimate; having the sanction of law, custom or logic; (of a child) born in wedlock; (of a king) hereditary

legitimigar.x: to legitimize; (cf. yur-izar: yust-igar, justifikar). Ex.: Legitima infanto, autoritato, pretendo, plendo.

lego.x: (natural, moral, social, parl., legislative) law (cf. yuro)

lejerigar.x: to lighten (cf. alejar). Ant.: grava, opres-anta, pez-oza, facila.

lejero.x: light (in weight, force); (fig.) not burdensome or severe (of food, clothing, work, punishment, etc.)

lemo.x: (log., math.) lemma; loam (as used for founding).

lenta.x: slow: not acting, moving promptly, sluggish, lagging; (cf. tarda)

lernar.x: (tr.) to learn (ulo); (cf. instruktar, docar, studiar, saveskar)

lesivajo.x: linen or object to be washed, the laundry.

lesivar.x: (tr.) to wash (clothes, etc. in lye); (chem.) lixiviate

levponto.x: lifting-bridge. Ex.: Levar la pedo, la manuo, la ankro. V.exp.: vid. elevar.

lexiko.x: lexicon, dictionary (esp. of Greek, Latin, Hebrew); (cf. vort-aro, vorto-libro).

lezar.x: (tr., physiol., jur.) to injure, hurt, wrong

liano.x: (bot.) liana, bind-weed, creeper; any woody, climbing and twining plant.

libelo.x: libella: an instrument which measures levels: (water-) level.

liberala.x: (of books, arts, education, principles, political parties, etc.) liberal

libertina.x: (esp. of the imagination, mind) unrestrained, wayward, flighty (to an excessive degree)

libertineso.x: libertinism (obs. sense), -esar: to be free from restraint, to go to excess.

libraco.x: (astron.) libration: an apparent oscillatory motion (as of moon).

licencar.x: (tr.) to grant a license, give (official) permission (to sell spirits, to teach, etc.)

licenco.x: license, licensing; (poetic) license; deviation from strict fact, form or rule (by artist or writer); licentiate: a European university degree between that of bachelor and doctor; M.A. degree (= L licentia docendi ), -iero: (univ.) licentiate, an M.A.

lico.x: (ancient) lists; (modern) track, race course. Def.: Voyo preparita specala (ed enklozita) per konkursala kuri (sive di kavali, sive di homi, sive bicikli, automobili, e.c.); IV-454. V. exp.: vid. areno.

ligilo.x: lash, band, strap (for tying); (fig.) bond (as of matrimony)

likar.x: (tr., intr.) to leak. Def.: (1) (aquo) enirar navo; (2) (liquido o gaso) ekirar vazo, e.c.; (3) (navo) enlasar aquo tra truo, fenduro; (4) (vazo) eklasar liquido o gaso; II-76.

likenino.x: lichenin: a starch derived from Icelandic moss.

limbo.x: (tech.) limb; an edge or border, as of a disk.

limitizar.x: to set bounds to, to bound (a field, a country; cf. restriktar)

lincokulo.x: (lit., and fig.) eye of a lynx, lynx-eye.

lineala.x: lineal: relating to lines; in a direct line (as line succession; cf. lineara)

linee.x: in line, in a straight line

lineo.x: (telegraphic, R.R., genealogical, military, writing, printing) line; (cf. streko)

linguala.x: linguistic: relating to a language (cf. linguistik-ala)

linjo.x: (lit. and fig.) linen: a piece of washable wearing apparel or household goods, made from flax , muslin, cotton

lintelo.x: (carp.) lintel: head-piece of a door-frame or window-frame.

liquidacar.x: (tr., com.) to liquidate, settle, wind up (property, debts, businesses).

liquidigar.x: to liquefy. V. exp.: Liquidaji referas kozi qui havas, mem instantale, la qualeso liquideskar; ex.: (liquida) metalo. Fluido nultempe asumas formo solid; aero esas fluido; (kp. fluido).

listo.x: list (of persons, of things); (parl., milit.) roll

literala.x: relating to letters; literal: following the letter of exact meaning, not figurative; (cf. vort-opa)

literaturo.x: literature: the collective body of literary productions, belles-lettres

literaturozi.x: the literati, literary people. Def.: La artiste skribita verki, la «bela literaturo»; II-87. V. exp.: Literaturo ne esas sinonima di verk-aro qua indikas omnaspeca verki; II-87.

litiero.x: litter: straw, hay, etc. used for bedding of animals.

lito.x: bed ((for sleeping, also fig. as bed of river), -ala kozi: bedding

litoro.x: littoral: coastal region, seaboard. Def.: La tota regiono plu o min larja, kontigua a la rivo; IV-426, 606; cf. plajo. Exp.: Litorala voyo o fervoyo ne sequas ne sequas sempre la rivo.

livar.x: (tr.) to leave or depart; to leave behind; to quit (a place or position). V.exp.: vid. abandonar.

livida.x: livid: black and blue, leaden-colo(u)red. V.exp.: Pal-ega tote ne esas exakta: livida esas plu juste plombo-kolora; III-20.

livristo.x: delivery-man. V. exp.: La furnisanto ne livras la vari, nam il havas nula livristo; II-79.

lizo.x: lees, dregs; grounds (of wine, beer); (fig.) dregs of the people.

lo.x: it (referring to the contents of a previous sentence, i.e. a fact, rather than a definite object; cf. ol)

locionar.x: (tr., med.) to wash with a lotion (ulu, ulo)

lojar.x: (intr.) to lodge, live, dwell for a limited time (che ulu, ulo)

lojbilieto.x: billet (for troops). V. exp.: vid. habitar.

lojeskar.x: to take one’s abode, settle oneself; (fig.) to lodge itself, fix itself

lojio.x: (theat.) box, loge; (actor’s) dressing-room; (house-porter’s) lodge; (masonic, etc.) lodge; (arch.) loggia.

lokacajo.x: what is hired, leased (house, vehicle, etc.)

lokacar.x: (tr.) to hire, rent, lease (ulo, de ulu); (cf. lugar)

lokomocar.x: (intr.) to move from place to place. Ex.: Lokomoco divenis plu rapida depos la kreo di fervoyo. Muskuli lokomocala.

longe.x: (for) a long time, a great while

lor.x: (prep.) at the time of (a definite event), at the same time as

lore.x: then, at that time, by then

lornagar.x: (tr.) to look through a spy-glass at (ulu, ulo).

lorno.x: (small) telescope, spy-glass; a single-barrelled field glass

lotigar.x: to divide into lots, to portion off: (cf. porcion-igar: parcel-igar)

lotizar.x: to put a share, a lot into something

loto.x: lot: portion, share; (things for sale) lot

lotriar.x: (tr.) to cast lots for (ulo); to raffle for; to draw (lots, in a lottery)

loyala.x: loyal: faithful in any relation implying trust or confidence; straight-forward, fair-dealing; bearing true allegiance. Ex.: Loyala a la rejo, a sua patrio, a sua promiso, en amikeso. Ant.: ne-sincera; hipokrita.

lua.x: his her(s), its; (when desirable to indicate gender, the forms: ilua, olua, elua are used ); V. exp.: su, lu: il lavas su (E. he washes himself)

lubrifikar.x: (tr.) to lubricate: to oil; grease (part of a machinme)

lucida.x: (of mind) lucid, clear, sane. Ex.: Homo di lucida mento. Instanti lucida.

ludar.x: (intr. of games, sports) to play (per); (cf. plear)

ludiono.x: «ludion»; (toy) Cartesian devil, bottle-imp. Def.: Aparato fizikala uzata por studiar la diferanta efiki sur korpo plunjita en l’aquo, anke uzebla kom ludilo.

lugar.x: (tr.) to let (out), rent (out); hire (out), lease (out) (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. lokocar)

luktar.x: (intr.) to wrestle: contend by grappling (kun) and striving to throw; to scuffle, tussle; (fig.) to strive, struggle (kontre).

lular.x: (tr.) to lull (ulu) to sleep, to soothe, compose, quiet

lumar.x: (intr. also fig.) to shine: emit rays of light, give light; (cf. brilar)

lumizar.x: to light (a room, etc.) throw light upon; (fig.) to elucidate (a subject)

lun.x: (abbr. accus. form of  ilun, elun, olun, without gender).

lupio.x: (med.) wen. Def.: Speco di tumoro sub la pelo; V-675

lupo.x: (simple) magnifying glass, reading glass, pocket lens. Def.: Optikal aparato, qua servas por «grandigar» l’objekti (ye mikra raporto), e qua esas nek sempre simpla lenso, nek mikroskopo. On nomizas ol anke «mikroskopo simpla»; V-675.

lurar.x: (tr.) to lure, allure, entice; (fig.) wheedle, cajole (cf. seduktar)

lustracar.x: (tr., antiq.) to lustrate: make clear or pure by propitiatory offering.

lustro.x: chandelier (cf. kandel-iero); (antiq.) lustrum: space of five years.

luxacar.x: (tr., surg.) to luxate, dislocate, put out of joint (cf. dislokar).

luxaji.x: luxuries, fancy goods, articles de luxe, -ala: sumptuary: relating to luxury

macedonio.x: macedoine: a dish consisting of a medley of fruit and vegetables; (fig.) medley, hodgepodge.

macerar.x: (tr., intr.) to macerate: soften by steeping.

macfarlane.x: macfarlane: a kind of overcoat without sleeves and with a mantle.

madono.x: madonna: a picture or statue of the Virgin Mary.

madrigalo.x: madrigal: a part song or glee; a little amorous poem.

magnato.x: magnate: a nobleman of Poland or Hungary.

magra.x: lean, meager, lank, spare; (of things) poor, sorry, scant, meager

majesto.x: majesty, supreme grandeur, august dignity, stateliness; (cf. Sinioro, la rejo, e.c.)

majorato.x: majorat; (in France) landed property attached to a title and descending with it; entailed estate.

majoritato.x: majority: more than half of a given number or group; (cf. plu-mult-o).

makadamizar.x: to macadamize: cover a road with small broken stones.

makako.x: (zool.) macaque: a genus (Macaca) of short-tailed monkeys.

makaroniko.x: macaronic. Def.: Dicesas pri verki kompozita en Latino barbara e burleska; IV-394.

mala.x: bad, evil, ill (quality, acts, writing, condition, weather, news, sense, etc.)

malajo.x: (gen. sense) bad object, act, event; hardship, misfortune; mischief

maldicensar.x: (intr., tr.) to speak ill (pri ulo), to disparage, decry (ulu, ulo); (cf. denigrar, difamar, kalumniar). Def.: Dicar malajo pri ulu, ulo, pro mala intenco. V. exp.: La civila lego punisas la difamo, na la maldicenso; ica resortisas nur a la etikal lego.

malear.x: (tr.) to cold-forge. Def.: Form-izar per martelo (en kolda stando). V. exp.: Forjar esas la sama ago, en varma stando. Martel-agar esas nejusta o nesuficanta, nam on povas martel-agar irga kozo, sen malear ol; la kozo povas rezistar, o ruptesar, o deformesar altramaniere; V-493.

maledikar.x: (tr.) to curse, imprecate, damn (ulu, ulo); (cf. blasfemar, imprekar)

malgre.x: (prep.) in spite of, despite, notwithstanding, against the will of

malgreke.x: (conj.) notwithstanding that (followed by verb; cf. tamen)

malicajo.x: malicious or mischievous act. N.B. The sense of this word is by no means always «malice». It is something between evil intention and keen wit with a tinge of each in it, sometimes having more of the one, sometimes more of the other.

maligno.x: malicious, pernicious, evil, ill-disposed, malign, baleful. (N.B. Maligna is used in a somewhat less strong sense than the E. «malignant»; and properly means: disposed to take pleasure in the misfortune or suffering of others

malio.x: a mallet or mall used in play

malyoto.x: bathing-tights, -dress; (tights as for acrobats, cf. kalz-ego).

mancho.x: (long) handle, hilt, haft; neck (of musical instr.)

mandibulo.x: mandible; (zool.) either the upper or lower, part of the beak of a bird; (anat.) lower jaw; (cf. maxilo)

mandoro.x: (mus.) mandore: a kind of stringed lute.

mandrelo.x: (tech.) mandril, mandrel. Def.: Utensilo por kurvigar plaki, dilatar tubi, e.c.; IV-336.

manekino.x: manikin, lay figure, dummy. Def.: Figuro imitanta la formo di homo o di animalo; ofte artikizita; III-327.

maniero.x: manner, way of doing anything; or acting; method; mannerism; (pl.) behavio(u)r, deportment, (cf. kustumo, modo)

manifesta.x: manifest, no longer concealed (cf. evidenta, vid-ebla, notora, publika). Ex.: Deo manifestas su per sua laboruri. Manifesta eroro.

manifestar.x: (tr.) to manifest, make to appear, make known

maniko.x: sleeve (of a garment, or any sleeve-like object)

manio.x: mania, monomania: derangement of the mind especially upon a single subject

manipular.x: (tr.) to manipulate; to treat, work or operate with the hand.

manipulatoro.x: sounding-key; apparatus used to send messages (telegraphic, etc.) by breaks in the current.

manjar.x: (tr.) to eat: chew and swallow; (fig.) to eat away; consume

manjarajo.x: something eaten or to be eaten; food, victuals (cf. nutr-iva, disho)

mankar.x: to be lacking, wanting, missing; (cf. indijar)

manko.x: want, lack, absence, deficiency, shortcoming, need

manometro.x: manometer: a pressure or vacuum gauge; steam gauge.

manovrar.x: (tr., intr.) to maneuver (manœuvre) (troops, ships); (fig.) to manage, or bring about, with skill (an affair, etc.).

mansardo.x: garret; story or room under a sloping roof (cf. atiko).

mansheto.x: cuff (detachable or not, of shirts, gowns); (cf. ponyeto, paramento). Def.: Parto (ordinare starchita) qua finis maniko di kamizo e cirkondas la karpo; VI-245.

mantelo.x: (garment) mantle, cloak; (arch.) mantel (as over a fire-place)

mantenar.x: to keep fast, hold fast, sustain (in a state of stability)

mantiso.x: the decimal part of a logarithm.

marabuto.x: Marabout. Def.: Mohamedista kleriko od ermito; VII-280.

marchandar.x: (tr.) to bargain for, beat down the price of, haggle about

marchar.x: (intr.) to walk, step, tread; (of soldiers) to march

marchetar.x: to trip along (of children). Def.: Facar pazi, pozar alterne la pedi sur la sulo, irge qua esas la direciono o la skopo di ta ago (ne rezervata a la militala marcho, o la militala komandi); IV-464.

marcipano.x: marzipan, marchpane: a kind of sweetmeat.

mareego.x: bore, eagre: rush of water up an estuary; wave caused by meeting of two tides.

mareo.x: tide, ebb and flow (cf. fluxo, refluxo)

mariajanunco.x: banns. V. exp.: L’ago mariajar implikas 3  personi; la homulo e la homino mariajata, e la legal (o religial) oficisto, qua mariajas (unionas) li. Do, segun rigoro, la verbo mariajar povas havar quale subjekto nur l’oficisto. Per extenso, on povas dicar ke la homulo e la homino mariajas su, pro ke lia volo esas ya la kauzo di la mariajo; II-726. La sacerdoto mariajas Maria e me. La patrulo di Maria grantis Maria e me kom spozino. Maria spozuligis me. Me spozinigis Maria, od, me mariajis me kun Maria.

mariajar.x: (tr.) to marry; legally unite in wedlock (by an official, priest, minister); (cf. spoz-igar, aliancar)

marinar.x: (tr.) to marinate: to salt or pickle, as fish, and then preserve in oil or vinegar

marjino.x: margin (of book, of paper); (fig.) border, edge (of anything)

mark.x: (money) mark; (weight) mark; an old weight: 8 oz. (ounces).

markifar.x: to produce a mark, leave a trace

marko.x: mark: token by which anything is known; stamp

markotar.x: (tr., hort.) to layer: bend a shoot or branch to the ground and cover with earth so as to take root

marmorumar.x: to stain or vein like marble.

marodar.x: (intr.) to maraud: rove in quest of plunder; (tr.) to plunder.

marquizo.x: marquee: a large field tent; an ornamental verander or penthouse overhanging a balcony, window or door.

marvelo.x: wonder, marvel, prodigy. Def.: Ulo qua efikas astoneso od admiro per aparta beleso, grandeso o stranjeso, mem per superhomeso o supernatureso; II-19.

masakro.x: (tr.) to massacre. Def.: Mortigar un (od, plu generale) plura personi kruele o senbezone; III-698.

mashinacar.x: (tr.) to machinate: plan or contrive in secret with evil purpose.

mashinagar.x: to use or operate a m.

mashinisto.x: machinist: one who runs or constructs m.s

masivo.x: a large solid mass (as of masonry); a block (of flowers, trees, etc.); bulk (of a mountain or hill).

maskar.x: (tr.) to mask (to cover the face with a mask, not travestiar)

maskarono.x: (arch.) carved or moulded face (or figure). V exp.: To ne esas masko, ma vizajo plu o min groteska, skultita IV-336.

maso.x: mass: body of matter cohering in one body, usually of considerable size; (cf. amaso, bloko, turbo).

masonar.x: (tr.) to do mason’s work on: to build (with stone, brick, etc.); to wall up, seal up (a door, etc.)

mastico.x: mastic: a resin from the mastic tree; any of the pasty cements, esp. putty

mastizar.x: to put m.s on, in (a ship, etc.)

materiigar.x: to materialize: to make (a spirit) visible in or as a material form

materio.x: (also fig. as of discourse, book, etc.) material, matter (out of which something is made)

matida.x: dull, hollow (of sound); mat(t), dead, dull, not shiny, glossy (of colo(u)rs, etc.). Ant.: sonora, bril-anta.

matino.x: morning, forenoon: time from dawn to midday

matloto.x: matelot: a kind of fish-stew; a kind of sailor’s dance, hornpipe.

mato.x: mat, matting (of straw or other materials).

matraquo.x: (chem.) mother-liquor. V. exp.: Matro esas la sentimental equivalanto di patrino; VI-535.

matrikulo.x: matricula: register in which names are entered consecutively, as for a hospital, prison, society, etc.

matura.x: (also fig.) ripe, mature: having become completely developed

maturigar.x: to cause to ripen or come to maturity

matutino.x: (R.C. Ch.) matins. Def.: «Ofico» di la matino; V-340.

mayuskulo.x: capital or uncial letter, majuscule. Ant.: miniskulo.

mazo.x: mace. Def.: Baston(ego) plu grosa ye un extremajo kam ye l’altra; ica servas kom mancho, e l’enesma havas nodi, o klovi o saliaji; II-709. La mazo moderna esas uzata quale ceremoniala insigno, ex.: en parlamento.

me.x: I, me; (acc. me, or in case of necessity men)

meceno.x: Maecenas; (fig.) patron of art and science.

mecho.x: wick (of lamp, of candle); tinder; (artil.) quick-match

mediacar.x: (tr.) to mediate: to intervene, interpose between people or in something to harmonize or reconcile

mediata.x: mediate: intermediate, not direct or immediate, indirect

mediatigar.x: to mediatize: to make intermediate, render mediate

medicindoktoro.x: doctor of m., -student(ul)o: student of m.

medikacho.x: quack. V. exp.: Per mediko on devas komprenar medicinisto praktikanta, kontre ke medicinisto (segun l’etimologio) esas irgu qua okupas su profesione pri medicino (mem nur teoriale). Profesoro di medicino, exemple, esas medicinisto, ma povas ne esar mediko. Kuracisto signifikas ta qua (profesione) kuracas, sive mediko, sive ne; VI-141.

medio.x: (also nat. sciences) environment, surroundings; (of people) circle, set; (cf. cirkum-aji)

meditar.x: (tr., intr.) to meditate, think over, ponder (cf. projetar); Ex.: Meditar (pri) ula verajo, la paroli di evangelio-libri. Il pasas sua tempo en meditado. Meno meditema.

mefito.x: mephitis: noxious or foul exhalation, especially from earth; (mines) choke-damp.

mejisar.x: (tr.) to taw (skins). Def.: Specala maniero preparar la peli, precipue la mikra peli: mikra bovyuno, mutono, mutonyuno, kapro-yuno, por fabrikar ganti, delikata shui, e.c. La mejisado esas specala karakterizata per to ke la tanago di la peli, vice facesar per tanoza extrakturi, quale la tanago propre dicita, esas facata per specala mixuro blankatra kompozita de aluno, vitelo e marala salo; VI-245.

mekanikala.x: mechanical; relative to mechanics or the laws of motion (cf. mashin-ala)

mekanikisto.x: mechanician: one learned in the theories of mechanics (cf. mashin-(if)isto). Ex.: omna movi di korpi esas mekanikal, la libera falo di korpo, same kam la falo di vapor-martelo.

mekanismo.x: (philos., mechan, and fig.) mechanism, machinery; structure; mechanical parts. Def.: Ensemblo di la mekanikal relati, kun egardo a la dispozeso di la parti; VII-205. Ex.: La mekanismo do horlojo od altra mashino. La mekanismo esas ulo abstraktita, la strukturo, la dispozeso di la parti di la aparato.

melankolioza.x: melancholy, dispirited, gloomy (of mind); (cf. trista). Ant.: gayeso.

meleo.x: melee; a general had to hand fight.

mem.x: (adv.) even, still, (in comparson); (emphasis) really, indeed (cf. ya)

membro.x: member (of society, community, party, parliament, of an equation); limb (of body)

memento.x: (R.C. ch.) memento: prayers for living and dead.

memorando.x: memorandum; (of societies, academies); (dipl.) memorial: a note or informal state paper used in diplomacy.

memorar.x: (tr.) to remember, recollect, have a memory of; (cf. merkar)

memorialo.x: memoir. Def.: Historiala verko, en qua l’autoro naracas l’eventi di sua vivo o di sua tempo; IV-172.

memorigar.x: to cause (ulu) to remember, remind, bring to mind, commemorate

menajerio.x: menagerie. Def.: Kolekturo de animali rara o sovaja por expozo; III-327.

menajo.x: housekeeping: administration, cleaning and general management of a house, especially apart from mere cooking arrangements

menso.x: (of abbeys) revenue; (fig.) table-money, allowance for table.

menstruar.x: (intr., physiol.) to menstruate, have the monthly flow

mentiar.x: (intr.) to lie, tell a falsehood (pri, per)

mento.x: mind: seat of consciousness, thought, volition and feeling; mentality: cast or habit of mind (cf. spirito, psiko, intelekto)

menuzar.x: (intr.) to do fine carpenter’s or joiner’s work

menuzisto.x: cabinet-worker, joiner (cf. eben-isto). V.  exp.: vid. karpentar.

merceristo.x: mercer, haberdasher: a dealer in textile fabrics, trimmings, and small articles of dress.

mercero.x: (Eng.) mercer’s business, haberdasher’s trade. (U.S.) dry-goods business

meringo.x: (cook.) meringue: a kind of icing and cake made of it.

merito.x: merit, worth, desert. Ex.: Meritar laudo, puniso, rekompenso.

merkar.x: (tr.) to mark, to impress (ulo) on one’s memory, to retain or remember) a thing, keep in mind, (cf. memorar)

merkato.x: (aslo fig. as in polit. econ.) market: public place for selling. Def.: Vendeyo publika; III-466. Stando di la ofro e demando di vari en un urbo o loko; II-76.

merlono.x: (fort.) merlon. Def.: Parto (solida) di muro inter du kreneli; VII-280.

mesajo.x: message: official communication, diplomatic, parliamentary; (cf. letro, send-ajo).

meskina.x: mean, paltry (person, act); narrow, illiberal (ideas, policy); stingy, niggardly (persons, policy); shabby (room, person)

meskinajo.x: mean or paltry thing or act, shabby trick. Def.: Qua indijas larjeso, alteso (precipue etikala); III-10.

mestiero.x: trade, handicraft: occupation or business in which manual or mechanical labo(u)r is necessary, as that of a carpenter or mason

metafrazo.x: metaphrase: literal translation. Def.: Expliko qua konsistas en tradukar loko (frazo) en plura klara, simpla e vulgara vorti; V-485.

metalizar.x: to metallize; to coat or impregnate with m.

metalurgio.x: metallurgy: science and art of preparing metals from the ores (not the extracting of ores; cf. metal-ifo).

metar.x: to put on , don (clothing, ornaments); (cf. vest-izar)

metebla.x: wearable: which can be put on.

metodo.x: method: special or definite system of procedure; (of things) –ala: methodical; (of persons) –oza: methodical

metonomazio.x: metonomatosis. Def.: Chanjo di propra nomo per traduko, qua celas ol; V-485.

metrala.x: (measure or verse) metrical. Note: A list of metric abbreviations may be found in IV-608-9.

metropolo.x: metropolis: a chief or capital city.

mezurar.x: (tr.) to measure (with an instrument), to survey (land)

mi.x: mi, third note of diatonic scale.

miaular.x: (intr.) to mew: to cry as a cat, to caterwaul, miaou.

mielmixuro.x: oxymel: a mixture of vinegar and honey

mieno.x: (of the face) look(s), mien, countenance, -acho: affected, lackadaisical, simpering look

migrenino.x: (med.) a kind of remedy for megrim or hemicrania.

migreno.x: megrim: a kind of sick or nervous pain affecting one side of the head, hemicrania. ?DeFIR

mikrigar.x: to make small, belittle; (cf. min-grand-igar, diminutar), -o-kosmo: microcosm. Ex.: Mikra spaco, chambro, homo, sumo, nombro, merito. Ant.: granda.

mikrope.x: little by little, bit by bit

militarigar.x: to militarize: to bring into a condition of (or imbue with) militarism. Ex.: On dicas, ke la maxim bona metodo kuracar militaristo esas igar lu militisto.

mimar.x: (tr.) to mimic: express by dumb show, as for ridicule

mimetikeso.x: mimicry; imitative resemblance of one animal to another or to some inanimate object.

minacar.x: (tr.) to menace, to threaten (ulu, per ulo). Ex.: Il minacis mortigar me. La muro minacis krular (E. the wall totters). Kolero esas minaco.

minar.x: (tr.) to undermine, to mine: extract ores, etc.; (cf. sub-destruktar) (milit.) to sap

mineraligar.x: to mineralize: transform into a mineral

mineralizar.x: to mineralize: to cover or impregnate with mineral.

minestrelo.x: minstrel: poet, singer of the Middle Ages.

miniaturo.x: miniature; a small and delicate painting, as a portrait; a representation on a much reduced scale.

minionino.x: a daintily pretty girl or woman; (fig.) darling, pet

ministerio.x: administrative or executive department of a government of which a ministro is the head (cf. V-158)

miniumo.x: minium: red oxide of lead; (paint) red-lead.

minora.x: (jur.) minor: under age; (logic, music, eccl.) minor

minoritato.x: minority: the smaller number. Ant.: majoritato.

minuciema.x: (person) particular; attentive to detail, fastidious, hairsplitter

minuskulo.x: (print.) small letter; (in manuscripts) miniscule. Ant.: mayuskulo.

minuto.x: (of time: astron., geom. of degree) minute.

miriado.x: myriad: an immense number; (antiq.) ten thousand.

mirteliero.x: bilberry plant: European whortleberry plant (Vacinium Myrtillus).

mistifikar.x: (tr.) to hoax, mystify: mischievously deceive someone in sport

mixar.x: (tr.) to mix, mingle, blend (ulo kun ulo)

mizerar.x: (intr.) to be in misery (because of poverty, destitution, or unhappiness or pain)

mizero.x: misery, wretchedness, want, sore need, distress.

mnemoniko.x: mnemonics: art or system for developing the memory.

moblizar.x: to furnish (a house, room, etc. with furniture)

moblo.x: a piece of furniture: any movable object serviceable or use or decoration of an apartment

modelo.x: model (of a machine, etc.): copy or standard to be followed

moderar.x: (tr.) to moderate: keep within bonds (passions, zeal, ardour, etc.); to abate (a price), reduce (one’s expenses); mitigate (a sentence)

modesta.x: modest: not bold or presumptuous; not boastful or obtrusive; (N.B. «modest» in the sense of observing sex proprieties is translated by pudor-oza, chasta, dec-anta). V. exp.: vid. diskreta. Ant.: Superba, pretend-ema, arog-ema, vanitat-oza, fatua.

modifikar.x: (tr.) to modify: make partial changes in (cf. chanjar)

modifikivo.x: (gram.) a modifying or qualifying word. Ex.: Modifikar lego, frazo, puniso.

modlar.x: (tr., sculpt.) to make a model (in clay, wax) of something from which a statue or other work is to be executed or enlarged.

modo.x: mode: a passing usage which depends upon taste, caprice; fashion, style; (gram.) mood (indicative, imperative, etc.); (philos., mus.) mode; (jur.) modus

modulacar.x: (tr.) to modulate: pass from one key to another without break in melody; to inflect, vary ( the voice in speaking).

mokar.x: to laugh at: ridicule, deride, mock, rally, gibe, scoff

mola.x: soft: easily yielding to pressure, not hard; (cf. dolca); (of muscles) flabby (cf. laxa); (of meat) tender; (of fruits) mellow

molestar.x: (tr.) to molest, pester, annoy, bother. V. exp.: Molestar signifikas volata tedado per tormenteti o persekuteti. La vorto bone tradukas la F. brimer (E. to play jokes on), qua esas molestado impozita kom probo a la novici en armeo, lerneyo. Anke on povas dicar: «la dogano esas konstanta molestado por la voyajanti»; III-35.

molio.x: mole, jetty (used as a harbor (harbour) breakwater).

moloso.x: a species of watch-dog (Canis familiaris molossus); (pros.) Molosian metre.

monetifar.x: to coin, mint into money; to raise money

monetigar.x: to monetize: put into circulation, give a standard value to in currency

moneto.x: (of gold, silver, copper) coin, cash, change, specie; (fig.) currency; (cf. pekunio)

monetpapero.x: paper money: which takes the place of coin (cf. bankobilieto)

monoftongo.x: (gram.) monophthong: a single vowel sound; a combination of two vowels pronounced as one.

monoklo.x: monocle, single eye-glass. Def.: Unika aparta okulvitro; V-1.

monokromajo.x: (paint) monochrome picture; camaieu. Def.: (monokrom-ajo) Pikturo per un sola koloro, plu o min klara; VI-480.

monomanio.x: (med.) monomania: insanity upon one particular subject (cf. manio)
