montanto.x: upright: piece of any framework, wood or iron; stanchion, beam, post, side-piece (of a ladder).

montrar.x: (tr.) to show, exhibit: make to see or know

moqueto.x: moquette: a kind of velvet carpeting; Wilton carpeting.

morala.x: habitual, customary: relating to mori (N.B. not conforming to the rules of right conduct, righteousness. A moral man = etikala homulo; cf. IV-233)

morbo.x: disease, malady, distemper: the illness itself; (for state, condition, ill person, cf. malad-a, -eso)

morge.x: tomorrow, (la) morga dio, morgo: the next day, day after

mori.x: manners, habits, conduct considered from the moral point of view; (cf. etiko)

morso.x: bit (of a bridle); (fig.) curb, check, restraint.

mortar.x: (intr., lit. and fig.) to die, cease to live, depart this life; (of fire) to go out; (of movement) to come to an end

morteskar.x: to be dying, be on the point of death

mortifikar.x: (tr., rel. and fig.) to subdue the passions and appetites by severe discipline; (N.B. for sense of «to humiliate», cf. sham-igar, vexar).

mortigar.x: to deprive of life; cause to die, kill, execute, put to death (by natural or artificial means); (cf. ocidar, asasinar, sen-kap-igar, masakrar)

motivizar.x: to state the motive or grounds of (an opinion, act); (fig.) to justify

motivo.x: motive: that which excites to action, determines choice; (mus.) motif

motoro.x: (mechanical) motor: moving power, that which imparts motion

movar.x: (tr., intr.) to move, set in motion, stir, propel

moyeno.x: means, medium (through which a thing is done); instrumentality

muar.x: (intr.) to moult, mew; shed or cast off hair (if dogs), feathers (of birds), horns (of deer), outer layer of skin (of serpents), and the like which are replaced by new growth; to break, change (voice at puberty)

muaro.x: moire: a watered fabric, as watered silk.

mucilajo.x: (bot.) (plant-) mucilage; (N.B. for the adhesive substance, cf. gluo). Def.: Humoro vikoza qua trovesas en ula planti; IV-586.

muelar.x: (tr.) to grind, crush (in a mill); (cf. grindar)

muflo.x: (chem.) muffle. Def.: Speco di vazo (ek argilo) en qua on pozas objekti submisenda nedirete a l’efiko di la fairo; III-530.

muflono.x: (zool.) mouflon; species of wild sheep (Ovis Musimon).

mujar.x: (intr.) to bellow, roar (winds, waves, thunder, cannon); (cf. bramar).

mukozo.x: mucus membrane (cf. pituito, mucilajo). Def.: Humoro normale sekretaca da la membrani dicata mukozi; IV-585.

muldar.x: (tr.) to form a mold (mould) of, as in sand, in which to make a casting; (fig.) -ar su: to mold, model oneself. V. exp.: En giserio, on unesme muldas: to esas ago donar justa formo ad la sablo o l’argilo en qua on varsos la fuzita metalo. Po la muldo on uzas la muld-ilo ek ligno, fero, e.c. Duesme on gisas la fuzita metalo en la mulduro; III-82.

muntar.x: (tr., tech.) to put together, assemble, set up, mount (a machine, a gem). V. exp.: On asemblas planki o peci, on ne muntas li. On muntas mashino o karpenturo, asemblante lua peci; IV-598.

murego.x: thick or large wall (as of a city, a fort)

murmurar.x: (intr.) to murmur: make a low, continued noise; (of water) to purl; (of wind) to breathe, whisper, rustle; (of bees) to hum

musono.x: monsoon. Def.: Vento qua suflas de esto a westo dum duimo di l’yaro, ed inverse dum l’altra duimo; II-643. DeFIRS

mustar.x: (intr.) must, to have to, to be under the nesessity of, be obliged; (past tense) had to

mutilar.x: (tr.) to mutilate, maim. Ex.: Mutilar membro di la korpo. (fig.) Mutilar la verseso, la poemo.

mutoni.x: sheep; (fig.) small, compact masses of white fleecy clouds (which move across the sky like a flock of sheep)

mutuala.x: mutual. Ex.: Societo di mutual sokurso (E. benefit society). Mutuala asekurerio. V. exp.: Mutuala, reciproka: Mutuala aplikesas nur a la sociala institucuri di «reciproka» helpo, sokurso, e.c.; IV-162.

muzelfloro.x: (bot.) snapdragon (Antirrhinum). Def.: La nazo e la boko di bestii, en qui ta du parti esas salienta (hundo, porko, e.c.); III-10.

nabobo.x: nabob. Def.: Princo di India; metafore, richega viro; VII-280.

nacionano.x: a native, national; member of a nation

nacioneso.x: nationality (of a nation as a whole)

nam.x: (conj.) for (= because, but in a less immediate and explicit way than pro ke. Introduces a sentence or subordinate clause which adduces reason, proof or justification). Esas matino, nam la uceli kantas: it is morning for (not because: pro ke) the birds are singing. Ex.: Vu ne trovos il en la domo, nam me jus vidis il en la strado. Vu ne povas vidar il, nam il esas departinta de longe. Lavez vua manui, nam li esas sordida. Me ne povas amar ilu, nam il odias me. Ni irez lente adheme, nam balde esos nokto. V. exp.: Nam, pro ke: Pro ke introduktas dependanta propoziciono, qua kontenas motivo o pruvo por la chefa propoziciono prieranta o sequanta: nam introduktas chefa frazo, qua kontenas anke motivo o pruvo, ma nur por preiranta frazo, o tacita penso. Ex.: Pro ke pluvas, me ne ekiros. Me ne ekiros nam pluvas; III-223; cf. or. Ta du konjuncioni interdistingesas precize quale Angla for e because. La Angla linguisto Sweet skribas pri li tale: «La du precipua konjuncioni kauzala esas pro ke, qua konstatas nemediata e direte aganta kauzo, e nam, qua ajuntas expliko o motivo, ofte kom quaza posa penso; ex.: ni kunprenis nia parapluvi, pro ke ni timas ke pluvos; nam la barametro falis de kelka tempo. Konseque, nam uzesas libere pos pauzo ed esas do nur mi-konjunciono (konjunciono koordinanta); IV-524; kp. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 113.

naracar.x: (tr.) to narrate, relate, tell (something that happened, a true incident)

narkotar.x: (intr.) to be in a state of narcosis

naturkolora.x: (of wood, etc.) not colored, of natural colo(u)r.

nauzear.x: (intr.) to feel nauseated, be sick to the stomach, be qualmish

navo.x: (nav.) vessel: (merchant-) ship (cf. milit-navo); nave (of a church)

nazfetida.x: a stinking nose; (med.) affected with ozaena

necesigar.x: necessitate. Ex.: Esas necesa konsequajo. Respirado esas necesa por la vivo. Ne esas necesa parolar pri to. Ant.: superflua, ne-utila.

nefertila.x: (of ground, inanimate things) infertile, barren (cf. ne-fekunda).

negar.x: (tr.) to deny: declare untrue or non-existing; (cf. renegar)

neglijar.x: (tr.) to neglect: to treat carelessly, slight, be remiss (in the performance of a duty, task, care of health, peson, etc.)

negociar.x: (tr.) to negotiate: to procure, or arrange for, by negotiating. Ex.: Negociar ligo atakala e defensala; Negociado pri ula afero grava, pri mariajo.

nekrologo.x: necrology: obituary review of (distinguished) persons who have died within a certain length of time.

nekromancio.x: necromancy: pretended divination by aid of spirits; black art; (fig.) magic

nekropolo.x: necropolis, city of the dead, large cemetery.

nenio.x: nenia. Def.: Kanto o lamento funerala, en l’antiqua mori.

nenufaro.x: nenuphar: nenuphär: the great white water-lily of Europa (Nymphaea albl or, Nuphar).

neta.x: clean, spotless, neat, tidy, natty: without spot, stain, blot, impurity; (of price) net (cf. sen-tara)

neutrigar.x: to neutralize (cf. equalibrar, kompensar). Ex.: Neutra vorto, sexuo, naciono, persono, (chem.) salo.

nevuso.x: nævus: pigmented place on skin, usually congenital; birthmark, mole

nia.x: our(s) «Nia Patro»: the Lord’s Prayer, (cf. note under on).

nicho.x: (arch.) niche, nook: recess in a wall (as for a statue or a bed)

nihilo.x: naught, nothing, something non-existent, nonenity (cf. nulo)

nimbo.x: (meteor.) nimbus: a large rain-cloud of uniform greyness (N.B. not halo; cf. aureolo).

nipelo.x: (tech.) nipple. Def.: Interna junto-tubeto kun filetoza extremaji.

nivelizar.x: to measure the level of, to find the height of (by a surveyor’s level)

nobeligar.x: to ennoble: raise to nobility (ulu). V. exp.: Nobela, nobla: La nobeli esas sociala klaso, qua formacesis per la reputeso heredita de la ancestri da la decendanti. Nobleso esas etikal traito. Nobelo tote ne bezonas esar nobla, ed inversa nobla homo ne bezonas esas nobela.

nobligar.x: to ennoble: to make noble. V. exp.: vid. nobela. Ant.: abjekta, vulgara, infama.

nocar.x: (tr.) to harm, injure, hurt, wrong, be injurious (ulu, ulo)

nochizar.x: to notch, dent. Def.: V-forma dentizuro (quale en flecho, dento-roto; l’intervalo o lakuno inter du denti di ingranajo, do l’inverso di dento; (kp. III-142). Mikra kavajo produktita per instrumento o frapo.

nociono.x: notion. Def.: Ideo quan on havas pri ulo. Ex. La koncienco direte donas al homo nociono pri la bono e lo mala. Il donos a vu nociono pri ca afero.

nociva.x: noxious, nocive, harmful, detrimental. V.exp.: vid. detrimentar.

nodo.x: knot (in thread, cord, rope, etc.); (nav.) knot: nautical mile: 6080.27 ft., 1852 meters (metres)

nomar.x: (tr.) to name: call (ulu) by name, to say the name of (ulu)

nombrizar.x: to give numbers to; to count, take census of

nombro.x: (cardinal) number, numeral (i.e. numbers used in simple counting: 1, 2, 3, etc. cf. numero); (gram.) number

nomesar.x: to be named, to be called

nominar.x: (tr.) to nominate: to name as a canditate for election or appointment to an office or title

nomizar.x: to name: give a name to (ulo)

norde.x: northerly, in the north (with movement: ad –e)

norio.x: noria: a machine for raising water by buckets on an endless chain.

norma.x: of or constituting a norm, rule, or principle

normala.x: ordinary, regular, normal: relating to an authoritative standard, as in speaking of health, etc.; (goem.) -ala, -alo: normal: perpendicular to a tangent

normigar.x: to establish (ulo) as a norm, to make a standard of (ulo)

normizar.x: to furnish with a standard, norm

nostoko.x: (bot.) nostoc: a plant of blue-green algæ (genus: Nostoc).

notar.x: (tr.) to note down, set down in writing, make memo of; (cf. remarkar)

notico.x: (short) notice, note, or account (instructive or informative as on bottle labels, or in a museum, etc.)

notifikar.x: (tr.) to notify (formally), give notice of (ulo, ad ulu). V. exp.: sav-igar.

notizar.x: to annotate, make notes in (a book); (mus.) to write down the notes; (N.B. on notas remarki en libro; on notizas libro per remarki; cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 109)

noto.x: noting; note, mark, memo, minute (to assist the memory); (mus.) note (written or sounded); (diplom.) note

notora.x: manifest, well-known, known generally, notorious (N.B. but not in a bad sense)

nova.x: (of things) new, novel; (of persons) new (in service, office)

novelisto.x: short-story writer. V. exp.: Romano esas generale libro kontenanta fingita historio di un o plura personi. Novelo signifikas nur rakonto de kelka pagini, qua havas la naturo di romano, me esas romano tre kurta, tam per l’ampleso kam per la duro (generale on rakontas nur aventuro, epizodo, fakto); IV-291-2.

nu.x: (interj.) well! now then! come now! well now!

nuancizar.x: to shade, variegate, express the nuances

nuanco.x: nuance: a slight shade, gradation, as of tone, colo(u)r, meaning, etc.

nuancoza.x: full of shades, tints, slight gradations or distinctions

nuco.x: a walnut; (fig,) nut: any hard shell enclosing a kernel

nudigar.x: to strip, undress, lay bare, denude

nugato.x: nougat, a kind of almond cake.

nulo.x: nothing; (interj.) no use! no go! not a bit of it! -u: no one, nobody

numerizar.x: to give successive numbers (to houses, journals, etc.).

numero.x: (ordinal) number (i.e. indicative of order or succession; as 1st, 2nd, 3rd, etc.)

nun.x: (adv.) now, at present, at this time

nuna.x: (time) present, actual, current, now occurring (cf. prezenta)

nura.x: indicates exclusion (of all else) only, sole (cf. sola, unika)

nutrar.x: (tr.) to nourish, feed, sustain (ulu), (cf. alimentar, alaktar)

obediema.x: (tendency) obedient. Ex.: La soldato obedias sua chefo.

obezeso.x: obesity. Def.: Qua havas tro abunta graso, precipue en la ventro: on qualifikas lu vulgare «ventroza». L’obezeso esas maladeso e preske infirmeso; VI-601.

objecionar.x: (tr.) to object: adduce as an objection. Ex.: On objecionis a Galileo ke, se la tero rotacas …

objekto.x: object: anything that comes within the cognizance of the senses (cf. skopo, komplemento)

oblato.x: wafer. Def.: Dina tabuleto ek farinpasto (azimo) uzata por siglar letri.

obligaciono.x: (fin.) debenture, bond: a legal obligation (bond) bearing interest

obligar.x: (tr.) to oblige: put (ulu) under obligation to do or not to do something, to bind, constrain (by duty, hono(u)r, etc.) (cf. devar, koaktar)

obliqua.x: (also anat., gram.) oblique, aslant, slanting; (fig.) indirect, not straightforward, insincere

obliterar.x: (tr.) to obliterate, blot out (little by little or in a manner to leave traces). V. exp.: Nek efacar, nek nuligar, ma nuligar per signo, qua igas ulo neuzebla (ex. postal marko); IV-394. Ex.: La censuristo obliteris la enskriburo.

obliviigar.x: to cause (ulu) to forget, to cause (ulo) to be forgotten (da ulu)

oblonga.x: oblong. Def.: Qua esas plu longa kam larja.

obolo.x: (Gr. coin) obol(us); any of several small European coins; mite, groat, farthing; a very small sum

obsedar.x: (tr.) to beset: to haunt, importune; to obsess, to worry; to possess (by fixed ideas); (cf. persekutar, tedar)

observar.x: (tr.) to observe: look at, watch (with attention and study); (cf. obediar, remarker)

observebla.x: observable. Ex.: Observar naturo, la irado di la astri, la mori di la diferenta nacioni. Astronomiala observado. Mento observema.

obskura.x: (lit. and fig.) obscure: without sufficient light to enable one to see objects, gloomy, dim, somber (sombre); not easily understood; little known; (of colo(u)rs) dark

obsoleteso.x: obsoleteness, desuetude, disuse. Def.: Exter la uzado, la kustumo.

obstaklo.x: (lit. and fig.) obstacle, hindrance, obstruction, impediment, bar, clog: that which opposes

obstinar.x: (intr.) to be obstinate (en, pri) to persist, be firmly bent (on)

obstruktar.x: (tr.) to obstruct, block up, choke up; be in the way of

obstruktiva.x: obstructive. Ex.: Obstruktar voyo, tubo. V. exp.: inkombrar.

obtenar.x: (tr.) to obtain, procure, get (ulo, de ulu). Ex.: Obtenar favoro de ulu. V. exp.: vid. recevar.

obturar.x: (tr., tech.) to obturate: to stop or close, as an opening.

obtuza.x: obtuse: blunt, dull, (of edges, angles); (geom.) larger than a right angle; (fig.) dull (in sensibility, mentality)

obtuzangula.x: obtuse angular. Ex.: Hakilo obtuza. Il esas homo mente obtuza. Ant.: akuta.

oceano.x: acean; (fig.) sea, flood, great quantity (cf. maro)

ocidar.x: (tr.) to slay, murder: kill with violence

ociemo.x: loafer, sluggard. Def.: Esar en stando di senlaboreso. Ociemeso esas la tendenco a ne laborar, a facar nulo; ocioza signifikas la fakto, ne tendenco; IV-287. V. exp.: On povas laborar dum sua liber-tempi, ma ne dum periodo di ocio (cf. chomar, flanar).

ocilar.x: (intr.) to oscillate: swing back and forwards (cf. vibrar, fluktuar)

ocipito.x: (anat.) occiput: back part of head or skull

odorar.x: (intr.) to have a smell or scent, smell (fragrant, etc.), exhale odo(u)r; (cf. flarar)

ofensar.x: (tr.) to offend, give offense (offence) to, shock (the sensibilities)

oficala.x: functionary relating to office, duty; (cf. oficiala)

oficestro.x: head of (civil) office. Def.: Funciono administrala o direktala, sive en la stato, sive en societo o grand entraprezo; III-697.

oficiar.x: (intr., eccl.) to officiate: perform divine service

oficiro.x: (milit. nav., of an order) officer (cf. ofic-isto)

ofico.x: (function, duty, assigned service) office, post (cf. oficio, employo)

ofrar.x: (tr.) to offer, proffer, tender (ulo ad ulu), to offer (to do); to place at the service of (ulu)

ofro.x: (polit. econ) supply: what is offered; Ex.: Ofrar helpo, sua brakio a siorino, sua manuo ad amiko, viktimo en sakrifiko, acompanar ulu. La lego di l’ofro e di la demando determinas la preco di la vari sur ula merkato. V. exp.: Il propozis a me irar kun il en la teatro, ma il ne ofris a me plaso. On povas ofrar la vari sen prizentar li: en la komercal borso, on ne prizentas la vari ipsa, same kam en la financal borso en ne prizentas la valori: tamen on ofras li; II-79, 167.

oglar.x: (tr.) to ogle: view with side glances; to cast glances at slyly

oktanto.x: octant: eighth of a circle; (astron. instr.) octant.

oktopodo.x: octopod (having eight legs); order Octopoda; (cf. polpo).

okupata.x: occupied, busy. Ex.: La lito okupas la tota spaco. La soldati okupis la urbo. La diskutado okupis la tempo. Ca laboro okupis dek yari di lua vivo. Il okupis su en (od, pri) sua gardeno. Esar sen okupeso. La okupo di la urbo da la trupi. La okup-antajo, -ivo di soldati, di komercisto.

ol.x: (abbr. for olu; acus. olun) (neuter pronoun referring to a definite object; cf. lo, lu) it

olda.x: (of living beings) old, of advanced age

oldeskar.x: to grow old; (plu-) -igar: to age, make look old. Def.: Di evo avanc-inta. V. exp.: vid. anciena. Ant.: yuna.

oleifar.x: to produce oil, give out oil

olelampo.x: Argand lamp: common oil lamp for illumination

olia.x: their (cf. lia). Ex.: Ol esas tre bela. La afero semblas bona, ma forsan ol ne esas tala. La kavalo esas tro fatigita; ol(u) ne povus tirar la veturo, La viri e la bestii ne konkordas inter su, nam ili (la viri) tiris ad-dextre, dum ke oli (la bestii) tiris adsinistre.

olim.x: formerly, in former times, once upon a time

olimpiado.x: Olympiad: a period of four years.

ombrizar.x: to shade, over shade; put in, cover with shadows

omisar.x: (tr.) to omit, leave out or undone, pass over

on.x: one (indefinite pronoun): people, men, we, they (when used vaguely for society), for people in general

onagro.x: (zool.) onager: a wild ass (Equus Onager); (hist.) onager: a stone-throwing machine.

ondifar.x: to rise in billow form or produce waves; to undulate, wave

ondo.x: (lit. and fig.) (small) wave, swell, surge (of water); undulation

opaka.x: opaque. Def.: Qua ne esas diafana, ne permeebla per lumo. Ant.: diafana, translucida.

operacar.x: (tr., surg., mil., math., finan.) to operate (upon)

opinionar.x: (tr.) to opine, express one’s opinion, be of the opinion. Def.: Expresar judiko pri temo. Ex.: Me favore opinionas pri la projeto. Publika opiniono.

oportuna.x: (of things) opportune, seasonable, timely, convenient (cf. favor-oza)

oportunisto.x: opportunist; (N.B. «opportunity» is translated by okaziono or oportunajo); Ex.: Okaziono oportuna. Oportuneso di la sokurso.

opozar.x: (tr.) to oppose (ulu ad ulo, ulu, ad ulu), to put in opposition to, place (ulo) opposite

opresar.x: (tr., phys., mental, social) to oppress: to lie heavy on; deject, treat with hardship; (cf. charj-egar, pres-egar); Def.: Presar forte (fizike o etikale) kontre ulu. V. exp.: On esas fizike opresata, kande on respiras kun peno; on esas etikale opresata, kande on angoras pro desquieteso, en expekto di trista evento od informo. La richuli opresas la povruli. La konquestiti povas esar opresata da la konquestanti, la laboristi da la patroni, e.c. III-223.

optikisto.x: optician: one skilled in optics (cf. okul-isto).

or.x: (conj.) now, but (in argument). V. exp.: Or expresas ne nur intersequo di du propozicioni, ma induktas nova argumento, plusa premiso, expliko, motivo. Ex.: Or, vua argumento semblas bona, ma ...  Omno qua foligas esas veneno; or l’alkoholo foligas; do ... Kande la premiso (motivo) sequas la konkluzo, or vicesas da nam;  ex.: L’alkoholo esas venono, nam ol foligas; kp. nam; VI-141-2; Talmey’s Text Book, p. 113.

ordinacar.x: (tr., eccl.) to ordain (a priest, clergyman); (cf. ord-izar).

ordinar.x: (tr.) to order: put in, reduce to, dispose in, order (cf. rang-izar)

ordinare.x: commonly, ordinarily. Ex.: Vanitato esas kulpo tre ordinara. Ordinara manjajo, homo. Ant.: extraordinara.

ordonancoficiro.x: ordinance officer. Def.: Soldato qua exekutas o transmisas la komandi di oficiro; la ordinanc-oficiro ludas simila rolo apud supera oficiro; III-266.

oreliono.x: (med.) mumps; an infectious inflammation of various glands (cf. parotidito).

organala.x: organic: relative to organs or organized means; (cf. organika)

organdio.x: (fabric) organdy. Def.: Speco di muslino; IV-448.

organismo.x: (lit. and fig.) organism. Def.: (lit.) Ensemblo di la organi (la organaro) qui konstitucas ento vivanta. Ex.: Homala organismo. (fig.) Politikala organismo.

organizar.x: to organize: furnish with organs; (cf. aranjar, institucar)

organo.x: organ (part of an organized body); (fig.) instrument, means; (cf. orgeno)

organzino.x: organzine: a double-thrown silk used in weaving.

orientizar.x: to adjust one’s bearings toward the east; (fig.) to ascertain one’s position, find out what one is about

originala.x: original: relating to origin; not copied; (cf. stranja)

orikalko.x: (met.) orichalk. Def.: Anciena nomo di latuno.

oripelo.x: tinsel; Dutch gold. Def.: Dina, oratra folieto, quan on uzas por orizar diversa objekti; VI-142. V. exp.: Or-pelikulo (E. gold leaf) esas vera oro

orkestro.x: orchestra: a part in theater (theatre) nearest the stage; a company of instrumental performers.

orlar.x: (tr., needle-work) to hem: turn down and sew the edge of (a garment, fabric)

ornar.x: (tr.) to adorn, embellish, bedeck (ulo, ulu, per ulo); (cf. dekorar, plu-bel-igar)

ornitoptero.x: ornithopter: a flying machine propelled by flapping wings.

orniva.x: decorative, ornamental. Ex.: La domi esas neta, komoda, ma li ne esas ornita. Ornar parko per statui. (fig.) Ca viri esas ornivi di nia yarcento.

oroza.x: full of, rich in gold, auriferous

ortopedio.x: (surg.) orthopedics. Def.: L’arto qua korektigas o preventas deformaji di la korpo.

orvietano.x: orvietan: a pretended antidote or counter-poison.

ostentar.x: (tr., intr.) to do a thing out of ostentation, show off, make a show (pri), parade (ulo); (fig.) to swagger

otario.x: otary: eared-seal. Def.: Speco di mar-hundo kun oreli; V-341. (Otariidae).

otomano.x: ottoman. Def.: Speco di divano; IV-395.

ovacionar.x: (tr.) to give an ovation to, to receive in triumph (ulu)

oxidigar.x: to oxidate: convert into an oxide.

oxigenizar.x: oxygenize. V. exp.: Oxigeno esas la ordinara vorto

pacientesar.x: to be patient, have patience, bide one’s time

pacienteso.x: patience, calm endurance or waiting, forbearance

padelo.x: frying-pan, skillet: metal vessel with long handle used for frying.

padlokizar.x: to padlock, fasten with a padlock.

pado.x: pad, padding; listing (put around doors and windows to keep out cold)

pagar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to pay (ulu, ulo), to pay for (ulo)

paginigar.x: (tr., print.) to make up into pages, to folio

pakigar.x: to bundle up, make (ulo) into a parcel

pakotilio.x: (com., nav.) (seaman’s) venture. Def.: Diversa vari (mikra) quin la maristi daras embarkar sen pagar freto; III-141.

paktar.x: (intr.) to covenant, enter into a compact (kun): (cf. kontratar)

paleografiisto.x: paleographer. Def.: Arto dechifrar la anciena skriburi.

paleskar.x: to turn, grow, become pale, to blanch.

paleto.x: paddle-board (of a paddle-wheel); blade (of an oar).

paliatar.x: (tr. med. and gen.) to palliate; mitigate, alleviate, (a disease); to cloak, extenuate (a fault)

palinodio.x: palinode. Def.: Anciena verso en qua la poeto retraktis sua olima opinioni.

palisadcelulo.x: (biol.) p. cell. Def.: Obstaklo (precipue en militarto) ek serio di pintigita palisi o fosti. Anke uzata por la senco biologiala; II-294.

palisizar.x: to cover with stakes; to stake out, make with stakes. Def.: Longa peco ek ligno (ofte) akutigita ye un extremajo.

paliso.x: stake, pale, picket (as of a fence)

palpitar.x: (intr.) to palpitate, throb; (fig.) to tremble, flutter. Ex.: Kande la kordio palpitas, on ne esas mortinta. Palpitar pro pavoro.

paltoto.x: paletot: a loose coat or jacket worn by both sexes, an overcoat (cf. surtuto).

pamfleto.x: pamphlet (N.B. this refers only to a pamphlet on a satirical or strongly controversial subject; cf. broshuro).

pancho.x: paunch (of animals); (fig.) belly, paunch (of persons). Def.: La unesma e maxim granda stomako di rumineri.

panduro.x: pandour; (fig.) marauder, brutal man. Def.: Speco di Hungariana soldati; IV-269.

panear.x: (intr., nav.) to lie to, be hove to; (fig. esp. automobiling) to be in a state of breakdown or halt (occasioned by accident, misfunction, trouble). V. exp.: Panear: esas en paneo. Paneo ne esas simpla halto, nek avario; ol esas halto koaktata pro avario o pertubo, misfunciono; ol esas verto teknikala di navigado, qua divenis vulgara ed internaciona per l’automobilismo; IV-578.

panelo.x: (arch.) panel, wainscot; (gen.) a flat section of considerable size of a garment, wall or other surface

pankreatito.x: (med.) pancreatitis. Def.: Inflamuro di la pankreati.

pantalono.x: (long) trousers, a pair of pantaloons (cf. bracho)

pantomimo.x: pantomime, dumb-show. Def.: La pleado di aktoro qua ne parolas e konseque expresas «omno» (panto) per gesti parte konvencionala; VII-156.

papiro.x: papyrus; (bot.) paper-rush. Def.: Egiptiana arbusto sur la kortico di qua skribis la antiqua, e ta kortico ipsa; III-141.

papriko.x: Cayenne pepper (Capsicum). N.B. «paprika», the mildly pungent condiment might be translated by dolca pimento, dolca papriko.

papulo.x: papule, (solid) pimple (cf. veruko). V. exp.: Papulo esas normala saliajeto di la pelo o di la mukozi (sur la fingri, sur la lango, e.c.). Pustulo esas tumoreto pusifanta (de qua venas lua nomo) en eruptiva morbi (variolo, skarlatino, e.c.); II-646.

para.x: (arith.) even, equal; of equal footing, of a common level

paradar.x: (intr.) to parade (as troops, or like troops); Ex.: Trupi paradas tra la stradi. Parado di cirko. Parado-placo, -agro (E. paradeground).

paradizucelo.x: bird of paradise. Ex.: La paradizo Mohamedala. (fig.) Ca loko esis terala paradizo.

parafizar.x: to put one’s initials to (ulo) with an added flourish

parafo.x: scrawled initials. paraph: flourish after a signature

parafrazar.x: (tr.) to paraphrase: freely translate, amplify (a text). V. exp.: Perifrazo esas frazo o frazeto uzata por expresar nedirete to quon on povus expresar per un simpla vorto. Ex.: «la flamifanta globo», vice «la suno». Parafrazo esas quaza traduko di frazo o texto en la sama linguo, por klarigar o developar olu. Ex.: La predikero citas verso ek la Biblio, e pose parafrazas olu; VI-248.

paralizar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to paralyse, palsy; render powerless, destroy energy

paralizesar.x: to be paralysed, have a paralytic stroke

paralogismo.x: paralogism. V. exp.: Paralogismo esas rezonado nekoncie falsa o kande la premisi ne justifikas la dedukturo. Sofismo esas volata paralogismo o mis-rezonado.

paramento.x: cloth cuff, turned-up end of the sleeve of a coat or gown; (cf. mansheto, ponyeto). Def.: Parto (ek drapo o simila stofo) di la maniko di vesto, qua esas trusita; VI-245.

parazito.x: of men, animals, plants, a parasite

parcelo.x: parcel, patch (of land): clearly defined and divided portion of gound etc.

pardonar.x: (tr.) to forgive, condone, overlook, pardon (ulu, ulo); (cf. indulgar). V. exp.: vid. exkuzar.

parear.x: (tr.) to parry, ward off (a blow); (cf. shirmar).

parenta.x: of the same family, related, akin

parenteze.x: in p.; by the way of (cf. incidente).

parfumo.x: (substance and odor) pefume, fragrance, agreeable odo(u)r (cf. odorizar)

pariar.x: (tr.) to bet, lay a wager, stake (ulo, pri ulo)

parieti.x: walls, coatings; (anat., bot., zool.) paries, parietes

parietizar.x: to put a wall in; chamber off (ulo)

parieto.x: wall (serving as partition, as in a room); inner surface (of a vase, tube. etc.); (anat.) coat, wall (as of stomach)

parigar.x: to put in two’s, pair, couple, match (by two’s); ye par-eso: at par, on a par, on an equality

parlementar.x: (intr., milit.) to parley: confer with an enemy

paro.x: a pair, a couple (of animals, or objects of like nature), brace

paronomazio.x: (rhet.) resemblance between words of different languages.

parotidito.x: (med.) parotitis (cf. oreliono). Def.: Inflameso neinfektala di la parotido; M. XI-67.

partala.x: partial: affecting a part only, not total;. Def.: Un porciono de de divebla toto. Ex.: Dividar ulo en quar parti. Partoprenar ula afero.

partenero.x: partner (in a dance, in sports; N.B. not in business; cf asoci-ito). Ant.: adverso.

partigar.x: to divide into different shares, portions

partikularismo.x: (rel., polit.) particularism. Ex.: Planto partikulara ad klimato. Partikulara amiko. Partikularajo (od, singularajo) di parolado esas idiotismo. Partikularigar la mikra detali. Il laboris partikulare (od, specale) bone. V. exp.: Partikulara esas la kontreajo di generala od universala; aparta signifikas quaze separita, izolita, sola; VII-154; kp. VII-476.

partikulo.x: (gram.) particle, a subordinate word never inflected, a preposition, conjunction, interjection; an affix; (phys.) particle: minute portion of matter; (R.C. rel.) particle, fragment of consecrated bread.

partio.x: party: collection of people for amusement, play, hunting, fishing, etc.

partiso.x: party, a number of persons united against others of contrary opinion; (in a law-suit) litigant, party

partizano.x: partisan, a kind of halberd or pike.

parto.x: part, share, portion; part (in games, music, etc.)

parturar.x: (tr.) to bear (a child), bring forth, beget, give birth to; to calve, lamb; (fig.) to produce, create; (cf. gravid-igar)

parturbenediko.x: churching (of a woman after a childbirth).

parturo.x: childbirth, delivery, confinement, parturition (cf. akusho, genito)

parvenar.x: (intr.) to arrive (at destination), to attain (one’s aim, fortune, success in life)

pasable.x: tolerably, rather, fairly, passably, pretty, indifferently. Def.: Indikanta grado o valoro meza, la minim alta, quan on povas aceptar o tolerar; III-205. Ex.: Ico esas pasabla vino. La teatrajo esis pasable bona. Ta muliero esas pasable bela. Esas pasable varma en ca chambro, ma ne sat varma por mea olda patro.

pasajar.x: (intr.) to take passage (on a ship), be a passenger (on ship); to go by sea

pasar.x: (tr., intr.) to pass (tra, super ulo); to pass (one’s life, time, etc.); to pass away

pasigar.x: to cause to pass; to cause or allow (a boat, a vehicle) to pass (cf. preter-pasar)

pasinto.x: one who has passed; (fig.) dead, vanished person

pasiono.x: passion: violent emotion; great love or fondness; vehement desire

paspelo.x: edging, welt. Def.: Streta bendo de stofo (generale de diversa kolori), per qua on bordizas ula parti di vesto (kolumo, manchi; specale militistala); VI-142.

pasteto.x: pâte: pie, pasty (made of meat or fish)

pastilo.x: pastil: aromatic lozenge for breath; a preparation to scent the air.

pasto.x: paste: any soft composition; (cook.) dough; (tech.) pâte

pastoro.x: pastor, minister, clergyman (cf. paroko); shepherd (of sheep)

pasturar.x: (tr., intr.) to pasture (animals), graze, browse, feed (off grass while moving)

pasvorto.x: password. Ex.: Il pasis avan nia pordo. Pasar de Anglia a Francia. Tempo pasas. Pasar de un temo ad altra. Me preter-pasis lua domo. Pasigez la salo, me pregas!

patibulo.x: gallows (in the form: TT ; cf. jibeto).

patino.x: patina, green film formed on metals.

patriotismo.x: (doctrine taught) patriotism. V. exp.: vid. civismo.

patristiko.x: (theol.) patristics. V. exp.: Cienco pri la doktrino dil ekleziala patri.

patroliar.x: (intr.) to go on patrol, go the rounds

patrologio.x: (theol.) patrology. V. exp.: Cienco pri la verki e la vivo dil akleziala patri.

patronesar.x: (tr., intr.) to be a patron (ulu, ulo), to patronize: support (ulu).

patroneso.x: patronage: authority or position of a patron

patrono.x: (antiq.) patron; (modern) patron, supporter, protector; employer; (eccl.) advowee; patron saint

pauzar.x: (intr.) to pause: stop temporarily; (mus.) to make a rest. Ex.: Pauzar dum lektado, dum kantado. Pauzar plurfoye en voyo.

pavano.x: pavan. Def.: Anciena danso (hispana origine); IV-395.

paviliono.x: pavilion: a large peaked tent; a building with a tent-like roof; (cf. tendo).

pavorar.x: (intr.) to be afraid, be in fear, be in a funk

pavoreskar.x: to take fright, begin to be scared

pazar.x: (intr.) to take steps, to stride, step (out), stalk (along)

pazetar.x: to trip along, take short steps

pazigrafio.x: pasigraphy. Def.: Irga sistemo di universala skribado, qua uzas signi, partikulare matematikala simboli, por reprezentar idei, ne vorti.

peano.x: pean, pæan. Def.: Himno o kanto por honorizar ulu, ulo; militala kanto; vinkala kanto.

peco.x: piece; lump (of sugar, of beef, etc.); (cf. fragmento, parto, porciono)

pecope.x: piece by piece, bit by bit, piecemeal

pedo.x: (anat. and fig.) foot; (of animals) paw; (of verse) foot

pektar.x: (tr.) to comb (the hair); to card (wool, etc.)

pektoralo.x: (anat.) pectoral muscle; pectoral, any breast object

pelala.x: relating to the skin, hide; cutaneous (cf. epiderm-ala)

pelerino.x: pelerine, a kind of cape, tippet worn by ladies.

pelmelo.x: pell-mell, hurly-burly, hubbub, jumbled mass, medley, litter

pelo.x: skin, hide (on the body; cf. felo)

pelotigar.x: to make (ulo) into a ball; to wind. Def.: Bulo ek filo volvita; III-205.

peloto.x: ball (formed of thread, silk, etc. wound round)

penacho.x: panache, a plume or bunch of feathers, as on a helmet.

penar.x: (intr.) to take the trouble (to do something or to do something difficult of execution), to take pains; (cf. esforcar)

pendar.x: (tr., intr.) to hang (up or down), suspend, dangle

pendigar.x: to cause (ulu, ulo) to be hanged or hung

pendinda.x: worthy of hanging. Ex.: La frukti pendas de la abori. Pendar animalo per la pedi. La judiciisto pendigas la trahizinti (E. the judge caused the traitors to be hung). Juvelo pendanta.

penege.x: with great trouble, with much difficulty

penetrar.x: (tr., intr.; lit. and fig.) to penetrate, pierce (cf. perforar, borar)

penigar.x: to put (ulu) to trouble (to do something)

penseskar.x: to have an idea; (cf. meditar, reflektar, rezonar, intelektar, imaginar, konceptar, memorar, sonjar, revar, kredar, judikar, opinionar). Def.: Formacar ideo pri ulu, ulo. Ex.: Me pensis (pri) ulo quo povas helpar vu. La homo qua pensas povas esar la mastro di qui ne pensas. Pensez ante ke vu facos to.

pensionar.x: (tr.) to pension (soldiers, etc.) to pay a regular stipulated sum for board and lodging

pensiono.x: regular payment, board and lodging, regular charge. Def.: Pagar reguloze ula sumo por manteno. V. exp.: Pensiono esas sumo quan ulu pagas o recevas reguloze por lua manteno. Ica senco kontenas ta di pensiono (1) di oficero od oficisto en retreto; ol kontenas anke ta di la pensiono (2) di skolano «interna», qua lojas e nutresas en edukerio, e ta di la pensiono (3) di gasto di hotelo, qua anke lojas e nutresas, o nur nutresas. Takaze ta qua recevas pensiono (1) esus pension-ato, -ario; qua pagas pension (2) o (3) esas pension-anto, -ero; la loko ipsa esas pension-eyo, -erio; V-282.

pentarko.x: pentarchos, one of five rulers; quinquivir.

per.x: (prep.) by means of, through the help of, by, with (marks, instrument, means); (arith.) multiplied by (the sign); (cf. da)

perceptar.x: (tr.) to perceive: to receive impressions of external objects; to feel; discern

percheyo.x: perching place; (fig.) upper gallery in a theater (theatre). V.: exp.: Perchar aplikesas, ne nur a hani, ma ad omnaspeca uceli, e mem metafore ad animali e homi; III-327.

perdesar.x: to be lost, be a loser

perena.x: perennial. Def.: Qua duras plura yari; V-89.

perforar.x: (tr.) to perforate, pierce through; (cf. borar, penetrar). Def.: Truifar sen rotaco; III-165. Ex.: Kuglo perforas korpo, muro.

perifrazar.x: (tr.) to periphrase; express in a roundabout way, by circumlocution. V. exp.: vid.: parafrazo. Exp.: «La rejo dil uceli» esas perifrazo por l’aglo.

periodo.x: (astron., chron.) period: term, portion of time (cf. ciklo, punto)

peripecio.x: peripetia, sudden turn of fortune, vicissitude; (theat.) denouement.

periplo.x: (ancient geog.) periplus (a sailing round). Def.: Historiala nomo di ula specala cirkumnavigi, e naraco di li; V-89.

perisar.x: (intr.) to perish: die; be destroyed, ruined

perjurar.x: (intr.) to perjure: violate one’s oath, (fig.) to break one’s word. Def.: Violacar promiso facita per juro; V-430.

perkutilo.x: instrument of percussion; (of guns) hammer, bolt (which sets off the cartridge). Def.: Frapar forte. Ex.: La perkutilo perkutas la amorcilo. La cimbalisto perkutas la cimbali. La mediko exploras per perkutado.

perkuto.x: percussion: shock of one body against another

permisar.x: (tr.) to permit, allow, give leave to, authorize, give license to; (N.B. This verb is transitive in relation to the thing, but intransitive relative to the person). -o: permission, consent

permutite.x: vice versa. V. exp.: Permutar esas chanjar l’ordino di plura kozi, qui duras formacar kolekturo. Me chanjas mea vesti kande me desmetas uli e metas altri. Ma me permutas li, kande (sen metar li) me chanjas lia ordino en mea vesteyo. Kande on mixas ludkarti qui restas sempre sama, on facas nur permuti; on chanjas li kande on prenas altra paketo de karti vice l’unesma; VII-204.

peroneo.x: (anat.) perone, fibula, small bone of the leg. ? eFS

perono.x: perron, an out-of-door flight of steps; outside stair-case; front-door steps.

peroraciono.x: (rhet.) peroration. Ant.: exordio. Def.: Lasta parto, konkluzo di diskurso.

perpetuigar.x: to perpetuate. Def.: Kontinua, qua ne cesas. Ex.: Perpetua fairo brulis sur la altaro di Vesta. Perpetua movado. Perpetua exilo.

perplexeso.x: perplexity: embarrassment of mind; irresolution. Ex.: Perplexa pro desfacilaji neprevidita. Situeso perplexigiva. V. exp.: Perplexa expresas nociono komplexa, quaze meza inter embarasata e nequieta (kun nuanco di hezito); V-89.

perquizita.x: (tr.) to make (legal) search, inquiry (pri ulu, ulo)

persekutar.x: (tr.) to persecute: harass unjustly; (fig.) to importune, annoy. V. exp.: Persequar esas: proxime sequar persiste, por atingar ulu od obtenar ulo. Ex.: Persequar furtisto. Persequar cervo en chaso. Persequar la glorio, la plezuro, la suceso. Persequar ulu avan tribunalo. Persekutar esas: kruele traktar ulu persiste. Ex.: La mali persekutas la boni, pro ke li odias lo bona. La Kristani persekutesis dum la unesma yarcenti di l’eklezio; V-430.

persequar.x: (tr.) to pursue (with a view to overtake); (jur.) to prosecute

persequeskar.x: to start pursuit; to indict, sue. V. exp.: vid. persekutar.

perseverar.x: (intr.) to persevere, pursue steadfastly: continue on a given course, esp. in the face of discouragement, obstacles; (cf. persistar). Ex.: Perseverar en ula entraprezo. Il esas persever-anta, -ema homo.

persieno.x: persienne, (outside) Venetian shutter; the ordinary outside window-blinds with movable slats; (cf. III-290

persistar.x: (intr.) to persist: hold firm, continue steadfast (en, pri) (cf. perseverar). Ex.: La testo persistas negar. Il persistas en sua opiniono. Persistanta morbo. Persistema homo. V. exp.: vid. insistar.

personego.x: personage: a great person or person of distinction

personeso.x: personality, individuality: quality of being a person

persono.x: person (man, woman, child); (theol., gram.) person; (cf. individuo)

perspektive.x: in perspective, in the distance. Ex.: Lineala perpektivo. Desegnuro perspektiva.

perturbar.x: (tr., astron., social) to perturb, trouble, unsettle, throw into disorder

perukisto.x: wig-maker. Def.: Kuafuro de falsa hararo.

perversa.x: perverse, obstinate in the wrong, wayward, depraved

perversigar.x: to pervert. Def.: Qua havas nenormala o kontreetika tendenci (o gusto); III-205.

peskar.x: (intr.) to fish, angle (por, per, ek); (tr.) to draw (ulo) out of the water, to catch (also refers to coral fishing, pearl fishing, etc.)

peskyuro.x: licence, right to fish. Ex.: Peskar karpo.

pesto.x: pestilence, pest, plague (cf. kontagio); (fig.) bane, scourge

peticionar.x: (intr.) to petition: present a petition (ad ulu)

petrelo.x: (orni.) stormy petrel; Mother Carey’s chicken (Procellaria pelagica).

petrisar.x: (tr.) to knead: work into a uniform mass (dough, etc.).

petro.x: stone (as a material substance; cf. roko, stono)

petular.x: (intr.) to be frisky, impetuous, boisterous, turbulent, unruly.

pezajo.x: a heavy object; weight for weighing

pezar.x: (intr.) to weigh (dek grami, e.c.) (cf. grav-esar, ponderar)

piacho.x: a bigot. Def.: Qua reverencas Deo.

piafar.x: (intr., of horses) to make a piaffer, to paw the ground.

piedestaleto.x: piedouche: small pedestal supporting a bust, etc.

piedestalo.x: pedestal (of a column, statue, vase, etc.)

pigmento.x: (natural, physiol.) pigment (cf. farbo). Def.: Materio naturale koloroza, qua donas koloro ad altra kozi; V-660. Ex.: Okulala, harala, pelala pigmento.

pigmeo.x: pigmy, dwarf; (fig.) a person without talent, or merit, or power.

pikar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to prick; prod, goad, puncture; sting

pikbastono.x: a goad (as for oxen). Ex.: Pikar sua fingro. Pikar bovulo, kavalo, papero. Vorti pikanta. Pikanta mustardo.

piketar.x: to peck at; strike with the beak

piklaji.x: pickles: vegetables, fruit or other food preserved in spice or vinegar pickle and used as a condiment

pikono.x: roko o harda materii (ex. makadamo). La (one-pointed) pick, pickaxe (cf. piocho). Def.: Instrumento por exkavar fera parto esas karakterizita per un pinto perpendikla a la mancho; VI-533.

piktar.x: (tr.) to paint (pictures in oil or water colo(u)rs); (cf. indutar, farb-izar)

pilio.x: (elec.) pile, primary cell. Ex.: La pilio di volta.

pilo.x: (of animals, also bot.) hair, bristle; (of persons) hair of all parts of body except top of head; (cf. haro); (of sheep, camels, etc.) wool; (of cloth, of hats) nap

piloriagar.x: to pillory, put (ulu) in a pillory.

pinchuro.x: the mark of a pinch (as on the skin).

piniono.x: pinion: small cog-wheel geared to a larger wheel.

piochagar.x: to dig (ulo) with a pickaxe. Def.: Instrumento por exkavar harda materii, di qua la fera parto havas du extremaji opozita (relate la mancho). VI-533.

pipeto.x: (chem.) pipette: tube to transfer liquids; dropping tube.

pipso.x: pip, roup: disease of birds, poultry.

piramidifar.x: to form a pyramid, rise like a pyramid

piro.x: (bot.) pear; (fig.) any pear-shaped instrument or object; e.g. an electric light bulb

pirogo.x: (Indian or savage) canoe, pirogue. Def.: Kanoto di sovajo, facita ek arboro-trunko o kortico (quale uzata da la Malayi Nord-Amerikan Indiani, e.c.).

pirograbar.x: (tr.) to engrave on wood with a hot point

pirometro.x: pyrometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la maxim alta temperaturi.

piruetar.x: (intr.) to pirouette: turn, whirl on toes; (of horses) to whirl.

pistar.x: (tr.) to pound, bruise, crush (with a pestle); (cf. triturar)

pitono.x: (myth.) Python; (zool.) python (genus: Python). Def.: Serpento reala e mitologiala; III-142.

pituitala.x: pituitary; (cf. muko). Def.: Humoro viskoza sekrecata da ula mukozi (di la nazo, di la bronkii) en stando morbala; IV-585.

pivoto.x: pivot: (mechan.) pivot, journal: pin or short shaft on which anything turns: (milit.) the wing on which a troop turns; (fig.) main hinge, principal agent

placo.x: place: open public space, as a square or circu in a town (cf. loko).

plado.x: plate: small dish to eat off (cf. disho)

plafono.x: (arch.) ceiling, upper surface of a room

plago.x: sore: break in soft part of body from disease; (fig.) plague, scourge (cf. pesto). Ex.: Ilua tota korpo esa kovrata da plagi. L’alkoholo esas plago di la publika saneso. Atilla nomizis su la plago di Deo.

plajiar.x: (tr., intr.) to plagiarize (words, ideas from another).

plajo.x: beach, (sea-) shore, strand. V. exp.: Plajo esas la bendo plu o min larja di sulo, quan la maro alterne kovras e deskovras; existas plaji de sablo e plaji de rul-stoni. La rivo esas la limito inter la maro e la tale dicita ferme (sika) tero. La litoro esas la tota regiono adjacanta la rivo. La plaji esas nur aparta ed eceptala loki en la rivi: ne omna rivo esas plajo (ex.: rivo ek klifi od ek rokaji); IV-606.

plako.x: plate, sheet, slab: flat piece of metal, etc.; tablet, plaque

plakoizar.x: to plate (over), sheathe, sheet over, veneer, overlay

plana.x: plane: without elevations or depressions; level, flat (cf. plata)

planajo.x: a flat thing or place; plain: level land

plantacajo.x: something planted, slip, set, crop, plant (cf. planto)

plantacar.x: (tr.) to plant: set in the ground for growth

plantizar.x: to ornament, cover with plants (cf. plantacar).

plasizar.x: to place (ulu); to put (ulo, ulu) in a place (cf. pozar, lok-izar)

plastrono.x: plastron: breast-plate; breast-pad; shirt-bosom, -front. Def.: Tri senci: pectoral peco di kuraso; pektoral peco, polster-izita, di vesto di skermisto; pektorala parto di kamizo; IV-202. ?eFI

plata.x: flat: having an even surface (cf. plana); (fig.) dull, insipid

platajo.x: a flat object; plateau, upland, table-land

platformo.x: platform; horizontal surface or structure (cf. programo).

plaudar.x: (tr., intr.) of liquids, waves: to break, beat against, splash

plear.x: (tr.) to play (a musical instrument, a role in a play; cf. ludar)

plebecito.x: referendum: (hist.) plebescite, plebescitum. Def.: Voto pri ula lego o rezolvo da omna civitani di un stato (ex. en Suisa); III-142

pledar.x: (intr., legal and gen.) to plead, argue (at the bar); to allege

plektar.x: (tr.) to (inter-) lace, plait, twine, wreath, weave (straw, etc.; cf. tres-igar)

plenipotenco.x: plenipotence, fullness or completeness of power

pleto.x: tray, shallow receptacle for tea, pins, diamonds, etc.

pleuronekto.x: (ich.) brill, flounder: a flat fish of several species (Pleuronectes).

plezar.x: (intr.) to be pleasing, be agreeable; (tr.) to please (ulu)

plezuro.x: pleasure: delight, joy. Ex.: Facar ulo kun plezuro. Dansar esas plezuro.

pliko.x: (med.) plica, a disease of the hair.

plisar.x: (tr.) to plait; (fig.) to pucker, crease. Def.: Facar reguloza falduri en ulo; (kp. frunsar).

plombsiglar.x: (tr.) to seal or stamp with lead

plugilo.x: a plow. Def.: Sulkizar la sulo per plugilo. (fig.) Spadagar la tero por plantacar.

plumaro.x: plumage, feathers (cf. penacho); collection of pens

plumo.x: (of birds) feather, plume; (for writing) quill, pen

plump.x: thump! slap! bang! Def.: Indikanta falo, precipue di ulo grava, mola, inerta; IV-511

plumpa.x: (of things) unwieldy, unmanageable from bulk or weight; (of persons) thick-skulled, dull-witted

plureso.x: two or more of the same kind

plushatra.x: plush-like, shaggy. Def.: Stofo simila a veluro e kun longa pili o lanugo sur un latero.

plutokratio.x: plutacracy: rule and power of the rich.

pluvigar.x: to cause to rain; to shower down upon

po.x: for, at the price of, in exchange for (indicates value received or given); (fin.) per (cent.) as, kin po cento: (at the rate of) five percent (cf. procento)

poeziajo.x: a piece of poetry, a poem

poka.x: few: not many; little: not much

pokope.x: by degrees, little by little, bit by bit

polemikar.x: (intr.) to carry on a controversy (kun ulu)

poliandreso.x: polyandry; (bot.) polyandria. Def.: (Muliero) qua samtempe havas plura spozuli; (speco di planti) qua havas duadek o plu multa stamini.

polifonio.x: polyphony. Def.: Multeso de soni diferanta ma sam-tempa.

poligrafio.x: the art of operating a polygraph.

poligrafo.x: multigraph, poylgraph: instrument for multiplying copies of a writing

polipo.x: (zool.) polyp; (med.) polypus: a species of tumor.

polisar.x: (tr.) to polish (marble, wood, steel, etc.) (fig.) to polish: refine (the mind, one’s style, manners, etc.) Def.: Igar ulo glata e brilanta per friciono; brunisar.

politeknikala.x: polytechnic: relating to arts and sciences

politeknikano.x: (fig.) a student in a p. school

polsterajo.x: what stuffed, padded: bolster, pad, cushion, padded quilt, etc.

polutesar.x: (fig.) to be polluted; to have seminal discharge or emission.

polvifar.x: to rise (of dust); to be dusty (of roads)

pomadizar.x: to apply p. to (hair or exterior of the body)

pomelo.x: pommel (of saddle); knob on the hilt of a sword or pistol. Def.: Mikra bulo ye l’extremajo di espado, di pistolo od avan solo; III-142.

pompono.x: pompon, top-knot; tuft added to dress of a soldier, etc.

ponderar.x: (tr.) to weigh (ulu, per ulo); (cf. pezar); (fig.) to ponder (mentally)

poniardagar.x: to poniard, stab (ulu) with a dagger; (cf. dago).

ponteto.x: foot-bridge; (R.R. culvert); (nav.) gangway; (tech.) trigger-guard (of a firearm)

ponyeto.x: wrist-band. Def.: La finala parto di la maniko; VI-245. Ex.: Kamizo ne-starchita, nokto-kamizo ne havas mansheti, ma nur ponyeti.

poplito.x: (anat.) ham, region back of the knee joint; (in quadrupeds).

popo.x: (Russian, Grecian) priest, (village) pope. Def.: Rusa (greka) sacerdoto; III-594.

populara.x: popular: prevailing among and liked by the people

populizar.x: to people, populate: furnish with inhabitants

populo.x: people, population (of a town, city, country; cf. habit-ant-aro)

por.x: (prep. indicating aim) for, in view of, in favo(u)r of

porcionigar.x: to portion out (ulo). Def.: Parto de un toto; partikulare ula provizuro de pano, de karno, esanta dividita inter uli.

porkespino.x: (zool.) porcupine (European genus: Hystrix; N. American genus: Erethizon).

pornografio.x: pornography: art or literature of an obscene nature.

portajo.x: that which is carried; load, burden

portalo.x: portal; grand and imposing door (as of a church, etc.).

portar.x: (tr.) to carry, bear, bring, take: convey in vehicles, by ship, hand, or person, also of wind, water, etc. (as agent) to wear (clothes, a sword, etc.)

porteo.x: range, reach of a shot, bullet, of a voice, etc.

portfolio.x: portfolio, a case in which to keep loose papers.

portiko.x: portico, porch, covered space enclosed by columns at entrance of building.

portreto.x: (pr. and fig.) portrait, personal representation by painting, drawing, photography

posedalo.x: possessive case; a possessive. Ex.: Posedar pekunio, domo, ula furio posedis il. Me pagos vu kande me posedos plu multa pekunio. Ka vu esas la posedanto di ta agro? Posedal pronomi.

posedar.x: (tr.) possess, be in possession of, own, have the faculty or quality (cf. havar, proprietar)

posedeskar.x: to become possessor of, take possession of

poshlibro.x: a book for the pocket (cf. burso)

postenizar.x: to post, station (uli, ulu, su) (cf. facionar); Ex.: Stacar en posteno. Gardar posteno. Livar, desertar posteno.

posteno.x: post, a place to guard; beat (of a policeman, etc.)

posterno.x: (fort.) postern; small gate under a rampart.

postigo.x: small casement in a door or window; blind (of a carriage). Def.: (Mikra) parto (ordinare, vitro-plako) di la fenestro o pordo qua esas apertebla.

postisto.x: employee of postal service; letter-carrier; postman

posto.x: mail, post, postal service, public conveyance and delivery, esp. of letters, packages

postpoziciono.x: postposition, a word or particle placed after or at the end of a word.

postular.x: (tr.) to demand, exact, require (ulo, de ulu)

posturar.x: (intr., lit. and fig.) to assume an attitude, to pose (as for a statue, a picture); to sit (for one’s picture)

poto.x: pot, kettle, jug: earthenware or metal vessel used for cooking or merely holding something

povar.x: (tr., intr.) to be able (to do), can (do), could, have the power to

povo.x: power, ability, force, means, might; (polit.) a power, powerful country. Ex.: Ni facas to quon ni povas. Me ne povis venar hiere. Me povabus manjar ol, ma me ne hungris. La povo di la mento. V. exp.: vid. darfar.

pozar.x: (tr., lit and fig.) to place, set, lay (down), ground (cf. depozar)

pozolano.x: pozzolana, a mortar made from volcanic ashes.

pragmatala.x: pragmatical: dealing with practical values or consequences

praktikala.x: pertaining to practice or action, practical (matter)

praktikanta.x: practising. Ex.: On praktikas la medicino, l’agro-kultivado. Esas necesa praktikar longatempe, ante ke on povas divenar habila. Praktikebla ideo, voyo.

praktikar.x: (tr.) to practice, put into practice, exercise; to observe (a rule, etc.)

praktikebla.x: practicable, feasible, possible; (of roads) passable; -isto: practitioner

pramo.x: (nav.) pram(e): flat-bottomed boat used in the Baltic. Def.: Speco di navo (barko) kun plata fundo, nur un ponto, kun segli e remili; IV-462.

prebendo.x: prebend, stipend granted to a prebendary

precedanta.x: antecedant, (cf. antea, antecedento). Def.: Esir en plaso, ofico nemediate avan

precedanto.x: one who has or takes precedence; predecessor (in office); (pl.) predecessors, forefathers

precedar.x: (tr.) to have, to take precedence of, to go before in rank, importance, etc.; (cf. pre-irar)

precede.x: pasar avan altru segun lego, regulo; VI-418. Ex.: Grava aferi precedas la neimportanta.

precedento.x: a precedent, authoritative case, example or instance.

precedo.x: precedence: right or fact of precedency, priority

precipitajo.x: (chem.) precipitate. Ex.: Il precipitis su ek la fenestro. Precipitar naciono en milito.

precipitar.x: (tr., pr. and fig.) to precipitate, cause to fall, hurry along, throw down, hurl headlong, dash down, plunge; (chem.) to throw to the bottom of a vessel

precipuajo.x: the chief thing, essential part, main point

preciza.x: precise, having fixed limitation, not loose, vague or uncertain; definite, distinct, exact, formal, terse; (N.B. not used of persons)

precoza.x: costly, expensive, valuable, precious (in money value)

predikar.x: (tr., intr., lit. and fig.) to preach (ulo, ad ulu); (cf. exhortar)

prefekto.x: (Rom. antiq. and chief administrator of each department in France) prefect.

preferar.x: (tr.) to prefer, like better: give preference in mind to (ulo, kam)

preferinda.x: preferable. Ex.: Preferar mortar kam vivar. Preferar la honoro kam la pekunio.

pregar.x: (tr.) to pray (to) (God); to beg, entreat, beseech (ulu, pri, por); (cf. suplikar)

prekara.x: (tr.) precarious, depending upon the will or pleasure of another; uncertain, unsettled.

prekoca.x: precocious, early, ripe befor the proper season; (of persons) ripe in understanding at an early age. Def.: Developita ante la normal evo; III-606.

premiizar.x: to give a premium or prize to.

premio.x: (com., fin., insurance) premium, bounty, bonus; (in competitions) a prize

prenar.x: to take: lay hold of, by hand, etc.)

preparar.x: (tr., intr.) to prepare (su, ulu, ulo, por, kontre)

preponderar.x: (intr.) to preponderate, have a superiority in weight or influence

presar.x: (tr.) to press, bear upon with force or weight

presbiterio.x: council of parish trustees; vestry council, presbytery (church elders)

preske.x: (adv.) almost, nearly, all but, scarcely. Ex.: Me vendis preske omno. Preske nulo restas. Laboro preske parfinita. Me preske nultempe vidis il. V. exp.: vid. quaze.

preskriptar.x: (tr.) to prescribe, to set down authoritatively, to direct, order; (med.) to direct as a remedy

presktirar.x: (tr., jur.) to bar or be lost by statute of limitation. Def.: Preskrito: perdo od aboliso di yuro pos definita tempo; III-410.

prestaciono.x: (feudal law) prestation. Def.: Speco di kontributo per laboro o pekunio por la manteno di la publika voyi, e.c.; IV-447.

prestajo.x: that which is loaned, a loan

prestijo.x: prestige. Def.: Speco di autoritato od influo, qua venas de l’extera aspekto ed efikas per l’opiniono ed imaginado; IV-447.

pretendar.x: (tr.) to lay claim to (ulo); be a pretender to (a throne, etc.)

preter.x: (prep.) passing, past (by): indicates motion from one side to the other past a certain object

pretextar.x: (tr.) to allege (as a pretext), pretend, feign, sham (ulo)

prevarikar.x: (intr.) to betray one’s trust (N.B. not «to lie»; cf. mentiar)

prevariko.x: breach of trust (esp. in public office). Def.: Faliar sua devo pro interesto o ne-sincereso. Ex.: Ministro, judiciisto, qua prevarikas en sua ofico.

prevosto.x: provost. Def.: Titulo uzata en diversa faki: eklezio, militistaro, polico, etc. (La epiteti o la kuntexto specialigos olu); V-89.

prezenta.x: (in space) present: not absent; (in time) present: not past or future (cf. nuna)

prezenteso.x: presence: existence in a place. V. exp.: On parolas pri persono prezenta same kam evento prezenta; VI-163. Ant.: absenta, pasinta.

prezervar.x: (tr.) to preserve, save: keep from injury (ulu, ulo, de, kontre); (cf. konfitar, konservar)

prezidar.x: (tr., intr.) to preside over; to take the chair, be chairman

prezuntar.x: (intr.) presumptuous, presuming; to have undue confidence in oneself

pri.x: (prep.) about, concerning, relating to, in regard to, in reference to, as regards, re, apropos of

priklar.x: (tr., intr.; of sensation) to prickle, tingle

prima.x: primary: first in order of development, of time; not derived

primara.x: primary, elementary, first or lowest in order

primitivo.x: (hist. gram.) a primitive. Ex.: Primitiva naturo, eklezio, linguo.

priora.x: prior, before (cf. antea); (jur.) priority. Def.: Qua pasas avan irgu pri ula kozo; VI-382. Ex.: La parento havas la yuro di prioreso (pro anteeso) dum un yaro.

privacar.x: (tr.) to deprive, take from, strip off; to bereave

privilejizar.x: to grant a privilege to a (ulu)

prizar.x: (tr.) to appreciate, like, prize, value. Ex.: Prizar la bona qualesi, la meriti, la servado, la judiko, la opiniono, du ulu.

prizentar.x: (tr.) to present: set or place before; (milit.) to present (arms); to introduce; (cf. ofrar, montrar, expozar). Ex.: Prizentar buketo. Prizentar akredito-letro ad ulu. Ca afero prizentas granda avantaji. Prizentar ulu a la rejo.

pro.x: (prep.) because of, on account of, out of, owing to, in consequence of

probabla.x: probable, likely, having more evidence than the contrary; which is likely to happen

probar.x: (tr.) to test, make trial of, put to test, prove by experiment; (cf. esforcar); (of ore metals) to assay

problematra.x: problematical, doubtful. Ex.: Geometriala problemo. Ol esas problem solvenda. Pozar ulo kom problemo.

procedar.x: (intr.) to proceed, go on (ad ulo); to act, behave in a certain way

procedo.x: proceeding, way of acting, behaviour, process. Ex.: Procedar a la exameno di kandidato. Procedar lente, cirkonspekte. Simpligar la procedo. Procedo kemiala.

procedurema.x: litigious. Ex.: Kodexo di civila proceduro. Spenso di proceduro.

proceduro.x: (jur.) procedure, manner of proceeding; practice; proceedings: measures taken in the prosecution of an action

procento.x: percentage (N.B. does not refer to interest or rent of capital; cf. po and Talmey’s Text Book, p. 82). Def.: Raporto di la du nombri; V-681. Ex.: Il postulas kin po cento kom procento. Me kolokis 1000 fr. ye la procento di quar po cento. La procento di la naski, di la morti, di la mariaji en ula populo o habitantaro.

procesar.x: (intr., jur.) to bring action, go to law, institute proceedings, prosecute, proceed (kontre ulu); (law-) suit, action; trial

procesionar.x: (intr.) to walk in procession, to make a procession (in the streets, in the church, etc.)

prodigar.x: (tr.) to lavish, be prodigal of, be unsparing of

produktar.x: (tr.) to produce, engender, bring forth, bear, yield; (cf. genitar)

profana.x: profane, not sacred; related to secular affairs; proceeding from contempt of sacred things

profanacar.x: (tr.) to profane: treat sacred things with abuse, irreverence, contempt; to desecrate; (tr.) to degrade, debase

profanajo.x: a profane thing or act (cf. profanacar); Ex.: Profana parolado, historio, konduto, ago, naturo. Mixar la profanaji kun la sakraji.

profesar.x: (tr.) to profess, make a profession of

profeso.x: profession. Def.: Deklarar publike. Ex.: On profesas religio, kredo, doktrino, fido pri ulu od ulo.

profetala.x: prophetic, relating to a prophet. (cf. pre-dic-anta).

profilizar.x: to draw or show (ulu, ulo); in profile

profitar.x: (tr., intr.) to profit (pecuniarily or otherwise); (cf. ganar)

profitigar.x: to cause profit to (ulu). Def.: Avantajizar per ulo; ganar per ulo. Ex.: Profitar (ulo) per komercaji vendita, konsilo donita.

profunda.x: deep, profound: extending far below the surface; (fig.) abstruse, sagacious

prognozar.x: (tr., med.) to prognosticate: foretell (ulo) from present symptoms; to make a prognosis.

programo.x: program, written outline of entertainment or ceremony; (of a theater) playbill; (of a political party) platform; (in a university) syllabus; (fig.) plan, project.

progresemo.x: a progressive person; (fig.) a liberal, radical. Ex.: La atako kontre l’enemiko progresas. La progreso di incendio, di inundado, di studiado, di morbo. Ant.: retro-irar, regresar.

projektaparato.x: a projector. Ex.: Korpo qua projektas sua ombro sur altra. Projekto di Mercator.

projetar.x: (tr.) to plan, scheme, purpose, to form a project

proklamar.x: (tr.) to proclaim, cry out, give out

prokuraco.x: procuration: power to act for another, proxy; the instrument which empowers, warrant, letter of attorney

prolixa.x: prolix, verbose, diffuse (style, discourse, narrative, etc.)

prolongar.x: (tr.) to lengthen, extend (by addition, in space)

promenar.x: (intr.) to go for a walk, promenade, walk, stroll (for pleasure)

promisar.x: (tr.) to promise (ulu, ad ulu; facar ulo); (fig., of weather, etc.) to forebode

promocar.x: (tr.) to promote: raise, advance (someone to a higher rank, grade)

pronacar.x: (tr.) to pronate: turn the palm of the hand downward or backward

pronar.x: (intr., R.C. ch.) «to pronate». V. exp.: Prono esas nek prediko nek solena diskurso. Ol kontenas diversa prego-formuli, rekomendi, konsili, avizi e fine instrukto-diskurso familiara facata por la parokiani dum la meso. Dec. 1538, M.XI 67.

pronta.x: ready: prepared, in readiness; willing, disposed

propagar.x: to propagate: multiply or continue by generation; (fig.) to spread abroad, diffuse; to make propaganda

propozajo.x: what is proposed, proposition; V. exp.: vid. ofrar.

propozar.x: (tr.) to propose: to offer (ulo) for consideration; to propound; to move (a resolution or amendment)

propra.x: own, belonging to, proper, peculiar to

proprajo.x: something which belongs to someone or something, peculiarity, characteristic, attribute, property, one’s own; (cf. singular-ajo, partikular-ajo)

proprietar.x: (tr.) to own: have legitimate possesion of (cf. posedar)

proprigar.x: to appropriate: consign to a particular person

prosektoro.x: prosector: assistant disector or professor of anatomy.

proskribar.x: (tr.) to proscribe, outlaw. V.exp.: vid. exilar.

prospekto.x: prospectus: preliminary statement of a plan, scheme, or literary work.

prosternigar.x: to cause someone to prostrate himself. Def.: Jetar su avan ulu, ulo, kom signo di adoro o humila respekto (ago o gesto ceremoniala).

prostitucar.x: (tr.) to prostitute, make a prostitute of (ulu); (fig.) to degrade (su); put (ulu, ulo) to a base use

prostracar.x: (intr.) to be in a stare of prostration (extreme physical weakness) be prostrated

prostraco.x: (med. and gen.) prostration (cf. prosterno). Def.: Esar en stando di extrema depreso, mentala o korpala.

protagonisto.x: protagonist: (theater) chief actor; (fig.) one who takes the lead in any great matter.

protektato.x: person protected; (fig.) protégé. Ex.: Protektar lo febla, la inocenti, la urbo. Protektata kontre la koldeso.? DEFIRS

protektorato.x: protectorate. Def.: Autoritato asumita da plu-forta stato super inferiora o dependata stato, partikulare pri la relati exterlanda.

proteo.x: (myth.) Proteus; (fig.) a man who frequently changes his opinions; (zool.) proteida

protestar.x: (intr.) to protest (publicly); (tr., com.) to protest (payment on a bill). Def.: Asertar forte, solene, publike. Ex.: Protestar kontre abrogo. Il protestas ke omno esis facata kontre lua volo. Protestar pago.

protezo.x: (surg.) prosthesis. Def.: Adjunto di artificala parto por remplas-igar parte o tote korpala defekto (ex.: artificala gambo).

protokolo.x: (parl.) written minutes (of proceedings); (diplom.) protocol; «proces verbal», official report (by functionary, as of a crime).

protuberanco.x: (anat., astron. and gen.) protuberance, prominence: projecting part.

proverbeskar.x: to become a proverb; become proverbial

provinco.x: province; (fig.) shire, country district or region outside of a capital city

provizar.x: (tr.) to provide, supply, furnish (ulu, per ulo); to victual

provokar.x: (tr.) to provoke: call forth; incite, incense

proxeneteso.x: business, position of being a pimp. Def.: Persono qua agas kom mediacero en shaminda afero.

proxim.x: (prep.) near, by, close to, nigh to; (of time and space; for quantities cf. cirkum; cf. apud)

proximeskar.x: to draw nigh, approach, to approximate

prozaltra.x: prosaic, dull, matter of fact; -atr-eso: prosiness

prudajo.x: a prudish act. Def.: Afektacante pudoroza.

pruntajo.x: that which is borrowed, a loan.

pruo.x: (nav.) bow, prow. Def.: L’avana parto di navo o batelo.

pruvar.x: (tr.) to prove, demonstrate by experiment or argument (ulo, per ulu)

psalmodiar.x: (intr.) to psalmodize, to sing psalms; (tr.) to drone out, recite (ulo) in a sing-song manner

psalmodio.x: psalmody, psalm-singing. (fig.) sing-song. Def.: Psalmodio: maniero kantar la psalmi (aplikebla ad altro kam psalmi); IV-515.

pseudonimo.x: pseudonym, nom de plume, alias. Def.: Aganta o skribanta kun falsa nomo.

psikala.x: psychical. Def.: La koncio fenomenala, la objekto di la «psikologio» (tale psiko esas plu generala kam anmo); V-32. Ex.: Psikala kauzi, qualesi, dolori.

psikiatrio.x: psyschiatry. Def.: Kuracado di mentala morbi.

psikologio.x: psychology. Def.: Ta parto di filozofio qua traktas la mentala fakultati ed agado di la psiko.

publicano.x: (Rom. hist.) publican. Def.: Recevisto dil imposto o censo por la Romani (e pro to odiata e desestimata da la Judi); VII-281.

publicisto.x: publicist. Def.: Persono qua skribis od esas erudita pri la yuri di nacioni, nacional ekonomiko, e.c.

pudorar.x: (intr., esp. of women) to feel a natural shame, modesty; be modest

pufo.x: large stuffed footstool; round ottoman seat. Def.: Sidilo (ped-apog-ilo) polsterizita (sen ula dors-apogilo): II-647.

pugno.x: fist, -o-frap-ar: (tr.) to strike with the fist

puliaro.x: bock and tackle, hoisting gear, compound pulley.

pulsar.x: (tr., intr.) to push, thrust, drive (by force or violence); to impel (by pressure); to displace (by effort); to throb, pulsate, beat (as heart); (cf. shovar)

pultro.x: poultry, collective name for all domestic fowls; (cf. hano)

pulular.x: (intr.) to pullulate: gow or germinate abundantly (cf. mult-eskar; formik-umar)

pulverigar.x: to reduce (ulo) to powder, to pulverize

pulvero.x: powder, any dry stuff composed of small particles, as used in guns, pharmacy (cf. polvo, pudro)

puncar.x: (tr.) to punch: indent with pump or die

puncilo.x: punch. V. exp.: Puncar diferas de la stampo per ke stampar esas nur imprimar sur surfaco, kontre ke puncar esas penetrar o mem borar ula korpo; II-357.

puncionar.x: (tr. surg.) to puncture, tap (a tumor, etc.).

punsar.x: (tr.) to pounce (a design). Def.: Kopiar desegno per pulvero, quan on pasigas tra la trui di papero perforita segun la linei di la desegno; VI-116.

puntizar.x: to dot, prick, mark (ulo) with a point; to punctuate

punto.x: (geom., astron., typo., play) point; dot; position; period; small hole (as made by a needle or awl)

pupitro.x: desk for reading, writing, drawing, etc. (N.B. not pulpit; cf. katedro)

pupo.x: poop, stern (of a ship, boat). Def.: Dopa parto di navo, di batelo; III-594.

pura.x: pure (air, water, blood, wine, race, life, style, intentions, mathematics, etc.); genuine, unmingled, unalloyed; plain, mere, sheer; downright

pureo.x: purée, a thick soup, as of vegetables, boiled and strained.

purgar.x: (tr. lit. and fig.) to purge (the body, soul, mind, etc.)

purgilo.x: a purging instrument. V. exp.: Purgar: kuracar per purgivo (quale purgar intestini); liberigar de nepurajo e stranjeraji (quale purgar metalo); liberigar de kulpi etikal, intelektala (quale purgar de prejudiko, misopiniono).

purismo.x: (rhet.) excessive nicety, esp. in choice of words

pustuleto.x: small pustule; pimple (filled with matter). V. exp.: vid. papulo.

putativa.x: putatative, reputed, supposed. Def.: Quan on supozas havar legal existo. Ex.: Putativa mariajo.

puteo.x: well: shaft sunk in the ground for water, oil

qua.x: (relative and interrogative pronoun; acc. quan)  who, what, which (person) (Note:  qua used as an interrogative adjective has the same form in the plural as  in singular; ex.:  qua membri ne pagis ankore: which members have not paid yet?; used  substantively it takes the form  qui; (cf. Talmey’s Text Book, p. 26)

quadranto.x: (instrument) quadrant; (geom.) quadrant:  quarter of a circumference of a circle; (cf. VI-322).

quadratigar.x: to  s. (ulo), to form in s.s (uli)

quadratizar.x: to cover (ulo) with s.s, to checker

quadraturo.x: (astron.) quadrature, quartile (aspect or relation of  90 degrees).

quadrilo.x: quadrille (dance and music); troop of horsemen (at a  tournament); a game of cards played by four persons.

quadriremo.x: (antiq.) quadrireme: galley with four banks of oars.

quadro.x: freestone, ashlar, hewn or squared stone; opp. of kruda stono.

quala.x: what (= what sort of, of what kind, what quality; indicating  comparison)

qualifikanto.x: (R.C. rel.) a  qualificator. Def.: Expresar la qualeso di, atribuar qualeso ad ulu, ulo. Ex.:  L’adjektivo qualifikas la nomo. Qualifikar ulu kom fripono. La verko esas  qualifikita kom herezioza.

qualifikar.x: (tr.) to qualify: to ascribe the quality of; (gram.)  to express a quality; to style, term

qualifiko.x: qualification: attribution of a quality or title

quankam.x: (conj.) although, though. Ex.: Il esas jeneroza, quankam  il ne esas richa. Quankam il esas mea amiko.

quanteso.x: (an abstract) quantity (as in math., physics, music, etc.)

quartermastro.x: (milit.) quartermaster, one who provides quarters,  provisions, etc.; (nav.) quartermaster, a petty officer rating.

quartero.x: quarter, district, ward, section of a city.

quarto.x: (mus.) fourth; (fencing) quarte; (piquet)  quart; (nav.) a four (or two) hour watch

quatreno.x: quatrain. Def.: Poemeto di quar versi; III-143.

questionaro.x: set of questions (as for an examination, etc.)

questionpunto.x: q.  point. V. exp.: vid.  demandar, inquestar.

quietigar.x: to tranquilize,  comfort, calm, reassure, quiet down (ulu)

quik.x: (adv.; of time) immediately, at once, directly, forthwith  (N.B. not the E. «quick»; cf. rapide, balde, subite)

quika.x: done or happening at once, instantaneous, immediate

quinino.x: (chem.) quinine, quinia. Def.: Alkaloido extrakta di  quino.

quinkunco.x: quincunx. Def.: Kinopa dispozo di kozi (un en omna angulo e  un meze di quadrato).

quintesenco.x: (lit. and fig.) quintessence, essential thing, pith  (of a matter).

quinto.x: (mus.) quint: interval of five consecutive notes; (fig.)  a tenor violin; (piquet) quint, a sequence of five cards; (fencing)  quinte, fifth guard.

quiproquo.x: quid pro quo, mistake, blunder. Def.: Intermixo di du personi  o kozi; V-25.

quirito.x: quirite, a citizen of ancient Rome in his civil capacity.

quirlar.x: (tr.) to twirl, querl; turn or wind (ulo) around.  V. exp.: Agitar liquido, ex. kremo, per quirl-ilo.

quita.x: quit(s), clear; rid, free (de, pre ulo); discharged (from  debt)

quitigar.x: to receipt (a bill, etc.); to give a receipt to (ulu);  to pay off, clear up

quoto.x: quota, portion, share, contribution. Def.: Parto quan on devas  pagar o recevar, en repartiso di ula sumo totala.

rabatar.x: (tr.) to make a reduction in (value or price); (cf. diskontar)

rabinisto.x: rabbinist, one who adheres to the tradition of the rabbins.

raciono.x: (faculty) reason, power of understanding, intellect; (cf. motivo, expliko, kauzo, rezonar)

radiar.x: (tr., intr.) to radiate, irradiate: to emit rays or beams

radiatoro.x: radiator (of heat); cooling apparatus. Def.: Aparato destinita cedar kaloro a l’aero cirkondanta (quale l’aparati, qui varmigas nia domi, e l’aparati, qui koldigas l’aquo en la motori di automobilo); V-626-7.

radikizar.x: to plant: fix (ulo) in earth by roots

radiko.x: (of plants, etc., also gram., math.) root; (gram.) root, stem, radix, radical, primitive word or syllable; (fig.) beginning, origin

radio.x: ray, beam, gleam; (geom.) radius; (of a wheel) spoke; (ich.) ray, skate

radiografar.x: (tr.) to photograph (ulu, ulo) by means of x-rays

radioskopar.x: (tr.) to view an opaque object by means of Röntgen rays

radotar.x: (intr.) to be in his (or her) dotage, to talk drivel; nonsense

rafinar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to refine (metal, sugar, the taste, etc.); (cf. pur-igar; delikat-igar)

rafinito.x: refined person: one who has a delicate taste, in art, literature

rago.x: tatter: cloth torn and hanging (cf. shifono)

raguto.x: (cook.) ragout: a highly seasoned dish; a stew; hash.

rajuntar.x: (tr.) to overtake, catch up to. Def.: Atinger ulu, ulo, sequinte lu kun plu granda rapideso; III-470. Ex.: Il jus departis, ma me esperas balde rajuntar il.

rakar.x: (tr.) to draw, rack off (wine, etc.) (fig.) to extract, worm out (secrets, money, etc.) V. exp.: To ne esas trans-varsar (varsar ek un vazo en altra per la suprajo), ma pasigar (liquido) de un vazo en altra, cherpante sube (per robineto o sifono); III-77.

rakontachar.x: to tittle-tattle. V. exp.: vid. naracar.

rakontar.x: (tr.) to recount, tell (a made up story, fiction, something which never happened, is not true)

raliar.x: (tr., intr., milit. and fig.) to rally (troops). Def.: Kunvenigar hazarde soldati dispersita, ne segun individuala ordino; metafore signifikas adhero (plu or min bonvoloza) a partiso, a persono, e.c.; V-742.

ramo.x: small bough, twig, small branch (of a tree); (fig.) a subdivision or branch artery, vein; branch of family, etc.

rampo.x: (upward) slope, gradient, incline, ramp. V. exp.: vid. pento.

rangizar.x: to place (ulo) in rows, put (uli) in ranks; to class (persons, things) (cf. lok-izar)

rango.x: row, file, tier, range; (degree, station) rank, order

rankorar.x: (intr.) to have a grudge, a ranco(u)r, spite; to feel resentment, animosity (kontre ulu, pri, pro, ulo).

ranuro.x: groove: a long, square-cut, sunken channel in wood or metal; (firearms) rifling; (cf. kanelo).

rapecar.x: (tr., of clothing) to piece, put a piece in, patch; (of shoes) to cobble; (cf. reparar).

rapida.x: (in space and time) rapid, swift, quick, prompt, fleet, speedy, fast (cf. ajila, hast-ema, alert)

rapo.x: (bot.) a variety of turnip (Brassica rapa rapifera).

raportar.x: (tr.) to make a report on, to report (ulo, ad ulu)

rapsodio.x: rhapsody: poem recited by a rhapsodist; (fig.) rambling composition.

raptar.x: (tr.) to sieze and carry away by violence, pillage, kidnap, ravish

raptocido.x: murder (attended) with robbery. V. exp.: vid. furtar, extorsar.

rara.x: rare, seldom occuring, not frequent, infrequent, unusual; (cf. skarsa)

rarajo.x: a rarity, curiosity. Def.: Des-ofta, des-frequa; V-595. Ant.: ofta, frequa, cf. skarsa.

raso.x: (human, animal) race, stock, breed; (fig.) family, line, ancestry, blood; (agri.) variety

rastaquero.x: a foreigner or stranger travelling without known means of existence; a fashionably dressed swindler.

rastar.x: (tr.) to rake: clean (ulo) with a rake

rasteliero.x: rack, wooden frame of open work, as for fodder, for arms, etc.

ratifikar.x: (tr.) to ratify, confirm (a treaty, an act, etc.). Def.: Autentigar ulo ja facita o promisita.

rauto.x: rout, a fashionable assembly, a large evening party.

ravinizar.x: to gully out (by torrent), to cross (a land) with ravines. Def.: Longa, profunda e streta exkavuro formacita da torento.

ravisante.x: admirably, wonderfully well. Ex.: Vua kantado ravises me. Me esis en raviseso (od, ravisata). Il kantas ravisante.

re.x: (mus.) re, D, the second note of the diatonic scale.

reala.x: real: actually existing, not imaginary, not fictitious

realeskar.x: to become or be realized; be converted into money; (fig.) to come to pass

realigar.x: to realize: make real, bring (ulo) into being; (fin.) to convert into money

rebelaro.x: (collect.) rebels. Def.: Qua violente refuzas obediar autoritato yurizita. Ex.: La rebela anjelo. Rebelo kontre rejo. Ant.: obedi-anta, -ema.  ? DEFIS

rebordizar.x: to put a raised edge on (ulo). V. exp.: Flanjo existas nur en tubi. Rebordo ne esas simpla bordo, ma bordo salianta ofte perpendikla a la chefa parto (quale rebordo di chapelo); IV-642.

recepcionar.x: (tr., tech.) to take over. V. exp.: Examenar la qualesi di furnisajo e pose decidar pri lua acepto o refuzo. VII-480.

recepto.x: (med., cook) recipe, receipt (cf. preskripto). Def.: Formulo qua indikas la kompozuro di ula medikamento o la ingrediento di ulo.

recevar.x: (tr.) to receive, accept (something offered, given, sent)

recevatesto.x: acknowledgement of receipt. V. Exp.: On recevas simple to, quo donesis o sendesis, mem ne demandita o ne expektata. On recevas donacajo, pensiono. On aceptas kande on voluntas recevar (gasto, e.c.). Obtenar esas recevar kozo, quan on deziras, demandas, por qua on konkursis (premio) od irge penis; II-647.

recidivar.x: (intr., jur.) to repeat the same offence, to commit the same crime again; (med.) to reappear (said of a former illness)

recidivo.x: recidivism: relapse into crime or illness, second offense

recipiento.x: (chem., phys.) recipient: receiving vessel for gases or liquids.

recitar.x: (tr.) to recite: repeat out loud something learned (a lesson, etc.)

recitativo.x: (mus.) recitative: sort of a musical declamation used in operas, etc.

redaktar.x: (tr.) to draw up, word (a document); to edit (a newspaper, journal) (cf. edit-ar)

redingoto.x: frock coat: double-breasted garment for men, with long skirts before and behind.

reduito.x: (fort.) reduit, inner fortification; (fig.) retreat, refuge. Def.: La senco vulgara e la senco militala esas identa: «loko, angulo en qua on povas retretar, refujar, celar su»; IV-706.

reduktar.x: (tr., intr.; also surg., math.) to reduce (to proper, suitable proportions; cf. diminutar); (jur.) to commute (a sentence)

reduktebla.x: reducible. Ex.: Reduktar (la dimensioni di) mapo, tablo. Reduktar ulu a taco. Reduktar ulo a pulvero. Reduktar frumento a farino. Reduktar rupturo. Reduktar du fracioni a la sama denominatoro.

referar.x: (tr., intr.) to refer (to): to direct, send to another; to attribute, ascribe

referendario.x: referendary, (in France) a former title of certain public officers; (in Germany) young barrister attending the courts and qualifying for the post of «Assessor»

reflektar.x: (tr., phys. sense) to reflect (back), mirror back (ulo); to turn something back; (intr., fig. mental sense) to reflect, consider, meditate especially on something past (pri): -esar: to be reflected (en, sur)

reformar.x: (tr.) to reform: amend for the better (laws, customs, morals, etc.)

refraktara.x: (of substances) refractory, not easily melted, wrought or acted upon

refraktebla.x: refrangible. Ex.: La prismato refraktas la lumo-radii.

refreno.x: refrain, burden of a song; (fig.) constant theme, topic.

refujar.x: (intr.) to take refuge, seek shelter (che ulu, ad ulo). (fig.) to have recourse (to)

refutar.x: (tr.) to refute, confute, disprove. Def.: Kombatar aserto od opiniono per argumenti, qui nuligas ol o qui pruvas la kontreajo. (En proceso, en diskuto, singla partiso penas refutar la aserto o pretendo di l’altra); III-222.

refuzajo.x: what is refused. V. exp.: Vu refuzas, sive kozo quan on ofras a vu, sive kozo, quan on demandas de vu, sive irga propozo quan on facas a vu. Do refuzar = ne aceptar, o ne koncesar (ne volar donar), o ne admisar, o ne konsentar; III-222.

regalar.x: (tr., also fig.) to regale, treat, entertain, feast

regardar.x: (tr.) to pay regard to: to look at something attentively, cast the eye on
