regenerar.x: (tr.) to regenerate: to generate anew; (theol.) to make to be born again; (fig.) to reform, amend. Ex.: La sapto regeneras la aboro-tisui. Bapto esas regenero. Regenerar naciono dekadanta.

regio.x: regie, direct administration, management of government properties (as opposed to contract administration), esp. the excise administration; a government monopoly.

regiono.x: (all senses) region, part of a country, of space, of the body, of a science

registro.x: register, record (of persons); account (of acts and proceedings); (com.) account book

regnar.x: (tr., intr.) to reign: to rule as king or sovereign, to hold sway over (ulu, ulo)

regretar.x: (tr.) to regret, be sorry about (ulu, ulo)

regretinda.x: regrettable. Ex.: Regretar la pekunio spensita, amiko mortinta.

regular.x: (tr., tech. and fig.) to regulate (machines, clocks, etc.)

regulatoro.x: (mechan.) regulator, governor. Def.: Ula parto di mashino qua regulas la movado.

regulizar.x: to make, establish regulations for, impose regulations on

reguloza.x: regular: conformed to rule or law, uniform, constant

rehabilito.x: rehabilitation, vindication. Def.: Riestablisar en lua olima stando, partikulare en yuri. Ex.: Rehabilitar la memoro di kondamnito. Rehabilitar ulu ad lua olima rango, ulu en l’estimo di la populo.

rejimo.x: (polit. social, medic.) regime, regimen; mode or system of rule or management. Def.: Senco politikala: formo o maniero di guvernado. Senco teknikala: maniero plu o min reguloza segun qua ula fenomeno (duranta) eventas. Senco medicinala: maniero (metodoza) di vivar e di nutrar su (to ne esas dieto, nek higieno); IV-580. Ex.: Anciena rejimo. Monarkiala rejimo. Rejimo di karceri.

rekalkar.x: (tr., tech.) to upset (metals); to ram (a gun)

rekalkilo.x: rammer (of a firearm). Def.: Facar preso sur materio cilindroforma (liquida o solida) sur un de lua bazi en la sinso di l’axo, tale ke on kurtigas ol; IV-581.

rekamar.x: (tr.) to figure or work a fabric with gold, silver, silk, etc.

rekapitular.x: (tr.) to recapitulate; sum up the principal points. Def.: Rezumar, kurte repetar o rimemorigar per enumero preciza e kompleta di omna punti, parti, o chapitri; III-206.

reklamacanto.x: claimant. Ex.: Reklamacar objekti pruntita o perdita. Reklamacar sumo debata, salario, honorario (cf. III-409).

reklamacar.x: (tr.) to (re-)claim, put in a claim for (compensation, a reward, what is due, one’s rights, etc.) (cf. postular)

reklamar.x: (tr., intr.) to advertise (loudly), to boom; (cf. avertar)

rekolecar.x: (rel.) to commune with one’s own heart, to turn one’s mind from earthly affairs and piously meditate

rekoliar.x: (tr.) to gather in, in order to save from loss. Def.: Prenar o gardar ulo od ulu abandonita, perdita o falinta; VI-115. Ex.: Rekoliar fragmenti de la naufrajo. Rekoliar la perdita infanti.

rekoltar.x: (tr., also fig.) to harvest, reap, get in (crops), gather in (the fruits of the earth)

rekomendar.x: (tr.) to recommend (ulu, ulo, ad ulu) (cf. konsilar, exhortar)

rekompensar.x: (tr.) to recompense, reward, require, remunerate (ulu, per ulo).

rekordo.x: record (in sports). Def.: Sportala prodajo, oficale konstatita, e qua ecelas super omna agi di sama genero entee facita.

rekortar.x: (tr.) to cut, clip; curtail, (the outside, the edge, the end), to pare, crop, prune, lop (the nails, a garment, a coin) (cf. tondar)

rekrutachar.x: to entice (ulu) into enlisting, to crimp.

rekrutar.x: (tr., milit. and fig.) to recruit, enlist (ulu, ad)

rekta.x: (geom.) straight; not crooked or curved; upright, plumb, erect

rektifikar.x: (tr., chem, and fig.) to rectify (spirits, errors, etc.). Def.: Purigar per distilado; igar exakta; korekt-igar.

rektigar.x: straighten, align, lay out in line; (milit.) to dress the ranks. Ex.: Stacar rekte. Irar segun rekto. Rekta kolumo. Rektigar la trupi. V. exp.: vid. direta, erektar. Ant.: kurva, tord-ita, sinu-oza.

rektoro.x: rector: headmaster of an acedemy, of a university, of a Jesuit college; (cf. paroko).

rekuperar.x: to recover, regain, retrieve, get back the possession or use of, to recoup

rekuperebla.x: (also fin.) recoverable. Def. Ri-aquirar, ri-posedar ulo. ex.: Rekuperar kaloro, sua havaji, spensi, forteso, parol-povo, vid-povo, bon-san-eso. DeFIS

rekursar.x: (intr.) to have recourse to (ad ulu, ulo), to appeal, to resort (ad)

rekurso.x: recourse; application for assistance or protection; resort (to a source of aid)

rekuzar.x: (tr., jur. and fig.) to challenge (a witness, juror); to take exception to (testimony, statements)

rekuzebla.x: exceptionable, challengeable, doubtful. V. exp.: Rekuzar esas teknikal termino di la yurocienco; on rekuzas judikanto o testo (t.e. on ne aceptas lu, ed on exkluzas lu), en ula kondicioni determinita da la legi, ex. kande la senpartiseso di la judikanto o testo esas suspektebla (pro lua relati kun la judikoti, pro lua personal interesti, e.c.). Judikanto povas rekuzar su ipsa spontane pro simila motivi, to esas, refuzas funcionar. Komprenebla, ca vorto povas uzesar kun metafora senco en la komuna vivo; III-222.

relatar.x: (tr., intr.) to have reference to, stand in some relation to, to be related, to relate to; (of persons) to be connected (by business, etc.; N.B. not family; cf. parenta)

relatata.x: correlative. Ex.: «A relatas B» signifikas ke existas «relato» inter A e B. On povas anke «relatigar» A ad (od, kun) B. V. exp.: Relato (matematikala senco): On povas dicar 2 relatas 3, quale 4 relatas 6, od on darfas parolar pri «relato» di 2 a 3. La nociono relato esas multe plu general ed ampla kam la nociono raporto. On bezonas sempre parolar pri relati inter diversa grandaji, e ca relati esas tante generala, ke ne omni povas expresesar per equacioni. La relato di a ad b povas esar irga funciono; la reporto di a ad b esas simple e nur la fraciono a/b; VI-296.

relate.x: relatively, comparatively (not absolutely); in reference to, with regard

relatigar.x: to put (ulu, ulo) into relation or connection (ad, kun ulu, ulo)

relato.x: relation (di ulo ad ulo, ulu kun ulu)

relayo.x: (also elec., teleg.) relay, fresh supply of horses, etc.

relegar.x: (tr., pr. and fig.) to relegate, send off, shut up, consign, seclude (ulu, ulo) in a fixed place

relevar.x: (tr.) to survey, map out, make a plan of; (nav.) take a bearing of (coasts, shores).

religiano.x: believer in a religion; faithful, true believer.

reliquio.x: relic (of saints, etc.); (pl.) mortal remains, relics

remarkigar.x: to cause (ulu) to remark, to attract notice to; (fig.) to state, to say

remarkinda.x: worthy of note, remarkable, curious, notable

remediar.x: (tr.) to remedy (a disease, a sickness); (fig.) to redress, repair, set to rights

remediebla.x: remediable (disease); (fig.) remediar malajo: to remedy an evil

reminicar.x: (tr.) to reproduce or imitate (consciously or not) from memory some literary or musical piece. V. exp.: Reminico ne esas simpla rimemoro: o esas rimemoro di ula literatural o muzikal peco, quan on imitas nevole o nekoncie: to esas esence imito o kopio di artala verko en altra, do tote altra kozo kam la simpla memoro, qua esas nur la kauzo od okaziono di la reminico. On povas havar rimemoro sen pro to facar reminico; V-627.

remisar.x: (tr.) to remit (debts, sins, etc.); (med.) to abate (symptoms)

remisebla.x: remissable: that may be remitted or forgiven, pardonable

remonstrar.x: (intr.) to remonstrate. Def.: Expozar polite (mem a superioro) la nejusteso di la ago; V-25. Ex.: En l’anciena monarkio, la parlamenti havis la yuro facar remonstri al rejo . . . qua generale ne egardis oli.

remonto.x: (milit.) remount(ing): purchase or supply of fresh horses

remorkar.x: (tr., nav. and gen.) to tow, take in tow, tug, haul, drag (a boat, a movable object; cf. tuvar)

remparo.x: rampart, bulwark; (fig.) any means of defence.

remplasar.x: (tr., intr.) to replace: take the place of, be in the place of (ulu, ulo)

remplasigar.x: to replace (ulu da ulu, ulo per ulo)

remulado.x: (cook.) remo(u)lade, a French salad dressing somewhat resembling mayonnaise.

rendimento.x: (tech.) output, efficiency (of machines). Def.: Elekto utila (di mashini).

reneganto.x: (rel. and gen.) renegade: apostate from the faith; backslider. Ex.: St. Petro trifoye renegis Jesu. Renegar sua familio, sua religio.Def.: Deklarar nevere ke on ne konocas ulu, ulo; abjurar (ne-vere); des-agnoskar (ne-vere). V. exp.: vid. renuncar.

renkontrar.x: (tr.) to meet: meet with accidentally when in motion, to fall in with, encounter (ulu, ulo)

rentiero.x: fundholder, stockholder, annuitant, person of independent means

rentifar.x: to bring in revenue, yield an income

rentizar.x: to allow a yearly income to (ulu), to endow (public institutions)

renuncar.x: (tr.) to renounce, give up, relinquish, resign (a position, office). Def.: Cesar dezirar o demandar ulo. Ex.: Me renuncas voyajo, quan me intencas facar; on renuncas yuro, quan on posedas; e.c. Rejido renuncas la trono o la krono, kande, nultempe regninte, il refuzas regnor; IV-100. V exp.: Ni renuncas yuro, precepti o kustumi; ni renegas mastro o nia religio; ni abjuras eroro, od imaginita eroro. Philip V renuncis la krono di Francia; St. Petro renegis sua mastro; Henry IV abjuris la Kalvanismo.

renversar.x: (tr., intr.) to overthrow, throw down, upset (cf. subversar, invers-igar)

renversebla.x: that may be overthrown. Def.: Faligar ulo, ulu ad tero. Ex.: Renversar muro, tablo, inkuyo, veturo, persono, (fig.) esperi. La muro renversis.

reparar.x: (tr.) to repair, restore, mend a road, a house, a machine, a picture; to refit (a ship); (cf. rapecar)

repartisar.x: (tr.) to divide into due proportion, portion out, distribute (ulo inter uli)

repastar.x: (intr.) to take one’s meal, have a meal (che, kun)

repasteto.x: luncheon, light repast. Def.: Manjar ye fixa horo, apud tablo (generale kune); II-74. Ex.: Li repastis che me. La repast-horo. Il manjas quar repasti omnadie.

repentar.x: (tr., intr.) to repent, rue, feel contrition

reperar.x: (tr.) to put a guiding mark on

reperkutar.x: (tr.) to repercuss: to drive or beat back; (of sound) to reverberate

reperkuto.x: repercussion, reverberation, rebound (cf. ri-salto). Def.: Reperkuto: l’ago di korpo shokata, qua shokas sua-vice altra; IV-138. Ex.: Reperkuto di (pafita) kanono.

repertorio.x: a table, index, register by which things can be readily located; (theat.) repertoire; stock-pieces, -plays

repetachar.x: to repeat tediously. V. exp.: On repetas nur paroli; on iteras omna-speca ago; II-80.

repetar.x: (tr.) to repeat: reiterate, tell or say again (what has been told before or what another has said)

repleta.x: (of living beings) chubby, plump, stout, firm-fleshed, replete (from food)

repleteskar.x: to become plump, chubby; (cf. korpulenta, obeza, grasa, plena, ronda). Def.: Qua havas formi ronda e karno ferma, do la pelo kelke tensita. (Lu povas tote ne esar korpulenta, ex. infanto. La repleteso esas signo di saneso); VI-601.

replikar.x: (tr., intr.) to rejoin, retort: to answer to a reply

repliko.x: answer, reply: (jur.) replication: the reply of the plaintiff to the defendant’s plea; rejoinder: the defendant’s answer to the plaintiff’s replication

reportar.x: (intr., stock exchange) to allow a contango

reporto.x: contango, premium or interest paid by a buyer to a seller to be allowed to defer payment until a future settlement; cf. VI-603, VII-354. Ant.: diporto.

repozaltaro.x: (fig.) temporary altar (in the street). Ex.: Lua korpo repozas sub la stono. Il ne dormas, il ne nur repozas. Il repozigas sua kapo sur kuseno. Havar repozo di koncienco.

repozar.x: (intr.) to rest (repose); (cf. dormar, jacar, apogar, haltar)

represar.x: (tr.) to repress, check, restrain, put down, suppress (a revolt, abuses, pride, one’s desires, etc.)

represiva.x: repressive. Def.: Haltigar l’efekto, la progreso di ulo.

reprezelar.x: (intr.) to retaliate, to make reprisals (kontre); (fig.) to give tit for tat

reprezelletri.x: letter of marque and reprisal. V. exp.: Reprezalar esas plu proxima a venjo kam a revancho. To konsistas (precipue en milito) facar a l’enemiko exakte la sama domajo, quan on subisis de lu. To facesas partikulare pri la agi nekorekta e kruela, qui ecesas la «yuri di la milito», exemplo masakro di nekombatanti, incendio di domi e vilaji, destrukto di monumenti, e.c. Reprezalo nule implikas revancho, nam ol facesas ofte de la vinkiti, precipue kande li vinkesas per nekorekta procedi; VI-143; kp. revanchar, venjar.

reprezentar.x: (tr.) to represent, exhibit by resemblance or action; depict; be the representative of

reprimandar.x: (tr.) to reprimand, admonish, rebuke, reprove, chide, lecture (ulu pri, pro ulo) (cf. exhortar)

reprochar.x: (tr.) to reproach, upbraid, taunt, twit (ulo, ad ulu)

repso.x: (fabric) rep. Def.: Stofo ek silko o lano tre forta; III-143.

reptar.x: (intr.) to crawl (as a serpent), to creep (as a child); (fig.) to crawl before one (in an abject manner)

republikisto.x: believer in, partisan of a republic.

repudiar.x: (tr.) to repudiate; to put away (one’s wife). Ex.: Philippe Auguste repudiis sua spozino Ingleburge. V. exp.: Propre, repudiar esas forsendar spozino, «desspozinigar» el segun legal formi. Figure, renegar opiniono, kredo. La repudio diferas de la divorco per ke ol ne bezonas ago di judiciisto o di extera autoritato; III-206.

repugnar.x: (tr.) to have or inspire a repugnance to, to hava an aversion to, to disgust (cf. antipatiar, nauze-igar)

repulsar.x: (tr.) to repel, repulse, rebuff, beat back (cf. retro-pulsar)

reputesar.x: to be held (to be so and so)

requizitar.x: (tr.) to requisition, make demand in the name of the public or of the law for (persons, animals, thigs, services)

resonar.x: (intr., lit. and fig.) to resound: send back sound, (re-)echo

resonilo.x: resonator. Ex.: Ica audeyo resonas perfekte. Voco klara e resonanta. (fig.) Omna loko resonis pro lua prodajo.

resortisar.x: (intr. jur.) to be under the jurisdiction (of), belong to the department, to be the province (of), be under the cognizance

resortiso.x: (legal) jurisdiction, resort; (general) province, department, competence, power

resortmatraco.x: s. mattress; (cf. elastika). Ex.: Resorto di horlojo, di veturo. (fig.) Donar resorto a la spirito.

respektar.x: (tr.) to respect: regard with a degree of reverence or esteem

respirar.x: (tr., intr.) to respire, breathe (cf. aspirar, expirar)

respirebla.x: breathable. Def.: Aspirar l’aero por regenerar la sango e lore expirar ol.

respondar.x: (tr., intr.) to answer, reply, respond (ulo ad ulu)

responsanto.x: one who is responsible; a bondsman

responsar.x: (intr.) to be responsible, be answerable, be accountable (pri ulu, ulo)

restajo.x: that which remains: rest, remainder (of a quantity or sum); leavings, vestige, scraps (cf. reziduo)

restar.x: (intr.) to remain: to be left, to be left remaining; to stay, sojourn, tarry (N.B. not lie at rest, repose; cf. repozar)

restaurar.x: (tr.) to restore. Ex.: Restaurar domo, pikturo, dinastio, arto, lego.

resteyo.x: place of sojourn. Ex.: Nulo restis de nia pekunio. Triadek hoteli restas. Il restis en Roma pos nia departo. Multi restis sur la kombat-agro. Me haltis en la urbo e restis ibe dum du monati. Me brulos to quo restas (od, la rest-ajo). V.exp.: Restar: esar dum kelka tempo en la sama loko o stando, ma ne definitive, t.e. mine kam habitar, ma pluse kam haltar; III-103.

restitucar.x: (tr.) to make restitution of, refund (ulo). V.exp.: Ne simple ridonar, ma ridonar to quon on prenis o gardis sen yuro, a la legitima proprietero; IV-81.

retenar.x: (tr.) to retain, keep, withhold, keep back, detain (cf. ditenar); (arith.) to carry

reto.x: net, mesh: object formed by threads or lines interlaced, network; (anat.) plexus (of nerves etc.); (geom.) chain (of triangles); (arch.) tracery (of windows)

retoracho.x: one who speaks elegantly but uselessly, word-spinner.

retraktamendo.x: forfeit. Ex.: La limako retraktas sua korni. Retraktar sua promiso, sua erori.

retraktar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to retract, withdraw, draw back

retretar.x: (intr., milit., rel., and gen.) to retire, retreat, seclude, draw off, draw back (from active work, duty, the world)

retretoficiro.x: retired or «half-pay» officer. V. exp.: vid. abandonar.

retushar.x: (tr.) to retouch, touch up (a picture, etc.).

revanchar.x: (intr., in good or bad sense) to retaliate, give like for like, get even, requite (su, pri ulu, kontre ulu); to avenge, revenge, take one’s revenge (in return for an injury); (cf. venjar, reprezalar)

revancho.x: retaliation, revenge, avenging. Def.: Retrodonar similajo a similajo, sive bona o mala, ma ofte en mala senco. V. exp.: Revanchar dicesas pri ulu, qua esas vinkata (en milito, konkurso o ludo) e qua inverse vinkas sua vinkinto. Revancho nule implikas ideo di venjo nek sentimento di rankoro, ma admaxime satisfaco propramo. En ludo, jentila ludero, qua vinkis, (ganis), ofras a sua partenero la revancho, o plu exakte la posibleso revanchar; nam ica povas vinkesar en la du foyi; VI-143.

revar.x: (intr.) to day-dream, muse: to see or fancy as if in a dream; (cf. son-jar)

revelar.x: (tr., also theol.) to reveal; (photog.) to develop

revelilo.x: (photog.) developing bath. Def.: Konocigar ulo da ulu, quo esis olim nekonocata, sekreta o celita. Ex.: Revelar la statala sekretaji. Revelar lua komplico. La latenta imajo esas revelata sur la klishuro. La revelado di Santa Ioannes.

revendikajo.x: object claimed; (cf. reklamacar). Def.: Reklamacar ulo quo apartenas a me, e qua esas en la povo di altru. Ex.: Revendikar sua yuri, ulo perdita, domeno.

revendikar.x: (tr., jur. and fig.) to claim (as one’s own), to demand back (ulo)

reverberforno.x: reverberatory furnace. Def.: Absorbar la kaloro e retrosendar ol radiifante; V-67.

reverencear.x: (intr.) to make a bow, on obeisance; (of women) to courtsey (ad ulu, ulo)

reverso.x: the reverse: back side of anything

revizar.x: (tr.) to revise (a book, a judgement, the constitution, etc.); Def.: Emendar; ri-examinar por modifikar.

revokar.x: (tr.) to revoke, repeal (an edict, privileges, a law); to recall (an ambassador); to dismiss (a clerk, officer, official).

revoltar.x: (intr.) to rise in revolt, to rebel (kontre ulu, ulo)

revoltigar.x: to cause to revolt or rebel; (fig.) to stir up, rouse. Ex.: La populo revoltis kontre sua suvereno. (fig.) La raciono revoltas kontre tala absurdeso.

revolucionar.x: (tr.) to revolutionize, to change thoroughly (opinions, an art, a country; (cf. perturbar, subversar)

revuar.x: (tr.) to review, inspect, carefully examine (troops, books, one’s life, etc.)

revulsar.x: (tr., med.) to allay a morbid condition by counter-irritation or the like

revulso.x: revulsion. Def.: Lokale iritar por cesigar konjestioneso od inflameso existanta en altra parto di la korpo.

revuo.x: review, inspection (of troops); review (magazine, book); (fig.) survey, examination.

rezedo.x: (bot.) reseda: mignonette (Reseda odorata); dyer’s weed (Reseda luteola)

rezervano.x: (milit.) reservist. Ex.: Rezervar kelka pekunio por bezoni futura o neprevidebla. Rezervar ula yuro. Rezervo-armeo. Facar mentala rezervo. Mieno rezervema.

rezervar.x: (tr.) to reserve, save, set apart, lay by or up

rezidanto.x: resident. Ex.: Il rezidas en Paris che me. Establisar rezido en ula loko. Ta domo esas lua rezideyo.

rezidar.x: (intr.) to reside, dwell, live, abide (cf. habitar, lojar)

reziduo.x: that which remains: (chem.) residium; settlement (of liquids); (geol.) debris, detritus; (com.) residue, arrear: that which remains (due); (arith.) remainder; (cf. restajo)

rezigar.x: to cut (ulo) close to or even with a surface; to raze, level (ulo) to the ground; (nav.) to razee: cut down; to hug, keep close to (a coast)

rezignar.x: (tr., intr.) to resign (ulo): to be resigned, feel resignation (pri)

rezistar.x: (tr.) to resist, withstand the shock of something; to defend (oneself), strive against (ulu, ulo); to hold against, oppose; not to succumb to (fatigue, etc.)

rezolvar.x: (tr.) to resolve: take or come to a decision (to do something)

rezolvoze.x: resolutely, stoutly. Ex.: Rezolvar parolar ad ulu. Rezolvar facar ulo. Ne facez rezolvi dum la unesma ataki di vua iraco. Homo rezolvema. V. exp.: vid. decidar.

rezonar.x: (tr.) to appply one’s reason to (ulo), to study (ulo)

rezultanto.x: (mechan.) resultant (force). Ex.: La deskonkordo rezultis en civitanala milito. La rezulto esas nekalkulebla. Ica (objekto) esas la rezultajo.

rezultar.x: (intr.) to result (from certain premises, conditions); to follow (from); be the consequence (of)

rezuma.x: summary, compendious. Ex.: La peroraciono rezumas la tota diskurso. Rezumo di la historio di Francia.

rezumar.x: (tr.) to recapitulate, sum up, to summarize

rezume.x: to sum up, upon the whole, in substance

ri.x: (tr.) to call again, call back, recall.

richa.x: (lit. and fig.) rich (esp. in money, land, goods)

richeskar.x: to become, grow rich. Ant.: povra.

rictus.x: (wide) grin, grinning. Def.: Kontrakto muskulala qua deskovras la denti e donas a la boko ridanta aspekto.

ridelo.x: side pole, rack or board placed on a cart to help hold the load; cart-rack.

rideskar.x: to burst out laughing, commence to l.

rifo.x: reef; ledge of rocks standing above the level of the water. V. exp. vid. brizanto.

rigida.x: (lit. and fig.) rigid, stiff, not easily bent, not pliant; (of persons) inflexible, unyielding

rigidigar.x: to stiffen, render inflexible. Ex.: Fera stango esas rigida. Stacar rigida. Koldeso rigidas la fingri. Il esas rigida homo. Ant.: laxa, flex-ebla, mola.

rigoristo.x: rigorist, a person rigid or exact to excess

rigoroza.x: rigorously, with rigour. Ex.: La rigoro di la legi, di la reguli. Rigoroza judiciisto. Rigoroza demonstro.

rimborsar.x: (tr.) to reimburse, repay, refund (in money). Ex.: Pagez por me, me rimborsos a vu.

rimizar.x: to put (ulo) into rhyme. Ex.: Ica du vorti ne rimifas.

rimo.x: rhyme: accord in sound of words (cf. verso)

ringizar.x: to place a ring on (ulu, ulo), to hoop, ferrule, bush

ringo.x: ring, circlet of metal or other substance; (tech.) ferrule, bushing

rinoplastiko.x: rhinoplasty, plastic surgery on the nose.

ripar.x: (tr., mechan., automobiles and other vehicles) to skid: slide sideways (cf. slipo). V. exp.: Ripar esas glitar skrapante, o kun forta friciono, qua impedas e fine haltas la funciono di mashino (teknikal vorto): II-648.

riskar.x: (tr.) to risk, hazard, venture (cf. aventurar, pariar)

rismo.x: ream (of paper: Eng.: 480 sheets; foreign: 500 sheets).

risoligar.x: (tr.) (cook.) to brown, to fry or roast brown.

rispektive.x: respectively. Ex.: La rispektiva yuri di du kunheredanti. Li iris a sua rispektiva hemi. Konsiderar rispektive la avantaji e des-avantaji di ulo.

ristornar.x: (tr., com.) to cancel (an insurance policy, esp. maritime)

ritornelo.x: (mus.) ritornello. Def.: Ario quaze preliminara qua anuncas ulo; IV-14.

rivalesar.x: to be a rival; to vie (kun) (cf. konkursar, konkurencar).

rivo.x: shore, beach, strand; bank (of a river); (fig.) skirt (of a wood)

robo.x: robe: long, loose garment for man or woman

robro.x: rubber (of card games as in whist).

robusteso.x: robustness. Def.: Qua posedas forteso, vigoro. Ant.: febla, debila.

rodomontoajo.x: empty blustering, bravado, hectoring. Def.: Fanfaronemo pri milital agi; falsa brav(ul)o; III-204.

rogacioni.x: (R.C. rel.) public prayers and processions held on rogation days.

rogo.x: funeral pile, pyre: stack of wood for burning the dead or a person at the stake. Def.: Lign-amaso por brular ulu od ulo; III-206.

rokajo.x: rocky mass high, steep and rising or jutting out to a point, as seen in the sea; rocky cliff, crag

rolo.x: (theat. and gen.) rôle: part, character, impersonation

rondiro.x: round, circuit; (of a policeman, etc.) beat.

rostro.x: (in gen.) any beak-like extension; (nat. hist.) bill, beak (of an insect); trunk, proboscis (as of an elephant); (bot) prolonged rigid process; (Roman antiq.) beak of a ship; rostrum in a forum.

rotacar.x: (intr.) to rotate, revolve: turn on axis

rotolar.x: (intr.) to rumble, roll (with noise). Ex.: Veturo rotolas kande ol rulas alonge la strado. La rotolado di tondro, di tamburo. V. exp.: L’ideo expresenda esas ta di bruiso produktata per frapi rapide sucedanta; V-493.

rozeolo.x: (med.) roseola, a rose colo(u)red rash; scarlet rash, rose rash; (cf. morbilo).

rubriko.x: rubric. V. exp.: Rubriko esas generala titulo. Ex. en Progreso esas: la Lingual questioni, Kroniko, Bibliografio, Diversaji, sub qui singla artiklo havas sua titulo; VII-412.

ruda.x: rude, (of things) rough, unformed by art; (of persons) rough, uncultured, uneducated; (of manners) coarse, unpolished

rudimento.x: rudiment, element. Ex.: Rudimenta organo. Rudimenti di gramatiko. La rudimenti di planti.

rugo.x: wrinkle (on the face); ripple (on the water)

rugoza.x: wrinkled, full of wrinkles; corrugated; (bot.) rugose

rular.x: (tr., intr.) to roll (by turning over, as a wheel, also from side to side, as a ship), roll along, wheel along

ruminar.x: (tr., intr.) to ruminate: chew over again, chew the cud (cf. meditar)

ruptar.x: (tr.) to break (asunder, up, open, by violence, or stress), to snap, rupture, shatter

ruro.x: country; rural district as opp. to town

ruzar.x: (intr.) to use low craft, cunning, artifice, stratagem

sabato.x: Sabbath: seventh day of the week among the Jews (Saturday); (fig.) the first day of the week as observed by Christians (Sunday) (cf. sundio, saturdio).

saciar.x: (tr.) to give a bare sufficiency to, give a minimum to (ulu)

saciesar.x: to content oneself; put up with

saguino.x: (zool.) sagoin: squirrel-monkey, marmoset of genus: Callithrix.

saimo.x: lard (cf. lardo). Def.: Porko-graso fuzita, sen salo; IV-581.

saja.x: wise, knowing, enlightened, sage, sensible, reasonable

sako.x: (also anat. and bot.) sack: bag, pouch

sakramento.x: sacrament. Ex.: Donar la lasta sakramenti ad uli. Sakramentala vino. La katolikismo havas sep sakramenti: sakramento di bapto, di konfirmo, di la extrema unciono, e.c.

sakrifikar.x: (tr., intr.: lit. and fig.) to sacrifice (ulu, ulo); to make offerings

sakrigar.x: to render s., to consecrate (ulu, ulo); (fig.) to annoint, crown (a king); (cf. konsakrar)

salariar.x: (tr.) to pay a stipend, wages, a salary to (ulu)

saldajo.x: balance due: difference between debits and credits of a running account; (cf. bilanco). Ex.: Saldar trupi, employati.

saldar.x: (tr.) to settle with: pay the balance due on an account current

salepo.x: (esp. pharm.) salep: dried roots of various orchids.

saliar.x: (intr.) to be protuberant, to jut out, project. (N.B. refers to form not movement; cf. spricar)

saligar.x: to salify: to form a salt with; to impregnate (ulo) with salt

saliigar.x: to cause to jut out, to bring into prominence; (of fluids) throw up

salino.x: salina: salt-works; (cf. sal-min-eyo). Def.: Loko ube produktesas la salo per vapigoro di la saloza aquo; IV-715.

salivifar.x: to salivate (cf. sputar). V. exp.: vid. bavar.

salono.x: saloon: drawing-room, parlo(u)r; (cf. art-ala expoz-eyo). Def.: Chambro en apartamento destinita por aceptar vizitanti.

saltar.x: (intr.) to leap, jump, bound, hop (upward or forward), vault (ad, sur, trans, retro, ad-avane)

saltigar.x: to bounce (ulo): cause to leap or jump

salutara.x: salutary, wholesome, beneficial. Def.: Qua risanigas o salvas; IV- 138. Ex.: Salutara legi, kura-civi manjaji. V. exp.: vid. sana.

salutego.x: a very low bow, salaam; hearty salute

salvar.x: (tr., also theol.) to save (from danger, peril, sickness), to deliver, rescue; to salvage (goods)

salvboyo.x: life-buoy. Ex.: Salvar urbo, vivo, sua honoro.

salvear.x: (intr., milit.) to fire a salute, a volley (cf. salutar)

salveso.x: safety, salvation: state of being saved

sana.x: (pr. of persons; fig. of things) healthy, well, hearty, hale, sound in health; (fig.) sound, wholesome

sancionar.x: (tr.) to sanction: give validity to. Ex.: Sancionar lego. Ica vorto ne havas la sanciono di kustumo.

sangala.x: relating to b.: -oza: sanguinary: bloody, blood-stained

sanio.x: (med.) sanies. Def.: Materio sangoza e fetida, qua fluas de ula ulceri. V-349.

santuario.x: sanctuary: that part of a church where the altar is placed; chancel; altar; (Jewish) holy of holies. (fig.) asylum, sacred refuge. Def.: Parto di kirko, di templo interdiktata a la profani; IV-582.

sapar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to sap, undermine

sapisto.x: (milit.) sapper. Ex.: Sapar la fundamenti di basiono, di edifico. (fig.) Ta sistemo sapas la fundamenti di la Kristana religio.

saponigar.x: (tr.), -ifar: (intr.) to saponify, make or produce soap

saporar.x: (intr.) to have a certain flavo(u)r (taste) (cf. gustar, savurar)

sapto.x: (of plants) sap. Def.: Suko quan la planti tiras ek la tero, e qua acensante en li nutras oli; II-705.

sarabando.x: saraband. Def.: Anciena danso, origine Hispana; IV-582.

sarmento.x: (bot.) sarmentum: a running stem (as the strawberry plant)

sarmentoza.x: sarmentose: having slender prostrate branches or runners.

satelito.x: (astron. and fig.) satellite. Ex.: La luno esas satelito di ica planeto.

satinumar.x: to glaze: give to fabrics, paper, etc., a satin-like gloss

satisfacanta.x: satisfactory: making amends. V.exp.: On adoptas satisfacar en la sequanta uzo: «satisfacar devo, obligo, kontrato, promiso, kondiciono», ne en la senco di kontent-igar; III-666.

satisfacar.x: (tr.) to satisfy: to answer, fulfil (expectation, promise), to discharge (an obligation); to make amends, atone for (an offense, sin)

satisfecit.x: certificate of satisfaction, of good conduct. Def.: Atesto-letreto donata (quale da skolestro a lua skolano).

saturar.x: (tr.) to fill completely; to satiate, glut, saturate, surfeit; (chem.) to unite or dilute until no more can be received. Ex.: Saturar acido. Saturar sua kuriozeso. La saturo-punto varias segun la tempuraturo. Saturita per manjajo, per aquo, per doloro. V.exp.: vid. saciar.

savano.x: savanna: treeless plain or meadow; U.S.: prarie.

savar.x: (tr.) to know (by learning), to have a knowledge of; to be versed in; be aware of; to know how (to do)

savema.x: (of persons) desirous of learning, curious (cf. kurioza)

savigar.x: to cause (ulu) to know (ulo), to apprise, inform, instruct

savurar.x: (tr.) to savo(u)r, relish (a dish); (fig.) to enjoy, delight in

savuro.x: savo(u)r, relish. Def.: Gustar lente, kun atenco e plezuro. Ex.: Savurar ula vino, tasedo de kafeo. (fig.) Savurar ula plezuro, la honori.

sbiro.x: sbirro: a former member of Italian Police.

se.x: (conj.) if (followed frequently, but not necessarily by conditional)

sebo.x: tallow or tallow-like substance, suet; (cf. stearino)

seciono.x: (geom.) section (cf. segmento). V. exp.: Seciono signifikas la figuro (plana) obtenita «sekante» objekto per plano (ex. la koniki esas konala secioni); kun ta senco ol uzesas tre ofte en geometrio e cetera matematika cienci; IV-351; V-660.

sedentaria.x: sedentary (life, profession). Def.: Qua restas konstante sidanta, pro mestiero; per extenso, la mestiero anke dicesas «sedentaria»; III-207.

sediciar.x: (intr.) to (cause a) mutiny, to riot (cf. rebel-eskar, revoltar)

sedo.x: bottom, backside: hinder part or seat of body; (cf. gropo, rumpo, lumbo)

seduktar.x: (tr.) to seduce (chastity); to lead astray (from the path of rectitude, duty); to beguile, entice (cf. lurar, trompar, facinar, misduktar, koruptar, subornar)

segar.x: (tr.) to (cut with a) saw: -ilo: a saw

seglaro.x: sails (of a ship); set of s.s.

seglirar.x: to s.: go sailing before the wind

segun.x: (prep.) according to, agreeably to, in conformity with; pursuant to, after

segunquante.x: as far as, in so far

segunvole.x: at will. Ex.: Segun vua deskripto, vua rekomendo, mea opiniono. Traktar ulu segun lua merito. Evangelio segun St. Johano. Ni diskutos to, nur segun quante ol povas kontributar a nia projeto. Segun ke vu esos richo o mizeroza, la homi judikos vu kom bona o kom mala.

seido.x: fanatical partisan, zealot. Def.: Fanatiko volunte kriminas pro religiala zelo, e.c.

sejornar.x: (intr.) sojourn, remain for some time at a place (cf. restar).

sekar.x: (tr.) to make a surface cut in; cut partially through; divide into sections

sekondar.x: (tr.) to second, back (up) support (a motion, proposition)

sekreta.x: secret, not made known, not revealed, clandestine (cf. cel-ita, privata)

sekrete.x: secretly, in secret. V.exp.: vid. arkana.

sekundara.x: secondary: indicates relationship as used in geology, electricity, public school, medicine, etc., compared with primara, terciara; (cf. acesora: duesma-grada; min grava).

sekundo.x: second: 60th of a minute of time or of an arc.

sekura.x: safe, secure: out of danger, without danger

sekuresar.x: to be s., -igar: to make safe, secure (cf. cert-igar)

selektajo.x: what is chosen, choice. Ex.: Selektar sua amiki. Selektar la maxim bona cerizi. Naturala selektado.

selektar.x: (tr.) to select, choose, pick out (cf. elektar, preferar, asortar)

selizar.x: to s., -if-erio: saddlery (where saddles are made; cf. harnes-if-erio)

semantiko.x: semantics, semasiology. Def.: Cienco di la signifiki (di vorti), di lia evoluciono (parto di la linguistiko); IV-81.

semar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to sow, strew, scatter (seed for growth)

semblante.x: apparently (cf. kred-ebla). Ex.: Ca vino semblas a me esar mala. Il semblas dormar. Semblo di amikeso.

semblar.x: (intr.) to seem, appear (to be), look (like) (cf. aspektar, simular)

semblo.x: appearance, semblance, external aspect, outward show

semestro.x: semester: six months period (of study) (cf. trimestro).

sempra.x: perpetual. Ex.: On ne esas sempre felica. Matine me levas me sempre tre frue.

sen.x: (prep.) without, not with, free from: indicates absence, privation, exclusion, destitution; (Note: Sen is often compounded with verbs in place of des-, ne- to signify deprivation, absence: des-esperar: to despair

sendar.x: (tr.) to send: cause to go, dispatch, forward

sensacionala.x: sensational (cf. impres-anta, -iva). Ex.: Ula novaji ofte produktas sensaciono. Sensacionala jurnali, libri.

sensaciono.x: sensation: excited interest or feeling (cf. sento)

senso.x: sense: one of the five physical senses or faculties

sensuala.x: sensual: devoted to the gratification of the senses; voluptuous

sensualismo.x: sensualism: sensuality (cf. sens-al-ismo). Def.: Devota a sensala plezuri; agreabla a la sensi.

sentar.x: (tr.) to feel (a sensation) (cf. konciar, perceptar, flarar, odorar, saporar)

sentenco.x: sentence: maxim: short saying containing an axiom, saw (cf. proverbo). (N.B. This is not the E. grammatical «sentence» cf. frazo)

sentimento.x: sentiment, mental feeling, emotion (opp. to physical sensation), -ala: (of things) sentimental

sentinelesar.x: to be on s. watch (cf. facionar)

senur.x: if only, provided that. Ex.: Se me povus, me venus. To esas importanta, se vera. Obediez; se ne, gardez! Me facos to, se nur il venos.

separajo.x: that which is separated, a s. part

separar.x: (tr.) to separate, part, divide, (ulo, de ulo)

sepultar.x: (tr.) to entomb, bury (a dead body) (cf. en-ter-igar)

sepulteskar.x: to prepare for burial, lay out (a body)

sequar.x: (tr.) to follow, go or come after, go next, to be or come next

sequencio.x: (R.C. liturgy) sequence: a certain hymn sung during mass.

sequenda.x: which must be followed. Ex.: Il marchis adavane e la altri sequis il. Sequar ulu per la okulo. Sequar voyo, metodo. La sequantaro venis dop (od, sequante) il. Sequo di lud-karti. Il remarkis sua eroro erste ye la sequante matino. Exemplo sequinda. Voyo sequenda.

sequestrajo.x: what is sequestered. Ex.: Sequestrar la havajo di ulu.

sequoyo.x: (bot.) sequoia: red-wood tree (Sequoia gigantea; Sequoia sempervirens).

serbatano.x: air-cane; pea-shooter. Def.: Longa tubo uzata por lansar, per suflado, mikra projektili.

serchar.x: (tr.) to seek, look for, search for, be in quest of

sereneso.x: serenity. Ex.: Mieno, fronto, tempo serena.

serie.x: in s., in rows. Ex.: Serio di personi, di objekti, di questioni, di soni.

serio.x: series, row, file; continued succession, order or course (cf. inter-sequo, sucedo)

serioza.x: serious, sedate, grave; not lively or amusing

seriozeso.x: seriousness. Ex.: Serioza karaktero, konverso, morbo. Parolar serioze. Konsiderar ulu, ulo kom serioza. V. exp.: vid. grava. Ant.: vivaca, gaya, amuz-anta, rid-ig-anta, komika, jokema.

sero.x: (physiol.) serum: thin, transparent part of blood (cf. serumo)

serono.x: (com.) seroon: a bale of tea, indigo, etc. wrapped in hide.

serpeto.x: pruning-, garden-knife. Def.: Speco di kultelo larja kun pinto kurvigita (en la sama plano), qua servas por taliar la arbori, tranchar la branchi; VI-539.

servachar.x: to dance attendance on (ulu), -em-acha: servile. Ex.: Servar ulu. Esar servisto di ulu. Facar servo ad ulu. Me esas pronta servar vu. Administrala servado. Servar ulu kom sekretario. Servar kliento, mashino.

servar.x: (tr., intr.) to be of service to, to serve (as an assistant or domestic); to be in the service (of), to serve (customers), to tend (a machine)

servitudo.x: (jur.) servitude: liability of property to rights of other persons, as a right of way over it. Def.: Obligo pri domeno relate altra domeno; III-606.

sesgar.x: (tr.) to cut (ulo) in the form of a crescent; (of dresses) to cut low; (cf. dekoltar). Ex.: Sesgar korsajo.

sesiono.x: session, sittings (of a deliberative body, as a court, legislature, etc.). V. exp.: Duro dum qua deliberanta korporaciono kunsidas kontinue. To ne esas kunsido, qua indikas la duro di singla kunveno; III-332.

severa.x: severe, hard, stern, harsh, strict (cf. austera)

sexto.x: (mus.) sixth: an interval of six diatonic degrees.

sezono.x: season (of the year; cf. okaziono, oportun-ajo)

shablono.x: pattern (cf. modelo); (fig.) routine (cf. rutino). Def.: Plana figuro, qua indikas la konturi sugun qui on devas taliar stofo; anke utila metafore (por expresar sklavatra kopiado); IV-447

shabrako.x: shabrak: ornamented saddle cloth, caparison. Def.: Tegilo ornita di kavalo; VI-75.

shafto.x: shaft, staff: long handle, as of a lance; stock (of a gun); shank (of a tool); (cf. shakto).

shakar.x: to give a check (to the king). V. exp.: Por la shako-ludo on adoptas: damo, episkopo, kavalo, turmo, e la expresuri: soldati, oficeri, roquar, shakar la rejo; VI-116; for other descriptive terms, cf. VI-299.

shakto.x: shaft, pit (of a mine or quarry).

shalmo.x: pipe or tube of straw, reed, glass, or metal (as used for sucking up liquids); (chemist’s) blowpipe; shawm: an acient reed instrument; shepherd’s pipe; (bot.) hollow sterm (of a plant).

shalupo.x: (sailing-) launch, long boat or cutter propelled by sails or oars; shallop

shamigar.x: to s. (ulu), to make (ulu) feel ashamed, to humiliate, mortify; (cf. pudoro)

shancelar.x: (intr.) to stagger, totter, waver, reel, be unstready, shake

shanceligar.x: to cause something to totter; (fig.) to shake (an opinion, decision, etc.)

sharko.x: (ich.) shark. V. exp.: Sharko esas la nomo vulgara di Squalus carcharius

sharlataneso.x: charlatanism, quackery. Def.: Venderacho di drogi, dent-extirpero, e.c. en publika loki; (fig.) ne-savanta mediko qua explotas la publiko.

sharpo.x: scarf (for shoulders); sash (as insignia or ornament); (surg.) sling; (cf. zono)

sheiko.x: sheik. Def.: Chefo di Araba tribuo; III-603.

sheklo.x: (tech.) shackle. Def.: Masho di kateno qua havas altra formo kam la cetera mashi e servas por specala skopo (fixigo di la hoko, di siteli en dragilo, e.c.); III-85-6.

shelo.x: shell, peel, rind, hull: hard outer case of eggs, nuts, etc.; (cf. skalio, bruo)

shibro.x: (tech.) slide-valve (in steam engine); sluice-gate (for water). Def.: Valvo-pordo qua agas glitante en sua plano tale ke ol obstruktas (parte o tote) vaporo en la vapor-mashino, aqua en kanalo, tubo, e.c.; III-293.

shifono.x: rag: piece of cloth torn off (cf. rago); scrap (of paper, etc.)

shikanar.x: (intr.) to chicane: to pettifog, quibble, prolong a contest by shifts, subterfuges; (tr.) to quibble over something or with somebody about something; to wrangle (without motive)

shinko.x: ham: thigh of a hog prepared for food

shirmar.x: (tr.) to shelter, shield, screen: -ar su: to take shelter

shirmtekto.x: penthouse, lean-to (cf. hangaro). Ex.: Parasuno shirmas el. Shirmata da la foliaro kontre la vento e suno.

shirting.x: (com.) shirting: cloth suitable for making shirts.

shokar.x: (tr., intr.) to shock: (physical) to strike on or against, dash against; give a shock to, clash with; (mental) to offend, be offensive to; (cf. kolizionar)

shovar.x: (tr.) to shove or push (ulu, ulo) along; (cf. pulsar, glitar). Ex.: Shovar ulu sur glacio. Shovar su tra turbo. Shovar botelo sur tablo, batelo al aquo.

si.x: (mus.) si: seventh note of diatonic scale.

sidar.x: (intr.) to sit , be seated (of persons, assemblies, courts); (fig.) to lie, reside (of things)

sideskar.x: to take one’s seat, sit down

sideyo.x: place where one sits; seat, bench (as of a court); see (of a bishop); (fig.) residence

siejar.x: (tr.) to besiege, lay s. to, invest (ulu, ulo)

siflar.x: (tr., intr.) to whistle: make a shrill sound ordinarily musical; (fig., med.) to wheeze; to whiz

sigiar.x: (tr.) to seal, affix a s., as a mark of authenticity, to a document, letter, bottle, etc.; (fig.) to seal up: close for security, as a closing a letter by means of gum or wafer; (cf. masonar)

sigilario.x: sigillaria: a genus of fossil trees.

signalizar.x: to hoist signals on (a mast,etc.), to cover with signals; to write or put a s. (on a tree, etc.)

signatar.x: (tr.) to sign, subscribe (one’s name), put signature to (cf. sub-skribar)

signizar.x: to put a s. on (ulo, ulu)

signo.x: (natural or artificial) sign, mark (cf. indik-ajo, indico)

sikio.x: sickle. Def.: «Falchileto», t.e. longa streta lameno kun mi-cirklatra formo, quan on uzas (od uzis) por tranchar ex. la frumento; VI-538.

silabigar.x: to separate into s.s.; to spell by s.s.

silencar.x: (intr.) to be silent: not to make noise

silencez.x: stop that noise! Ex.: La mashino silencis. Dum la silenco di la nokto. Foresto silencoza. V. exp.: Taco esas absenteso di parolado

simaro.x: simar: (of priests) cassock; (cf. sutano); (justice’s) robe; a former long gown worn by women.

simbolesar.x: to be symbolized (da ulo). Ex.: La balanco esas la simbolo dil yusteso. La glavo simbolizas la lego.

simetra.x: symmetrical: which corresponds in proportion, position

similesar.x: to be s., be alike, resemble

similigar.x: to render s., to assimilate (cf. asimilar)

simio.x: (general term) simian: ape, monkey, baboon, etc.

simonio.x: simony. Def.: Simonio: komerco kontre-etika di la sakra kozi: III-332.

simpatiar.x: (tr., moral and physical) to sympathize with, have sympathy for (ulu); (phys.) be in sympathy with

simpla.x: simple: not complex or complicated; easy; (of dress) plain, common

simptomo.x: (med. and fig.) symptom: -a, -atra: symptomatic. Ex.: Simptomo di anemio. (fig.) Simptomo di revolto.

simultana.x: common, co-existing, co-equal, simultaneous. V. exp.: Qua valoras egale e kune, solidare, ex.: equacioni simultana. Konseque simultana ne esas sinonimo di samtempe. Dec. 1212, VII-66

sindiko.x: syndic: a municipal officer; manager, business agent (of corporation, company); administrative assignee (of an insolvent’s estate).

sinekuro.x: sinecure. Def.: Ofico sen responsiveso o devi.

singulareso.x: (quality), -ajo: (something pertaining to one) singularity, peculiarity. Ex.: Verbo en la singulara nombro (od, en la singularo). Singulara propoziciono, ideo, kazo. Singulareso di opiniono. Singularajo en la manieri di ulu.

sinkar.x: (tr., intr.) to sink (ulo, en ulo, su); to settle, subside; Ex.: Sinkar palisegaro en la tero. La fero sinkas en l’aquo. V.exp.: kp. Dronar. DE

sino.x: intimate place, internal part, close or secret receptacle: (fig. senses of) bosom, heart (midst), womb. Ex.: En la sino dil eklezio. En la sino di la tero. La sino di Deo. En la sino di sua familio.

sinonimeso.x: synonymy: quality of being a s. Ant.: antonimo.

sinoptika.x: synoptic(al). Ex.: Sinoptika tabelo di cienci. La sinoptika evangelio.

sinso.x: direction (one way); (math.) sense: one of two opposite directions

sintezar.x: to synthesize. V. exp.: Sintezo esas l’ago inversa di analizo. Kemiala sintezo, metodo sintezala. Sintezar albumino.

sinuifar.x: to wind about, meander. Ex.: La sinui di litoro, di rivero.

siorino.x: Mrs., Miss, madam, lady (married or not); (cf. sinioro, damzelo, damo)

sireno.x: siren: powerful whistle; (acoustics) a measuring instrument for air vibrations; (myth.) sea-nymph, mermaid; (fig.) a seductive woman

sismografo.x: seismograph. Def.: Instrumento por enskribar la ter-tremi; VI-135.

sismometro.x: seismometer. Def.: Instrumento por mezurar la ter-tremi.

siso.x: a half dozen (Note: For other derivative forms cf. du).

sistematiko.x: systematizing: scientific (or efficient) disposition; labo(u)r saving arrangements.

sistemigar.x: to systematize. Ex.: La sistemo di Descartes. Planetala sistemo, od planetosistemo, od planetaro. Il esas persono tre sistemema. Sistemigar sua idei, sua dokumenti.

situar.x: (tr.) to place, seat, locate (ulo, ulu) (cf. jacar, pozar, plas-izar, lok-izar); -o, -eso: situation, site location

situita.x: situate(d). Ex.: Domo, urbo bone situita (o kun bona situeso). Dramatatra situeso. Situeso bona, mala, embarasiva. V. exp.: Situeso, relate personi, esas generale acidentala, tempala; la stando esas kustumale permananta. On trovas sua aferi en neagreabla situeso, qua forsan developos a permananta mala stando.

sivagar.x: (tr.) to sift, bolt, strain; (fig.) to examine minutely, separate the good from the bad; to winnow.

sive.x: (1) whether; (2) either; (1) sive ... sive: (alternative and condition) whether … or whether

sivo.x: sieve, sifter (for flour, etc.); strainer (for liquids) (cf. kriblo, filtrar)

sizar.x: (tr.) to sieze, gripe, catch or lay hold of; (fig.) to take, grasp quickly, apprehend (arrest); to distrain (property)

sizilo.x: griping. Def.: prenar o manukaptar vivace e vigoroze ulu, ulo. ex.: Sizar l’espado per la pinto. Sizar la brakio di ulu. Sizar la havajo di ulu. Sizar oportuna instanto (o tempo). Sizar pretexto. Teroro sizis la menti. La febro sizas me.

skabelo.x: (wooden-) stool, foot-stool (cf.tabureto). Def.: Moblo por la pedi, o por acensar sur olu; II-647.

skalio.x: shell (as of an oyster, etc.) (cf. shelo)

skalioza.x: scaly, squamous. Def.: La krusto dika e solida qua kovras la korpo di la tortugi, ostri, musli, e.c.; VI-603.

skalo.x: ladder; scale: instrument of measurement; (math., mus.) scale

skalpajo.x: s.: skin on top of the head.

skaramucho.x: scaramouch; (fig.) cowardly buffoon. Def.: Persono di la komedio Italiana; IV-583.

skarifikar.x: (tr., surg.) to scarify (the skin of someone). V.exp.: tranchar.

skarmuchar.x: (intr.) to skirmish, to have a brush with the enemy.

skarsa.x: scarce: not plentiful; scanty (cf. rara, des-densa)

skarseso.x: scarcity. Def.: Des-abund-anta; V-595. Ant.: densa, abund-anta.

skemo.x: schema, scheme: systematic plan; outline or demonstration of a system, showing relations and functions; (N.B. not «scheme» project)

skenuno.x: one of the threads of a skein.

skisar.x: (tr.) to sketch, outline, make a rough draft of; (fig.) to delineate: give the plan or idea of

sklavesar.x: to be a s., be in slavery

skolano.x: schoolchild, pupil, scholar (cf. erudito, ciencisto, lern-anto, stipend-iero, dicipulo)

skolio.x: (lit., geom.) scholium. Def.: Komento od expliko di texto; matematikal expliko di teoremo; IV-583.

skolo.x: school: a place or establishment where instruction is given, usually elementary; disciples or followers of some teacher or doctrine in art, philosophy, -etc.

skopo.x: that at which one aims; aim, scope, objective, intent(ion), purpose, view, goal, butt, object to attack

skrachar.x: (tr.) to scratch, claw, graze, gall; (of ropes) to chafe; (of clothing) to make a rent in; (cf. lacerar, gratar, skrapar, exkoriar). Def.: Facar sek(et)o en la pelo (od altra surfaco), do vundeto; IV-656. V. exp.: La ungli di kato skrachas bonege, ma nule exkorias. Me tante gratis me, ke me fine skrachis me.

skrapar.x: : (tr.) to scrape (with a tool), scrape off, abrade; (of chimneys) to sweep; to scale off

skrapuri.x: scrapings. Def.: Deprenar gratante per instrumento ula parti de la surfaco di korpo. Ex.: Skrapar anciena pergameno. La stono skrapis la pelo. Skrapar kraso de la pelo, o fango de la vestaro.

skribajo.x: what is written: written paper, document

skribisto.x: professional writer, scribe (N.B. not author; cf. autoro)

skrubagar.x: to s. down, s. on (something with screws. N.B. not to screw the screw; cf.visar)

skrubizar.x: to put screws on: cover with screws

skurar.x: (tr.) to scour, furbish: to cleanse by scrubbing

skuristo.x: scourer; scullion. Def.: Destruktar e forprenar partikli o despuraji de la surfaco di ula korpo per friciono; III-163.

slameyo.x: miry place, slough, mudhole, quagmire (cf. marsh-eto)

slamizar.x: to cover with, choke up with fine oozy mud or silt.

slangar.x: to speak s. (cf. jargono, galimatiaso). Def.: Linguo specala, konvencionala e plu o min sekreta, propra a profesiono od a societo klozita (studenti, raptisti); VII-158.

slingo.x: noose, sling, snare, loop (cf. glit-nodo, lazo). Def.: Nodo en kordo, e.c. ne forsita per tiro; III-288.

slupo.x: (nav.) sloop. Def.: Speco de seglo-navo kun un masto; IV-583.

sluzagar.x: to take (a boat, ship) through a l.; to open a l. for a boat

snapar.x: (tr.) to snap, snatch: bite or catch suddenly with the teeth ( as a dog) or with beak (as a bird). Def.: Kaptar bruske per la boko; IV-512.

sniflar.x: (tr., intr.) to sniff: inhale strongly; snuff up; (fig.) to turn up one’s nose (at)

snortar.x: (intr., of horses) to snort: blow through the nose (cf. sternutar, mungar).

sobrar.x: (also fig.) temperate: moderate in food or drink; sparing, abstemious, sober; (cf. ne-ebria, temper-ema, -moder-ema)

sobre.x: soberly, with sobriety. Ex.: La homo qua ne exajeras manjante, drinkante, qua esas moderema e su-dominacanta, esas sobra persono. Esar sobra en parolado, en laudado.

societo.x: society (formed for a particular object), association; (com.) company, partnership (cf. firmo)

socio.x: society (in general) community: any large body of persons or living beings living a community life

sofao.x: sofa. V. exp.: vid. kanapeo, divano.

sofismala.x: sophistical (cf. sofist-ala). V. exp.: vid. paralogismo.

sokursar.x: (tr.) to succo(u)r: to come to the aid of when in danger

sokursarmeo.x: relief army. Ex.: Sokursar ulu dronanta. V. exp.: Sokursar signifikas irar rapide e kurajoze helpar ulu, uli, en situeso di minacanta danjero; on helpas ulu en desfortunoza o perturbita situeso per la donaco di adicionala forci o moyeni.  On sokursas amiko en batalio; on helpas la povri, falinto.

sol.x: (mus.) sol: fifth note of diatonic scale.

sola.x: alone; without company, sole, only (cf. nura, unika, solitara)

solenigar.x: to solemnize. Ex.: Solena festo, vovo, dio, tono, vizajo.

solfejar.x: (tr., mus.) to (sing) sol-fa: sing the notes of the scale

solicitar.x: (tr.) to solicit: earnestly apply for (cf. suplikar, peticionar)

solida.x: (also geom.) solid: not liquid; (fig.) firm, substantial, sound

solidara.x: (jur. and gen.) solidary: jointly and severally responsible or liable; binding upon every one

solidareso.x: solidarity, joint responsibility; (fig.) coherence, fellowship, community of interests

solidarigar.x: to make jointly liable; to unite the interests of (cf. konsolidar). Ex.: Solidara obligaciono. La spozulo esas solidara por la debaji di sua spozino. Asociiti en komercal societo esas solidara. (fig.) La solidareso en la interesti di omna laboristi.

solio.x: threshhold (of a door, of a window; also fig.), door-soll. Ex.: (fig.) la solio di vivo.

solitara.x: (of places) solitary, lonely, deserted; (of persons) (living) alone

solitareso.x: loneliness, solitude. V.exp.: Solitara esas ulo plu kam sola, mem kam solesema: to esas: «qua restas kustume tote sola ed izolita». Exempli: Solitar querko stacas meze di la planajo. On povas anke parolar pri solitara loko; to nule esus sinonima si dezerta: ex.: «ta solitara templo esas frequentata da multa pilgrimanti.» Solitareso expresas la L. solitudo. On povas vivar sola, mem en urbo; to ne esas vivar solitara od en solitareso. On anke havas la substantivo solitaro por persono; V-101.

solo.x: (mus.) solo. Def.: Qua esas ne-akompanata; izolita. Ex.: Il esas sola en la chambro. Unu sola ne povas facar to. Laborar sole. Il esas sola en solitara loko.

solvarajo.x: what is to be solved, the problem

solvarebla.x: (also phys.) solvable; soluble, dissolvable. Ex.: Solvar problemo, desfacilajo. La rezultajo di dis-solvo di sukro per aquo esas sukroza (dis-)solvuro.

somito.x: (geom., also of trees, mountains, etc.) summit, top. V. exp.: La suprajo ne esas sempre nek necese la somito, nam ol povas esar larja e plana; on ne parolas pri la «somito» di moblo, di (plata) domo. La suprajo di la tero tote ne identesas kun la somiti di la monti; II-163.

somnolegar.x: to be overpoweringly sleepy. Def.: Sentar la bezono o tendenco (momentala) dormar; IV-463. V. exp.: Dormema indikas kustumala tendenco a dormar, ne instantala stando.

sonalio.x: small bell (as used on the harness of horses). Def.: Instrumento sonora, en formo di bulo kava, fendita, qua sonas per la bulo agitata interne; IV-14.

sondar.x: (tr., intr.) to take soundings in; (gen.) to sound: ascertain the depth of, explore the nature of the bottom; to fathom; (fig.) to try, test; (med.) to probe (with a probe), to sound (with a sound); (mining) to make a boring

sonjar.x: (intr.) to dream (while asleep; cf. revar). Ex.: Me dormis e sonjis ke me esis richa.

sonoreso.x: sonorousness. Ex.: Sonora voco, linguo. Ant.: matida.

soquo.x: sock: shoe used by actors in ancient comedy.

sorbiero.x: sorb-tree, service tree, mountain-ash, rowan tree (genus: Sorbus).

sorcar.x: (intr.) to practise sorcery, witchcraft; (tr.) to bewitch

sorcisto.x: sorcerer: one who is supposed to be in league with evil spirits; (fig.) wizard, conjuror, magician

sordidigar.x: to dirty, soil. Def.: Des-neta. Ex.: Sordida aquo, linji, chambro, manui, homo, avareso.

sordino.x: (lit. and fig.) sordino: a mute or damper on trumpet, violin, piano, etc.

sorgar.x: (tr.) to care for (by physical acts), take care of, look after (ulu, ulo); to take pains with

sorgema.x: careful, painstaking, regardful (cf. diligenta). Ex.: Konfidar ad ulu la sorgo (pri). Komisar ulu por sorgar (pri). El esas la flegisto qua sorgas il. Sorga la stilo. Sorgema laboristo. (fig.) Esar sorgema pri sua honoro, sua reputo. V. exp.: vid. suciar.

sortaro.x: assortment. (Note: For idiomatic uses of the E. «sort», «kind», cf. quaza, quala, tala, ul-maniere). Ex.: Ibe esas omna sorti di bestii. Quala viro! Il esas ulsorta (o quaza, od ulspeca) giganto.

sospirar.x: (intr.) to sigh, heave or fetch a s.; (tr., fig.) to sigh out, breathe forth. Ex.: Sospiro pro doloro. (fig.) Sospirar versi.

sovaja.x: (referring to living and growing persons, plants, trees, etc.) savage: wild (living in a state of nature) not domesticated, uncivilized; (fig.) unsociable; ferocious, fierce

sozio.x: double, second self, counterpart. Def.: Persono qua esas perfekte simila ad altru.

spacoza.x: spacious, roomy. Ex.: spaco havas tri dimensioni. Hike ne esas sata spaco. Spacala relati. Spacoza chambro.

spano.x: chip (of wood, metal) (cf. rabot-uro). Def. Reziduo dil ago limar, rabotar o di altra tranchanta instrumento. V. exp.: vid. splito.

spanto.x: a timber, rib, in the frame of a ship.

spanyoleto.x: window-sash fastening (the ordinary bolt and catch; cf. kremono). Def.: Vekto ocilanta cirkum sua mezpunto e qua ingranas od embragas en hoki supre ed infre di la fenestro; IV-448.

sparadrapo.x: (pharm. Med.) cerecloth, sparadrap. Def.: Kataplasmo aglutinanta extensita sur linjo o papero. Ex.: Kovrar vunduro per sparadrapo.

sparar.x: (tr.) to economize, save, put by, husband; (intr.) to be economical, frugal

sparbuxo.x: money-box. Ex.: Sparar la revenui di la heredajo. On povas sparar tempo, kredito, forteso. Me sparis mil franki por futura uzo. Spariva procedo. Sparema mento.

specifiko.x: a specific. Ex.: Graveso specifika. Esas specifika mikrobo en tuberkloso. Quinino esas specifiko kontre ula febro.

specimeno.x: specimen, sample. Ex.: Montrar specimeno di frumento, di drapo, di vino, di insekto.

spektarajo.x: spectacle, sight, view (cf. spektaklo). Def.: Regardar longe, pasive, ma kun atenco ed intereso, quale en teatro od altra spektaklo; V-35. Ex.: Il spektis ta eventi. La aktori e la spektanti. La spektajo (od, vidajo) de ta vidpunto esis bela. Ta veneracinda viro esas spektindajo.

spektarar.x: (tr.) to look at or on, be a spectator of, witness; (cf. regardar, vidar, kontemplar)

spekular.x: (intr.) to speculate: (philos.) to theorize; (finan.) to make (financial) speculations. Ex.: Spekular pri metafizikala problemi, pri frumento.

spico.x: spice: pepper, nutmeg, ginger, etc; (cf. kondimento, piklo)

spiko.x: (bot.) ear: spike or head of corn, grain

spindelo.x: spindle: piece of wood used for twisting and winding thread (cf. fuzelo; bobino, ruko)

spionar.x: (tr.) to spy on (ulu, ulo); (intr.) to act as a spy

spiralo.x: (geom.) spiral; (of a watch) hair spring; (in gen.) a spiral spring

spiritismo.x: spiritism, spiritualism: doctrine or beliefs of spiritists

spiritisto.x: spiritist, spiritualist: one who professes to hold intercourse with departed spirits or believes such intercourse possible

spiro.x: (geom.) a winding line like the threads of a screw, helix.

splendideso.x: splendo(u)r. Def.: Brilanta; belega; luxoza. Ex.: Palaco splendida. Splendideso di la suno, di la trono.

splinar.x: (intr.) to be splenetic, be in low spirits

splinigar.x: to give the blue devils to (ulu)

splino.x: spleen: hypochondriasis: morbid depression of mind; (cf. spleno).

splinto.x: (tech.) small metal pin (used to fasten parts); (cf. stifto)

splisilo.x: splicing-fid, marlingspike. Def.: Specala maniero juntar du kordi per desplekto di l’extremaji e posa riplekto; III-86.

splitigar.x: to splinter: cause to fly into splinters. V. exp.: Splito esas spano di tote nereguloza formo, dum ke spano havas formo dependanta de la materio e de l’instrumento per qua on laboras ulo; III-488.

splito.x: splinter, sliver, shiver, (of metal, glass, wood, etc.)

spoliar.x: (tr.) to spoliate, (des)spoil, rob, pillage, sack, plunder. Def.: Desposedigar ulu, ulo de ulu per fraudo, o violento; for-portar violentoze. Ex.: Spoliar orfano de lua heredajo. Spoliado di urbo. Domo spoliita.

spontana.x: spontaneous: voluntary, self-acting, -moving. Ex.: spontana genitado. La movi di la kordio esas spontana. Spontaneso di ula ago.

sporadika.x: sporadic; scattered; (med.) not epidemic. Ex.: Dum ta yaro aparis sporadika kazi di kolero.

spozigar.x: to make (ulu) one’s spouse, to espouse, wed (ulu)

spozo.x: spouse: either one of a married couple

spricigar.x: to cause (ulo) to spout, to throw up, dash (liquids)

springar.x: (intr.) to spring: rise upward and go forward with impetuosity

springo.x: spring, dash, rush, leap, bound; (cf. precipitar). Ex.: Il springis e saltis super la fenco.

spular.x: (tr.) to reel: wind on a spool (thread, wire, etc.).

squadro.x: (set) square: instrument for determining right angles

squalo.x: (ich.) shark (genus: Squalus). V. exp.: vid. sharko.

squatar.x: (intr.) to squat down (on one’s hams or heels); (cf. blotisar).

stabiligar.x: (tr.), -eskar: (intr.) to stabilize. Def.: Qua esas en stando, en situeso ferma, solida. Ex.: Stabila equilibro. Stabileso di edifico.

stacionara.x: steady, stationary: not moving or changing at the time

stacionareso.x: steadiness. Ex.: La temperaturo povas esas stacionara, anke la stando di morbi, di arti. V. exp.: Stacionara ne esas la sama ideo kam fixa: ol esas plu proxima ad konstanta, ma indikas konstanteso en movo, per quaza equilibro sempre ruptebla

stacionnavo.x: s. ship. Ex.: Fervoyala staciono. Katoliko facas sua stacioni en la kirko.

staciono.x: (building and place) station; R.R. depot; (R.C. rel.) station; (cf. gar-eyo)

stadio.x: (Gr. measure and place for gymnastic contests) stadium.

stagnanta.x: stagnant. Ex.: Stagno di aquo od stagnanta aquo. (fig.) Mea aferi, komerco stagnas.

stagnar.x: (intr.) to stagnate (of liquids); be at a standstill

stampo.x: (tr.) to stamp: imprint on the surface of something

standar.x: (intr.) to be in a certain state, relative condition; to be in good or bad health

stando.x: state, stand, condition: state of being, manner of existing

stango.x: bar (of wood or metal), rod, pole; leg (of a table); stem (of a candlestick, etc); stock (of a key, nail, anchor)

staplo.x: distributing point for goods, as a seaport or large inland city, staple-mart or entrepot.

starchivo.x: starch (for linen). Def.: Rigidigar per amilo.

startar.x: (tr., intr.) to start: set going, cause to act (as a machine, train, sport). Ex.: Me startas la motoro. La motoro startas facile. On povas startar la motoro di automobilo sen departigar la veturo. Starto di konkurso.

startero.x: starter (of a race). Def.: Ta qua direktas, imperas la departo; IV-338.

statuto.x: statute, written decree or law; by-law; article (of association; cf. lego)

stebar.x: (tr.) to quilt, to (pad and) stitch; to stitch (with a machine)

stebmashino.x: sewing machine. V.exp.: Stebar esas sutar per mashino, quo ne esas propre sutado, nam mashino uzas generale du fili, e la sutado nur un; II-646.

stekajo.x: (hort.) slip, cutting. Def.: Enirigar ulo en ulo per la pinto. Ex.: Stekar paliso en la sulo.

stekar.x: (tr.) to stick: thrust point in, drive in (by point); (hort.) to propagate by cuttings or slips (cf. spros-ifar)

stelizar.x: to star: stud, cover (ulo) with stars

stentorala.x: stentorian: extremely loud. Ex.: Stentorala voco.

stentoro.x: (antiq.) Stentor: a person with a powerful voice

stereotipar.x: (tr.) to stereotype; (fig.) to fix firmly or unchangeably; (cf. klishar)

sterila.x: sterile, barren, unfruitful; (fig.) fruitless, vain; (cf. arida)

sterkskarabeo.x: (ent.) coprophagan; dung-beetle. Def.: La dungo formacita ek la exkrementi di animali (mixita kun palio); VI-248.

sternar.x: (tr.) to lay (ulu, su) down at full length.

stertorar.x: (intr.) to have a death rattle; to have a rattle in the throat (from respiratory trouble).

stifto.x: peg: small pin of wood or metal used for fastening hinges, frames, clocks, etc.

stigmatizar.x: to mark with a brand or with scars; (fig.) to set a mark of disgrace on (ulu, ulo). Ex.: La stigmato di puniso, di la variolo, di vicio, sur la korpo di Francisko di Assisi. Variolo (e metafore, krapulado) stigmatizas la vizajo. Me stigmatizas ta aserto kom mentio.

stigmato.x: brand (of a hot iron); (bot.) stigma; scar of a wound (cf. cikatro); (pl. theol.) stigmata (of Christ); (entom.) stigmati (on the tracheæ); (fig.) stigma: mark of infamy

stilistiko.x: stylistics. Def.: Cienco o teorio di stilo; IV-707.

stilo.x: (lit., artist) style, tone, manner; diction: selection of words (cf. diciono); (bot. and antiq.) style

stiloida.x: (anat.) styloid. Ex.: Moblaro segun la stilo di Louis XIV. Stilo moderna, historiala. Ta auturo havas bona stilo.

stimular.x: (tr.) to stimulate, rouse, excite; to spur on, incite; to goad (oxen); (cf. ecitar)

stipendio.x: (in public schools or colleges) exhibition, scholarship, bursary (in Scotland): a sum of money granted to pay, wholly or in part, the expenses of a pupil’s education

stivar.x: (tr., nav.) to stow (a cargo), trim (a hold)

stofo.x: stuff, fabric, tissue, cloth: any woven fabric

stoika.x: (philos. and fig.) stoic(al): unaffected by passion

stoko.x: (com.) stock. Def.: Quanto de komercaji o pekunio disponebla da vendisto. Ex.: Stoko de frumento. Stoko en magazino. Stoko de oro en banko.

stonizar.x: to macadamize, gravel, ballast: cover with small stones

stono.x: pebble, small stone, loose rock (cf. petro, roko)

stonoza.x: full of (small) stones, pebbly, flinty (of roads, etc.)

stopar.x: (tr.) to stop up, choke up, stuff up (a hole, bottle, etc.; cf. obstruktar, obturar)

storaxo.x: (bot., pharm.) storax. Def.: Speco di balzamio; IV-707.

storo.x: roller-blind, spring-blind or curtain (cf. jelozio, persieno).

stoterar.x: (tr., intr.) to stammer, stutter, lisp from natural defect). V. exp.: Balbutado eventas che l’infanti, pro ne-habileso, o che l’adulti pro pavoro od altra emoco; kontre ke stoterado esas konstanta defekto di pronuncado; IV-518.

stradeto.x: small s.; lane (in town); alley, court

strandar.x: (intr., also fig.) to strand: run aground or on shore: -igar: to run (a ship, boat) aground, to beach.

strangular.x: (tr.) to strangle, choke, stifle, throttle (ulu); (cf. asfixiar, sufokar, garot-agar); Def.: Mortigar per presar la trakeo; perdigar, haltar la respirado. Ex.: Li strangulis per kordo. Il mortis pro stranguleso. (fig.) strangular ula cienco, ula arto.

stranja.x: strange, unusual, uncommon, odd, singular, queer (cf. baroka)

stranjajo.x: a strange thing, oddity, curiosity. Def.: Qua esas kontre kustumo, ordinara experienco, kustumala ordino, la komuna raciono. Ex.: Stranja dicajo, bruiso, aranjo, vivo. Esas stranja ke il ne ja advenas. La stranjeso di lua vestaro, di lua konduto.

stranjerajo.x: an extraneous body; (chem., surg.) a foreign substance. Def.: Qua esas de altra naciono; qua ne apartenas ad korpo. Ex.: Stranjera lando; linguo, milito, aferi, relati. Trovar ulo stranjera (kontre-natura) en korpo. Argumento stranjera (ne-apartenanta, ne aplikebla) a la kazo, proceso, temo. Note: The E. word «stranger» is ordinarily to be translated by ne-konocato: He is a stranger to me: me tote ne konocas il: il esas ne-konocata da me.

straso.x: strass: a brilliant glass used for artificial gems; a paste (diamond).

strategiisto.x: strategist. Ex.: Napoleon esis maestro do strategio. Jomini esis strategiisto. Strategiala pozicino.

streko.x: stroke, dash (as of a pen); (print.) dash; (geom.) a straight line

stridanta.x: strident, shrill, creaking, grating. Def.: Produktar sono akra e penetranta. Ex.: Cikadi, gondo-bendi stridas. Voco stridanta.

stridar.x: (intr.) to produce a strident noise, to creak

strigo.x: barn-, white-, screech-owl (genus: Strix flammea). Def.: Noktala raptema ucelo di qua la facio esas ornita per plumoza koliaro kompleta; IV-296.

strikar.x: (intr., of workmen) to strike, to go on strike, quit work: -anto: striker.

strikteso.x: strictness. Def.: Des-ampla; IV-434. Ex.: Strikta senco, obligo, devo, en aferi. To esas strikte vera. Strikte parolanta.

strokar.x: to do the act called for by the ideas above defined

stroko.x: indicates a single movement, an elementary, sudden act: stroke, coup, feat; (in game) move; (fencing) thrust; (of dice) throw; (rowing) stroke; (of whips) smack

stropo.x: (nav.) strop, strap, sling (for a block, or piece of cargo)

strukturo.x: structure: manner of building, construction, form; (fig.) disposition, arrangement. Ex.: Ta edifico havas stabila strukturo. La strukturo di la vivanta korpo, di poemo.

studiar.x: (tr., intr.) to study (ulo, pri ulo); (cf. lernar)

stulo.x: chair: seat with back; (cf. tabureto, benko)

stultajo.x: silly thing; foolish act; absurdity. V. exp.: Stulta expresas ideo min forta kam stupida. Stupideso esas kompleta manko di inteligenteso. Stulteso esas plu juste manko di sagaceso, di judikado; II-711. Ant.: saja. I

stumpo.x: stump (of tree, limb, column, cabbage, etc.); core (of an apple)

stuntita.x: stunted. Def.: Impedar la kresko e developo di ulu, ulo; IV-512.

stupidigar.x: to make (ulu) s.; stultify, besot, dull. Ex.: Homi obtuza e stupida. Mieno stupida. Mala traktado stupidigas infanto. V. exp.: vid. stulta. Ant.: inteligenta.

stupizar.x: to stop or cover with tow or oakum; (nav.) to calk (caulk); (tech.) to pack (a piston, etc.)

sturmo.x: storm, with thunder and lightning, thunderstorm; (fig.) tumult. V. exp.: Sturmo; mala vetero konsistanta ek fulmini, tondri, akompanata o sequata generale da pluvo o grelo. Tempesto: mala vetero konsistanta ek granda vento, qua sur la maro efektigas ondegi danjeroza por la navigado, e qua ofte akompanesas da pluvo. L’unesma fenomeno povas eventar sen vento; la duesma konsistas esence en vento, e povas eventar, sive sen pluvo o grelo, sive sen ula elektrala fenomeno; VIII-198.

stuvagar.x: to dry or heat in a slow, moist heat; (med.) to foment (a wound); (cf. furnelo). V. exp.: On stufas koquajo en irga vazo klozita, e ne en stuvo. Existas stuvi humida e sika, t.e. kun o sen aquo-vaporo; II-648.

stuvo.x: a stove or room used to produce hot air for drying, or hot vapo(u)r for sweating; sweating room; hot-air bath; vapo(u)r-bath; drying-room

su.x: (reflex. Pronoun, 3rd person, singular or plural; acc.: sun): self, oneself, himself, herself, itself, themselves

sub.x: (prep.) under, below, beneath; lower in place or rank; denoting subordination, dependence

subiteso.x: suddenness. Def.: qua esas tote ne-previdita. Ex.: Subita morto, chanjo di la vetero.

sublimajo.x: sublime object. Ex.: Sublima abnego, genio.

sublimato.x: a sublimate. Def.: Vaporigar ulo e lore rikondensar ol a stando solida.

submisar.x: (tr.) to reduce (ulu) to a state of submission, dependence, to subdue, subjugate

submisionar.x: (intr.) to (make a) tender (por, pri) (a contract, loan)

submisita.x: subdued, subjugated. Ex.: Submisar la rebeli, sua pasioni. Me submisas me a vua decido. La submiso di la urbo. Ica populo submisesas (facis sua submiso) ed esas nun en (stando di) perfekta submiseso.

subordinar.x: (tr.) to (make) subordinate, subject (ulu, ulo, ad ulu, ulo)

subordinite.x: subordinately. Ex.: La guvernerio subordinas la civitani a la  judiciisti. La legi subordinas la civitani a la judiciala oficisti. Subordinar sua volo ad altru. Mantenar subordineso en la armeo. Propoziciono subordinita. La chefo fidas a lua subordinati (od inferiori, od imperati).

subornar.x: (tr.) to suborn: induce or instigate (ulu, uli) to do an evil deed, by bribes or the like; to bribe, tamper with; (cf. seduktar, koruptar)

subsidiar.x: (tr.) to subsidize: grant a subsidy to (ulu)

subsidio.x: subsidizing, subsidy; sum granted. Ex.: Subsidiar paketboto. La subsidiajo esis 50 mili, ma mem ca subsidio ne esis suficanta.

substancala.x: substantial (cf. esenco). Exd.: Substanci korpala, metala, liquida. Esis multa vorti ma nula substanco en la diskurso. Indemno substancala. Griza substanco di la cerebro.

substantivigar.x: to substantivize: to convert into, or use as, a substantive.

substitucar.x: (tr.) to substitute: put in place of another (ulu ad ulu, ulo ad ulo) (jur.) to entail (an estate)

substitucato.x: a substitute. V. exp.: A remplasas (E.: takes the place of) B = A okupas (provizore o definitive) la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di B.  A remplas-eskas = A prenas (komencas okupar la loko di B, pozas su od aparas en la loko di B.  C remplas-igas B per A = C pozas (o produktas) A en la loko antee okupita da B. En la sama kazo, C substitucas A a B, od, C remplasigas B per A (E. puts A in place of B). Praktikal regulo: Omnafoye kande la propoziciono kontenas tri termini, on devas uzar remplas-igar o substitucar, ne remplasar. Uzez la prepoziciono «ad» kun substitucar, ne «per». Uzez «per» kun remplas-igar. (Substitucar un kozo ad ultra; remplas-igar un kozo per altra; do, en la pasivo: remplasata da … remplasigata per … e substitucata a ….. ); III-102. V-283; kp. suplantar, suplear.

substituto.x: (jur.) deputy magistrate, surrogate. V. exp.: Substituto esas la nomo di ofico di persono; por la kozi ni havas surogato; IV-583.

subtila.x: (physical) subtile: not dense or gross; (mental) subtile, subtle: keen, sharp, acute

subtiligar.x: to subtilize: render fine or ethereal; to draw subtle distinctions in, refine into niceties. Ex.: Subtila veneno, polvo. Subtila intelekto, mento. La subtilaji di metafiziko. Troa subtileso nocas argumento.

subvencionar.x: (tr.) to grant a subvention to, subsidize

subvenciono.x: subvention: government aid or bounty; (cf. subsidiar). Ex.: Subvenciono di teatro di la stato.

subversar.x: (tr.) to subvert: overturn from the foundation: bring to ruin or destrucion, as by moral or political force; (cf. renversar)

sucedar.x: (od, inter-sequar) l’una l’altra: to succeed, follow one another. Ex.: Jorno sucedas la nokto. La sucedado di nia idei. Louis XII esis la sucedanto di Charles VIII. Chapitri sucedanta.

sucesar.x: (intr.) to succeed: accomplish one’s purpose, be successful

suciar.x: (tr.) to care about: be concerned, solicitous, anxious about (ulu, ulo)

sudorifar.x: to perspire, be in a sweat

suficante.x: sufficiently. Ex.: Cent franki suficos a me. Suficajo de frumento.Kapaceso suficanta. Esar suficante klara. To suficas a me, equivalas: me konsideras, aceptas to kom suficanta. V. exp: vid. saciar, sat.

suficas.x: (impers.) it is sufficient; that is enough; that will do

sufixigar.x: to suffix: annex at the end of a word.

suflar.x: (intr.) to blow (wind, etc.); (tr.) to blow: force wind or breathe upon; (theat.) to prompt (a speaker); (chess, checkers) to huff

sufokar.x: (tr., intr.) to suffocate, stifle, smother, choke; (fig.) to check, subdue; (cf. strangular)

sufrar.x: (tr., intr.) to suffer (from), be afflicted with; (cf. dolorar, subisar, tolerar)

sugar.x: (tr.) to suck (candy, etc., ulo de ulo)

suko.x: juice: sap (of vegetables) the water (of fruit)

sukombar.x: (intr.) to succumb (ad), to yield, get worsted. Ex.: Sukombar a tento, a doloro, sub la pezajo.

sukrizar.x: to s.; put s. in or on; to sweeten

sukusar.x: (tr.) to cause violent vibrations in, to shake, shake off, jerk, jog, jostle, jolt; (cf. agitar, ocilar, shancel-igar, tremar)

sukusope.x: by shakes, jerks. Ex.: Sukusar arboro, tablo, sua kapo. Sukusado la polvo de la vesto. Sukusado di veturo sur voyo aspera.

sulko.x: (also fig.) furrow (as made by plow); ship’s track

sumaria.x: (adj.) summary. Def.: Dic-esas pri agi facita rapide, sen tempo-perdo o neutila formulaji. V-623. Ex.: Sumaria judiko.

sume.x: (fig.) finally, on the whole, after all

sumigar.x: to sum up, cast up, totalize

sumigo.x: summing up. Def.: Rezultajo di la adiciono di plura nombri o quanti. Ex.: La sumo di la unaji. Sumigar du nombri.

sumno.x: summons, Def.: Demandar impereme o postular segun yuro e legala formi; III-417. Ex.: Sumnar debanto pagar. Sumnar fortreso kapitulacar.

suolo.x: sole (of boots, shoes) (cf. plando); a sort of horn under a horse’s hoof

supear.x: (intr.) to sup, take a (midnight) supper; (noktomezala) -o: (midnight) supper

super.x: (prep., elevation) over, above (but not in contact with; cf. sur); (of degree) over, more than, greater than, superior to

superbigar.x: to make (ulu) c., to puff up

superfluajo.x: (object) superfluity; overplus, (work of) superogation. Def.: Qua esas troa. Ex.: Ornivi, regreti superflua. Superflueso de vorti. Esas superfluaji en ta verko.

superioreso.x: superiority. Ex.: La arki-episkopo esas la superioro di (od esas superiora ad) la episkopo, e do havas superioreso. V. exp.: vid. alta. Ant.: inferiora.

supernumerarieso.x: s. service or time; state of being a s. Def.: Employato quan on admisas exter rango, por vartar ordinara employo; IV-584.

supino.x: (gram.) supine: verbal noun, similar to the English verbals in -ing.

suplantar.x: (tr.) to supplant (a rival, etc.). V. exp.: B supleas A kande lu okupas la loko (ofico, funciono, rolo) di A nur provizore, ne kun la sama yuri o grado. B suplantas A kande lu privacas A de lua loko por remplasar lu permanante; kp. Substitucar.

supleanto.x: substitute, assistant, deputy. Ex.: Lua laborego supleas (E. makes up for) (manko di) talento. Cadie Sro. X. supleos vu. V. exp.: vid. suplantar.

suplear.x: (tr.) to supply: make up, make good (the defficiency), furnish (what is wanted); to take the place of, the duty of (temporarily)

suplemente.x: in addition, by way of s.

suplikar.x: (tr.) to supplicate, humbly beseech, entreat, beg (ulu pri, por ulo). Def.: Pregar ulu kun insistemeso e submiseso. V. exp.: vid. implorar.

suportanto.x: (person) supporter, upholder. Ex.: La pilastri qui suportas la vulto esas suportili. Suportar la spensi di familio. Suportar (E. bear) la koldeso, la doloro. Esar sen suporto, sen helpo, sen amiki. Suportanti di la guvernerio. V. exp.: Suportar esas portar kozo sen movo, tale ke ol ne falez; ma portar uzesas generale kun movo. Metafore, suportar uzesas en senco vicina di tolerar; IV-162

suportar.x: (tr., lit. and fig.) to support: bear the weight of; (cf. sustenar, tolerar)

supra.x: top, of or relating to what is highest up in space or degree

supre.x: on top, overhead, above, aloft, on high; upwards, upstairs (cf. supere)

supresajo.x: what is suppressed. Def.: Impedar existar o (jurnali, e.c.) aparar. Ex.: Supresar sedicio, libro, imposto. Supreso di pruvo di krimino. V. exp.: vid. abolisar.

suprizanta.x: surprising. Ex.: Surprizar furtero, la enemiko. Mi-voye la pluvo surprizis ni. Li timas surpriz-atako da la enemiko. Donar surpriz-buxo a la puero.

suprizar.x: (tr.) to surprise, take by s., take unawares, to come or fall upon suddenly and unexpectedly, overtake suddenly; (cf. astonar, kaptacar)

sur.x: (prep.) on, upon: above and in contact with the upper part of something; resting on the top of (cf. super, an); (arith.) divided by

surdento.x: tooth grown over another, projecting tooth.

surfacala.x: superficial: relating to the s.; (fig.) specious (plan, judgement, reasoning; cf. ne-profunda, ne-serioza)

surmenar.x: (tr.) to overdrive, drive beyond one’s strength, overtax, overstrain (super-charjar, fatigar). Ex.: Surmenar kavalo. Surmenar sua forteso per laborado, sua mento per studiado.

surogato.x: (of things) substitute: that which is put in place of another thing; (med.) succedaneum

surveyar.x: to keep an eye on, superintend, look after, watch over, inspect

suskriptajo.x: subscription: amount contributed. Ex.: Me suskriptas cent franki kom yarala kontributo ad ca entraprezo. Me abonas ta revuo ed anke suskriptas pekunio por la mantenokaso.

suskriptar.x: (tr., intr.) to subscribe: contribute a definite sum to an undertaking; (cf. signatar, subskribar)

suskripto.x: subscription: act of contributing (N.B. not to a newspaper, cf. abono); the consent in writing

suspektar.x: (tr.) to suspect: hold in suspicion, to distrust; doubt the hono(u)r, fidelity or sincerity of; to imagine guilty; (cf. des-fidar, konjektar)

suspektindo.x: a suspect. Ex.: Suspektar ulu pri krimino, pri herezio. Ta suspekto esas male fondita. Lu mem suspektas sua amiki.

suspendar.x: (tr., phys. sense) to suspend, hang up: fix (ulo) on high and leave hanging; (cf. pendar, akrochar)

suspensar.x: (tr.) to suspend (functionaries, judgement, privileges, work) (cf. suspendar, halt-igar, interruptar). Def.: Revokar dum tempo; VI-163.

sustenar.x: (tr., phys. and fig.) to sustain, bear, uphold; prevent from falling (cf. sub-tenar, suportar, mantenar, helpar, defensar)

sustracionar.x: (tr., arith.) to subtract, deduct (ulo, de ulo). Ant.: adicionar.

sustraktar.x: (tr.) to abstract, appropriate (fraude); purloin, steal, embezzle (money, etc.). Def.: Deprenar o furtar ulo per habileso o per fraudo.

susurar.x: (tr., intr.) to whisper, murmur or mutter (words); (fig.) to whisper, sough (of the wind)

suvereneso.x: sovereignty. Ex.: Autoritato suverena. En demokratio, la populo havas la suvereneso.
