tabeleto.x: tablet, V. exp.: Tabelo esas omna plata surfaco, qua expozesas a la vido e montras ulo; ne nur la tabelo di materii di libro, ma omna kadro, en qua on expozas nomi od irgaspeca objekti; la nigra tabelo, sur qua la matematikisti skribas; do anke la pikturi, segun quante li esas movebla (ne adheranta a muro, ma pendita e kadrizita). Tabulo esas surfaco plana e horizontala, qua dividas armoro, biblioteko, e.c. e servas por suportar kozi. Ol esas generala ek ligno; ma quale sempre, lua skopo multe plu importas kam lua materio. Tablo anke esas plano horizontala, ma suportata da la sulo, kontre ke tabulo esas parto di moblo, e generale diplasebla vertikale; VI-604.

tabelo.x: a flat surface for writing, painting, drawing, etc., hence that which is thereon: table (of contents), list

tabernaklo.x: (Hebrew hist.) tabernacle, tent for ark of covenant (R.C. rel.) receptacle of the consecrated vessels; (fig.) holy place

tabureto.x: stool: small seat without back (cf stulo)

tacar.x: (tr., of persons) to say nothing about, pass (ulo) over in silence, not to say (ulo); (intr.) to be silent: not to speak, to hold one’s tongue

tacigar.x: to silence, hush (ulu), to reduce (ulu) to silence

tagizar.x: to tag (lace, etc.) i.e. fit with a point

tago.x: tag: a metallic point at the end of string; tag (of lace)

takigrafo.x: tachygraphy: stenography (especially of the ancient Greeks and Romans).

takimetro.x: tachymeter, tachometer: instrument for measuring velocity, speed-indicator, -meter.

tako.x: (nav.) cleat. Def.: korpo T-forma, fixigita per la bazo di la T: ol utilesas ex. por ligar la navi per kordo (amari); VI-603

taktismo.x: (biol.) influence exerted by certain substances upon development of unicellular organisms.

takto.x: (phys.) sense of touch, feeling; (fig.) tact: nice discernment of what is fit, proper

taliar.x: (tr.) to cut (out), carve, trim, prune (so as to give a certain form to), to shape (cloth, wood, metal, ivory, etc.)

talmaniere.x: thus, so, in such a way

talonecitar.x: to urge (a horse) with the h.s.

talono.x: heel (of foot, of shoe); (fig.) anything heel-shaped; as, heel of a keel, of a pipe, etc.

talusigar.x: to slope (ulo): -a rivo: steep bank, bluff.

taluso.x: a slope, declivity; (of R.R.) embankment; (fort.) talus

talvego.x: (physiog.) thalweg: a line following the lowest part of a valley, whether underwater or not; a line of continuous maximum descent from any point on a land surface, or that cutting all contours at right angles (Webster), (gen.) river bed.

tam.x: (adv.) as (much, etc.; comparative sense; followed by adjective, adverb, or kam)

tamburino.x: tambour: a small and long snare drum. V. exp.: mi-tamburo.

tamen.x: (conj.) yet, however, nevertheless, still. Ex.: Lu ne esas bona, tamen me helpos lu. Quankam la pueri ne esas sempre jentila, tamen omna bon-kordia homo esas atraktata a li.

tampar.x: (tr.) to tamp (as with a hammer), to ram (as with a pile-driver, rammer).

tamponizar.x: to plug (ulo) with a tampon, to stopper.

tampono.x: stopper, tampon: plug of cotton, wood, metal, etc.; (artil.) tampion; (cf. stop-ilo)

tandeme.x: in tandem: in single line (not abreast): -veturo: carriage with horses in tandem

tangar.x: (intr., nav.) to heave, pitch: rising and falling of bow and stern of ship or boat

tanko.x: tank; (fig., milit.) tank. Def.: Vazo metala klozita o klozebla hermetike (ne kuvo qua esas apertita a l’aero); III-491.

tapar.x: (tr., tech.) to (screw-) tap (for insertion of screw or making thread for putting on a nut), to worm

tapiseto.x: small c.; rug; cloth for table, etc.

tapotar.x: (tr., tech., med.) to percuss (as in massage); (gen. sense) to tap.

tardaigar.x: to retard, delay, put off, protract, spin out

tarjo.x: targe(t): species of shield or buckler.

tarmezurar.x: (tr.) to tare: ascertain the amount of tare in (ulo)

taro.x: (com.) tare: an allowance made for the weight of the container of goods

tartanstofo.x: (fabric) tartan, plaid (as worn by the Scots).

tastar.x: (intr.) to feel one’s way, grope, fumble

tautologio.x: tautology. Def.: Ne simpla repeto, ma vana repeto di la sama ideo sub diversa formi; V-90.

tayo.x: waist: trunk of the body above the hips

tebaido.x: desert, lonely solitude. V. exp.: Nomo (Thebaid) propra (geografiala) diveninta komuna per metaforo.

tegar.x: (tr.) to cover (a bed, a piece of furniture, etc.); to caparison

teknikala.x: technical. Ex.: La tekniko di la pikt-arto. Teknikala termini.

teleskopumar.x: to drive together trains, etc., so that one or both slides over the other.

telizar.x: to mount, paste, sew, put (ulo) on cloth

temperar.x: (tr., also mus.) to temper: moderate, allay, mollify; (cf. hard-igar)

tempestar.x: (intr. of weather and fig.) to storm: blow with violence, blow a gale; (fig.) to make a great noise, rage, bluster (cf. furiar, bruisar)

tempesto.x: tempest, gale, violent storm (with noise of elements) (cf. sturmo, uragano)

tempestoza.x: tempestuous; (fig.) boisterous. Ex.: La vento tempestas. (fig.) Lu tempestis pri la konduto di sua pueri. Navo batita da la tempesto. Tempesti di pasiono. V. ex.: vid. sturmo.

templano.x: member of a t.; (fig.) knight templar.

tempo.x: time: part of duration (cf. foyo); (gram.) tense (of a verb); (mus.) tempo, time

tempope.x: from time to time, now and then, at times

tenaca.x: (tech.) tenacious: strongly adhering or cohering; tough; (cf. persist-ema)

tenaceso.x: toughness, tenacity. Ex.: Pecho, metalo, e.c. esas tenaca.

tenaliagar.x: (tr.) to use p. on (ulo); to hold (ulo) with p. V. exp.: vid. pinco.

tenar.x: (tr.) to hold, have hold of, hold on; to keep in a given situation or position

tenaro.x: (anat.) thenar: ball of hand or foot.

tendencar.x: (intr.) to tend: be directed to an object or purpose; be inclined, lead to; (cf. vizar)

tenera.x: tender, susceptible to love or kindness, loving (person, heart)

tenono.x: (carp.) tenon. Def.: Extremajo di peco ek ligno, metalo, e.c., qua eniras mortezo.

tensar.x: (tr.) to stretch: draw in length; to strain, tense; (a gun) to cock

tensilo.x: stretching instrument. Ex.: Tensar kordo, la fingri. Tenso di la muskuli, di la mento. Elektrala tenso. (fig.) To tensas la situeso.

tenua.x: tenuous, thin, spare, fine: thin and long

tenuigo.x: attenuation. Def.: Desgrosa; qua havas mikra periferio; qua havas nur la du dimensioni: dina e longa. Ex.: Tenua filo, vaporo, kolono, gambi, voco. V. exp.: vid. dika. Ant.: grosa.

teokrato.x: theocrat. V. exp.: Ne partisano di la teokratio, ma chefo di teokratio; (cf. teokratio); IV-643.

teologala.x: divine (virtue). Ex.: Fido, espero, karitato esas la tri teologala vertui.

tepideskar.x: to become t. V. Exp.: La radiko tepida esas necesa por indikar to quo ne esas kolda: varm-eta e kold-eta esas nejusta od neklara. La metaforal uzado di la vorti esas utila en etiko teologio; II-712.

terajo.x: piece of e., object made from e., earhtwork

terco.x: (astron., math.) 1/60 of a second; (mus., cards, fencing) tierce.

tereno.x: terrain: small piece of ground, viewed as to its fitness for some purpose, as for a building, a battle, etc.

teriako.x: (pharm.) theriac(a). Def.: Anciena medikamento kontre veneno.

terminaro.x: terminology; bounds (to which one may go)

terminizar.x: to bound, set bounds, set landmarks

termino.x: (gram., math., log.) term (cf. periodo); boundary), boundary mark, landmark; (of R.R.) terminus; (gen.) the farthermost point

termologio.x: thermology: science or theory of heat.

terniono.x: (math.) ternion, ternary: a form having three variables.

tero.x: earth (as a planet and as ground; cf. sulo, tereno)

terorar.x: (intr.) to be terrified, be frightened (cf. trepidar)

tezo.x: thesis; proposition, theme supported by argument; undergraduate’s essay.

tikar.x: (intr.) to have a local and habitual convulsive movement of the muscles (especially the facial muscles); (fig.) to have a bad habit, an ugly knack; (of a horse) to be vicious

tiko.x: wry motion; bad habit. Ex.: Il tikas (od, havas la tiko) rodar sua ungli.

tiktakar.x: (intr.) to go tic-tac, to tick (as a clock)

til.x: (prep.) (of time) till, until; (in space) (un) to, as far as

timar.x: (tr.) to fear (or, to be afraid that) (or, lest) something may happen; to dread, be apprehensive

timbro.x: (of a clock) clock-bell; a hand bell (such as used on tables, without a loose clapper but struck by a hammer as in a clock).

timidigar.x: intimidate. Ex.: Timida mulieri, infanto. Ant.: audac-oza, brava.

timigar.x: to cause to dread, make afraid

timono.x: (single) pole, shaft (of a cart). V. exp.: vid. brankardo.

timpano.x: (anat.) tympanum: drum of ear; (arch.) tympanum; (mus.) dulcimer.

tinio.x: (med) ringworm, especially of the scalp; scald-head; favus; tinea capitis.

tinklar.x: (intr.) -igar: (tr.) (lente) to toll: sound a bell slowly

tinkletar.x: to tinke, jingle, clink (as small bells, money); to patter (as feet, sleet against the window, etc.).

tino.x: tub, water-cask; firkin (for butter). Def.: Speco de vazo konstruktita quale barelo, ma apertita; IV-643.

tintar.x: (tr.) to dye; (fig.) tint, tinge, stain (cf. kolor-izar)

tipo.x: (print., med., nat. hist.) type; (of measures, weights) standard, model; symbol

tirado.x: (lit. and fig.) tirade. Def.: Teknikal termino di teatro: longa peco (generale brilanta od eloquenta), quan un persono dicas sen interrupto; III-268.

tiraliar.x: (intr.) to engage in desolutory firing; to bang away; to skirmish fire

tiraliero.x: (F.army) tirailleur; a soldier placed so as to harass the enemy; sharpshooter.

tirar.x: (tr.) to draw, pull, tug; (of chimneys) to draw; (cf. tranar, haular, vindar, tensar, cherpar, extraktar)

titrar.x: (tr., chem.) to titrate: determine the standard, the dosage of (a solution, a substance)

titulizar.x: to entitle: give a title to (cf. nomizar)

toko.x: toque: a flat cap; a close fitting bonnet

tolerar.x: (tr.) to tolerate, put up with, suffer, allow, bear, endure (ulo, de ulu)

tondar.x: (tr.) to shear: clip from surface with shears, etc. (cf. rekortar)

tonizar.x: (med.) to give tone to; (photog.) to tone: bring as a print, to a required color (colour)

tono.x: tone, pitch (of voice) (mus.) tone; degree, pitch of sound; (med.) tone: condition of an organ

tontino.x: tontine. Def.: Sistemo di mutuala asekuro, inventita da Tonti (1653); IV-643.

tordar.x: (tr.) to twist, wring, contort; (med.) to strain, sprain; (of wood) to warp

torefaktar.x: (tr.) to torrefy: to dry, parch, roast (by exposure to heat). Ex.: Torefaktar la kafeo-grani.

torento.x: torrent: rushing stream (of water, words, people, etc.)

torida.x: (geog.) torrid; (cf. tropik-ala, varm-ega). Ex.: Torida zono.

torono.x: (nav.) strand (of a rope); (cf. brino). Def.: Una de la kordi, qui kuntordita kompozas plu grosa kordo; V-157.

torporar.x: (intr.) to be benumbed, or in a state of torpor (as from cold)

torsado.x: twisted fringe or cord; bullion (as of epaulets).

torso.x: torso: trunk, chest, bust (of a person or statue).

tortikolo.x: (med.) torticollis: rheumatic pain causing wry-neck; (fig.) stiff-neck, crick in the neck.

tostar.x: (intr.) to give a toast (ad ulu), to drink a friend’s health

tosto.x: toast(ing): drinking (ad ulu) the health, the prosperity.

tota.x: entire; whole (of one thing; cf. omna)

tra.x: (adv. tra-e): through, across (noting passage or motion in crossing)

traco.x: trace: mark left by foot of man or beast; track; footprint; (hunt.) trail

tradicionar.x: (tr.) to transmit, hand down (ulo) by tradition

trafiko.x: traffic: movement of persons, goods, etc. Def.: Movado o cirkulado en komunikilo (voyo, telegrafala lineo, e.c.); III-328. Ex.: La trafiko ye ca strad-angulo esas tre densa.

traito.x: feature (of the face), lineament; trait, characteristic

trakar.x: (tr.)(hunt.) to drive game, to beat up (a wood); (fig.) to ferret out, close in on; hem in; cut off on all sides

traktar.x: (tr.) to treat: behave to, or toward (ulu); deal with; handle, discourse on (a subject); (chem.) to subject (ulo) to the action of; (N.B. not medical; cf. kuracar)

tramplar.x: (intr.) to stamp (the feet); (of horses) to paw (the ground). Def.: Frapar la sulo per la pedi, sen avancar; VI-115. Agitar la pedi pro nervozeso od altra sentimento: nepacienteso, iraco, e.c.; IV-587.

tranajo.x: anything which drags; trail, train (of a dress)

tranar.x: (tr.) to draw, drag along, trail (ulo, dop su)

trancar.x: (intr., hypnotic, epilep.) to be in a trance or in a hypnotic state

tranceskar.x: to go into a t. Def.: Esar en stando nekoncianta dum epilepsio, hipnoto, e.c.

tranchar.x: (tr.) to cut (completely) through, cut off, carve (meat); (cf. de-tranchar)

tranchilo.x: a cutting instrument, as a knife, etc.

tranquila.x: (physical and mental) tranquil, quiet, still, not in motion

tranquiligar.x: to (make) still. Def.: Qua esas sen agitado. Ex.: Tranquila vicino, strado, infanto. Restez tranquila. V. exp. vid. kalma.

trans.x: (prep.) on the other side of, beyond, across, over (with or without motion); (cf. tra)

transa.x: which is on the other side

transajo.x: object beyond or on other side; the hereafter

transaktar.x: (intr.) to come to terms, to compound, compromise (kun ulu, pri ulo)

transaktema.x: inclined to compromise. Def.: Konciliar deskonkordo per reciproka konceso. Ex.: Esas plu bona transaktar kam procesar. On devas ne transaktar kun sua honoro.

transferar.x: (tr.) to transfer (ulo ad ulu); (cf. transportar). Transfero di ula yuro ad altru.

transformar.x: (tr.) to transform (ulo ad ulo): to change the form of

transirar.x: (tr., intr.) to go across (to the other side), to traverse (cf. tra-irar)

transitala.x: transient: relating to transit (cf. provizora, tempala)

transitar.x: (intr.) to be or pass in transit

transitiva.x: (gram.) transitive. Ex.: Komercaji transitas de una urbo ad altra. La transito de monarkio a republiko. Transitala komercajo. Verbo transitiva.

translacar.x: (tr., intr., mechan. and fig.) to move, shift (ulo) from one place to another

translaco.x: translation: (mechan.) motion in which all points of the moving body have at any instant the same velocity and direction of motion. (Webster).

translucida.x: translucent: transmitting light imperfectly, semi-transparent. Ex.: Vitro despolisita esas translucida. Ant.: opaka.

transmisar.x: (tr.) to transmit. Ex.: la nervi transmisas la impresi. Transmisar impero. Transmiso di lua vertui a lua filii.

transmutar.x: (tr.) to transmute (ulo ad ulo). Ex.: L’alkemiisti probis transmutar matali ad oro.

transparanta.x: transparent; (cf. diafana). Ex.: Brilanta objekti transparas tra la vitro. Sun-radii transparas tra l’aquo. Roki sub l’aquo esas transparanta per la sun-radii (pro ke l’aquo esas diafana).

transparar.x: (intr.) to shine (through), glimmer, be visible (tra, sub ulo); (cf. lumar)

transpirar.x: (intr.) to transude, transpire, ooze out, exhale; (cf. exudar, sudor-ifar); (fig. of news) to transpire: be divulged, become known, leak out. Ex.: La humori transpiras tra la pelo. Gasi transpiras de korpi mortinta. Pos la recevo di ta telegramo, nula informo nova transpiris.

transubstanciar.x: (tr.) to transubstantiate; change into another substance

trasar.x: (tr.) to trace, draw: mark out, delineate, chalk out

tratar.x: (tr., com.) to draw (a bill of exchange) on

traveo.x: truss (of a bridge); (arch.) bay (of joists); (of a church) triforium. Def.: Intervalo di du trabi, fosti, koloni, pilasti. (N.B. ne esas sempre apertita quale pordo o fenestro); IV-644.

traverseto.x: bracket. V. exp.: Travers-eto esas stango horizontala, qua suportas tabuli di armoro, di biblioteko, e.c.; IV-644.

travestiar.x: (tr.) to disguise (by assuming the dress of a person of another sex or condition in life); (fig. burleske) to travesty

travo.x: trave: a frame to confine an unruly horse or ox while shoeing.

treko.x: trail: footpath, unfinished road; (of race-course) track

trelicho.x: coarse sacking, sackcloth; denim, dungaree cloth. Def.: Speco de grosa tolo, qua uzesas nur por facar saki, ma anke (laborala) vesti; IV-644.

treliso.x: trellis-, lattice-work (of wood or metal) plaited wire-work

trempar.x: (tr.) to soak, steep, drench, wet (thoroughly) (ulo en ulo). Ex.: Trempar la pano en la vino. Trempar la linjaro. Trempado di la sulo per la pluvo.

trepidar.x: (intr.) to shake, quiver, tremble; (cf. tremar). Ex.: La trepidado di korpo-membri, di la nervi. Vapornavo trepidadas pro la movado di sua mashinaro e la ondi.

tresayar.x: (intr.) to give a start, be startled, (feel a) thrill (de, pro)

tresto.x: trestle, wooden horse: a horizontal piece with four legs serving as a support; easel

trezoreyo.x: treasury: place where t. is found; (R.C. rel.) place for relics and ornaments: (cf. kas-erio)

trezorifar.x: (intr.), -igar (tr.) to treasure up, hoard up. Ex.: La trezori di la tero. Ca infanto esas trezoro.

tribono.x: tribune: a Roman magistrate. Ex.: La tribono acensis sur la tribuno.

tribular.x: (tr.) to cause tribulation to, to distress, afflict. Ta tempo tribulas nia psiki. La tribuli di autoro.

tribunalo.x: tribunal, court (of justice), bench, judgement seat

tributanta.x: (ad), -anto, -ero: tributary. Ex.: Tributar a Caesar. Ta lando esas tributanta ad Anglia.

triduum.x: (R.C. rel.) prayers continuing for three days.

triftongo.x: (gram.) triphthong. Def.: Grupo di tri vokali formacanta un silabo; V-486.

trigramo.x: trigram, trigraph. Def.: Grupo di tri literi reprezentanta un sono; V-487.

trio.x: any three things or persons united; trio, triade, triplet, trey

trista.x: (of persons or things) sad, sorrowful, mournful, cheerless, dispirited, doleful, gloomy

tristigar.x: to sadden, throw gloom over. Ex.: Trista informo, vizajo, adio. La morto di mia amiko tristigas me. Ant.: Gaya, joy-oza, kontenta.

trivialigar.x: to make banal. Ex.: Trivial expresuro, stilo.

trogo.x: trough (as for animals); hod, tray (as for carrying mortar); (cf. vazo), -o-roto: bucket (of a water-wheel)

trompar.x: (tr.) to deceive, impose upon, delude (denotes intention; cf. eror-igar, deceptar, dup-igar)

trompiva.x: fallacious. Ex.: Trompar la fido di ulu per ulo.

tronsidar.x: to sit enthroned; (fig.) to lord it over

trotigar.x: to cause to trot, to trot (a horse).

trotuaro.x: sidewalk, pavement: footway of stone, asphalt, etc.

trovajo.x: thing found; (treasure-) trove; (fig.) godsend, windfall. Ex.: Trovar trezoro, kulpo, voyo, amiko.

trubaduro.x: troubadour. V. exp.: Trubaduri apartenas a Suda Francia, e truvero a Norda Francia (e vicina landi); IV-645.

trublar.x: (tr.) to trouble, disturb, muddle: throw into disorder; (of liquids) to make turbid or muddy; (cf. konfuz-igar, perturbar)

truflizar.x: to stuff, or cover with t.s.

truismo.x: truism. Def.: Verajo evidenta, triviala, di aqua l’enunco esas neutila, do ridinda; V-487.

truko.x: (R.R.) flat-car (cf. var-vagono). Def.: Fervoyala, platformatra var-vagono neklozita.

trumpetagar.x: to play the t.; (fig.) to t. forth, spread abroad

trupo.x: troop, band: company of persons having same occupation; (theat.) company, troop; (of animals) band, herd, flock

trusar.x: (tr.) to tuck up, put a tuck in; turn up, pin up, tie up. V. exp.: Trusar esas nek levar, nek faldar: on trusas robo, mantelo, maniki, pantalono, bordi di chapelo, mustacho; mem figurale nazo esas trusita; III-471.

truvero.x: trouvère, trouveur. V. exp.: vid. trubaduro.

tu.x: (acc.: tun; pl.: tui ) thou: familiar form of 2nd person singular: you; used in speaking to a child or an intimate friend

tualetar.x: (intr.) to make one’s toilet: wash and dress; careful adjustment of dress, etc.

tuberkulo.x: (bot.) tubercle; (physiol.) a small tumor (tumour), or tumorlike elevation; (cf. tubero).

tufo.x: tuft, bunch, cluster, clump, wisp (of straw: assemblage of things of the same nature: threads, feathers, hair, etc. (cf. penacho)

tuliparboro.x: t. tree, whitewood, white poplar: liriodendron (Liriodendron Tulipifera).

tumefaktar.x: (tr., med.) to tumefy, cause to swell

tumultar.x: (intr.) to raise a tumult, disturbance, uproar, hubbub, to (cause a) row, a riot

tuniko.x: (coat of soldiers, pupils) tunic, an antique undergarment; (anat.) coat, film, tunic (of the eye); wall (of the stomach); (bot.) coat, integument

turnar.x: (tr., intr.) to turn (from right to left), turn around, to (cause to) move circularly), twist, whirl, wheel around; (cf. jirar, rotacar, renversar, volvar, tornar)

turnirar.x: (intr.) to hold a tournament, to joust, to take part in a tourney.

tusetar.x: to cough: clear one’s throat, to hem

tushar.x: (tr., intr.) to touch, be in contact with.. (N.B. not concern); to put one’s hand, foot, etc. (on); (cf. palpar, kontaktar, kontigua)

tushebla.x: tangible (cf. palp-ebla). Ex.: Tushar ulo per la fingri. Lua pedi tushis la sulo. Regardez ol, ma ne tushez.

tutelar.x: (tr.) to be guardian of (ulu) -esar da ulu: to be under the guardianship of someone

tuteligar.x: to place someone under the guardianship (of another person)

tuvar.x: (tr., nav.) to warp: move a ship or boat by a rope or cable attached to some fixed object

ubiqueso.x: ubiquity. Def.: Qua esas omnaloke; IV-270.

ula.x: some, any: indicates a certain, but only partly defined person or object;  (semi-indefinite article) a, an (used only where it is desired to emphasize indefiniteness)

ultra.x: ultra: beyond due limit; further, additional

ultre.x: (prep., adv.) besides, further, moreover, in addition (to this)

ulular.x: (intr.) to ululate: (of owls) to hoot; (of dogs, wolves, etc.)  to howl.

unesme.x: first, at first, first of all

unigar.x: to unify: to form into one (cf. uniform-igar)

unika.x: unique; without another of the same kind; only, single, sole; (fig.) unequalled,  unrivalled, unparalleled, unprecedented (cf. nura)

unionar.x: (tr., immaterial sense) to unite (cf. juntar, ligar)

urogalo.x: capercailzie: the largest European grouse (Tetrao urogallus).

urtikago.x: (med.) urtication: whipping or  stinging with nettles.

ushero.x: usher (judicial courts, etc.). Def.: Ta qua komisesas oficale por konocigar ed  exekutigar la judiciala decidi.

utilesar.x: to be useful (ad); to be used (por)

utiligar.x: to utilize,  turn to good use, turn to account, avail oneself of

uzar.x: (tr.) to use, employ: make use of (ulo); to wear out (clothing, etc.)

uzufruktar.x: (tr., jur.) to have the usufruct of (ulo).

uzukaptar.x: (tr., jur.) to have the usucaption of (ulo).

uzurpar.x: (tr.) to usurp (ulo de ulu); to encroach upon, trench upon, infringe

uzurpo.x: usurpation, encroachment. Ex.: Uzurpar la trono, ula yuro, povo, domeno.

vabo.x: honey-comb. Def.: Konstrukturo ek vaxo, quan la abeli facas en la abeluyo IV-398.

vacilar.x: (intr.) to vacillate: be unsteady, waver, reel, stagger; to fluctuate,  waver in mind or opinion; (of light) to flicker; (in speaking) to falter

vagar.x: (intr.) to wander, rove about, stroll, stray, straggle

vajisar.x: (intr., of infants) to wail, cry. V. exp.: La specala krio di nove naskinta o  yuna infanto; IV-578.

vakancar.x: (intr.) to have a (or, be on a) vacation, holiday

vakancdio.x: a day's holiday.  Ex.: Pasar la vakanco en la ruro. Ni vakancas dufoye dum la yaro: la paskala e la somerala vakanco.

vakanta.x: vacant. Ex.: La trono, la  ofico vakas. Vakigar la trono, lo ofico. Vakanta aprtamento, episkopeso.

vakuifar.x: to make a void, produce a vacuum  (as by air-pump)

vakuigar.x: to empty, vacate; to draw (poultry), to gut (fish);  to drain (a ditch, etc.)

valorar.x: (intr.) to be worth, be equal to in value, be as good as; be fit, be useful or good  (for something); (of laws) to be in force

valorigar.x: to make (ulo) of worth, of value, make  useful for

vanajo.x: a v. act, wish. Def.: Sen-efikiva; sen-rezulta; sen reala fundmaneto. Ex.:  Vana esforci, esperi. Vaneso di homala grandaji. Vaneso di la vanaji, omno esas vanajo.

vane.x: in vain, to no purpose;  no use! -eso: vanity (N.B. not of person), emptiness, vainness (of a project, etc.)

vaporagar.x: (tr.) to steam (ulo), give a steam bath to

vaporo.x: steam (from boiling water); vapor (from liquids or fluid floating in the atmosphere);  (of wine) fume (affecting the head)

varsar.x: (tr.) to pour (out) (as liquids); to spill (accidentally); shed (blood); to empty  (solid things)

vartante.x: while waiting, in the interim (cf. dume)

varteyo.x: waiting-place, -room. Def.: Restar en la ula loko o stando, til ke ulo eventas; III-423.  Ex.: Me vartas nepaciente la decido. V. exp.: vid. expektar.

vato.x: wadding, padding: soft stuff of loose texture; prepared sheets of carded cotton (as used  to thicken dresses, quilts, etc.)

vaxo.x: wax (of any kind, nat. or artific.)

vazo.x: vessel (for holding liquids); vase (as for flowers, etc.)

vehar.x: (intr.) to go about in any sort of vehicle: ride, drive, sail

vehigar.x: to  convey, carry, cart, transport (in a vehicle)

vehilo.x: vehicle: any means of transport by land, air or water; (fig.) any means of transmitting;  (med.) excipient; menstruum

veino.x: (anat., also of marble, wood) vein; (geol., min.) vein, seam

vekar.x: (intr., also fig.) to awaken, wake up

velkar.x: (intr.) to fade away, wither, lose freshness; (of flowers) to droop

velkigar.x: to cause (ulo) to wither. Ex.: La suno velkigis la folii di la planti.

velo.x: veil; a piece of stuff used to conceal something; (fig.) cover, screen, shade

veneracema.x: reverent.  Def.: Veneraco: projunda respekto religioza o religiatra; III-328.

veniala.x: venial: that may be forgiven; excusable

ventas.x: (impers.) it is windy, the wind  is blowing, there is a (high) wind

ventro.x: belly, paunch, stomach; (of bottles, etc.) belly, body; (cf. abdomeno,  stomako)

verdajo.x: a g. object; verdure;  (pl., fig.) salad-herbs, pot-herbs

vergagar.x: (tr.) to flog (with a birch), to cane

vergo.x: rod, wand; ferule or birch (used for punishment)

verifikar.x: (tr.) to verify (by examination), to confirm; to try, test (weights and measures);  to audit; to prove (a will)

verjuso.x: verjuice: the sour juice of unripe or green fruits; (fig.) acid liquor. V. exp.:  Dicesas metafore pri vino tro yuna od acida; IV-646.

verkaro.x: literature (= books in general; cf. literaturo)

vermo.x: worm: any small creeping animal; maggot, grub Z(cf. larvo, lombriko, silko-raupo,  tenio)

vers.x: (prep., physical sense) toward(s): in the direction of (cf. ad)

versiono.x: version: manner of relating a fact (cf. tradukuro). Ex.: Existas plura versioni  pri l’acidento.

vertebro.x: vertebra: joint or bone of spine

vestaro.x: clothes, attire, dress, toilet,  garb, habiliment; raiment, wearing apparel

vestibulo.x: vestibule: front hall of an edifice, anteroom, lobby.

vestio.x: round jackets (without tails, as for waiters, fencing, etc.).

vestizar.x: to clothe, dress, array (ulu, per ulo) (cf. metar)

vestono.x: jacket: short coat for men (cf. jaketo).

veterano.x: veteran: old soldier; (fig.) any one of long practice.

vetrino.x: glass case (for showing objects, as in museums, shops, etc.), show-case.

veturirar.x: (od, -vehar): to go, travel, drive in a v.

veturo.x: vehicle (serving to transport persons or merchandise, carriage, wagon, conveyance

vexar.x: (tr.) to vex, provoke, irritate; (cf. despitar, molestar)

viatiko.x: money or provisions given for a journey; (R.C. rel.) viaticum, last sacrament.  V. exp.: La primitiva senco esas voyajo-subvenciono, de qua venas la religiala senco; IV-646.

vicerala.x: visceral. V. exp.: Vicero  havas senco diferanta de intestino, e plu vasta: ex. la kordio esas vicero; IV-81.

viciizar.x: to vitiate: taint, contaminate; to sully (the character of); (jur.) to render defective or void.  Ex.: Ebriemeso esas vicio. Vici-zar legal akto. Ant.: vertuo.

vicina.x: (esp. of people) neighboring, bordering, contiguous, adjacent (cf. proxima,  apuda, kontigua)

vicio.x: vice: fault of character (cf. defekto, manko)

vidajo.x: what is seen, a sight, a view

videnda.x: what ought or must be seen

vidigar.x: (ulo da ulu): to cause someone to see  something

vielo.x: vielle: a stringed instrument played upon with a wheel; (cf. turn-orgeno). Def.:  Instrumento muzkala kun kordi, quan on pleas per manivelo e klavi.

vigilar.x: (intr.) to abstain from sleep; to watch; to sit up; (cf. vekar)

vigilio.x: vigil; eve of a feast pf R.C. church. V. exp.: La dio ante la dio, quan on konsideras.  Necesa ed internaciona en la religial uzo; IV-646.

viktimo.x: victim: person or animal sacrificed; (fig.) sufferer, dupe

viktualio.x: victuals, provisions; (nav.) stores. Def.: Provizuri por manjar; IV-646.

vilanelo.x: villanelle: a kind of rustic ballad or dance.

vildizar.x: to stock with g.: -chasar, -kaptar:  to hunt

vindar.x: (tr.) to reel up; to wind or hoist (as with a windlass; cf. spular, hisar,  en-volvar)

vinkar.x: (tr.) to overcome, vanquish, conquer, master, defeat, get the bette of; (intr.)  to win; be victorious

violacar.x: (tr.) to violate: to infringe, transgress, break a law, one’s oath);  to ravish, rape (a female)

violentar.x: (tr.) to violate: do or use violence to, to ill use, force (ulu, ulo)

violentesar.x: to suffer violence (da). Ex.: Violentar la koncienco.

vipero.x: viper: venemous reptile, as adder; (fig.) malignant person

viraro.x: crew (of a ship), squad of men, etc.

vireso.x: virility, manliness,  manhood, man's estate, vigor

virga.x: virgin(al: entirely chaste, also in fig. sense

viro.x: a (grown) man, a manly person: male adult possessing masculine qualities, as a soldier,  etc.

virtuozeso.x: virtuosity,  virtuosoship: professional or consummate skill, artistic perfection, masterly style or play.

visar.x: (tr., intr.) to screw in: turn in a screw

vishar.x: (tr.) to wipe (off), wipe dry by rubbing; (cf. sik-igar)

visto.x: visé: official signature. Def.:  Oficale signatar o autentikigar dokumento od akto. Ex.: La visto di konsulo sur pasporto.

vitrizar.x: to furnish or cover (ulo) with g. (windows, etc.)

viulo.x: (mus.) viol; name for instruments of violin family

vivar.x: (intr., tr.) to live: be living, be alive (cf. habitar, kondutar)

vivigar.x: to vivify, quicken, give life to, animate (cf. anm-izar)

vizajo.x: visage: face of a person. Def.: L’avana parto di la homala kapo, konsiderata de  extere ed en lua expresiveso; V-679.

vizar.x: (tr., intr.) to aim at, to take aim (cf. intencar, tendencar, ambiciar)

vizitar.x: (tr.) to visit, pay a v. to, call upon (ulu, ulo)

vizo.x: aim: direction of the sight toward an object

vocala.x: vocal, verbal, oral, uttered or relating  to the v.

vokalizar.x: (intr., tr., mus.) to vocalize: to sing a vowel sound without uttering words.

volar.x: (tr.) to will: determine in the mind, to decide, resolve, exercise volition (cf. dezirar,  voluntar)

volatileso.x: volatility. Def.: Vaporeskema ye l’ordinara temperaturo; IV-4.

voltar.x: (intr.) to volt: make a sudden turn or leap aside (as in fencing); (cf. voltijar).

voltijar.x: (intr.) to vault (on a horse, on a slack rope, etc.)

voluntar.x: (tr., intr.) to be willing (to); to have no objection (to); (in polite phrases)  to be so kind as, be pleased to

volunte.x: gladly, readily, willingly. Ex.: Me voluntas facar to. Voluntez  enirar, sioro. Voluntez dicar a me. Me akompanos vu tre volunte. On volunte (E. readily) kredas to quon  on deziras kredar. V. exp.: Voluntez esas vicina a komplezez, degnez, ma min forta; VI-213. La  tri vorti: voluntar, komplezar, degnar formacas gradaro: komplezo esas ulo plu kam volunto

vomar.x: (tr., intr.) to vomit, throw up, belch out (wind, gas, etc.)

vomiko.x: (med.) vomica: abscess cavity in the lungs.

vomitorio.x: (anc. arch.) vomitory. Def.: Arkeologiala termino: enireyo ed ekireyo en la  teatri ed amfi-teatri; IV-647.

votar.x: (intr.) to vote (either viva voce or by ballot) (por, kontre): (tr.)  to v. for (ulu); to enact (ulo)

vovala.x: votive. Ex.: Vovar absteno. Vovar templo a deo.

vovar.x: (tr., intr.) to vow, make a v. (of)

voyo.x: (tera, fera, mara) way, road; (R.R.) track, route

vu.x: pl. vi): you; (for familiar usage cf. tu)

vulgara.x: vulgar: used or done by the common run of people, common, popular, unrefined; (N.B.  for low, coarse sense, cf. grosiera, ne-polita, mal-gusta); (noun form = populo, turbo, plebey-aro)

vulgareso.x: (quality) vulgarism: commonness, unrefinedness (N.B. not «low» cf. grosier-ajo)

vulgato.x: Vulgate: Latin version of the Bible.

warfeto.x: landing-stage, gang-way. V. exp.: Warfo  esas nek digo, nek kayo, nam ol ne esas masiva, ma speco de eshafodo  formacita ek ligna o fera trabi; II-712.

xenio.x: satirical epigram (first introduced by Goethe and Schiller); (biol.) xenia.

xilografar.x: (tr., intr.) to engrave on wood or print from wood engravings.

ya.x: indeed, most certainly, truly (used in a sentence to lend emphasis, to confirm a statement)

yarala.x: yearly, annual; relating to y.; -ala (od,  un-yara) planti: annual plants

ye.x: preposition of indefinite meaning to be used when no other preposition covers the meaning;  especially denoting position, place, precise situation, time: ye la fino di la libro:  at the end of the book

yen.x: (conjunction with an interjectional character) (with or without hike, ibe) here is, there is;  (interj. meaning) look here! behold! lo! yen la volfo: here is the wolf; look, the wolf!  yen (hike) me: here I am

yolo.x: jolly-boat; a ships boat of medium size; yawl.

yurizar.x: to entitle, authorize, give the (legal) right to; (cf. darfar)

yuro.x: right (founded on law, property, vested interest) legal-right, -title, -authority; right (moral claim founded on justice, equity); (cf.  lego, yust-eso)

yusta.x: just, equitable, rightful, fair, justifiable (cf. yur-iz-ita, equitatoza, justa)

yusteso.x: (moral) justness, justice, fairness, uprightness, integrity (cf. equitato, yuro)

zesto.x: the woody skin quartering the kernel of a walnut.

zezear.x: (intr.) to lisp. Def.: Pronunciar j quale z e sh quale s; IV-647.

zonizar.x: to girdle, girt; inclose in a z.; -o torida: torrid z.

zono.x: (geog., geom.) zone; (for body) girdle, belt, sash, waist-band (cf.  tayo)

zumar.x: (intr.) to buzz (as flying insects), to drone: make a humming or buzzing noise.
